name: Basic Pizza Dough - By Hand Method
review: Followed recipe and instructions, Dough was 'sticky' from the start, even when I used a huge amount of flower... just downhill from there, ended up binning the whole batch.

name: Basic Pizza Dough - By Hand Method
review: If your a person who likes those thick crust pizzas, this isn't for you.  Love the simplicity of this recipe.  Had company and made it.  Everyone was very impressed.  This is a traditional Italian style crust.  Thin and Crispy, mmmm.  Thanks! Emeril.

name: Basic Pizza Dough - By Hand Method
review: The first time i was making pizza i used this dough recipe an it came out wonderful. Everyone loved it. Even my sister; and she is the most pickey person you'll ever meet.

name: Pineapple Cookies
review: it left a lot to be desired..my daughter said it was more like a buscuit than a cookie.i wont be making again.

name: Pineapple Cookies
review: what taste? there was no taste. ours went into the garbage also. was upset, was looking forward to home made pineapple cookies. yuck!

name: Pineapple Cookies
review: THIS HAD NOOO TASTE....it was very boring.. no matter what you added extra like brown sugar r vanilla it still had no taste...in different batches i add chocolate sryup on top...i put cranraisn in one batch nuts in another...definely wont make this again..and plus raise the tempt. to 350 rather then 325 to cook faster

name: Old Ebbitt Grill Crab Cakes
review: the original was good. Not this one it was a bit salty. I made it twice tonight. I put less of the crab boil seasoning.

name: Old Ebbitt Grill Crab Cakes
review: I remember these from childhood. I was thrilled to see the recipe!

name: Old Ebbitt Grill Crab Cakes
review: I have not made this particular crab cakes so I can't rate them but in answer to the question of how to make the crab cakes stay together - the secret is to form them into cakes and then refrigerate 30 minutes before frying or broling. It really works.

name: Neely's Peach Iced Tea
review: Miss Gina,

name: Neely's Peach Iced Tea
review: Corrine!  You can't rate something you haven't tried, baby!!  Or giive it the average of the current ratings so you don't mess up the rating.  I almost didn't try this because of the "low" rating score.  You can find hibiscus tea at Market Street (United, World Market or on line.  Hibiscus tea with simple syrup ALONE is fantastic.  This recipe is triple dipple fantastic.

name: Neely's Peach Iced Tea
review: want to make this it look sooo good and have looked every where but can not find the hibiscus tea bags. what do you use in it place or where can I find it..Help I want to try this love peaches and tea...lol

name: Vietnamese-Style Iced Coffee
review: I have always been a fan of Vietnamese "dessert" coffee.  This recipe is just as I remember it.  Modern latte's don't compare to this coffee.  I do believe the comment about this being low calorie was just a joke.  Although the coffee is very addicting, it's not something you want to drink on a daily basis.  My suggestion:  Lightly cover the coffee grounds in luke warm water before pouring the hot water over; it helps to bring out the full flavor.

name: Vietnamese-Style Iced Coffee
review: Sara does real justice to this recipe, but most Vietnamese coffee shops use a blend of coffee grounds and chicory. Look for a brand called "Cafe du Monde". It's in a yellow cylindrical can smaller than a folger's can found at many Asian markets. These grounds give it a taste that is distinctive from using just french roast coffee grounds. Also, someone mentioned that this was a low calorie drink -- it's not. Check the nutrition information on the sweetened condensed milk. There's quite a bit of fat and sugar -- that's why it's so good!

name: Vietnamese-Style Iced Coffee
review: Wow! Refreshing and Delicious! Not a Calorie in sight! Just Kidding!

name: Veal Parmesan
review: I found this by Googling "Best Veal Parmesan Recipe". It was the first one to pop up.  I made the recipe exactly as is, no substitutions or omissions.  I've been cooking for my boyfriend for months now- every night.  When I made this tonight he actually got up twice in the middle of his meal to give me a big kiss...kept asking me what was in it, telling me how good it was, asked where the heck I got this recipe from, said it had character...and then exclaimed that it was the best homecooked meal he has ever had- and then quickly said "But please don't ever repeat that in front of anyone in my family" lol.  Highly recommend!

name: Veal Parmesan
review: oh mi... a staple in my home... so freakin good.  I use fire roasted tomatoes instead of italian style and it makes the sauce even more amazing!!! And in place of pancetta, I use turkey bacon... def gives it a great flavor !

name: Veal Parmesan
review: Just made this today for my significant other and myself, it was excellent, she raved about it.

name: Cheesy Baked Farro
review: I didn't think I would like this recipe, since I had never had farro/barley before. But this recipe was soooo good! It was cheesy, and the barley (couldn't find any farro was still a bit chewy. the topping was crunchy and very good. I cut the recipe in half, and it was still enough for 4 people! Am definitely making this again!

name: Cheesy Baked Farro
review: Yum yum yum!  The only reason I won't be making this regularly is because of the calories!  Whole milk, butter and three different kinds of cheese = heaven. I used barley because the farro was super duper expensive ($11/pound. Definitely would like to try it with farro someday though.  Cheesy comfort food deliciousness!

name: Cheesy Baked Farro
review: perfect I would not change a thing this makes a lot the 2nd time I made it i cut the recipe in half worked perfectly

name: Pizza with Pineapple and Ham
review: I used this recipe for the pizza dough and found it to be tough. I'm not sure if it was over worked in the food processor or not. I made it twice and both times the dough was unmanagable. Sorry Giada but this one is not a keeper!

name: Pizza with Pineapple and Ham
review: I'm only rating the pizza dough. I didn't have olive oil so I used canola oil and the pizza didn't rise very well and it was very dense.

name: Macaroni and Cheese My Way
review: ok i will make this quick i just found out i have problemswith my colon and i have to change the way i eat i love shrimp but i really don't like vegatables so i came across this receipe at work  (sorry for any misspellings  lol  i didn't have a lot of money so i used shrimp had bacon at home and i  didn't have enough for shells so i used rice instead, frozen spiinch and alfredo sauce i already had at home i added 2% cheddar and parmeson chese and it is awesome  i used the sauce over the rice and no breadcrumbs and it is awesome awesome the budget way

name: Macaroni and Cheese My Way
review: It was expensive to make, and I didnt really like the white wine flavor in the sauce.  Also, the spinach clumped together.  Just didnt taste like mac and cheese to me.  More of a salty shrimp and bacon casserole.

name: Macaroni and Cheese My Way
review: This turned out really well. However, there were a few things not exactly explained on the recipe - and for novice chefs like myself, it helps to have all the details. Here is what I diid: I bought the Barilla Medium Shells and used about 2.5 cups. For the bacon, I used about 3-4 pieces and cut them up into little pieces before I cooked it. If you can, I highly recommend using the Fontina cheese, I think this really adds to the creamy flavor. I used 1 cup of sharp cheddar as opposed to 1/2 cup. I used 1/2 cup wine, I don't see the need for a whole cup and frankly I'd rather drink that myself with dinner! I bought a bag of the baby spinach and that worked really well. Lastly, I opted out for the breadcrumbs. Unless you have the time to make these, you definitely do NOT want to use store bought breadcrumbs - they don't work well as a topping, they are more for binding. So without the breadcrumbs, I thought it tasted just fine. I also forgot to add the Parmesan, and trust me, this is so cheesy as it is, it probably doesn't need it! Great recipe that made me feel like a really good chef!

name: Maple-Oatmeal Scones
review: Very easy to make and quite good.  Loved that they weren't too sweet.   The mixture was a little more moist than I expected but quite tasty.

name: Maple-Oatmeal Scones
review: Easy to make if you use a big mixer.  Scones weren't as sugary as I would have liked and the glaze lacked flavor.  I guess I am not crazy about Maple Syrup after all.

name: Maple-Oatmeal Scones
review: Ina is amazing.  These scones are amazing- Fluffy and delicious with a rich taste that is not to sweet...unless you go wild with the glaze.  I halved the recipe and came out with 13 good size scones.  Great recipe, as expected.

name: Raspberry Souffle
review: No matter how hard I tried I could never get my raspberry souffle to giggle.  I used some of my best material, not even a snicker!

name: Raspberry Souffle
review: Well I am an experienced cook, if not a professional cook myself and find this recipe although delicious it is unbalanced. There seems too much liquid which made the soufflé tasty but very watery. I made it twice thinking I had done something wrong but with same result the second time around. If I ever do this again, I think that I will thicken the fruit base with the egg yolks by warming it to a custard consistency in order to help with incorporation of the egg whites properly. It is almost impossible to incorporate the fruit as liquid as it was and I used fresh raspberries only.

name: Raspberry Souffle
review: It was ok.

name: Grilled Jerk Chicken with Mango Cilantro Salsa
review: This recipe turned out ok for me. I should have followed my instinct and added two more peppers. I did double the recipe as I used roughly 7 pounds of chicken wing drummettes, again I should have added two more peppers (lack of heat was the only semi-negativeI didn't necessarily want them "hot" I just wanted more zing. I also added more garlic about 3 extra cloves. I did let them sit for about 30 hours. These I am sure would have been fantastic on the grill but I made them in the oven due time constraints. I laid them on baking sheets sprayed with some cooking spray, baked for about 1/2 and hour and then flipped them. Once they were browned and slightly crisp I took them out of the oven.

name: Grilled Jerk Chicken with Mango Cilantro Salsa
review: This was absolutely marvelous in every single way. It is a magnificent and vibrant way to ring in the summer. We marinated the chicken overnight, and it was delicious, but I think next time we will go the full 48 hours. We also used a habanero instead of the Scotch bonnet pepper, and that's only because we didn't have one available at our store. I think next time we will use two peppers simply because this didn't have enough spice for us, but that's our preference. Also, we used boneless and skinless chicken thighs since we made tacos out of it. The chicken was amazing and the mango cilantro salsa was perfect. We paired it with a great fresco cheese and some fresh tortillas and had an amazing dinner. Overall, we will most definitely be making this again.

name: Grilled Jerk Chicken with Mango Cilantro Salsa
review: Outstanding!  I did not marinate the chicken over night and I did not use the pepper. I used boneless, skinless tights and drumbsticks and baked them in the over at 350 degrees for about 40 minutes. I paired this chicken recipe (minus the mango salsa with a beans and rice recipe.  I will definitely make this again!

name: Beet Salad with Walnuts and Goat Cheese
review: how about a big fat YUM on this one?  so easy, so good...

name: Beet Salad with Walnuts and Goat Cheese
review: Delicious, I also add crisp fried ginger.

name: Beet Salad with Walnuts and Goat Cheese
review: I had to make a few replacements: butter lettuce and spinach, since escarole and arugula weren't available; and pecans, because I don't like walnuts.  I also added a bit of chopped fresh mint to the dressing.  The beets go very well with aged goat cheese.  (I found a fabulous goat cheese called Midnight Moon; it's made in Holland and is excellent. It doesn't crumble; you'll have to grate it!

name: Cinnamon Toast Pecans
review: excellent but a little dry next time i'll add more coating.

name: Cinnamon Toast Pecans
review: Very good but for it to be 5 stars it needed just a touch more sugar - so I put 2 tablespoons instead of tsp. And I also made a batch for the adults with a pinch of cayenne pepper! Big hit!

name: Cinnamon Toast Pecans
review: So good!!! I took them to a Christmas party last year and have been asked for the recipe many times. One elderly lady confiscated the entire tin and called them her own.

name: Herb Seared Sanddabs with Warmed Arugula and Fire Roasted Tomato Salad
review: I made this for dinner tonight using "limanda" (which I THINK is flounder in Spanish. Fish translations are tricky!, and it got a 9  of 10. I had to use dried herbs for the dredge. Next time I'll use less, but the fish had a really nice flavor. The last piece I cooked about 3.5-4 minutes on each side, and I'll do it that way next time. The salad was WONDERFUL. I oven-roasted the tomatoes and tossed the peppers in with them. I also subbed spinach for the arugula, but the greens are really what you notice least. Next time I'll add asparagus to the roasting pan while the tomatoes are cooking. I served it all with steamed cauliflower and garlic bread. I'll be adding this one to my meal rotation.

name: Herb Seared Sanddabs with Warmed Arugula and Fire Roasted Tomato Salad
review: We substituted flounder for the sanddabs and the dish was very easy to prepare and tasted excellent.  A new favorite preparation method!

name: Stuffed Calamari
review: This dish is a great way to bring out the rich flavor of the calimari without making it tough.  Provides strong visual impact at the table.

name: AB's Chili Powder
review: OMG!! This is the best Chilli Powder ever!! It has amazing flavor and not that much heat. I used all the dried chilies he listed and I cannot tell you how much I love this powder. I ended up using both the food processor and the spice grinder to get it to a powder consistency. It smells amazing!! and if you taste it straight, it does seem to have too much heat, but when used in recipes it has just a slight kick. Seriously, my husband LOVES things hot and I am a big wimp with heat [usually take the ribs and seeds out of jalepenos] but this powder has just the right amount of heat. I too will NEVER buy Chili Powder from the store again!! Thanks Alton

name: AB's Chili Powder
review: Excellent chili powder.  I substituted Moritas for the Cascabels as I couldn't find them, Moritas are a slightly hotter pepper so I reduced the quantity from 3 to 2.  Turned out very well.

name: AB's Chili Powder
review: not sure how to rate this-how many stars:

name: Walnut Apple Muffins
review: Heavy. Followed recipe to the letter and they came out dense and gooey.Even used a scale to weigh the ingredients to be exact. Sub self rising flour a mistake???Flavor was bad, so i'm not trying again.

name: Walnut Apple Muffins
review: Fun variations include using hazelnut oil instead of canola and adding hint of nutmeg and cloves, which always go so well with cinnamon. Try adding chocolate chips for more sweetness. I had to bake mine a little over 30 minutes actually to keep them from getting doughy but that's because I never use the full amount of baking powder to keep the flavor. Overall, the muffins turned out delicious!

name: Walnut Apple Muffins
review: Simple recipe makes a very yummy muffin.  I found that I needed to bake for 30-35 minutes to cook through and get lovely golden on top.

name: Killer Baja Chili Rellenos Mariscos (Roasted Poblano Chiles Stuffed with Seafood and Rice)
review: This is very flavorful and fragrant too.Never used cojita cheese before, it worked out well not overpowering the dish.  Had more filling than chili's to stuff so just piled it in dish and will make for some awsome leftovers tomorrow.

name: Killer Baja Chili Rellenos Mariscos (Roasted Poblano Chiles Stuffed with Seafood and Rice)
review: Delicious!  The poblano peppers I used were hotter than normal (blistering hot, in fact - unusual for poblanos, but the dish was so delicious that we ate leftovers the next day and found ourselves wanting more.

name: Killer Baja Chili Rellenos Mariscos (Roasted Poblano Chiles Stuffed with Seafood and Rice)
review: I loved this recipe.  Added more shrimp and used lobster instead of scallops once.  Just as good , maybe even better.

name: Red Sangria
review: WOW! This sangria is delicious.  I made it for a 4th of July cookout and everyone enjoyed it.  Great recipe!

name: Red Sangria
review: I've made this many times and it is always a hit!

name: Red Sangria
review: This is to die for! Absolutely delish! It is nice & strong. I've made this a few times now & have not let my guests down.

name: Slow-Cooked Collard Greens
review: I thought these collards were great. It's the first time I've ever made collard greens on my own...ham hocks sort of freaked me out, so I used ham fat and a ham bone and I still thought the flavor was nice. Will definitely make these again! They even heated up nicely on day #2.

name: Slow-Cooked Collard Greens
review: Great! Made it a little more expensive than collards ought to be, but they sure were good!

name: Slow-Cooked Collard Greens
review: As a southerner, I was tired of all the work that goes into cooking collards the way my mother does, and I was reluctant to try this recipe because it is so different. I cooked them a day ahead and they were really good.  I added a little more vinegar and sugar, then I added some red pepper flakes. Also I bought the prewashed, precut greens which took longer to cook, but next time I'll do the fresh.  Thanks, Tyler.

name: Beef Rouladen with Brunoise Vegetables and Red Wine
review: This recipe is a bit complex for an everyday meal.  Paring it down and simplifying it made a wonderful meal with complex flavors.  Definitely something I?m adding to my recipe box.  The recipe as is would make for a wonderful entertainment.  Give it a try.

name: Beef Rouladen with Brunoise Vegetables and Red Wine
review: Excellent! It pleased the mother- in -law!

name: Beef Rouladen with Brunoise Vegetables and Red Wine
review: Is the perfect combination

name: Tomato Bread Soup: Pappa al Pomodoro
review: I LOVE this soup...so easy and very delicious. I mostly always have the ingredients on hand, and it can be made in about 30 minutes. My friends love it too. Thanks, Mario!

name: Tomato Bread Soup: Pappa al Pomodoro
review: I tried Pappa Pomodoro in Florence last month and loved it.  This recipe tasted the same.  The only change I made was to add a teaspoon of sugar.  Will definitely have this again

name: Tomato Bread Soup: Pappa al Pomodoro
review: Very very good

name: Lentil Vegetable Soup
review: This is the best soup recipe ever!!!!! Looks a little complex but it's not and I am not a cook. Was a little skeptical about quantity of onions and leeks but all cooks down and you have no idea they are even in the soup, other than the great flavor. I made recipe (many times now and was sending link to friend. Just make the way they recommend the first time before you decide to change anything. I doubt you will want to change it the next time around.

name: Lentil Vegetable Soup
review: I am not one to write a review but I had to this time. Ina amazing soup absolutely amazing! I made some changes. I ommitted the cumin. No green lentils where i live used regular lentils. Turn out perfect.Vinger was omitted and so was the cheese. The soup was excellent even without it. Thank you INA! You are the best!

name: Lentil Vegetable Soup
review: This soup is delicious! But I did make some adjustments...besides halving the entire recipe, I added 2 cups of chopped kale and 1 1/2 teaspoons of curry powder. I omitted the cheese and used veggie stock instead because I am a vegan. My husband is vegetarian, so instead of adding cheese (b/c we didn't have any he added a dollop of sour cream and said it was very good.

name: Roman Pizza
review: The crust was really hard to work with, it didn't roll out easily and it was dry. I used my kitchen aid with the dough hook, not a food processor so I don't know if that had anything to do with it. I've made bread and pizza crust a hundred times before that way and had no problems but perhaps this recipe with so little water you need to use a food processor? I live at higher but not high altitude and it's a desert climate so that may be it too. The cheese and pancetta combo is nice!

name: Roman Pizza
review: The first time the dough was too dry, second time i doubled the amount of water, could be the brand of flour i used

name: Roman Pizza
review: This pizza is quick and easy enough for weeknight dinner (with a little preplanning for the dough and has loads of flavor.  The dough is very simple to make and rolls out nice and thin.  We make the long rectangular shape and it's when cut into slices makes for easy handling for the kids.  The flavor combination is excellent.  The smokey mozz and salty pancetta go together well.  There isn't a lot of flavor in the crust, so try to use flavorful toppings.  We've made it with bacan and regular mozz as well - tastes good, but we prefer the orginal.

name: Basic Crepes
review: Really great recipe.  The crepes took a bit of time to do, about 1/2 hour to cook it, but it was fun.  I recommend straining the batter like it says because mine was kind of chunky and crepe batter should be smooth and kind of thin, and that's how it came out after straining.  The filling and cheese sauce was so good.  They were easy and tasted great.  I didn't blanche the asparagus beforehand, to save time, but put them in the wine after reducing.  Also used dried basil and tarragon instead of fresh basil, and swiss instead of gruyere b/c that's what I had on hand.  Even my kids liked it.

name: Basic Crepes
review: Anne, this is superb and so much fun!  My fingertips are a little charred from flipping crepes, but I 'spose if I do it enough I'll toughen up!  The crepes were eggy, like crepes are supposed to be, and the combination of flavors in the filling were so spring/summery. The only substitution I made was tarragon in lieu of basil.  I'm not a big basil fan although I grow enourmous amounts of it in my garden to make pesto to give as gifts.  Go figure??

name: Basic Crepes
review: I followed the recipe exactly and wow...way too much egg.  It has an eggy flavor and it tasted like soggy, oily eggs.  Bleh.

name: Cardoon Soup with Meatballs: Cardi in Brodo
review: This is the perfect soup. Full of different, scrumptious items, cheesey and satisfying. It even works for begetarians if you use meat substitute for the meat balls (I used Gimme Lean. It's delicious!

name: Potato Soup with Shrimp
review: First time ever making potato soup, and I love it !  I used cubed venison that I breaded and fried and bacon, super yummy, next time I am trying ham and broccoli. Thanks so much for introducing me to an awesome soup I can play with !

name: Potato Soup with Shrimp
review: This was a great soup! I made it last winter.  Love it!  I will make this again as soon as it gets cold!

name: Potato Soup with Shrimp
review: One of most versatile recipes I have. each time I make it I try something different ie. corn, ham, shrimp ect. and it has never failed!

name: Baby Spinach Salad with Roasted Red Onions, Pecans, Dried Cranberries, Crumbled Goat Cheese and Citrus Dressing
review: Excellent salad.  Fabulous dressing!

name: Baby Spinach Salad with Roasted Red Onions, Pecans, Dried Cranberries, Crumbled Goat Cheese and Citrus Dressing
review: This salad is so delicious! So many great flavors. The onions are a must!

name: Baby Spinach Salad with Roasted Red Onions, Pecans, Dried Cranberries, Crumbled Goat Cheese and Citrus Dressing
review: This salad is delish!! I will be making this one often. The dressing  is very tasty and brings all of the flavors together perfectly. I added some chicken to make it a full meal.

name: Stuffed Zucchini and Red Bell Peppers
review: This was great! I had some red peppers from my garden along with jalapenos and cilantro so I changed it up a bit for a Mexican twist. My husband could not stop eating them. I substituted chicken and pepper sausage for the turkey, picante sauce for the marinara sauce, Mexican cheese blend for the Romano and crushed tortilla chips for the bread crumbs. Served it on a bed of lettuce and tomatoes added some extra picante sauce and it was healthy and heavenly! Will definitely make again!

name: Stuffed Zucchini and Red Bell Peppers
review: I had this last night and absolutely loved it. There were only 2 of us so we did just the zucchini and I have to eat gluten free so we eliminated the bread crumbs without a problem. I am anxious to try it out with peppers too. Excellent!

name: Stuffed Zucchini and Red Bell Peppers
review: Absolutely Delicious!  Instead of a traditional marinara, I used a spicy diavlo version to add some extra heat and they turned out wonderful!

name: Pappardelle with Rabbit
review: Don't do this with commercially rasied rabbit, theyare too lean.  Way too much cooking.  almost unedible meat was so dry.  Next time I'll skip the frying.

name: Pappardelle with Rabbit
review: very tasty,easy but long preparation.i cooked it 4 times so far and every time we enjoy it very much

name: Beer Baked Beans
review: I gauge my cooking on how much others like it.  Brought this to a work potluck and everyone loved it!!  Awesomely easy and delicious!!

name: Beer Baked Beans
review: There is too much beer, so I have modified the recipe and cut that in half.  I also added a few more slices of bacon, and now it is wonderful.

name: Beer Baked Beans
review: Planning on taking this on a camping trip, I made this and froze it in the freezer for about 2 weeks. I added a couple of sliced hot sausages to the recipe. It was very tasty. No too spicy. There were no leftovers. I plan to make this again.

name: Cactus Salad
review: 4 stars for adding olive oil and red wine vinegar. Too oily and not authentic. Instead use lemon from several juicy lemons.  That will marry all the flavors of nopale, tomato, red onion, cilantro and jalapeño. Yes, I added jalapeño instead of cerrano pepper. Milder was preference. This is taking pico de gallo up 10 notches when you add nopale, corn, queso fresco, and avocado. Tastes so good with tortilla chips as a starter/appetizer. Or as a side to red snapper or add to tilapia fish tacos.

name: Cactus Salad
review: I can't say enough good things about this dish. It is absolutely delicious! I used a lot less olive oil to cut down on the fat. Also, you can use the cactus mix as a filling for tacos. YUM!

name: Cactus Salad
review: No need to prepare the paddles yourself, most Mexican produce stores will have the paddles cooked and diced, ready to use, I guess if you are in the Western US.

name: Pepper-Crusted Maple-Glazed Salmon
review: Excellent recipe and very easy to make!  Make sure you keep an eye on the salmon while its baking.  I also added a coating of applewod salt that gae it a smokey/maple flavor.  My husband said his taste buds were exploding!

name: Pepper-Crusted Maple-Glazed Salmon
review: Quick and Easy and DELICIOUS!  My 5 year old loves it.

name: Pepper-Crusted Maple-Glazed Salmon
review: I used about 2 tablespoons of fresh cracked pepper, but otherwise I didn't alter this recipe. The salmon was yummy!

name: Cooked Apples
review: This was great. I used this as a base to make brandy apples, i just added the brandy and vanilla to the recipe. It tasted just like the brandied apples from longhorn steakhouse. Food network you have a new fan.

name: Cooked Apples
review: This is the one I was looking for. I used brown sugar, added raisins, and also some fresh grated nutmeg. Yum!

name: Cooked Apples
review: Made this tonight an had to make more after dinner my friends an family eat all of it an ask for more so I make more. The only thing I added to it is raisins to it. I think it would be a good base for an apple crisp to. I think I will try that soon and I will post it on here.

name: Zucchini Bread
review: I used this recipe as a basic guideline and read previous reviews to help me along.

name: Zucchini Bread
review: I changed this recipe also, I used 1 cup of white flour, 1 cup of whole wheat cut back on the sugar and added about 3 Tbs. of crushed pineapple.  The bake time was way too long, mine was ready in about 45 mins.  When I took the bread out, I drizzled the pineapple juice from the can and it was Yummy

name: Zucchini Bread
review: This recipe is very good.  I did have to substitute Canola oil for the veggie and pine nuts instead of walnuts, but it is delicious.  With so many zucchini's in my garden, I will be making this a lot for family, friends and work mates.

name: Marinated Steak Tips
review: best ever highly recommend WHAMMMO

name: Marinated Steak Tips
review: This recipe was easy and delicious.  They only problem I had was the meat we had purchased was not fantastic.  The marinade was fantastic regardless... this mix would also taste great with chicken.

name: Marinated Steak Tips
review: Fast , easy and delicious. The wife said it was the best steak I've ever made.

name: German Chocolate Cake - Make My Cake
review: it was very good  but i hated how it took so long i used the recipe for my 13th birthday party because i LOVE germany !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

name: German Chocolate Cake - Make My Cake
review: Was asked in the morning to bake a cake for a friend's birthday...this recipe popped up and was easy to follow the directions and was delicious...light and full of what a German Chocolat eCake should taste like.  On this busy day my son and neice took over and followed the directions for the filling with no problem.  Easy - perfect - highly recommend .. thanks...

name: German Chocolate Cake - Make My Cake
review: I have only made the coconut pecan filling and it is the BEST! Honestly, I find that any homemade cake I have made does not live up to the moistness of a boxed cake mix, however the coconut pecan frosting from a tub is absolutely awful! I use a packaged chocolate frosting for the outside of the cake as well. I have even used the filling to fill the centers of chocolate cupcakes with chocolate frosting tops, amazing little surprise when you take a bite! A nice change up is almond extract rather than vanilla too.

name: Beer Battered Fried Trout Tacos with Spicy Horseradish Coleslaw
review: This is a great recipe for both adults and kids alike.

name: Beer Battered Fried Trout Tacos with Spicy Horseradish Coleslaw
review: This is the best possible recipe to go with Pulled Pork Sandwiches.  It's great right on the sandwich, or as a side.  It took it to one gathering and it became a standard request.

name: Beer Battered Fried Trout Tacos with Spicy Horseradish Coleslaw
review: Just made this tonight to use a head of cabbage I got in my CSA box, and I'm so impressed!  I added 1/2 of a thinly sliced red onion instead of the green onion and made the dressing exactly as the recipe says.  The flavor is tangy and creamy and just delicious!  Will definitely make this again.

name: Oatmeal Cake
review: I made this cake with no changes and it is wonderful!  Great flavor and moist and the icing is delicious.  It will make your house smell so good.We couldn't wait until it cooled all the way.

name: Oatmeal Cake
review: In other, no one made the cake per the instructions.  Always a laugh to read "I loved this cake and we made it last night.  Although we changed half of the ingredients, we really loved this recipe"  Well DUH.  That is so annoying when looking to reviews for information about the listed recipe.  To change it before even trying as is, you make no Review contribution other than to let people know what your tastes are, which no one cares about.

name: Oatmeal Cake
review: I used Quaker old fashioned oats and soaked them in the boiling water until room temperature -- didn't simmer them. I also substituted wheat germ for the oat bran because that's what I had on hand. And because we love spice cakes, I a pinch each of ginger and nutmeg. Crispy on top, moist and spicy inside with a little bit of chew. Fabulous! Much better than the oatmeal cake recipe I had been using before.

name: Osso Buco Milanese
review: As usual, another great recipe from Tyler Florence. I did substitute the Marsala for a dry Chardonnay, and instead of the gremolata I just poured some lemon juice over the finished dish. I do prefer to "manicure" the veal shanks before serving, as they can get messy if you don't. I also serve the bones for those who enjoy the marrow. Also, I always under-cook the pasta by two minutes or so, drain it, then finish it in the pot with the sauce. The sauce gets absorbed by the pasta as it finishes cooking, thereby enhancing the flavor throughout the dish. Yummy! Thanks again, Tyler!

name: Osso Buco Milanese
review: i made this recipe with Lamb - used a dry red wine instead of the marsala and added extra veggies. It was DELICIOUS. My mother in law who is Italian thought this was excellent and asked me to make again. She now likes it better than a leg of lamb roast!!

name: Osso Buco Milanese
review: Super delicious & easy to make. I have made it with different wines, with lamb and pork shanks and it comes out perfect every time. Once in a while I add ground rosemary to the gremolata. It's good with rice, mashed potatoes, quinoa, couscous, it's so good it doesn't matter I suppose what starch you choose.

name: Turkey Tacos Picadillo
review: I have made this about 5 times now.  I add a chopped chipotle pepper in adobo. I also like to use chicken breast.  After poaching and cooling....I shred the chicken breasts by hand and let it cook with everything until heated through....I prefer it over ground meat.

name: Turkey Tacos Picadillo
review: My children and friends beg me for these. So much healthier than a ground beef taco and so very tasty.

name: Turkey Tacos Picadillo
review: This taco was tasty. It was probably the best taco I ever had. I liked it so much, it made me smile: A direct quote as dictated by my seven year old daughter.

name: Classic Cake Doughnuts
review: I just made a few for my daughter's breakfast after an hour in the fridge. This recipe is the closest I've found to my long lost, favorite recipe from my grandmother's cookbook. Instead of mace, I used 2 tsp of lemon zest, instead of evaporated milk, I used regular whole milk, and instead of shortening, I used butter. The batter was initially very sticky, but I am a culinary genius, so I managed. LOL! I spread the batter into a log as I wrapped it in plastic wrap. The suggestion of freezing is probably best for manageability. It began getting sticky again after working with it (putting holes in the center with the end of a mixer beater. The doughnut I ate was quite delicious. I didn't realize I was out of powdered sugar, but as with old times, granulated sugar and cinnamon did just fine. I'll keep some without coating for the baby. Great, easy recipe everyone can enjoy for breakfast, snack, or dessert.

name: Classic Cake Doughnuts
review: strait forward delicious....fairly simple...swapped mace for 5 spice...freezer 1 hour instead of fridge for 4!

name: Classic Cake Doughnuts
review: These were awesome!!! My mom always talks about thedoughnuts that her parents would make in their restaurant whn she was growing up.  I finally found this one, and we half heartedly gave 'em a chance.  We are now completely addicted.  The only negative I have is that the dough must be made 6+ hours before frying. I suggest making a double batch so you can make them the next weekend.

name: Nachos on the Grill with Tomatillo-Poblano Salsa, Smoked Tomato Relish, and Green Onion Creme Fraiche
review: Made the Tomatillo-pablano salsa part of this recipe and it was NASTY.....    very sour and no seasoning ....  I used lemon instead of lime and that may be the reason for it being so sour....   really dont think that would make that much of a difference though.

name: Nachos on the Grill with Tomatillo-Poblano Salsa, Smoked Tomato Relish, and Green Onion Creme Fraiche
review: Tasty? What did you think? i did the green salsa only in that dish, i used jalapeños no poblanos i love it was great.Thanks

name: Nachos on the Grill with Tomatillo-Poblano Salsa, Smoked Tomato Relish, and Green Onion Creme Fraiche
review: I tried out this recipe with my mother and it was a hit in the family. Everyone said it was excellent. I prefer the smoked tomato relish the best.

name: The Ultimate Sloppy Joes
review: Definitely not the ultimate sloppy joe bc the overwhelming flavor of this recipe is ketchup and mustard.  You cannot taste the other ingredients.  Also, by using ground turkey instead of quality of ground beef that makes things even more bland.  Good for a middle of the week supper but not good enough for a Superbowl party!

name: The Ultimate Sloppy Joes
review: I used 1 pound of turkey and halved everything else. I'm not a huge of sloppy joes but these I really liked! They did not taste like ketchup but that could be because I halved it. At the end I did add a dash of worcestershire, gave it that depth. I will make these again.

name: The Ultimate Sloppy Joes
review: My favorite! I make it with ground beef insted of turkey.

name: Chicken and Rice Soup
review: Lots of great flavor and heat! Worth the effort.

name: Chicken and Rice Soup
review: This is a soup full of delicious flavor! I used diced chicken breasts. I added zucchini and yellow squash for the veggies. I left out the spinach. Since I was serving it to children as well, I used 1/2 the paprika, 1/2 the black pepper and didn't add crushed red pepper or cayenne pepper.  Such a versatile recipe that you can make by adding more or less of the veggies depending on what your taste is. Definitely a keeper!

name: Chicken and Rice Soup
review: Great soup! Especially if you like it hot!  I used a frozen vegetable mix instead of the fresh vegetables in the recipe, just added them at the end when I put the rice & stock in. Fantastic! Makes those winter sinus problems clear right up! Love it

name: Pan Roasted Black Grouper with Wild American Shrimp, Black-Eyed Pea Cakes, Applewood Smoked Bacon and Frisee Salad and Smoked Tomato Coulis
review: The black eyed peas cakes really were great. I very much enjoy the flavor of cumin so I used a full teaspoon instead of the recommended 1/2 tsp. If you are pressed for time, I definately suggest you make these in advance. They are perfectly fine to cook up, refridgerate and reheat later. Depending on how big you make the cakes depends on how far they will go. I ended up with about 10 good sized cakes.... for just two people that's a lot. It has been nice however to use the rest throughout the week as a snack or with other meals. A great staple to just about any meal.

name: Pan Roasted Black Grouper with Wild American Shrimp, Black-Eyed Pea Cakes, Applewood Smoked Bacon and Frisee Salad and Smoked Tomato Coulis
review: When I read the recipe I was hooked. Never having tried black eyed peas, this looked like a good opportunity to experiment. The Pea Cakes were amazing, so nutty, complex and satisfying. The fish was great, although I would skip the fying and bake all the way. The greens were very good (couldn't find just frisee at my crummy local Publix, so I used the generic spring mix and they turned out really good. The coulis was also a nice touch (like previous reviewer, I used regular tomatoes, smoked paprika as well as chipotle powder. I skipped the shrimp - a bit predictable and my iron chef timer would have expired! Do try this - if only for the pea cakes (which make an excellent veggie burger in themselves.

name: Pan Roasted Black Grouper with Wild American Shrimp, Black-Eyed Pea Cakes, Applewood Smoked Bacon and Frisee Salad and Smoked Tomato Coulis
review: Living in rural Texas, I have problems finding all the ingredients, but I made the Black-Eyed Pea Cakes and they were wonderful.  However, the second time I had to double the recipe since my family could make a whole meal of them.  Thanks

name: Pasta with Sausage and Broccoli Rabe
review: Tasty with the addition of a little Olive Oil and chicken stock for extra moisture.  Annedaly10 - I believe the negative reviews are just a matter of palate and personal taste.  Some like a little more oily taste or perhaps a little saltier.  The juice and oil from the cooked sausage poured over the pasta may not be enough to add flavor for some or perhaps the sausage they use is not as flavorful.  Still, a good comfort dish with the addition of a loaf of crusty bread and a salad!

name: Pasta with Sausage and Broccoli Rabe
review: I have made this twice and love it!  I was surprised to see negative reviews, then I re-read the ingredients.  I used half a pound of pasta, not a whole pound.  I was cooking for 2, and still we have leftovers. Delicious that way, make your own adjustments.

name: Pasta with Sausage and Broccoli Rabe
review: Lidia Bastianich has a great recipe for this dish.  Here is one that is very close

name: Jamaican Meat Patties
review: Use the leftover meat and  use it on hotdogs its a little twist on a chilli cheese dog

name: Jamaican Meat Patties
review: Yum!!!! Delicioso!

name: Jamaican Meat Patties
review: The filling was good but the crust is not authentic.

name: Pan-Roasted Chicken with Mushrooms and Rosemary
review: What a great dish! I made this for four using chicken thighs but did have to change any of the timing. Served with mashed potatoes, this is a simple and tasty weeknight or weekend meal.

name: Pan-Roasted Chicken with Mushrooms and Rosemary
review: very simple and delicious!  I altered it a little, I used thighs and breast with bone and multiplied the ingredients by the weight. I had to cook it an extra fifteen minutes to account for the bone. I did not make the sauce at the end as it was juicy and others in my family don't like the lemon. I squeezed lemon over mine.  This is a keeper it is fresh, simple and fragrant. Served it with steamed broccoli and baked sweet potato with a little butter, cinnamon and brown sugar Splenda mixture. The dish was colorful, savory, quick and easy!

name: Pan-Roasted Chicken with Mushrooms and Rosemary
review: Delicious, simple ingredients and simple instructions.  I used a split breast with bone in and skin so I had to bake it in the oven an additional 15 minutes with foil over it (to keep things moist!.  Also I put the rosemary stalks in the sauce while it simmered to get more of the flavor.  I love this recipe!

name: Wild Mushroom and Truffle Ragu over Fettucine Pasta
review: My friend made this dish for our gourmet group last week.  It was absolutely delicious.  If you have not splurged on truffle oil but liked this recipe anyway -- SPLURGE.  The small amount needed is well worth the expense and makes a real difference in dishes that call for it.  This is a keeper.

name: Wild Mushroom and Truffle Ragu over Fettucine Pasta
review: this recipe rocks ! i left out the truffle oil and used the dry herbs that i had on hand with fresh parsley ... paired it with a steak ... mouth-frickin' watering !  emeril, thank you !

name: Wild Mushroom and Truffle Ragu over Fettucine Pasta
review: My husband loved this and I have made it several times.  It gets better each time I make it!!!

name: Chorizo Mushroom Queso Dip
review: Really good. It is hard to find any kind of chorizo here so I used hot Italian sausage and added a bit of vinegar and Chili seasoning to meat.

name: Chorizo Mushroom Queso Dip
review: This was inedible.  Definitely not queso and the flavors do not go well together.  YUCK!

name: Chorizo Mushroom Queso Dip
review: Tasty? Yes! Used Mexican Chorizo and shredded Monterey Jack cheese. Just be certain to DRAIN your chorizo and mushrooms before adding cheese. Mine was a little greasy but... still great flavor.

name: Green Beans with Bacon
review: My family and I really enjoyed these green beans.  The red pepper flakes definitely added a nice touch.

name: Green Beans with Bacon
review: Great quick easy recipe, used more bacon than called for and steamed green beans before adding to skillet. yummy!

name: Green Beans with Bacon
review: These were a hit! I did add more bacon as suggested by others, I used dried onion flakes because my dad isn't big on onions, and rather than cook for two minutes, I cooked the beans until they changed in color.  They were nice and tender.  I will make these every Thanksgiving from now on. Delicious!

name: Shrimp Bruschetta with Limoncello
review: The use of limoncello works very well.  With a few changes this is a 5-star recipe.  The shrimp should be seasoned liberally w/ salt & pepper before cooking---season sauce as well.  My shrimp were completely cooked before adding the juice and limoncello, so I suggest you monitor doneness and remove them before adding the liquid...no need to boil cooked shrimp.  The last suggestion would be adding a little heat.  Crushed red pepper in the oil might do the trick.

name: Shrimp Bruschetta with Limoncello
review: Doubled the recipe and used to serve over a pound of bow-tie pasta. I'm glad I reduced the limoncello by half. It would have been way too sweet. Husband thought it was good. Kids did not like it at all.  I added some pepper flakes for heat

name: Shrimp Bruschetta with Limoncello
review: Wonderful over pasta!

name: Profiteroles
review: I don't think this recipe should be rated as difficult - it was actually much easier than I expected.I used a big ziploc bag and snipped the edge instead of a pastry bag. I added a bit of cinnamon to the chocolate sauce, but otherwise followed the recipe exactly. Very tasty.

name: Profiteroles
review: Outstanding!! Especially the chocolate sauce.

name: Profiteroles
review: These profiteroles came out perfect I wish I could post a pic!! I filled mine with Ina's recipe for pastry cream with a touch of Cognac in it. My family and friends loved these!! Will make again.

name: Broccoli Stuffed Baked Potatoes
review: This recipe list 1 cup of cheese in the list, but 2 in the directions.  It also tells you to preheat the oven, but never tells you when to use it or how long??? I think this recipe is incomplete .

name: Broccoli Stuffed Baked Potatoes
review: My husband and one-year-old loved it... I thought it was missing something.  The potatoes were a little dry after everything was mixed in, so I added a little of the water that the broccoli was cooked in; it added a nice flavor and moistened them up nicely. Maybe a little extra butter and a little less cheese would help this dish out.

name: Broccoli Stuffed Baked Potatoes
review: The directions for this recipe are incomplete. It says to preheat the oven but it never tells how long to bake for!

name: Slow Cooker Lemon Garlic Chicken
review: This recipe needs a little help. To make this dish eatable and flavorful, I added one can of cream of mushroom soup and instead of water I substituted in chicken stock. Also I left a slice of lemon in the crockpot. I also chopped up some canned mushrooms, used brown rice, a dash of garlic powder, and 1/4 of stick of butter. This recipe could definately be cooked in 6hrs on low instead of the recommended 8hrs.

name: Slow Cooker Lemon Garlic Chicken
review: Discusting was an understatement.  Not a do over

name: Slow Cooker Lemon Garlic Chicken
review: this recipe is definitely flawed like others have commented, but with some alterations it turned out really good.  I agree - 5 hours on low is all you need and add the rice at the end (i used brown rice.  Also, i would use way less garlic next time.  maybe only 3 cloves.  I added dried thyme and the lemon wedges to the cooker for more flavor.  When I was adding the rice i took the chicken out, shredded it, and put it on top of the rice to finish.  It was very moist and i will try this again with less garlic.

name: Cannoli
review: The cannoli shells tasted odd (too much like cinnamon and chocolate - ingredients that I didn't think should be in a cannoli shell but seemed like they would taste good together and the filling was so runny  it couldn't be piped even after the addition of copious amounts of powdered sugar. I should've read the reviews about straining, even though my ricotta seemed pretty dry.

name: Cannoli
review: The filling is great, could eat a bowl full-- but I did as other reviews said drained the ricotta in cheese cloth, and used very little lemon juice. Couldn't find cannoli molds, so I did some research and used a 1 14" wooden dowel cut into 4 inch pieces---they really aren't reusable though. The shells were good, but I needed 2 tbsp more marsala then listed. I found natural cocoa was better than dutch processed.

name: Cannoli
review: For something so simple I didn't even think to read the reviews. Not only is this recipe horrible, it is also useless.  I should have known better than to put a 1/3 of a cup of lemon juice in it.  The food network with all it's resources should be doing a better job with what they put up here. As for Mario, I never liked him and now know he does not use all the recipes he seemingly makes available on this site. Save yourself the headache and trash this recipe.

name: Tiny Banana Splits
review: To think I was making regular sized banana splits this whole time!!

name: Panettone French Toast
review: My kids look forward to eating this breakfast around the winter holidays every year.  After New Years you can find panettone in many supermarkets on sale!  But the one thing I absolutely omit from the recipe is the additional 1/4 cup of sugar in the custard.  Really no need for it. The panettone is sweet enough and the brown suger syrup, amazing!!!!

name: Panettone French Toast
review: I guarantee their isn't another french bread recipe out there to top this one. I had been looking for something to compliment my traditional Christmas brunch breakfast casserole and this is it!  To the reviewer who said that any syrup would do.  Uh, uh!  The syrup and the french bread are a match made in heaven.  The cinnamon syrup is the perfect compliment to the fruity french toast. Put is this way...I offered the old maple syrup standby to everyone at the table and there were no takers.  Absolutely delizioso!

name: Panettone French Toast
review: It was a hit, came out gorgeous and yummy. I'm not even a big panettone fan, but we had a lot of it as a gift so I'd figure I'd make it...I have pics but I dont see a way to post them here unfortunately. Yes, it is sweet, but the episode title is "simply sweet". Its a once-in-a-while treat.

name: Meaty Mushroom Lasagna
review: Maybe if you have a sous chef! First, this recipe does not take 30 min to prepare. It took 30 min just to clean the cut the mushrooms. Start to oven, it took 2 hours and 15 minutes. Now I may be slow, but come on. There is no way anyone could get this done in 30 min.

name: Meaty Mushroom Lasagna
review: Absolutely delicious, have served it several times and have never had a complaint. A highly requested dish in my home and among friends.

name: Meaty Mushroom Lasagna
review: Absolutely delicious! I made it for my 3 boy roommates and they gobbled it up! Prep time is a bit longer than indicated for prep time like chopping up everything, but I love Giada's recipes.

name: Birds in a Nest
review: I only looked up this recipe because I wasn't sure if I should pre-toast the bread or do it in the pan, as I was craving an old favorite.  Not even a huge fan of fried eggs all the time but let me tell you yummm.  I added bacon to mine; Bacon and cheese make everything better.  And as far as the comments on the oil- are you kidding me?  There's no way any pan can fit 6 huge slices of bread with eggs and actually cook properly.  Therefore don't put that much oil at once or your one or two or three slices will absorb it.  Common sense would say to use it as you go.  Try again and you'll love it.  Or just use my favorite- BUTTER.

name: Birds in a Nest
review: This is a super easy dish to make and very delicious.  I used a good french bread and it was very good.  Be careful to turn off the burner once you flip it over so you do not overcook the egg though.  I have made this dish several times now!

name: Birds in a Nest
review: This had way too much oil for my taste.

name: Stuffed Manicotti with Fresh Marinara Sauce
review: Wow!  I followed this recipe to a T.  It was delious and so easy to prep the day before.  try it you will like it!

name: Stuffed Manicotti with Fresh Marinara Sauce
review: This recipe is a great family dinner or crowd pleaser. Takes a little prep work but well worth the effort. Nothing is worse than tons of time in making a meal and it's just ok. This will not disappoint. You're going to love it!!

name: Stuffed Manicotti with Fresh Marinara Sauce
review: This has become a staple in our house!  It's easy, although it does take time.  Absolutely delicious and it's easy to be creative with the stuffing.  We just make a half-recipe of the cheese filling, then mix the same amount of chicken, spinach or seafood to obtain the total amount of filling.  You can lower the calories that way too.  It's so easy my 23 year old son is making it tonight for his girlfriend after doing it once with me over the holidays!

name: Cannelloni in the style of Tuscany: Cannelloni alla Toscana
review: It was the worst canneloni ever. Lacked flavor and the sauce was medeocre.

name: Cannelloni in the style of Tuscany: Cannelloni alla Toscana
review: OK,

name: Cannelloni in the style of Tuscany: Cannelloni alla Toscana
review: made it with turkey but still yummy!

name: Seafood Gumbo
review: This is the best gumbo recipe I've used.  I used a really bit stock pot and still had to limit the stock to 2 gallons, so I also scaled back the seafood a bit.  I also added salt. For the roux, I used vegetable oil instead of butter.  Easy to make.  It's very hearty and great for a cold day!

name: Seafood Gumbo
review: Easy recipe to follow. However, took much longer than 30 minutes to prep. Next time I would use less stock. Also, I added andoullie sausage and okra.

name: Seafood Gumbo
review: The recipe was labeled medium, but it really was very easy, and very tastety.

name: Gordy's Fresh Homemade Chili
review: Very easy to make. I just used 2 pounds of ground beef and divided the rest by 5. I simmered it for about 3 hours - great aromas throughout the house. Flavorful and as spicy as you make it. The chili sauce leaves a slightly sweet taste as well. Very popular with our football guests!!

name: Gordy's Fresh Homemade Chili
review: Super quick and easy to throw together.....VERY yummy non spicy everyone in the family loved it! Also made it for a few friends and neighbors, and it was a bit hit!!! I dont cook it for 50 at a time though, so breaking down the ingredients is so fun!!! heehee! JUST noticed this is from a Diners, Drive-ins and Dives show! I love that show and happy that this is a recipe from there!!!! YUMMY YUMMY

name: Gordy's Fresh Homemade Chili
review: Not your average spicy chili.  THis is real homestyle chili without all the heat.  I do like heat but this was such a departure from the norm that I had to give it 5 stars.  You will absolutely love the aroma it creates while it simmers away on the stove or in the slow cooker.

name: Caramel Apple Pie
review: Oh glorious pie!  I will never love another.  You are mine for forever!  (PS, the topping is what makes it so incredibly wonderful.mmmmmm.......

name: Caramel Apple Pie
review: This pie is probably the only apple pie I will make from now on!  Rave reviews the two times I have made it and requests for more!!

name: Caramel Apple Pie
review: I used Alton's recipe for the crust and followed the rest to the "T" and let it cool for 6 hours, anybody know why it may have turned to a cobbler when cut?  It just didn't hold it's shape at all.

name: Pear Butter
review: Love this easy way to have pear butter-so fantastic

name: Pear Butter
review: We could not detect any flavor. Too bland.

name: Pear Butter
review: Very good on not only corn bread but ice cream as well

name: Carrot Souffle
review: Big Hit with the whole family. I added butternut squash since I didn't have enough carrots, then took out the milk and organge juice because it seems to have enough liquid already. It was just spectacular. The pecans crunch on top really makes the whole dish.

name: Carrot Souffle
review: Always a family hit!

name: Carrot Souffle
review: Always a hit.

name: Uncle Bubba's Seafood Nachos
review: extremely easy and so good.  Definitely a crowd pleaser!

name: Uncle Bubba's Seafood Nachos
review: No way to get around the fat so just close your eyes and enjoy! Modified recipe to make things easier-instead of cream, butter, parmasean cheese, used jar of already made (Trader Joe's Alfredo sauce.  A HUGE hit!

name: Uncle Bubba's Seafood Nachos
review: Very good nachos!!! I made it twice already and the family loved it!!!

name: Cuban Chicken and Rice
review: For my family, it was a good Sunday dinner; everyone gathered around the dinner table with a big casserole dish filled with rice and chicken.  What could be better than sharing a good meal and lingering a little longer at the table with each other.

name: Cuban Chicken and Rice
review: Delicious! Was easy and tastes great. We love rice in this family so for us it was the perfect amount.

name: Cuban Chicken and Rice
review: I am Cuban and love this EASY recipe...the other Cuban chicken rice takes a lot longer..but what I did do to make more authentic was to add a bottle of beer instead of the water to the rice it gives it a great taste..anyway that is what my authentic Cuban mother use to do!!

name: Lobster Macaroni and Cheese
review: Excellent! Subbed the sharp cheddar for fontina and added  1lbs fresh dungeness lump crab meat with the lobster. I made more than what was called for as I was serving 6 people. Goes well with tuna tartar w/quail eggs and olive loaf crostini.

name: Lobster Macaroni and Cheese
review: I must admit there are some problems here.... Like me unwittingly not realizing that the Pecarino was a accent cheese. What I did was divide the cheese up into equal amounts. End result was a HUGE overpowering pungent $40 Lobster cover up..... It was good, and I admit to loving the qualities of Pec/Rom or Parm.. This was just too much. Also, if I decide to try this again I think I'd do 2 lbs of Craw fish tails.

name: Lobster Macaroni and Cheese
review: This was wonderful.  I planned it out a little as to not break the bank.  A local grocery store had lobster tails on sale for two weeks so I bought a tail each week.  One week, I bought the Gruyere and another week I bought a really nice quality Romano. I bought a half pound of small scallops to give it more of a seafood flavor.  It took me about 3 weeks to get all of my ingredients but it was sooo worth it.  Will try again.

name: Tassie Cups with Lemon Curd Filling
review: this was the tastiest and easyist lemon curd i think ive made in a long time . i made them for my coworkers at a museum iworked at and they were a huge hit i will use this recipe alot.....

name: Tassie Cups with Lemon Curd Filling
review: I actually give this 10 stars!  This is the best lemon curd I have ever had.  I've made lemon curd many times and this is the easiest and best tasting.  The tassie cups were easy and very good too!  Next time I make this, I'm going to double the recipe.  They're fun to make, everyone likes them and make a nice presentation.  I put a little dollop of whipped cream and a small lemon wedge on them.  Thanks Paula, will be making these many more times in the future!!

name: Tassie Cups with Lemon Curd Filling
review: I will make these again.  My sister told me I missed my calling, that I should of been a chef.  Thanks Paula, I gave the credit to you. Very good recipe :

name: Chicken Fried Steak with White Gravy
review: This was the first time I have ever made Chicken Fried Steak.  It was delicious!  I made the recipe and had 2.81lbs of cubed beef steaks and I still had some flour and buttermilk left over.  Since I can't drink milk all I ever have is Original Almond Breeze milk and wasn't sure the gravy would turn out with it.  As I made the gravy, I dumped the rest of the buttermilk mix into the gravy pot too then scraped a very small amount of the flour and spices used to coat the beef to thicken it since I had added more liquid, let it thicken. It was AMAZING! But next time, I will add the rest of the buttermilk mix IN PLACE OF the milk for the gravy and use the flour mix as the flour in the gravy.  Not as much wasted that way.  It wasn't bland, it was peppery like a good white gravy should be with a tiny bit of kick.  I am thinking now that I may have to mix some of the dry ingredients up just to keep in the cupboard as a quick go-to gravy mix.

name: Chicken Fried Steak with White Gravy
review: followed this almost exactly, except eyed most of the measurements instead of fully measuring out...and it came out amazing. Literally ridiculous. The kind of comfort food that will fill your heart and arteries with gooey deliciousness.

name: Chicken Fried Steak with White Gravy
review: I didn't make the Chicken Fried Steak, but I used the recipe of the White Gravy.  I did make fried chicken with my gravy, and I think it worked just like it was supposed to.  Tasted great for my first time making it.

name: Pork Loin with Fig and Port Sauce
review: I love this recipe.  The Fig and Port sauce is absolutely amazing and easy to make.   The only problem I had was that my 3 1/2 lbs pork loin took 75 min to cook not 45 min like the recipe says.

name: Pork Loin with Fig and Port Sauce
review: LOVED this recipe! I have 6 kids and I'm always in search for a great meal they'll eat. The pork was tender and juicy....and the fig sauce was amazing!! I pared it with mashed potatoes and grilled asparagus. The kids kept coming back for more! It was a hit!

name: Pork Loin with Fig and Port Sauce
review: We used this sauce with a pork tenderloin.  It was great.  My 7yo daughter asked for again for tomorrow night.

name: Alder Roasted Salmon with Rosemary Polenta and Wild Mushroom-Pearl Onion Ragout
review: I made this for my wife for Mother's day as a special dinner.  It was a huge hit.

name: Alder Roasted Salmon with Rosemary Polenta and Wild Mushroom-Pearl Onion Ragout
review: I have made this many whole recipe many times now and it's always a hit! I use lowfat milk in place of the half & half because I thought the original recipe was a bit rich.  I also always add diced zucchini into the polenta which is excellent.  Tonight I'm adding zucchini into the ragout also, as I love veggies.  I did think the salmon needed a bit more flavor so add a squeeze of lemon juice and rosemary before grilling!  5 star before the adjustments and 5.5 after :-

name: Alder Roasted Salmon with Rosemary Polenta and Wild Mushroom-Pearl Onion Ragout
review: I just made the polenta to go with a shrimp dish. It was flavorful and creamy. I used dried rosemary instead of fresh - and tripled the garlic. MMMMMM....

name: Caramel Apple Pie - 2003 1st Place Apple
review: This Caramel Apple pie was so delicious! I made it one night for my family and my 5 year old told me I should "hide it from daddy" so we could have it all to ourselves. It's super simple and so I'm making again to take to dinner at a friends house tonight. Thanks for sharing this great recipe!

name: Caramel Apple Pie - 2003 1st Place Apple
review: This really is the best apple pie I've ever had.  I'm a novice in the kitchen, and this was still easy enough for me. I doubled the filling mixture and used Heath bars for the toffee. This pie is going to be a new tradition in my family.

name: Caramel Apple Pie - 2003 1st Place Apple
review: The best apple pie ever! My son is still raving about it! I don't know how to top this recipe for Christmas dessert!

name: Baklava
review: WOW! I took this to work today and it was gone in about .5 seconds. One of my colleagues said it is better than any baklava she has ever tasted. I left out the rose water, but other than that, I followed the recipe to a T.  Thank you for making me look like a super star, Alton!

name: Baklava
review: Just finished and I thought if you went step by step it was very easy --this is my first Baklava and it came out so yummy! I agree with the previous comment too that it is an Alton recipe so there is a reason for everything :

name: Baklava
review: you made this recipe way more complicated than it needs to be. For example you could use just one type of nut.  Many use walnuts alone. The syrup is over the top!! One could use a sugar based syrup no honey involved.

name: Warm French Lentils
review: Trust me - delicious - but needs a bit tweeking - although I love Ina!  I cut back on salt and vinegar - no need to add the entire mixture.  Add and taste - add and taste. I cut my carrots a bit chunkier - I like the texture.  I made some scallops as a topper.  Really delicous - healthy. Trust your own taste.  Overall  - DELICIOUS!   skinnyjo :

name: Warm French Lentils
review: I have made this several times, but I use 1 teaspoon of salt instead of 1 tablespoon.

name: Warm French Lentils
review: I am always looking for new recpies for lentils and I LOVE them and they are sooooo good for you nutritionally. My husband does not like lentils per se, so I try every recipe I can. I found this one to be easy and rather unique with the turnip and leeks. I followed the recipe exactly [using green lentils, not particually french] and found them to be very flavorful. My husband even stated he would eat them again!! I wouldn't change a thing with this recipe, even the salt - as long as you are using Kosher salt, 1 TSP is not too much.

name: Arancini di Riso
review: Wonderful  my family loved it. Can you make this with short grained brown rice?

name: Arancini di Riso
review: Another excellent recipe from Giada.  I followed her recipe as given but used one half Italian bread crumbs and one half Panko crumbs; gave them a very crispy coating.  I also made the risotto the day before and I think that made it easier to  make the next day.  Too, I made the balls in the morning, coated each and set each one on a cookie cooling rack and refrigerated them until late afternoon.  I fried them in a 12 in. non-stick pan with enough Canola oil to cover them almost halfway.  (Yes, wetting the hands made for easy forming.  Set each on paper towels then transferred them to the oven to keep warm; about 275 degrees; that way they were done and I did not have to fry, etc. when guests arrived.  Yes, any cheese of choice would work; a definite do again recipe!

name: Arancini di Riso
review: I followed this recipe precisely.  Not my first time making risotto, but my first time making rice balls.  I formed the balls, put them back in the fridge, then pulled them out to fry them up.  I used the right amount of oil, and used a cube of bread to check the temp.  I added 6 balls to my 6 quart dutch oven, and within a couple minutes they completely came undone.  I now have loose risotto and melted cheese in a large pot of hot oil.  Really scratching my head as to what went wrong here.

name: Chocolate Gravy and Biscuits
review: I must have done something wrong with the biscuits. The biscuits were good while they were hot, but when they got cold or warm they became hard. That is to be expected when you have a family of 7 like I do. The gravy had to much chocolate. I will reduce the amount of cocoa from 1/3 cup to 2 tbsp. Otherwise the gravy was perfect! Thank you Mrs. Paula Deen.

name: Chocolate Gravy and Biscuits
review: Growing up, we called this soppin chocolate. We would have this with what we call side meat. My grandma made is all the time. Especially on Sunday nights..........loved that I found a very close match to it. Wouldn't you know that it would be from another southern gal, Paula Dean!!!

name: Chocolate Gravy and Biscuits
review: Let me tell you...I grew up eating Chocolate Gravy too! My grandmother used to make it for me everytime I would visit. My aunts would make it and my mother as well. I always thought it was just our family recipe because everytime I ever told anyone about it or asked if they tried it, they would say "what, chocolate gravy, eww." They just don't understand what they were missing! A GREAT THING TO ADD TO THIS WHILE EATING....BRACE YOURSELVES....A SPOON FULL OF PEANUT BUTTER and A TOUCH OF BUTTER. So Creamy and good! That's for all you who love the mixture of chocolate and peanut butter that is...and believe me it will put your tummy in a good mood. Makes you full real quick! I introduced my kids to Chocolate Gravy and maybe one day they will pass down the tradition. GREAT TO KNOW OTHERS HAVE HAD THE SAME EXPERIENCES AS I GROWING UP ON CHOCOLATE GRAVY!!

name: Roasted Root Vegetables
review: The flavor was awesome.  It's a keeper.

name: Roasted Root Vegetables
review: I made this recipe for Thanksgiving and everybody thought it was delicious.  It had a sweetness to it without being overly sweet.

name: Potato Latkes
review: My husband made these for Hannukah this year and they were great! I used a bag of frozen hashbrowns and left out the nutmeg. My mom wanted the recipe, she loved them! Def recommend this recipe.

name: Potato Latkes
review: The recipe my mother always uses has about equal amounts potato and onion. 8:1 is not nearly enough! Also, some salt is an important ingredient. And I've never heard of putting caviar etc on latkes... Other than that it seemed fine, though.

name: Potato Latkes
review: We made these for a small dinner party -- everyone raved about them. Easy to make, and they look as beautiful as they taste. I made the recipe to the letter w/ no changes.

name: Artichoke Pie: Sformato di Caciofi
review: It can be easier by using store bought pie crust. Also I added bacon. The sauce sounds intimidating but was really very easy. It was rich but very very tasty. Make sure it is served room temperature. Everyone should try this!

name: Artichoke Pie: Sformato di Caciofi
review: This was acutally quite easy to make, especially as I used frozen artichokes.  They seemed to work fine.  I saw Mario make this on TV and he cut the onion in eighths instead of chopping, but I chopped and liked the outcome.  This was a big hit at my Easter brunch.  NOTE:  the crust comes out very much like a soft cake, NOT like a traditional pie or tart crust.  I'm going to make this again with a more traditional crust.

name: Blondies
review: horrible. too much flour and no flavoring even after i doubled the amount of butterscotch. it was always very dry

name: Blondies
review: They're good.  They weren't mind blowing but I just wanted something quick and easy so they were perfect for my needs.

name: Blondies
review: This recipe is quick and easy and the blondies are so YUMMY!! I like em with chocolate chips and chocolate icing :

name: Green Beans Slow-Cooked with Bacon and Onions
review: This is THE traditional southern way to prepare green beans.  I have been spoiled by my parent's garden for years, but as they age, I needed to find for myself how to prepare that same beloved taste that most of you know!  This was it!  I used water, and much less than it called for in order to prevent over cooking and "wet beans," however this is a true and solid recipe to follow.  Salt, pepper and bacon grease to taste.  Added cornbread and I'm in Heaven!

name: Green Beans Slow-Cooked with Bacon and Onions
review: FABULOUS RECIPE!  The problem is keeping the family away from nibbling while I finish dinner.  I actually think they could make a meal on this one side dish.

name: Green Beans Slow-Cooked with Bacon and Onions
review: i love green beans  and so do my kids and this was a really good recipe

name: Baked Ziti
review: AMAZING. Truly, a great recipe that's simple and so delicious! This is my go-to for any red-sauce pasta dish, and it should be yours too. I've made this in many ways: with whole wheat pasta, ground turkey, without mozzarella, and with dried herbs. No matter how you make it, it's always delicious. The only change I make regularly is using 14.5 oz can of tomatoes and 14 oz of jarred pasta sauce. Seriously, if you haven't made it, you should.

name: Baked Ziti
review: Everytime I make this I get many compliments and have handed the recipe on to many others.  My children friends and my family love when I make this for them.  My only change is that I add extra mozzarella cheese.  You will not be disappointed in this recipe.

name: Baked Ziti
review: One of the best recipe's ever!  Thank you Tyler Florence. This a crowd pleaser everytime. The only alteration is more cheese!

name: Asian Rice Cakes
review: This was the pits.  It was virtually impossible to make cakes out of the rice and the "cakes" I was able to make did not hold up in the pan.  I ended up making fried rice instead of rice cakes which was not the goal.  Also, a bit of salt or some ponzu sauce helps with the flavor.  I was barely able to taste the ginger in it otherwise.

name: Sunday Night Roast Beef and Gravy with Easy Rice
review: Very tasty; restaurant quality.  I didn't have thyme and so skipped that.  I kept the onion in the gravy and that was excellent.  I cooked a 3 1/4 lb roast and it needed more time to cook than advised.  I added another 30 minutes and it was perfect.  The rice is an excellent side.  I served with broccoli and cauliflower with a garlic sauce.

name: Sunday Night Roast Beef and Gravy with Easy Rice
review: Extremely easy!  I made this with what I had in my kitchen, so I didn't have thyme, and I only had a 1.65lbs. roast.  I cut down the ingredients, and only cooked in the oven for 30min, came out great!  Perfect temp inside.

name: Sunday Night Roast Beef and Gravy with Easy Rice
review: Perfect!  I took the suggestion of another reviewer and let my roast sit out for about 2.5 hours to come up to room temperature prior to cooking.

name: Seafood Crepes
review: I am from south Louisiana and love great food.  I was looking forward to trying this recipe because I love seafood crepes, but this was horrible!  So if you are also from south Louisiana, don't try this recipe!  It's definitely not for your taste!!

name: Seafood Crepes
review: So delicious..used shrimp an claw crab meat..bought ready-made crepes,worked out great.The sauce was especially good

name: Seafood Crepes
review: The crepes tasted very good and looked pretty.  For the crab, use imitation crabmeat (the stuff in California rolls.  You can purchase imitation crabmeat at a local Asian supermarket.  The crepes were easy to cook and I will definitely make it again!

name: Chocolate Chocolate Chip Muffins
review: If you don't want your chocolate chips to sink coat them in flour before you add them to the mixture.

name: Chocolate Chocolate Chip Muffins
review: I followed the recipe exactly and made sure not to overmix, after they came out of the oven they tasted great and moist but after I stored them overnight under a cake dome they became really dry.  Don't think I will make these muffins again, I had to throw them out, what a waste.

name: Chocolate Chocolate Chip Muffins
review: My muffins came out good, but I wouldn't follow this recipe again. They were too dry. I might try to work around the recipe by adding applesauce or sour cream next time. I will also use a mix of milk chocolate and white chocolate chips. Maybe even peanut butter chips would be good in this muffin.

name: Stuffed Clams
review: I have now made this a few times- following the recipe- they really are easy to make and taste sooo much better than the store bought ones!  Now I am playing with the recipe some- I changed the onions to shallots, pepper to peppadew peppers, no mushrooms but I mince the garlic into the onion/pepper mix- I also sauteed them up in garlic infused olive oil and the butter- used panko style bread crumbs and a few dashes of Frank's Red Hot- they came out awesome!

name: Stuffed Clams
review: This was a hit with my harshest critic-my boyfriend! I followed the recipe to the letter with one exception-I only used a cup instead of the 2 cups of clams in the recipe but it still turned out great.

name: Sweet Potato Casserole
review: My daughter-in-law will eat this casserole until she is sick!  This one will be a regular at our family gatherings.

name: Sweet Potato Casserole
review: This is an excellent recipe!  I used oats instead of the nuts as my son has a nut allergy.  I used 1-1/3 cups and it turned out great!  Will definitely make this again.

name: Sweet Potato Casserole
review: I completely agree with Tyler, Texas!  I made it for thanksgiving and everyone loved it as much as me so I made it again for Christmas.

name: Spinach Paella
review: I took the advise below about not adding Spinach and did not include it.  I also added Chorizo and used Risotto instead (because I already had this in the pantry.  Turned out really great!!  My husband loved it.  I don't have any complaints outside of feeling like I needed some type of bread..like french bread or tortillas or something.  So, I warmed both to see what fit better.  They actually both were pretty good.

name: Spinach Paella
review: Excellent!

name: Spinach Paella
review: Let me start with the fact that spinach is one of my favorite foods.  But the spinach in this dish is extremely overwhelming.  I think maybe in the scaling down of the recipe, the spinach amount was not decreased.  The bad thing is that the dish looked and smelled wonderful cooking, and tasted great before adding the spinach.  If I ever made it again, I would only use 1/4 lb of spinach, or leave the spinach out entirely.  The flavors, cilantro, scallions, red pepper, garlic, all sounded excellent, but unfortunately all I could taste was the spinach.

name: Steamed Clams
review: I used beer and butter to steam my clams I wouldn't cook themany other way. Sset timer for 10 min.

name: Steamed Clams
review: I followed the recipe exactly and although it was good I still prefer olive oil and an addition of chopped celery. I also prefer not to add the butter to the broth but just dunk each individual clam in melted unsalted butter.

name: Steamed Clams
review: I used butter instead of oil and beer instead of white wine. Its a lot more fragrant with beer. Skipped the water. Came out insanely good.

name: Spaghetti and Meatball "Stoup" (thicker than soup, thinner than stew)
review: Delicious! I add red pepper flakes just to add a little bit of heat, (you don't want to go overboard. I LOVE the fact that the leftovers are thick and more traditional spaghetti & meatballs. It makes this dish travel incredibly well as leftovers. I've read that many break the spaghetti quite a bit or use a short cut pasta but I like the long noodles and love to eat mine with a spoon and a fork :-!

name: Spaghetti and Meatball "Stoup" (thicker than soup, thinner than stew)
review: This is my go to recipe for bringing a meal to a neighbor/friend in need.  HOWEVER, RR omits any addition of salt or pepper.  Add that and you're good to go.  I've even resorted to frozen meatballs or watering down some Prego when I have zero time but need to send a meal for someone.
