review: I have made this recipe twice and loved it! It is a great change from green beans the "regular" way. A little too hot for everyone the first time (I thought it was just right so I cut back on the chiles.

name: Szechwan Long Green Beans
review: Not only is this recipe easy to prepare, it tastes delicious. My entire family loves the Szechwan Long Green Beans

name: Lamb Squazetto with Soft Polenta
review: This dish is absolutely devine. Used Italian tomato products, good pancetta and lamb.

name: Lamb Squazetto with Soft Polenta
review: Don't add 2 tablespoons of salt to the polenta. I think the recipe must have intended 2 teaspoons. I read the recipe multiple times to make sure I hadn't read it wrong, and the polenta was throw-away inedible with the specified amount of salt.

name: Lamb Squazetto with Soft Polenta
review: I've been making this for a number of years, having first seen it on Mario's show one day.  I normally use leg of lamb, and it turns out great.  You should make this in a stove top dutch oven and don't be afraid to simmer it for a bit longer - 90 minutes or even longer and the meat will be super tender.  I use Parmesean for the cheese on the polenta, as I can not get strachino cheese (and his initial TV episode used parmesan reggiano. I also used low sodium chicken stock (store bought to save time.  I cooked the pancetta cubes crispy first before adding the onions.  Great dish.

name: 50's Chocolate-Wafer Whipped Cream Roll
review: You can just eat the cookies by themselves.  They're pretty good.  You usually have to many anyways.  Once you let it sit in the fridge it gets all soft and tastes really good. Make it.

name: 50's Chocolate-Wafer Whipped Cream Roll
review: I made this dessert for my brother-in-law's birthday and everyone just loved it.

name: Mac & Cheese
review: This mac and cheese was delicious.  It makes a ton of mac and cheese though.  I cut the recipe in 1/4 as it was for 2 people, and we still had lots leftover.  I omitted the tomatoes and only used about 1/2 cup of bread crumbs with 2 tbs melted butter.

name: Mac & Cheese
review: So good and tasty , very creamy, love this dish. thanks

name: Mac & Cheese
review: To die for!  Been trying lots of different Mac  n Cheese recipes in the past and so far this is the best one! I didn't have gruyere  so I used parmesan instead and it was still soo good. Thanks Ina!

name: Braised Radishes
review: I had high hopes for this recipe.  I had homegrown radishes picked this morning, and made this recipe as a side for dinner.  I was the only one who tried it (out of four and it was good except the skin, or outer layers, of the radishes were super bitter.  the sauce was good and once dissected, and bitter parts discarded, was good.  unique texture to a cooked radish.

name: Braised Radishes
review: This was the best thing I have ever done to a radish! I must admit that I am not much of a radish fan... but after getting two bunches in my organic veggie box I had to do something! This is easy and yummy! It doesn't taste like a radish at all... like cooking an onion, raw onion has a  lot of bite..... cooked onion is much more mellow. Radishes are similar. They have a nice texture - not mushy yet also not crisp (once cooked.

name: Braised Radishes
review: This is absolutely delicious! If you think you do not like radishes...think again!  This recipe makes them sweet and tender...the sauce is good enough to put over mashed potatoes!  Super easy to prepare!

name: Rustic Peach and Blueberry Crostata
review: The flavors are wonderful in this recipe - especially the lemon in the crust. A tip for easy removal of peach skins that I picked up from another version of a similar recipe is to blanch them. Very easy to make.

name: Rustic Peach and Blueberry Crostata
review: Definitely make the dough vs. using pre-made if you have the time - the lemon zest makes all the difference!  Looks beautiful and impressive enough to have at a dinner party and was relatively easy to make.  I baked it on a cookie sheet with parchment paper so it was easy to remove after it was baked.  Followed the directions pretty much exactly but I added a little bit of cinnamon to the fruit.  Served it at room temperature with a cinnamon/honey mascarpone whip cream - yummy!! Will definitely be making this again.

name: Rustic Peach and Blueberry Crostata
review: I followed the recipe exactly and mine was very runny.  Used the pizza stone.

name: Truffle Brownies
review: My 6-year-old said, "These are better than a candy bar!"  He was sooooo right!  This is what you should take to any family gathering, bake sale, etc.  They are very smooth and "truffly." Not classic brownie texture, so if that's what you're looking for, make something else.  You have to try these, though!

name: Truffle Brownies
review: A winner every time. I have never used a round pan for brownies, I use a rectangular one. Keep them in the refrigerator, it seems like the cold keeps them fresh and delicious! I also cut them in tiny squares because they are so rich and they look like a gourmet delicacy.

name: Truffle Brownies
review: This is a gem of a recipe.  And its is ridiculously easy to prepare. Be advised that the one pitfall to the recipe is the ganache. The recipe calls for 1/2 cup chocolate chips (4 ounces.  Weigh it and use the full 4 ounces. If you just measure out half a cup it won't be nearly enough. Strangely, butter doesn't work in this recipe. Keep in mind this is really an elegant little cake and is not going to look like a mere batch of brownies, especially with its ganache glaze.  I baked mine in a spring form pan for 15 minutes and it was absolutely perfect. The cake bakes with the edges slightly raised, which makes a convenient way to ice it: pour the thick but still fluid ganache onto the top of the cake. Then tilt and rotate it all around so the ganache runs out to the very edges of the cake. It will then set into a flawless mirror finish. You're going to love this one!

name: Smoked Salmon Pizzettes
review: This was a very simple and tasty recipe.  It was a big hit at my last party and I highly recommend it.  Also, you can serve this on puff pastry rounds as well as long as you dock them with a fork before baking them off.  It only takes about 10 minutes for the puff pastry to cook so, it takes just about the same amount of time.

name: Smoked Salmon Pizzettes
review: I made this recipe for my family the other day and they begged me for more. Definitely one of the best things I've ever dished out to my folks.

name: Smoked Salmon Pizzettes
review: These were the hit of Christmas morning. My mother-in-law ate 3 before she even realized that there was "fish" on them. Kids to the pickiest eaters loved them! Had to make more for tonight.

name: Almond Pancakes
review: excellent easy and simple, especially when the cupboards are bare! I made this recipe with 4 ounces goat cheese, Krusteaz waffle mix, vanilla, sugar and water! it turned out delicious! used a non stick pan no problems with burning. didnt even have syrup...served it with fresh strawberry jam, it was reminiscent of strawberry cheese cake! So unique and delicious!i!

name: Almond Pancakes
review: No one in my house liked these very much. I followed directions, and they were very pretty but no one was crazy about the taste!

name: Almond Pancakes
review: I am going to disagree about this recipe.

name: Mudah's Peach Cobbler
review: I have been using this recipe for about 10 years. I love it. I use half the sugar because I use 4 cans of peaches. I drain two cans and add the juice of 2 cans. I make extra dough to dot the peaches with, but I do everything else the same. Love, love, love this recipe!

name: Mudah's Peach Cobbler
review: Very good cobbler, especially when it's warm.  You don't even need the vanilla ice-cream, it's great by itself.  My family ate it in one day!  Thanks Emeril.

name: Mudah's Peach Cobbler
review: The flavor of this cobbler is really nice, how can you go wrong with peaches, lots or sugar, cinnamon and nutmeg?  However, i gave it two stars because this is more like a pie, with lots of yummy syrupy juice, than a traditional cobbler.  The crust is a traditional pie crust, and so i was disappointed, i thought it would be something more cobbler-like.

name: Traditional Szechuan-Style Hot and Sour Soup with Tofu Fritter
review: I have been using this recipe for at least 5 years and it is fantastic.

name: Traditional Szechuan-Style Hot and Sour Soup with Tofu Fritter
review: This was very good.

name: Traditional Szechuan-Style Hot and Sour Soup with Tofu Fritter
review: This soup tasts better than the soups one might find at a good Chinese-Style restaurant.  Classic taste, great texture.  One of my all-time favorite soups.

name: Braciole
review: It didn't come out pretty for me, making it for the first time, but this is literally the most delicious thing I've ever made. It seriously gave me my first home made foodgasm.

name: Braciole
review: It was so much easier than I expected. Best stuffing EVER! Probably could have added some water to the brasing liquid and let it go a little longer though.

name: Braciole
review: The problem with this recipe is that after browning it needs to braise in your Sunday sauce to get tender. My mom made these every sunday and the braciole, meatballs and sausage would cook in the sauce for a few hours, flavoring the sauce and getting tender. Forget the salt on the meat, parmasean will add plenty.Ann burell has a good recipe too, but its all in the cooking.

name: Refried Beans
review: Excellent pinto bean recipe. We smear the beans on heated corn tortillas with a little cheese and cilantro, roll it up and eat it, unbelievable.  Only change I make is that I soak whole red chilies and a little cayenne in the bean soak.  I also add a full diced jalapeno and 1/2 the seeds. Definitely worth a shot.

name: Refried Beans
review: made these for a mexican night for my family, they were beautiful. there my go to recipe for refried beans from now on.

name: Refried Beans
review: I have been making these beans for a couple of years and I absolutely love them!  Sometimes I use black beans and if I want a smokey flavor I replace part of the Jalapeno with chipotle peppers.  Also my wife likes to dip chips in beans so for her sometimes I run them through the food processor until smooth.  If you like this you should try his Mexican rice and Chimichangas for a real mexican feast!

name: Feta-Spinach Salmon Roast
review: The whole family loved this recipe!  I always soak my salmon in a little milk first (for about 30 minutes and it will take an "fishy"ness out of it...

name: Feta-Spinach Salmon Roast
review: I made this recipe last night and I absolutely loved it.  I didn't stack the salmon according to the instructions but I did place them side by side and they came out great.  I could not believe how wonderful the flavors were and how easy it was to make.  I think next time I'll add a bit of garlic to my filling.

name: Feta-Spinach Salmon Roast
review: I loved the idea of this recipe and I will still definitely use the filling in chicken breasts or maybe in giant pasta shells. I added a squirt of lemon juice and some garlic to my filling also.   The not so great part of the recipe:  with the salmon stacked like that, the bottom piece of fish cooked through while the top piece of fish was almost raw.   Overall, it left something to be desired...

name: Stuffed Quahog, "Stuffie"
review: i liked the presentation. ingredients were easy to obtain. different but easy to make.  conversation piece. favorable.

name: Grandma Peggy's Cornmeal Rolls
review: These were really a five star recipe, but I gave it a four because of the vague written directions.  I had no idea if this was a "no-knead" bread or if the "soft dough" meant wet and sticky or supple and elastic. Since no information was given I did not knead the bread. I just added the five cups of flour to hold it together and put it in the greased bowl.  After the first rise, I didn't punch it down and the dough was rather sticky.  But I shaped the rolls anyway with a little flour on my bench. As luck would have it, they turned out fine, but I can't help wondering if I had kneaded them before the first rise and punched it down after the second rise if  they  would they have turned out even better.

name: Grandma Peggy's Cornmeal Rolls
review: I have made these for the holidays every year for the past five years and my family loves them. It's no longer a request, but a demand! They all insist I make them... and now I make a double batch, because when I show up with them, everyone digs in and gobbles them up, and we still have enough for dinner.

name: Grandma Peggy's Cornmeal Rolls
review: Overall, this is a great recipe.  It would be a little easier to follow if there were instructions on kneading.  I used a kitchenaid stand mixer with dough hook attachment, and it worked fine, although the dough never released from the sides on its own.

name: Spice is Right Cookies
review: If I recall correctly, I think the amount of flour differs on this website than from show. 1 Cup of flour should yield the flatter/buttery cookie. 2 Cups of flour yields cookies that keep the shape you drop them on the pan in and have a bit of a floury taste. Also, watch out on the instant coffee mix...some are stronger than others so you might want to use less.  I also did the lemon/lime zest cookies and those were my favorite!  Still a great basic/quick and easy cookie base you can play with and make multiple varieties of some tasty treats.

name: Spice is Right Cookies
review: i love them but i added my own twist. i put in ground nutmeg, ground clover, allspice, ground ginger, and cinnamon. And you need to add lots of all of them. I call them Jamaican Spice cookies.

name: Spice is Right Cookies
review: Delicious.  I left out the ginger and added 1/2 tsp of vanilla to the creamed sugar and butter mixture. My dough was too soft, so I chilled it 1/2 hour before making the cookie balls. They came out great!  Follow the advice to take them out before you think they're fully cooked.  They will feel very soft, but will firm up as they cool.

name: Lobster and Scallop Ceviche
review: I followed this recipe exactly as it states. I am SOO happy with it! The lobster tasted great and the scallops melted in my mouth! This recipe made a good amount to serve roughly four people as an appetizer. Plan ahead because it takes a while to squeeze the juice out of 4 oranges, 4 limes, and 4 lemons if you do it by hand like I did!

name: Lobster and Scallop Ceviche
review: I made it with all lobster and added 2 cloves of grated garlic.  I also kept the ketchup out and let people add it on if they wanted.  I think this might have been the best ceviche I have ever had.  The mix of citrus didn't overpower the taste like you sometimes get if you use only limes.

name: Lobster and Scallop Ceviche
review: I made this dish last year for our annual Cinco de mayo party and it was a hit! Needless to say... its May 3rd as I write this and I came on to print off the recipe again!

name: Fried Taro and Lotus Chips
review: As long as I had my fryer out I added sweet potatoes. The taro and Lotus chips were exceptional. Wonderful side to the Aisian slaw and chicken dish.

name: Potato and Leek Soup
review: amazing, I top it with freshly grated Parmesan.

name: Potato and Leek Soup
review: Excellent soup... perfect comfort soup! Well balanced would not change a thing!

name: Potato and Leek Soup
review: oh my, this is Delisc! i changed it up quite a bit and i like my version. i added diced carrots, used veggie broth instead of chic, more leaks & sauv blanc. i just blended a little bit of it and left most of it unblended--mmm! thanks for the excellent start!

name: Baked Potato Hash Browns
review: i normaly love tyler's recipes but this one missed the mark.  there is just not much flavor.  i did omit the bacon and cooked it in olive oil instead, but i did add green pepper.  i had no problem with the flipping (used another pan to flip into but i wouldn't make again.

name: Baked Potato Hash Browns
review: Tyler could boil water and I would make it! Made this last night for my monthly steak night (I suggest following rabbitguyman's suggestions for shredding, rinsing, drying potatoes for best starch free  and dry potato results. Single here and used a 6 inch cast iron skillet I got for $5 at the thrift store. The key is the "flip"; I used another skillet coated in olive oil and I got about a "95% flip" for a first time effort. I found it did not need the full 15 minutes oven time when using cast iron due to the even heat distribution. This is the perfect side dish to my monthly steak night; even dry thyme gave it major flavor. Next time I'm gonna substitute a little rosemary for thyme. Yum!

name: Baked Potato Hash Browns
review: I made this last night. While not perfect the flavor was very good. I put the potatos in a colander and pressed down with a plate to squeeze all the water out and it seemed to work. It was very hard for me to judge when the potatos needed to be flipped and I went a little longer than I should have. The onions burnt a bit.

name: Chopped Chicken Livers
review: Great and easy to make. Did not use Chicken Fat.. Just Olive Oil.  O.K. so not just like grandmother made, but good enough for me.

name: Chopped Chicken Livers
review: I would have given this 5 stars, but i don't agree with not using the processor  -  I processed half, and chopped half  -  tasted just like my Jewish neighbor's  -  perect  -  another thing she taught me was to flambe' with brandy at the end of the liver cooking  -  worth the smoke alarms going off!

name: Chopped Chicken Livers
review: Totally authentic taste

name: Chicken Schnitzel with Mushroom Sauce
review: I loved this and so did everyone else whom I've served it to.  I did add sherry to the sauce and it was great.  The chicken stays so moist.  Yes, I had a messy kitchen but it was worth the work.

name: Chicken Schnitzel with Mushroom Sauce
review: This recipe was so good and so easy!  As stated in other reviews, make sure to reduce sauce so it does not come out runny.  We will be enjoying this meal again and again!

name: Chicken Schnitzel with Mushroom Sauce
review: I made this for my husband's and my annual Oktoberfest party. It was a big hit, both with the sauce and without for those who didn't care for mushrooms. The chicken remained moist and juicy and was not dry as I feared it might be.  Many of our guests asked if they could take some home for leftovers. I followed the recipe to the letter, except that I used Italian-seasoned breadcrumbs instead of plain, which I think added just that little bit more flavor. Enjoy!

name: DiPasquale's - Arancini
review: I visited DiPasquales this past weekend and was amazed with the flavors.  Was down visiting freinds who live in Baltimore and we took 17 people to a splendid evening.  We had fast service, 8 of our party were kids, the food was hot, fresh, and the best I have ever had.  Thank you Triple D's for the heads up.  I will travel from Michigan to Baltimore again for the food, then the company.  The Deli was amazing.

name: DiPasquale's - Arancini
review: My husband and I were stationed in Sicily for 3 years and this recipe is spot on. I have been dying to try it ever since I saw in on triple D, thanks Guy! It is a bit of work but well worth it, I felt like I was back in Italy and so did my friends who I served it to, they were stationed there too. If you are looking for a delicious snack or appetizer that will impress your guests, try this Arancini. I have not found one recipe out there that is 100% accurate like this one. I think the cooling of the rice made a big difference in making it easy to work with, as well as the flour/water mixture, which is like the glue to hold it together. Yummy!!! thank you to DiPasquale's too!

name: DiPasquale's - Arancini
review: Made these over the weekend.  Omitted the peas (kids won't them. Never heard of or eaten before.  Very good.  I made the risotto and filling a day ahead.  Did have about half of filling left over.  (made loaded nachos for football game As some else suggested, hands should be very wet for assembly.   Recipe made 8 baseball size rice balls.  Will make again.

name: Roasted Red Bell Peppers
review: exactly what I needed.

name: Eggnog Pudding
review: Really tasty.  I would not categorize it as "Medium" Difficulty, I would say Easy.   Mine turned out to be a light foam.   Not sure if that was me or if it is intended that way.  Will also use it as a substitute for whipped cream over desserts at Christmastime.

name: Eggnog Pudding
review: This pudding is super easy to make with ingredients I always have and is delicious!

name: Eggnog Pudding
review: I love eggnog...I love pudding...  What could be better than to mix the two???

name: Penne Pasta with Sausage and Cheesy Garlic Bread
review: I love this dish.  I don't drain the tomatoes so that I have more sauce.  I also freeze this in serving size portions so that I can take it to work for lunch whenever I want.  This was easy to make and and I crave it several times a year.

name: Penne Pasta with Sausage and Cheesy Garlic Bread
review: This recipe was fabulous, and very easy!  My family loved it. My husband can not eat onions, so I Substituted onion powder in the recipe and it turned out great!  My family voted this a definite "do again"!

name: Penne Pasta with Sausage and Cheesy Garlic Bread
review: OMG I LOVE THIS!!! but add a twist I put some corn starch in to make it thicker so it will stick to the noodles and I cut up about 2to3 sweet red peppers and it is AMAZING!!!

name: Corn, Squash and Chile Traditional Side Dish
review: This dish was very easy to make and it was absolutely delicious!  I will definitely be making this again.

name: Corn, Squash and Chile Traditional Side Dish
review: Very easy to make.  Add more chilis for spiciness.  Maybe even some red bell pepper to add some color to an easy and good side dish.

name: Corn, Squash and Chile Traditional Side Dish
review: Perfect example of simple fresh ingredients adding up to a delightful dish. Sweet white corn makes all the difference.

name: Scrap Iron Chef's Bacon
review: If you want a 5 star version, substitute maple syrup for molasses, brown for white sugar.  Remember you can use ice for the rapid cool down instead of tap water. I like the salt increased by a quarter cup.

name: Scrap Iron Chef's Bacon
review: Absolutely love this recipe and it's easy to make. Alton is right... there is nothing like the taste of making your own bacon. I know that the recipe calls for no nitrates (Pink Salt but I usually add a little. I've made it with and with out. With out.... it will taste like bacon but won't have the "red" color that we are use to with bacon. With pink salt.... it will maintain the red color. Also, I used liquid smoke in my latest batch instead of actually cold smoking with great results. In my smoker, it's hard to control the temperature when it begins to warm up outside which gave me the idea of liquid. I got a huge "thumbs up" from the family.

name: Scrap Iron Chef's Bacon
review: My friends and I constructed our own version of the cold smoker based on Alton's design.  We used a small cardboard box for the hot side and a U-Haul wardrobe box for the cold side.  (Much easier than using metal boxes.  We put together a really fun video that you can watch here:

name: Fondant Glazed Petit Fours
review: The sponge cake came out fine, if a bit soft (but that's sponge cake for you.

name: Fondant Glazed Petit Fours
review: This was my first attempt at making Petit Fours.  I'll be honest...I totally forgot to look at the rating, otherwise, I would have passed and made something else...so that is my fault.  My cake was very dry and crumbly...and the icing was terrible.  Very disappointing.

name: Fondant Glazed Petit Fours
review: I think this may be the worst recipe I have ever tried from Food Network. The cake was dry. I chilled it overnight, and it still cut poorly. The frosting just runs right off. I expected it to be thin since the recipe asks that you repeat the glazing process, and I have glazed things before (covered cake with chocolate ganache, glazed cookies, etc. This glaze doesn't even stick to the cake! I can't see how repeating the process will help. I was going to take these to a Mother's Day tea, I guess I'll be buying at the bakery instead. Sure wish they had more recipes here for handmade petits fours.

name: "Kitchen Sink" Chocolate Chunk Cookies
review: A favorite of everyone. Children and adults alike,

name: "Kitchen Sink" Chocolate Chunk Cookies
review: I was pleased with these cookies. I used chocolate chips instead of chunks and that seemed to work just fine.  I also used less chocolate and a little more peanut butter chips and marshmallows. I look forward to turning them into ice cream sandwiches!

name: "Kitchen Sink" Chocolate Chunk Cookies
review: In the last year I've tried 50 chocolate chip cookie recipies and this one (with a few little alterations were THE BEST result from them all.  I used Cake Flour and Bakers Sugar (increasing to a full cup from a half in the recipe also added two tablesppons of crisco into the recipe along with the butter requirement.  The cookies were chewy and soft.  I only baked for 10 minutes because we like our cookies undercooked slightly.  OMG!  Delicious.  A bunch of very picky people really liked them declaring them the best to date and a few wanting the recipe!

name: Grilled Whole Long Island Sound Porgy
review: Made this in a 375 degree oven in an open aluminum foil packet.

name: Marinated and Grilled London Broil with Emeril's Homemade Steak Sauce
review: I did not make the steak sauce as I would have been the only one to eat it.  The marinade was rather basic in the "raw" state (used Dijon as had no course ground mustard.  However it did give a nice flavor to the outside of the grilled steak.

name: Marinated and Grilled London Broil with Emeril's Homemade Steak Sauce
review: Made this for dinner yesterday and served it on a salad garnished with gorgonzola cheese. My family went crazy, fought over the last bit in the bowl. I followed the directions exactly, and it was so perfectly good. Bought the london broil cut of meat at WalMart and it was a deal, 5.98 a pound, so all in all a pretty inexpensive meal. I chopped up some romaine and green leaf lettuces, grilled 2 ears of corn and a small bag of mini sweet peppers, cut them up and the corn off the cob, added some cherry tomatoes and cucumber, tossed it all lightly with a balsamic vinagrette, then topped the salad with the thinly sliced meat and some gogonzola. Best steak salad ever!

name: Marinated and Grilled London Broil with Emeril's Homemade Steak Sauce
review: No rating by Food dot com will not let me leave it blank. We did not care of the taste of the marinade. It was nothing special, rather bland. I will not make again. I did not make the steak sauce, maybe that would have helped.

name: Vanilla Wafers
review: Yummy!!! This is the second time I've made the recipe. The first time I didn't have whole milk or vanilla sugar. The vanilla sugar makes a HUGE difference in the amount of vanilla flavor in the finished product. First time I made these I used the Ziplock piping method mentioned by other reviewers. This time I used a cookie press and am MUCH more pleased with the results (I did have to spray the cookie press plate with non-stick spray to keep the dough from sticking. I wish we could post pictures! These cookies don't last overnight at my house unless I hide them!

name: Vanilla Wafers
review: These are tasty! I was making them for the banana pudding recipe, but ended up making another batch to eat! I used a Ziploc to pipe the dough onto the baking sheets as suggested in one of the reviews. After chilling for 10 minutes, the dough came out smooth and easy. I made the cookies in narrow finger shapes and they cooked in 10 minutes. I will definitely be making these again!

name: Vanilla Wafers
review: Once again AB makes generic divine.  Nothing but Trefoil Girl Scout cookies beat these things!  I've found a source for some uber  vanillia extract that makes these cookies incredible.

name: Mardi Gras Jambalaya
review: I followed the recipe as written, as I always do, and every time I make it, it's a big hit. Makes plenty for a crowd and to share later. Love it. Great flavor. Really special.

name: Mardi Gras Jambalaya
review: I used chicken thighs instead of duck and Louisiana hot links instead of smoked sausage.  This spiced it up quite a bit.

name: Mardi Gras Jambalaya
review: I think it's a typo about 8 cups of water(2 quarts, and 2 cups of rice.  That's way too much liquid,

name: Pollo Frito
review: I love it!  We make this chicken multiple times a year.  It's extremely flavorful, moist, and easy.  I do have to admit I add garlic to the marinade.  We have served it to guests and prepared it for our weekend family meals.  This is not supposed to be a replacement of southern fried chicken.  It is an lite Italian twist.  For those looking to replace southern fried chicken look elsewhere. Keep up the great work Giada!

name: Pollo Frito
review: I live in the south and we love fried chicken. I also love lemon. This recipe is perfect. My family was eating it right out of the skillet. The chicken comes out moist and tender. I will make this dish time and time again !

name: Pollo Frito
review: Bland. Terribly bland. Even after i added additional salt, cayenne, garlic powder, onion powder and italian seasoning.

name: Lasagne
review: this is flat out fantastic.  The bechamel adds so much flavor instead of the standard, gloppy cheese.  And it makes for a liter dish as well.  Yes, add thyme or your favorite herb to the bolognese.  (I omit the pancetta and just use more beef or pork instead.  Just not crazy about the cured meat flavor in the bolognese.  Make it today.

name: Lasagne
review: Fabulous!

name: Lasagne
review: There is no mention of broth in the ingredients list for the bolognese, yet it is says to add it when you add the wine.  How much broth and what kind?  I started making this yesterday but had to stop because I don't have the broth.

name: Braciole
review: what if u dont have a food mill

name: Braciole
review: This was the best recipe I have ever tried.  I even left out the pine nuts and mushrooms bc I don't like.  WAS AWESOME. Also substituted mozzarella instead of provolone.  My husband wouldn't even talk during dinner bc he was too busy eating this.  EXCELLENT!

name: Braciole
review: Anne Burrell's recipes are always my favorites. She's bold in everything she cooks, and that's the way I love to cook too. I made this braciole as listed, with the exception of throwing in about a half a cup of raisins, in a bow to tradition. I looked for currants but couldn't find them. This recipe is work, but the results are worth it. It did make more filling than I could use, so I put the extra filling in a baking dish, topped it with some leftover provolone and parmigiano-reggiano, and baked it for 30 minutes like a Thanksgiving stuffing. My son and husband nibbled on that while waiting for the dish to finish. I served it with orecchiette pasta, which I cooked al dente and simply tossed with a little butter and parmesan, topped with a basil chiffonade. I served some pasta on one side of a big bowl, then some braciole and its tomato cooking sauce on the other, so it all came together in one big heavenly mixture. Yum!

name: Mexican Meatloaf
review: Best meatloaf ever! I made a few a modifications based on what I had in the house and diet restrictions.  I used ground turkey (2 packs and sweet italian turkey sausage (4 b/c I didn't have any ground beef or chorizo and I was not about to drag the fam to store to get it. I didn't have a poblano so I used half a fresh jalapeño and a couple slices of pickled jalapeño. I didn't have serranos for the sauce so I used one jalapeño.  Also, I wrapped the meatloaf and bacon and spread a little bit of the sauce on it.  DELICIOUS! Kids ate it  - with a little ketchup instead of glaze b/c it was a little too spicy for them.  Perfect for me and Hubbs!

name: Mexican Meatloaf
review: AMAZING!!!! The best meatloaf I have ever had.  Make sure you don't have to work the day after you eat this because it gave all of us gas.  haha.

name: Mexican Meatloaf
review: Very Good! The salsa compliments the meatloaf well. Would make again.

name: Homemade Italian Breadcrumbs
review: Made this in about 15 minutes total on a whim tonight. Used some disappointing bagels that were a bit stale when I got them home from the store. Great way to use bread otherwise gone to waste!

name: Homemade Italian Breadcrumbs
review: Wow this was so easy! I used Three large garlic sticks that I never got to. Broke them down like you said and just added the salt and italian seasoning and Omigosh it tasted so good! I am so making my own breadcrumbs for now on! Thanks Alton!

name: Homemade Italian Breadcrumbs
review: Very Tasty! Very easy to make! Highly Recommended!

name: Oven Baked Pecan-Crusted Chicken Fingers
review: Very good.  I really liked the honey mustard sauce!

name: Oven Baked Pecan-Crusted Chicken Fingers
review: I will definitely be making this again, my whole family loved it!

name: Oven Baked Pecan-Crusted Chicken Fingers
review: One of the best chicken recipes we have made.

name: Watermelon Punch
review: I made this recipe and it was great! The kids loved it.

name: Watermelon Punch
review: I make a batch and added some Vodka and it was the hit with my book club, on a hot summer night. Easy to make recipe!

name: Watermelon Punch
review: This punch is refreshing and tastes all right.  I was expecting the watermelon flavor to star, but it was nearly completely lost among the pineapple and lemonade flavors. I was disappointed. And I agree with the others that it was too sweet.

name: Mascarpone Gelato with Balsamic-Macerated Strawberries
review: It was easy to follow recipe and turned out great!

name: Thanksgiving Day Sweet Potato Pie
review: I loved this recipe..  Although added a little bit more of the cinnamon, nutmeg, and ginger...  However, delicious

name: Thanksgiving Day Sweet Potato Pie
review: I was looking for a light dessert that combines pumpkin and sweet potatos together and this was the only one i found!! I made the mixture from fresh meduim pumpkin (cooked, 1 sweet p., 1 egg, 1/2 cup of sugar, vanilla, 1 cup skim milk in the food processor untill very smooth. I sprayed a pan and i elimianted the pie crust  to be even lighter, and poured the mixture in with some rasains and coconut. Preheat oven 400. It was delicious even warm and very silky like the consistency of a pudding. My husband loved it and I did too. I prefered it warm though. Next time I'll use splenda instead of sugar and it will be guilt free!! :

name: Thanksgiving Day Sweet Potato Pie
review: I made this pie for my husband. Since he absolutely LOVES sweet potatoes I figured I couldn't go wrong with this one. And I was right. this pie was not only fantastic but it was so easy to make.  I actually did bake the sweet potatoes in the oven but then thought next time I could try them in the microwave to speed up the process.  Then I just put sweet potatoes and all liquids in the blender. Once that was mixed I added the sugar and spices.  So good and no lumps!  I'll be making this for my father-in-law this weekend.

name: Mini Ham Croissants
review: Interesting that Jacques Torres has joined most of us and buys frozen puff pastry!  Filling the puff pastry triangle with cut/chopped ham...additional changes we made:

name: Cauliflower "Mac" and Cheese Casserole
review: This recipe is amazing. I just made this tonight and wow I am impressed. used colby jack cheese and regular 2 % milk instead of the heavy cream which makes it even lighter. I would recommend this recipe to friends and family and I certainly will be making this again. :

name: Cauliflower "Mac" and Cheese Casserole
review: This was very good!! Kids and hubby both went back for seconds. Like others I made a few tweaks. I substituted nuefchatel for cream cheese and I added diced and sautee'd polska kielbasa and onions as well as about 1/4 cup diced pickled jalapenos. I also added a little sprinkle of panko crumbs to to the top before baking. Definitely a "make again and again" dish. I've also made this with a few additions left over from dinner the night before like carne asada meat and home made pico de gallo. When the teenagers ask for it, you know it's a keeper.

name: Cauliflower "Mac" and Cheese Casserole
review: This is amazing and I'm not even a fan of cauliflower! Thank you so much!

name: Fried Ice Cream
review: Fun recipe to make! Not one to do at the last minute...but, a keeper.

name: Fried Ice Cream
review: Great recipe. I made a few changes to make it work for me. Rather than freezing the ice cream balls first, I created the ice cream balls and rolled them in the topping immediately. They stuck to the ice cream a lot easier because it was a bit softer. Then the second time I used the egg wash.  For my topping, I mixed hard sugar cookies, frosted flakes, and coconut and used cinnamon in the egg wash. Great!

name: Fried Ice Cream
review: These were really great. It was a lot easier than I expected it to be. I can't wait to make it again.

name: Mixed Salad with Blackberry Vinaigrette
review: I thought this recipe was great.  I ended up using only 12 oz blackberries instead of 16.  I also substituted tarragon vinegar for the white balsalmic.  Thought it was great as it was but may add a little more sugar next time and not toss as much into the salad.  Great base for any vinaigrette. My boyfriend went back for seconds.

name: Mixed Salad with Blackberry Vinaigrette
review: With both raspberries and peaches in season I made some changes to this recipe that are as good as the original.

name: Mixed Salad with Blackberry Vinaigrette
review: Great dressing, but a little bit bitter. Add some additional sugar for a better taste. I used feta instead of goat and it was delicious.

name: Linguine with Chicken Ragu
review: This is very tasty and doesn't take long to make if you "cheat" slightly and use a good jarred sauce.  I like to use Patsy's (the extra spicy one  to give it some kick.  I have made this a number of times and the only changes I make are to half the recipe (there are only two of us use the jarred sauce, add some fresh mushrooms, and that's about it.

name: Linguine with Chicken Ragu
review: I wanted to love this but I just didn't. I think it was mincing up all the chicken thighs? Lots of work and the flavor was just ok. I even made the marinara. Was worth a shot but I probably won't make this again.

name: Linguine with Chicken Ragu
review: Great recipe and wonderful flavors. Used a jar of marinara but otherwise followed recipe to the T. Highly recommend.

name: Beef Borscht
review: I like Emeril's style of cooking and trust the outcome for most of his recipes.  I changed this one up abit working with what I had on hand. No need for extra fat so I cut out the Bacon adding more Beef! I also sauteed the Onion and 1/2 a head of Cabbage in the microwave with abit of butter and olive oil until transparent! The last 30 min. of cooking time, I added the 1/2 half of the Cabbage.  I also added a large Beef Broth with extra water and instead of Fresh Dill....I simply added the grocery cubes of frozen Dill which worked just as well.

name: Beef Borscht
review: Excellent borscht. Best one I have made! I used pancetta instead of bacon. Thanks Emeril....you rock!

name: Beef Borscht
review: This is a great soup and a variation on one that I know and love so well.  I have had beef borscht before, but not with these ingredients and it was excellent.  I didn't roast the beets whole; instead I sliced them, layed the slices on a roasting pan and used olive oil instead of veg oil.  Also, I did this FIRST and found out why it is mid-way down the recipe as the stew has to simmer for two hours.

name: Cornish Game Hens, Cooked under a Brick, with Orzo Risotto and Grilled Zucchini
review: emerils cornish games hens,cooked under a brick, with orzo risotto and grilled zucchini showed an excellent flavor and clenzed my palite.the dish also showed a lot of colors.

name: Cornish Game Hens, Cooked under a Brick, with Orzo Risotto and Grilled Zucchini
review: As I was searching for something to do with orzo one night, I found this recipe. Not only was it easy to prepare, it was absolutely delicious. It's now on my list of recipes to use on a regular basis. Thanks, Emeril!!

name: Slow-Cooked Country Green Beans
review: I tried these for the first time at our family Christmas get-together.  The beans were awesome, and there were numerous compliments about them.  I did add a little more cayenne than the recipe called for, and the extra "kick" was worth it.

name: Slow-Cooked Country Green Beans
review: One of the best green bean recipes I've had. Great Thanksgiving side.

name: Slow-Cooked Country Green Beans
review: Fantastic, but I, of course, made a couple changes. Way more cayenne (we like it spicy and used chicken stock instead of water. This is served like clockwork for every Thanksgiving and Christmas dinner. My cousin's wife begged for the recipe; she said it was the first time she'd ever seen her three kids actually go for seconds on a vegetable.

name: Overnight Oatmeal
review: I didn't have the dried fruit so I followed the rest of the recipe anyway except I have a five quart Rival and really like oatmeal and trust Alton totally so I doubled it.  I like maple, brown sugar and cinnamon so I added some to the recipe.  I left it on low and went to bed.  It was a little soupy when I got up so I turned it up to high for about 30 minutes.  The reason  for the soupyness wasn't the slow cooker, it was because I hadn't used the dried fruit which would have absorbed some of the liquid, but the higher temperature took care of that.  I forgot to say I misted my crock pot with olive oil before adding the ingredients,  no cleanup problems and it doesn't affect the flavor.  I added fresh blueberries to my bowl and it was the best oatmeal I've ever had.  Thanks Alton you're the best and I'm pulling for your team on Next Food Network Star.

name: Overnight Oatmeal
review: I tried this on sunday to have for breakfast all week and although I didn't follow instructions exactly (didn't add milk or half and half just made it with water and a pinch of salt b/c I really like to add granola and nuts it was fabulous!  I made it before I went to bed and int he morning it was perfectly cooked!  Thank you so much.  It coulnd't have been easier!

name: Overnight Oatmeal
review: My husband and I saw this on a rerun of Good Eats.  The very next day we went to the grocery store to grab the ingredients.  He made a batch with cinnamon and raisins, and I made one the next night with cinnamon, dried cranberries, and dried blueberries.  It was oatmeal perfection!  I can't wait to try other variations of this recipe!  Seriously, it's a fast, easy, hot breakfast, and a lot healthier than a lot of other fast breakfast options.

name: Fresh Peach Crostata
review: I rolled my store bought pie crust out a little larger like other recipes called for.  Added some blueberries to mine and didn't put in all the sugar but it was plenty sweet enough.  I also had the problem with the juices spilliing out all over the pan so it didn't look as gorgeous as I would have hoped but still tasted delicious and that's what matters the most.  Don't know that there is anything one can do about the juices spilling out but if someone has a suggestion other than putting in a regular pie plate, let me know.  I like the free form look of the crust.  On a whole easy and delicious dessert especially with the ice cream!

name: Fresh Peach Crostata
review: I added a handful of frozen blueberries since my 4 peaches were not that big.   Also, added cinnamon and nutmeg and used a pie plate as suggested by others.  Was 4 servings for us.

name: Fresh Peach Crostata
review: I threw this together last evening when I noticed I had 3 peaches and 2 plums sitting on the counter that needed to be utilized.

name: Baby Ruth Candy Bar
review: Not sure if I did not get to to exact temp or what but I mixed the remaining powdered sugar and  I waited fifteen minutes to let it cool but could not roll them to sticky??? It was not happening!! What did I do wrong?

name: Baby Ruth Candy Bar
review: i like this babe ruth bar because it taste just like a store bought one. Yum!

name: Baby Ruth Candy Bar
review: It was so good!!

name: Turkey Patty Melt
review: Delicious, great recipe!

name: Turkey Patty Melt
review: This is soooo good!!  I've got it on my "frequent meal" list!!

name: French Dip Sandwich
review: This is our new favorite recipe!

name: French Dip Sandwich
review: This is a great recipe, we have been making for over a year.  It is one of the most requested from my teenagers.  My college son has now requested as a must have whenever he is home on break!

name: French Dip Sandwich
review: This is on the list for fast,tasty, and easy. The dip IS really good!

name: Apple Tart Tatin with Homemade Puff Pastry
review: I really liked this one. I've made it twice and it turned out great both times! The puff pastry recipe is really good but remember that it makes about five times more than what you need for the measured amount. I make it larger in a bigger frying pan, but like I said, it's really not too hard. I think it's only rated difficult because the puff pastry takes about 7 hours to make right. After making it I keep the extra dough in the freezer for anything - It works great!

name: Apple Tart Tatin with Homemade Puff Pastry
review: I can cook, I cannot bake, so making any kind of dessert that does not come in a box eludes me.  This comes out perfect for me every time (although I use frozen puff pastry, not pressing my luck there.  Easy, and tasty.  Thanks, Emeril!

name: Apple Tart Tatin with Homemade Puff Pastry
review: Used frozen puff pastry but it was still really good and relatively easy.  I'm sure I'll be making it again very soon.

name: Lime Soda
review: We loved this homemade soda!  I have never tried making my own soda drink and this is so, so much better than anything in a bottle or can.  I have a lime tree and I'm always looking for recipes that use limes.  This one is easy and can be used with any citrus in my opinion.  I've used it with  lemons and I'm going to try it with my Meyer lemons next.

name: Lime Soda
review: i tried this using water instead of club soda because i was too lazy to get to the store. i also used lemon instead of a lime. it came out GREAT!!! my only concern is the amount of sugar used. i always aim for healthier options so next time i might try adding more lime/lemon rind to the water/sugar solution in efforts to stretch the syrup a bit more. using this recipe, we're putting in almost the same amount of sugar per serving that you'd get in a can of pepsi or other commercial soda. i want to try to lower it a bit to make it a bit healthier...other than that i think this idea is great and it tastes great, even with lemon!

name: Lime Soda
review: I tried it after I had went to a Puerto Rican restaurant and had it! It was almost as good as the one I had in the restaurant. I will need to perfect the process but I can't wait to try it again and maybe add a little vodka or light rum!

name: Pizza Margherita
review: This took me literally 15 minutes to make, very simple and delicious.  I used a store bought dough and kept everything else to the recipe directions.  It came out great!!

name: Pizza Margherita
review: The recipe was easier than listed, I enjoyed it, but will experiment with sauce for more flavor.

name: Pizza Margherita
review: It look so yummy!

name: Spaghetti with Fish and Vegetables: Ciambotta
review: WOW!!  I had no idea this recipes with such simple ingredients would produce such a wonderful flavorful meal.  I used cod and good for you angel hair pasta and it was perfect!  My picky 14 YO ate a huge bowl full and so did my son.  I don't think I simmered my sauce long enough so next time I will simmer longer.  I also put some diced fresh jalapeno from my garden on top before serving.  I will for sure make this again!!!

name: Spaghetti with Fish and Vegetables: Ciambotta
review: Easy and inexpensive.  The sauce was great.  Tried this dish with regular white fish but next time I will try with a skinned fish - I bet it adds alot of favor.

name: Spaghetti with Fish and Vegetables: Ciambotta
review: This recipe was fabulous.  It was simple, tasty and easy to clean-up.

name: Venetian Carrot Cake
review: :p Simply delicious! (:

name: Venetian Carrot Cake
review: What a great cake! Tried this last night and it filled the house with a wonderful fragrance. The cake was moist and delicious and not sickeningly sweet like the American version. I used almond meal from Natural Grocers about $3.50 for a 1 lbs package. I really don't know what's not to like about the recipe. I prepared it for a gluten intolerant friend and he loved it. Concerning the lack of leavening, my cake didn't need it. The eggs provided all the left necessary.

name: Venetian Carrot Cake
review: This is an excellent gluten free recipe. I made cupcakes to grab for breakfast on the way out and they are great. I used walnut instead of pine nuts, and added coconut. Definitely a keeper.

name: Guy's Spicy Spanish Rice
review: Tasty, although not as spicy as advertised.  Will keep some of the seeds in next time.  Loved the roasted vegetable flavors, the corn gave a nice sweetness.  Liked the texture differences between the peppers, corn and squash.  Will add more beans and liked the spicy sausage idea too.  Will definitely attempt again!

name: Guy's Spicy Spanish Rice
review: I love this recipe and always get rave reviews when I make it. Like others I have tweaked it to meet my needs. I don't use the squash and I use less stock. I add canned tomatoes, usually whatever Mexican blend I can find. I use canned corn as well.  Also, I add spicy sausage making this a more hearty main dish. Served with cornbread this is one of my family's favorite meals.

name: Guy's Spicy Spanish Rice
review: EXCEPTIONAL WITH LAYERS OF FLAVOR AND TEXTURE.  AGREE WITH OTHER REVIEWERS ABOUT THE PREP TIME...YES, IT TAKES LONGER THAN ANTICIPATED, BUT WHEN YOU HAVE THE TIME...DO IT.  FOLLOWED THE RECIPE , BUT ADDED MORE CORN (3 COBS AND AN EXTRA POBLANO.  IT IS MORE OF A SPICY HEAT RATHER THAN A HOT TASTE...SORT OF SNEAKS UP ON YOU, BUT DOESN'T LINGER. ALSO, SUGGEST YOU WEAR GLOVES FOR THE SERRANO.  MY HANDS WERE HOT AFTERWARDS, BUT THEN I THOUGHT AFTER ALL THAT CHOPPING, THE CAPSAZIN ( AN INGREDIENT IN LINAMENTS WOULDN'T BE THAT BAD AFTERALL.  THIS IS A RECIPE THAT SEEMS AS THOUGHT IT WOULD BE EVEN BETTER THE NEXT DAY...IF YOU HAVE ANY LEFT.

name: Chili Oil
review: So, who does not like freshly infused olive oil? Show of hands. I thought not.

name: Chili Oil
review: This was heavenly with bread or to use for many other recipes.  Thank you Giada!

name: Chili Oil
review: This is a great substitute for plain jane olive oil

name: Sweet and Sticky Applesauce Baby Back Ribs
review: extremely tasty...loveee it, my husband loves it..everytime i make ribs i make it this way..its very popular in my house...i added a lil brown sugar to the bbq mixture....omg this ribs are delicious..thnx for this recipe

name: Waffle of Insane Greatness
review: Best waffle recipe!!! Super easy, light and crispy, and extremely delicious! However the amount it makes is only enough to serve 2-3 people not 4 (at least for my family.

name: Waffle of Insane Greatness
review: Totally easy and yummy waffles!!

name: Waffle of Insane Greatness
review: These are the best waffles EVER!!!  We have been making them for breakfast once a week for about a year now...

name: Hot and Sour Thai Soup: Tom Yum Goong
review: I make this recipe whenever I'm craving this soup.  I sometimes add other ingredients like baby bok choy, snap peas, chicken , etc. for some additional heartier ingredients.  It's great every time.

name: Hot and Sour Thai Soup: Tom Yum Goong
review: good recipe, but the plural of guest is GUESTS, no apostrohpe!

name: Hot and Sour Thai Soup: Tom Yum Goong
review: Needs tamarind!!!

name: Cheesy Cast Iron Skillet Scrambled Eggs
review: i didnt enjoy the way this meal turned out in the end

name: Cheesy Cast Iron Skillet Scrambled Eggs
review: Great, fast and easy dish! Most any cheese can be subbed but use the goat cheese whenever possible- the creamy bite is what makes the dish!

name: Cheesy Cast Iron Skillet Scrambled Eggs
review: I quartered this recipe as I was only making it for three people. I love eggs and red onions. Yet this was the first time I ever put them together. Delicious! I used cheddar cheese instead of goat cheese, and this was still awesome. My kids raved about it while eating it. I can't wait to try it with feta, as I don't really go for the goat cheese thing. Chives were a nice addition. Great recipe, Bobby!

name: Pumpkin Cookies with Cream Cheese Frosting
review: Awful!  Very bland. A total waste of ingredients.

name: Pumpkin Cookies with Cream Cheese Frosting
review: I followed the general recipe but made a few changes. I used a whole can of pumpkin, used brown sugar instead of  white sugar and omit the syrup all together. I increased the nutmeg to 1/2 teaspoon and included 1/2 teaspoon of pumpkin spice. And do cook for 16-20 mins depending on size! These are very good holiday cookies. Traditionally speaking they are not cookies but cake like cookies. That's how they are suppose to be. I've never had a pumpkin spice cookie that wasn't cake like! Almost tastes like a pumpkin bread.

name: Pumpkin Cookies with Cream Cheese Frosting
review: I liked how these cookies were soft but wasn't too impressed with the taste. However I did add some vanilla extract (1/2 teaspoon or so and it added a little more flavor.

name: ZUCCHINI STUFFED WITH WILD MUSHROOM AND PINE NUT QUICHE
review: It was delicious, but it needs to be cooked longer than the recipe calls for, so as to cook the eggs.

name: ZUCCHINI STUFFED WITH WILD MUSHROOM AND PINE NUT QUICHE
review: I served this dish at a bridal shower (as a crustless quiche alternative and it was a hit.  The mushroom mixture was delicious!  Two tips:  Make sure the zucchini rounds aren't too thick and add extra mushroom mix - it really adds to the flavor.

name: Rotisserie Duck with Hoisin Baste served with Grilled Oranges, Scallions and Pancakes
review: Sounds like a gimme, but for the tremendous amount of trouble to make the hoisin baste and apply it, added to the difficult nature of duck itself (as compared to, say, chicken, you'd better already have a serious affinity for duck over some other kind of meat. The baste is good, but it is pretty labor intensive and in the end the dinner was merely OK. And I followed the recipe to the T. I would suggest the same baste, but on something else, like chicken or pork.

name: Rotisserie Duck with Hoisin Baste served with Grilled Oranges, Scallions and Pancakes
review: My husband and I were anxious to try out the rotisserie on the new grill and thought duck would be a great option for the maiden voyage.  This recipe is super easy, the sauce was really tasty, and it made for a great Christmas dinner that we didn't have to fuss over.  The grilled oranges add a festive aroma.  We added grilled mushrooms, yellow squash, and yellow and orange peppers basted with a little of the sauce to round out the meal.

name: Rotisserie Duck with Hoisin Baste served with Grilled Oranges, Scallions and Pancakes
review: If you have a a gril, it is a must try!

name: Guacamole
review: Actually, the previous review is clueless.  You do NOT have to have lime juice or garlic.  Real guacamole does not contain garlic.  Most people from mexico simply smash fresh avocado with possibly a little salt.

name: Guacamole
review: you've got to have lime juice and garlic

name: Jack's Old South Meat Marinade
review: Best Marinade I've ever used. Works great with all meats. For those that are serious about grilling, this marinade is a must to try. I see why Jack wins all those contests!

name: Jack's Old South Meat Marinade
review: So many times I have dried out the pork roast because my wife insist we over cook it. I inject a roast today with Jack's marinade and it was moist, tender and sweet. I see now why he wins barbecue cook-offs. Great recipe!!!

name: Jack's Old South Meat Marinade
review: I cooked two pork butts on my grill using Jack's marinade and rub.  They were awesome!  I've never received so many compliments.  It was the first time I've ever tried any BBQ.  Jack's recipes make it taste great.  The hardest part was waiting all those hours to get to eat!  My Southern husband was really impressed with this Yankee girl. Thanks!!

name: Vegetable Tofu Stir-Fry
review: The Veggie Tofu StirFry did take longer to cook the tofu from the original recipe. Red pepper flakes were added for a touch of heat since I didn't have fresh ginger to begin with. The sauce I thought was excellent; even when I used flour to thicken the sauce instead of cornstarch.

name: Vegetable Tofu Stir-Fry
review: My husband made this for dinner tonight and I thought it was delicious!  He substituted shitake mushrooms for the peppers and it tasted great.

name: Vegetable Tofu Stir-Fry
review: Decent stir-fry, as long as you do not start with the onion and garlic. Unless you enjoy burnt pieces of soot. If you do saute the onion and garlic first, be sure to remove from the skillet/wok before adding the tofu.

name: Dustin's Chicken Spiedini
review: I made this for the first time last night and it was a huge hit. Thank God for the other reviews, because the instructions were poorly lacking compared to how the reviews saw it prepared on TV. I used thin sliced chicken breast and they were very east to roll. The only thing I will do differently next time is I will try and grate the Asiago. My cubes didn't melt as much as I would have liked, and for me Asiago is too strong a taste to bite a chunk. Other that that a great recipe to prepare ahead of time or for a large crowd.

name: Dustin's Chicken Spiedini
review: Wow. This was quick, easy, fast and tasty!!

name: Dustin's Chicken Spiedini
review: This is a great basic recipe that needs to be jazzed up.  I read the other reviews and this is what I changed.  Roll the chichen bread crumbs wrapped around the asiago cube, dip in olive oil and make sure to use Italian or zesty bread crumbs and brown the chicken in butter and oil.  Then place the browned chicken in a glass pan that has chicken stock, white wine, butter, vidalia onions, garlic, onions, and bay leaves.  Cook for 15 minutes, then flip the spiedinis and cook another 10 minutes.  This turned out to be the most juicy and flavorful chicken EVER!!  Like my dinner guest said, "This chicken melts like butter in my mouth."

name: Sawmill Gravy
review: The recipe was good but not great. It was bland despite adding what I thought should be more than enough salt. I added a teaspoon of organic chicken base and it perked up to be perfect.

name: Sawmill Gravy
review: To bjsdeepblue:  you have to make sure to scrape the bottom of the pan as you are stirring your gravy, before it starts to thicken up.  I've found I get best results by using a whisk at first, just to break up the lumps of roux, then switch to a wooden spoon, stir constantly, and keep scraping the pan bottom - that's where the gravy will start to thicken first.

name: Sawmill Gravy
review: I make great tasting gravy with this recipe, but I substitute a cup of coffee for a portion of the milk. Tastes wonderful, and gives the gravy a slightly darker color.  BUT, I always seem to have a film or layer (probably flour? which sticks like hardened glue to the bottom of the skillet. I would love to hear suggestions on what my mistake is?

name: Southern Fried Chicken
review: I loved it  I think I may have used a little too much house seasoning (salt but it was delicious

name: Southern Fried Chicken
review: My family and I's favorite fried chicken recipe of all time! Even my picky neighbor gobbled it down. The hot sauce is amazing in this recipe. It doesn't make it spicy, just brings out even more flavor. This is now my only fried chicken recipe I'll ever use. Love you Paula!

name: Southern Fried Chicken
review: ITS EASY TO MAKE. I LOVED IT. IT MADE MY MOUTH WATER IT WAS SO GOOD

name: Emeril's Favorite Chinese Chicken with Green Beans
review: My family absolutely loved this.  I was told that I need to make it at least once a week.  It's the bomb!

name: Emeril's Favorite Chinese Chicken with Green Beans
review: It was ok. Tried it but probably wont make it again.

name: Emeril's Favorite Chinese Chicken with Green Beans
review: This was okay, but I probably won't make it again.  It's probably actually really delicous, but I have very little experience using my wok and don't really understand Asian food ingredients yet.

name: Cranberry-Orange Sauce
review: This cranberry sauce is the only one that I make for Thanksgiving.  It is the easiest and most flavorful cranberry sauce I've ever tasted.  I make an extra batch for myself so my family can enjoy it after the holidays.

name: Cranberry-Orange Sauce
review: I agree with a previous reviewer, it is not clear whether you use the whole orange and juice or just the zest.

name: Cranberry-Orange Sauce
review: so easy and tastes so much better than canned cranberry sauce

name: Beef Pastrami
review: I followed the instructions to the letter when making this recipe. I thought it turned out poorly. The fact that no curing salt is used scares me as I regularly make smoked sausages. I have a much better recipe that turns out a far superior product. You're welcome to email me for the recipe.

name: Beef Pastrami
review: great recipe, followed instructions smoked to 165 deg, simmered to 185 deg results better than expected

name: Beef Pastrami
review: Amaizing Recipe....I served real bombs on plates, everybody amazed.

name: Savory Crepes with Creamy Chicken, Ham and Mushroom Filling
review: One of the best dishes I've ever prepared. I made a savory crepe with chives but otherwise didn't change a thing. My guests raved. Might try it next time with shrimp and crab instead of chicken and ham.

name: Savory Crepes with Creamy Chicken, Ham and Mushroom Filling
review: Very enjoyable. I used AB's crepe batter recipe and Emeril's filling. I baked them covered with foil for the initial baking period so they wouldn't dry out or burn, then I put the parmesan cheese on top and finished baking them uncovered. They were perfect and my other half really enjoyed them also.

name: Savory Crepes with Creamy Chicken, Ham and Mushroom Filling
review: I made this tonight but with some changes to use what I had on hand.  I used just 2% milk instead of the cream and omitted the ham.  I used white wine instead of Sherry.  I had purchased some premade crepes at the store, but when I tasted one, it was way to sweet.  So I made these crepes but I did not refrigate the batter for one hour as I had no time.  I cooked my chicken in my homemade chicken stock and cut the peices into about 1/3 inch in size, after boiling for 20 minutes.  I precooked the mushroom in butter then I added the small chicken cubes and the white wine.  I reduced this until the wine was mostly absorbed.  I did not have any Gyurere cheese, so I omitted that also.  My family loved it.  I could only give it a 4 star, because I made so many changes.  Tarragon is a great herb to add to this recipe, and do not forget the Essence! The crepes were so easy to make, I am sick that I spent $5.99 for 9 premade sweet crepes.  Lessons learned!

name: Fabulous Focaccia
review: I also don't have a stand mixer, but I do have a bread machine so I used the "dough" setting to do the kneading and rising--thanks hunterhall for the idea. I put the liquids in the first: foamy yeast mix + 2 tsp salt--reduced from 1 Tbsp--dissolved in 2 Tbsp water + 1/4 cup olive oil. Then I put 3 1/2 cups of all purpose flour on top and started the dough cycle. It turned out to be too much flour so I had to add an extra 1/4 cup of water. Next time I will try only 3 cups of flour. The dough still turned out great! After the onion was done cooking I mixed the minced garlic in with it to make it easier to spread evenly on top. Then mixed the dry toppings together and sprinkled them over the rest. I used only 1 tsp of salt on top and I think it was still too much-next time I won't use any salt in the topping. Not all dough recipes work with a bread machine, so I'm glad this one does. Super easy and super delicious! I look forward to experimenting with other toppings.

name: Fabulous Focaccia
review: The salt is way to high especially with the Parmesan.  I would not salt it at all and just use the parmesan for the salt flavoe other than that this is a real SUPER winner

name: Fabulous Focaccia
review: Delicious! So simple and quick. My 2 year old can't get enough!

name: Tequila Chicken
review: Good to be sure, but this recipe is WAY too busy.  Just Marinate skinless boneless chicken thighs (three times the flavor of breasts in 2 oz. tequila and a little Mexican hot sauce.  Salt and pepper and grill on hot grill for about 6 minutes per side.  Your guests will love it. Guaranteed!!

name: Tequila Chicken
review: I added extra cayenne pepper for a bigger kick.  This was a really yummy marinade though

name: Tequila Chicken
review: Spicy, moist, delicious, fast and easy!  Lots of flavor without having to marinade overnight.

name: Shrimp Scampi Pizza
review: This pizza tastes amazing the only thing I did differently was use red pepper flakes.It was really easy to make. i love this recipe!!!

name: Shrimp Scampi Pizza
review: this was such an easy recipe, it sounded too good to be true! I also added thinly sliced tomatoes when i put it back in the oven. Absolutely delicious- if I didnt have to save some for my husband i would have  eaten it all!

name: Shrimp Scampi Pizza
review: forgot the lemon juice...very tasty 2 lbs wasn't as much as I thought it would be. We used the whole 2 lbs.

name: Black Forest Gateau (Schwarzwalder Kirschtorte)
review: I'm glad I read the reviews first - corn starch is much different from corn flour! I used 3 - 8" tins to pour the batter into and baked with parchment on the bottom and sides. The first test run cake I made was a little dry, so the second time I made sure to brush the cake liberally with the syrup. I also brushed the syrup on the bottom layer, inverted it and spread the melted chocolate on the dry side. Big difference. I also left 8 of the cherries from the jar to soak a couple of days in the kirsch to put on as a garnish. On the first cake, I ran out of whipped cream, on the second, I had too much left over! Suggest putting whipped cream in a small piping bag first to ensure you have enough to decorate, then layer the cake and frost the sides. This is a do-over and I was never a fan of Black Forest cake until now.

name: Black Forest Gateau (Schwarzwalder Kirschtorte)
review: Some of the language was confusing: wheat flour, corn flour.

name: Black Forest Gateau (Schwarzwalder Kirschtorte)
review: all other parts went fine, but the cake didn't turn out right.  It was very flat and there was no way I could cut three layers out of that.

name: Portuguese Kale Soup
review: It's a great soup.  Even my kids eat their greens with this soup. LIke most others I ditched the turnips added more potatoes. Thought it was a little thick for our tastes and added an extra cup of water.

name: Portuguese Kale Soup
review: Yum!  I can't find the Chourico in my town, so sometimes I use chicken sausage and chicken stock, but today I decided to try it with chorizo and beef stock.  Everyone I've served it to has loved it, and it makes a big pot.  This is a recipe I make again and again.

name: Portuguese Kale Soup
review: Very good!  I omitted turnip also, didn't have any.  Also I used half beef and half chicken broth and a full 28 oz can of diced tomatoes.  It was excellent!

name: Portobello Mushroom "Fries"
review: I tasted them before breading and finishing them and thought they tasted just as good at that point, minus the extra time and calories. The final product didn't turn out crispy for me- one side was a little soggy. I will make them again, but I think I'll try finishing them in the oven next time.

name: Portobello Mushroom "Fries"
review: Delicious. I even left the "gills" on. My mom has never had portobello mushrooms, so tomorrow for mother's day I think I'll prepare these for her...what a way to first try portobellos. This time I'll try it without the gills.

name: Portobello Mushroom "Fries"
review: I have made the Portobello Mushroom "Fries" twice and they came out delicious both times.  Rachael Ray knows how to brighten up your Day.  You go Rachael !!!!!!!!!!  I just love you !!!!!!!!!!

name: Individual Chicken Pot Pie with Puff Pastry
review: 5 Stars even tho made changes, but Alton Brown deserves the credit for flavoring of filling! Hubby has yearned for his Grandma's. He said flavor even beats her's! Love Alton Brown & Good Eats! Hubby does too!

name: Individual Chicken Pot Pie with Puff Pastry
review: Tasty, Easy, Time Consuming, Modified Recipe - Like others I used store bought puff pastry but all the chopping still took some time. Made two batches and froze one. Reduced chicken to 1 lb/recipe, used half as many mushrooms, doubled the carrots and celery. Instead of a whole yellow onion used half and added 4 ozs of fresh pearl onions. Also substituted 1/2 c of white wine for 1/2 c of the chicken broth. Agree with other reviewers, took longer than stated for sauce to thicken. Suggest cooks taste the tarragon before adding it. I skipped it altogether and substituted a blend of sage, rosemary, celery seed and a little fresh parsley. Also agree with reviewer who translated ounces of butter and flour to 4 T of butter and 5 T of flour. That worked perfect. This is a very forgiving recipe, alter seasonings to taste. My family thought pearl onions were one of the best ingredients. They take slightly longer to cook down than regular onions, (maybe 2 more mins -- delicious!!

name: Individual Chicken Pot Pie with Puff Pastry
review: I can't speak for Alton's puff pastry recipe, but the chicken pot pie filling is excellent.  I think I would prefer a lower chicken-to-vegetable ratio - two carrots wasn't quite enough.  The mushrooms were a tasty addition.  This is a minor complaint, though...I was very pleased with how this turned out.

name: Classic Bean Sprout Stir Fry
review: This was a very easy, fast and delicious dish. I actually added a little sesame oil, fresh shitake mushrooms, and a pinch of salt and pepper.  When just about done i added a good dash of lite soy sauce.  Yummy!!!  My family loved it!

name: Classic Bean Sprout Stir Fry
review: I had all the ingredients on hand.  I didn't bother with the "hair" on the sprouts.  I added about a teaspoon of garlic chili sauce, finished the sprouts with some finely chopped cilantro, and served it with jasmine rice, pan seared tilapia and a freshly cooked mango chutney.  WOW!  Thanks so much Chef Tsai!

name: Classic Bean Sprout Stir Fry
review: This is a quick and tasty vegetarian dish that's easy on the budget, too.

name: French Onion Soup with Shaved Swiss Cheese
review: Just made this for the 3rd time this past weekend.  It is beyond good!

name: French Onion Soup with Shaved Swiss Cheese
review: I made this today for lunch and it was wonderful.  I was concerned about the bourbon being overpowering, but it was not at all.  I ended up toasting french bread and melting the cheesse on top of it and topping the soup....it was a nice addition.  I would recommend this dish.  I always have loved french onion soup, but it is always too salty, I had homemade chicken stock and didn't add as much salt (hardly any since my stock was a little salty already....turned out great!

name: French Onion Soup with Shaved Swiss Cheese
review: This is the first time I have not been overjoyed with a recipe from Emeril.  My husband had two bites and could not eat any more!!  He LOVES french onion soup and orders it at everywhere we go, but this was not good!!  The broth is not heavy or dark enough.  I think the addition of the chicken stock ruins it and also the white pepper overpowers the entire soup.  Sorry Emeril, but I can't support this one.

name: Cin Chili Stuffed Poblano Peppers
review: I followed the recipe except substituted chipotle powder for the jalapeno powder.  The Cin Chili was very tasty.  I am not a huge red chili powder fan, but I did follow the recipe.  I will definitely make the Cin Chili again, but I will decrease the amount of chili powder by half.  The chili itself wasn't too spicy heatwise, but adding the chili to the poblanos definitely turned up the heat quite a bit.  (I did seed and cut out membrane.  I tamed mine down a bit with a dollop of sour cream--delish!  For those who don't like the heat, you will want to try a milder pepper.  The Cin Chili would be a great taco filling, and I think I will add cheese to the leftover chili and wrap in tortillas for chili cheese burritos.  For an appetizer, the chili would also be good stuffed in jalapenos and maybe even wrapped in bacon and grilled.  Even though the recipe takes some time to cook, it is very easy, and you don't have to stand over the stove the whole time while it's cooking.

name: Cin Chili Stuffed Poblano Peppers
review: I usually have great success with Food Network recipes.  This one....not so much.  I followed the recipe to the letter, when I was to add "Batch 2", I thought the chili was way too dry...so I checked the Food Network reviews, and decided to add more beef broth.  That worked.  All in all, I spent too much time adding batches of basically the same ingredients, setting the timer waiting to add the next batch,  for a mediocre result.  This is not worthy of two hours of my time....sorry.

name: Cin Chili Stuffed Poblano Peppers
review: I followed this recipe and even at this moment my mouth is still burning the recipe needs to be tweaked to taste. I also felt that cooking the Cin Chili was way to long and the peppers would have been better had they been boiled and skin removed I thought that not only hurt the over all presentation but that the cheese would have melted and stuck better. I believe the peppers probably need to be dipped in a batter suffed with the Cin Chili and at the last ten minutes add the cheese I am almost certain this would have made for a much better dish that I would have enjoyed more. I still would see other recipes but this is not a keeper for me and not boiling the peppers was a step not needed to be left out!.

name: Buttermilk Pound Cake
review: It would be better to have cup measurements not everyone has a scale

name: Buttermilk Pound Cake
review: As one earlier commented, it is a great way to use leftover buttermilk.  But I had the same problem, I baked it at 375 for about 20 minutes when I checked it and it was already so brown.  I reduced heat to 325 and continued baking.  Should have read review. But still it's the best pound cake I believe I have ever made or eaten.

name: Buttermilk Pound Cake
review: Amazing way to use up some buttermilk before it goes bad...it was great to be able to use my recently acquired kitchen scale too.  The cake was moist and didn't have the expected tangy flavor...the kid loves taking this with them as a snack to camp, way better than a Lil Debbie :

name: Gina's Banana Cupcakes
review: These cupcakes turned out fantastic! It was an easy recipe to follow too.  I didn't make the frosting because I ran out of molasses but I did a traditional cream cheese frosting with a little cinnamon.  The cupcakes were so moist and takes better than another recipe that I normally use.  Everyone loved them even my 7 yr old son who doesn't like bananas!  He at least loves banana in cupcakes now!  Enjoy!

name: Gina's Banana Cupcakes
review: I made these cupcakes yesterday 7/22/12.  I cannot tell you how delish they were!  Very tasty & moist.  Good with or without frosting.  Although I made a homemade butter cream icing and it was a little too sweet for me.  I am thinking cream cheese frosting would be the bomb on these.  Thanks Gina for the awesome recipe :

name: Gina's Banana Cupcakes
review: I have to say, these cupcakes were amazing.  I made them for the first time for a wedding...talk about a gamble, but it paid off.  They were so easy to make and delicious.  I did not make the frosting with it, but I will have to try it.  If you don't like the frosting try a caramel frosting like I did.  You wont't regret trying these!

name: BBQ Chicken Pizza
review: This is a great go to recipe!  Easy to put together after working all day and a favorite with the picky eater in the family.

name: BBQ Chicken Pizza
review: This was great!  We made our own dough as well.  We will definitely do this again:

name: BBQ Chicken Pizza
review: Very good pizza recipe! Easy, delicious, and simple. It will definitely be one of my regular go to recipes.

name: Crab Louis
review: Great recipe but I omitted the horseradish.Delish !!!!

name: Crab Louis
review: This was such a refreshing salad on a hot summer night.  I added fresh dill to the dressing as well as just a tad more ketchup.  We all loved it!!

name: Crab Louis
review: Sara's recipes never disappoint and this certainly is no exception.  The dressing was delicious and would be wonderful on any salad.  Thank you, Sara!

name: Green Chile Stew
review: Used homemade chicken stock instead of bouillon, which probably gave the stew a much richer mouth-feel than the original would have. I think 4-6 servings is a bit low -- for us it was about 8 servings (4 servings for 2 lbs of meat is a half pound per person - yikes!.

name: Green Chile Stew
review: Unbelievable recipe.  I love that the kitchen bouquet is used.  I use it in just about everything!!!  Great, Great recipe!!

name: Green Chile Stew
review: Absolutely wonderful!!  I am from NM and I make many stews and mine are good but this one beats em all hands down.  I only changed a few things.  I made it with chicken breast 1.5lbs.  Used 28oz mild frozen green chile and 14oz hot. Used a carton of chicken broth and added an onion.  I cooked it on low for 3 hours...OH MY. and yes the bouquet is a real taste enhancer, I had to look it up and buy it.  Well worth the trip.

name: Very Basic Bread
review: the best bread I have ever made.  Made some mistakes and did not have the terra cotta base (its winter and the local hardware is out dah but it still had an excellent chew.  The youtube videos (pt 1-2 is invaluable in helping to explain the steps.  Alton was/is always spot on with his cooking instructions

name: Very Basic Bread
review: Tastes good, but yes it's basic. This was my first bread and it was probably a good starter recipe, but I'll likely look for something more adventurous for next time.

name: Very Basic Bread
review: Tastes good, as far as basic bread goes. I agree with Alton on soaking the flour overnight as a preferment, to help hydrate the gluten, instead of using the straight dough method. But he is really over complicating a simple bread recipe.
