I didn't use all the dried spices it called for, but the flavor was still fantastic. I'd recommend this recipe to anyone.

name: Double Mustard Crusted Pork Roast with Jus
review: Very tasty!  Bought a boneless pork loin roast-marinated it the day before-while it was resting -put the veggies with their juices in a saucepan and added the vermouth,stock and butter.  Went great with Guy's Adams Apple mashed potatoes!  Lots of flavor!

name: Double Mustard Crusted Pork Roast with Jus
review: This was the best pork roast I've ever had--so much flavor. I used a pork loin and my supermarket gave me a wonderful cut.  Next time I would put some chicken broth in the roasting pan when I put the pan in the oven because the drippings came out very dry and too brown. I cooked the roast to 160 degrees on the meat thermometer. After resting for 20 minutes, the temperature had risen to 165 degrees and was perfectly moist. And I added more of the vegetables to the pan in larger cuts because everybody wanted to pick at them while the roast was resting.

name: Double Mustard Crusted Pork Roast with Jus
review: I had a 5 lb bone in pork loin roast & cooked at 350. It took me 3 hrs 15 mins to reach 160 degrees. I personally had no problems cutting my pork & losing any crust. I served the chops on the bone. Sharp knife is the key.

name: Beef Stroganoff Hamburger Dinner in a Skillet
review: This was a family hit!! The only ingredient I was missing was sour cream, I used evaporated milk and cider vinegar instead! I also cooked my egg noodles in beef broth, the flavor was amazing! My family wants it more often!!

name: Beef Stroganoff Hamburger Dinner in a Skillet
review: Bland bland bland. you would think that all the ingredients combined would be tasty but it was just boring. The order of cooking is odd..I think if you add the spices and then drain the meat you are going to lose a ton of flavor. We won't be making this again. Even extra spices and sour cream couldn't save it.

name: Beef Stroganoff Hamburger Dinner in a Skillet
review: Worst recipe I ever had!

name: Ginger Flank Steak with Wasabi Smashed Potatoes
review: My family loves this meal. They would be happy to have it every week. The only thing I do different is divide the potatoes in half before mixing so I can make spicy for my husband & me & not so much for the kids & my mom. I told my oldest boy we were having this for dinner tonight & he actually jumped & whooped!

name: Ginger Flank Steak with Wasabi Smashed Potatoes
review: Quick and easy!  I marinated the meat the night before and it turned out perfect!

name: Ginger Flank Steak with Wasabi Smashed Potatoes
review: I love this meal. The flank steak is very flavorful and the wasabi in the potatoes really adds a nice taste. I have made this twice and the first time it was perfect the second time I under cooked the meat just a little but it was still good.

name: Basic Marinara Sauce
review: Delicious just the way it's written!

name: Basic Marinara Sauce
review: Very good.  Mine turned out a little runnier than I would have liked.  May want to add some tomato paste if you prefer a thicker sauce.

name: Basic Marinara Sauce
review: What to do with all those extra garden tomatoes?  Use them in here. Also, boy is it hot by the time those tomatoes are ready huh?  Saute the garlic onions and herbs then pour it into a slowcooker and deglaze the pan with a splash stock, white or red wine, V-8 juice  or even water.  This will keep your kitchen cool and save a little bit on that all mighty power bill.

name: Corned Beef Hash with Poached Eggs
review: We make this every year (for the past 6 years at least for my hubby's b-day breakfast because it's his favorite and he's lucky enough to be born the day after St. Paddy's Day.  We are in the middle of a move and I can't find my original printed recipe (eek!  You'd think I'd have it memorized but I always forget something - but know I'm forgetting it! I was happy to find it on here after a bit of web searching to my relief.  It is delicious and crispy and simple to toss together.  I love getting breakfast assembly done the night before!  To make sure there are 'leftovers' to make it - I always pull out enough potatoes and beef BEFORE slicing and serving it with cabbage and carrots and Guiness, just to make sure we have enough for the hash in the morning.

name: Corned Beef Hash with Poached Eggs
review: This is always a favorite....the trick is having enough corned beef left over to make it.

name: Corned Beef Hash with Poached Eggs
review: After spending a fortune on a corned beef brisket, all we could taste in this recipe was the mustard.  My dog ate good that night

name: Salad with Citrus Vinaigrette
review: This salad was okay.  The dressing was very tart. Perhaps next time i will use sweeter citrus fruit.

name: Chocolate Covered Almonds
review: Jacques IS an expert.  Chocolate covered almonds are yummy.

name: Nopal Cactus with Prickly Pear Vinaigrette and Toasted Pumpkin Seeds
review: Used some substitutes (Rasberry syrup and canned cactus but it was a hit.  I'd make it again

name: Sticky Road Chocolate Bars
review: I had a small piece before my teenage daughter and her friends ate all of the bars and then asked me to make more. Good, good, good!

name: Sticky Road Chocolate Bars
review: very disapointed, i made this so well i thought is going to be good, the bottom  layer was very very dry, but the top is good. next time i will change the bottom layer recipe....i use sweetened chocolate still dry....

name: Sticky Road Chocolate Bars
review: It was good, but I think a sweeter chocolate might be better to use.

name: Five Layer Taco Dip
review: I love the recipe to make your own taco seasoning at the bottom of the recipe.

name: Five Layer Taco Dip
review: Made this for Cinco de Mayo.  Very easy!  Everyone raved about it.  Love the inclusion of fresh avocado.  It makes the dish!

name: Five Layer Taco Dip
review: We had this as a dinner, not a dip..add me to the list of those who added no-fat refried beans, just as tasty as full fat.  I also added chopped white onion and a little bit of chopped jalapeno. I did not add the chips, but instead fried up corn tortillas in a pan in some oil.  I assembled this by putting some sliced lettuce on top of the crisp tortilla in a baking dish, scooped the taco salad on top of that, added a dollop of cold sour cream on top AFTER it baked.  I assembled it all early in day so that by dinnertime it needed to be heated thru, put it in oven for 5 mins at 375 when we were ready to eat, and it melted the cheese too. Cilantro and sliced black olives would work with this too.

name: Pate a Choux Dough
review: Wonderful recipe and very easy to follow. These were a huge hit!

name: Pate a Choux Dough
review: the best ever recipe for choux: well puffed and dry inside. thank you!

name: Hawaiian pesto-crusted Ono on baby greens with Asian Vinaigrette
review: The entire recipe is fabulous!! Thanks Eemril

name: Hawaiian pesto-crusted Ono on baby greens with Asian Vinaigrette
review: This is one of my favorite Emeril recipes.  The pesto is delicious - I make it often, and have also served it with other seafoods, chicken, and pasta.  Great flavor!!

name: Candy Cane Cookies
review: I made these with my husband,we used the chocolate drizzled over the peppermint and then a little more over the chocolate.Outstanding!!  I think this will be one of my favorite christmas cookies from now on!!!They are a little hard to shape and drizzle,but you could just make them into balls and press down a little,bake and then peppermint sugar mixture and drizzle with chocolate.Be sure to grind peppermint canes or candy nice and fine.

name: Candy Cane Cookies
review: I just used this recipe for the basic no thrills (no chocolate or candy cane, which I'm sure would make it better, just like the recipe my mom use to make when I was little. So good and incredibly easy to make!!

name: Candy Cane Cookies
review: I have been making these for years.  I don't always add the chocolate and peppermint candy.  These are always a big hit with children and adults.

name: Grillades and Grits
review: I'm from the South but have never heard of grillades. To me it was similar to pot roast. Pot roast with grits what's not to like? It is rather heavy though. I think you could use all canned tomatoes and get the same effect.

name: Grillades and Grits
review: This is the best Grillades recipe I have. Thanks Paula.

name: Grillades and Grits
review: Great recipe! The only thing I substituted was the extra hot stewed tomatoes because I dont think they make that anymore so I just used the mexican style stewed tomatoes and I enjoyed it.

name: Emeril's Fresh and Fierce Margaritas
review: I gave this a shot and made 2 batches.  Our rowdy group loved them so much they were gone so fast!  I will make 4 batches next time for a party of 4 or try to figure out how to dillute them, they were super strong with alcohol.  I would put 3/4 cup of tequila and 1/2 cup of grand marnier next time.  Big hit!

name: Emeril's Fresh and Fierce Margaritas
review: Yes these are fierce! A bit time consuming, but worth it if you have the time - enjoy!

name: Emeril's Fresh and Fierce Margaritas
review: Awesome, Made them with Tyler's ultimate  enchiladas for tex mex night definitely worth a try. But like said after about three you'll feel it

name: Acorn Squash Flan
review: Prepared as a side dish according to recipe specifications. Wonderful flavor combination of souffle, mushrooms, cheese, vinaigrette and onions. Just sat back and watched the enjoyment and soaked up the compliments. Easy to time up the complimentary ingredient preparation while the flan is cooking.

name: Acorn Squash Flan
review: Really goo.  It takes a while but, it isn't too difficult to make.  Everyone loved it.  I left off the "juilienne" strips of squash as mine turned to mush.  I also did not have mascapone cheese so, I used cream cheeses instead.  Everything else was as stated in the recipe and turned out wonderfully!

name: Acorn Squash Flan
review: My husband does not like squash, but he loved this recipe!  It was so light, more of a souffle than a flan.  I didn't make the mushrooms, but the flan was great.  I think kids might even like this one!

name: Traditional Pork Tamales
review: I should start out by saying that I followed the directions for the chile sauce, as I had prepared the pulled pork the previous day.  There is a lot of flavor in this red sauce and it will go well with the pork for my tamales.  However, I found it to be way too salty.  If I were to use this chile sauce recipe again, I would omit the adding 3 additional tablespoons of salt when you blend the tomatoes, chilies, garlic, and cumin together.

name: Traditional Pork Tamales
review: I used this recipe and it follows most guide lines for Tamales, except the Spuds and Carrots.

name: Traditional Pork Tamales
review: I wanted to make pork tamales and after reading dozens of recipes, this fit with the flavors I wanted in them. But, I made some major changings. After cooking the pork in the water with garlic, peppercorns, and bay leaves. I let it sit overnight in the frig.  I strained this liquid and use it to cook the tomatoes and chiles. Then I strained this liquid again as the liquid to use with the tomatoes and chilie in the blender.. I didn't add 3 tablespoons of salt. I did add the 2 teaspoons to help me make a paste of the garlic as I have been trained to do. I used a coffee grinder to grind the cumin seeds. Once I blended the chilies and tomatoes, and spices with the liquid, I cooked the sauce like they said to do. After 15 minutes,I added the shredded pork. We tasted it and added a little more salt about 2 pinches to increase the flavor of the chiles.  I used Mexican Masa from my local Mexican store. It is excellent and I can't make anything that taste like they make. These were delicious and will use my recipe again and again.

name: Spicy Chicken
review: I have made this so many times- I love it. My grocery store carries small bottles of flavored oil, so I just use store bought chili oil.  I also get green olives in red pepper flakes from the olive bar and then use the oil from the container in the pan with the chicken.  I typically use way more than 1 cup of olives- I think the more the better, but you have to really like olives.  This is great served over short grain brown rice.

name: Spicy Chicken
review: It was good but I can't figure out how to get two cups of oil into a four ounce bottle.

name: Spicy Chicken
review: I made this dish with her fiery angel hair pasta and it was delish.  I am not a fan of olives but this dish was so tasty that it didn't matter. I cook this for my "girls" get together and they loved it. They thought it took me hours to prepare, but when I hold them how simple it was to make they were shocked!  This dish along with white and red wine will make any get together a success.  Thanks Giada...

name: North of the Border Carne Adovada
review: I know the North of the Border products well and plan to serve their carne ardovada again this 4th of July with flour tortillas on the side to soak up every last drop of sauce.

name: Whiskey Spiked Peach Iced Tea
review: I made this over the weekend for friends and it was ABSOLUTELY delicious!!! It blended with the Jack Daniels so well!

name: Whiskey Spiked Peach Iced Tea
review: I'm not really a big whiskey drinker (or a whiskey drinker at all, but this was pretty good. It's not overly sweet and all flavors work well together.

name: Whiskey Spiked Peach Iced Tea
review: This is great as a cocktail and as just peach tea!  Didn't think I would like it, but the longer the fresh mint is in the drink the better.  It almost taste like a Long Island Iced Tea, but better.  You have to try this one, it will be the hit in my house for Mother's Day :.

name: Almond Biscotti: Quaresimale
review: Very easy very tasty, but using whole almonds makes it very hard to cut.  Have lots o little pieces.  That's all I would change.  Pat. New Mexico.

name: Almond Biscotti: Quaresimale
review: They were easy to make and really good. Instead of 3tsp of Vanilla, I DID 2tsp of Almond extrac and 1 tsp vanilla. They were good.

name: Almond Biscotti: Quaresimale
review: RATE THIS RECIPE 4 STARS/ TO THE UNINIATED...QUARESIMALE BISCOTTI ARE SUPPOSED TO BE HARD AND CRUNCHY...EXCELLENT FOR DUNKING IN COFFEE OR EAT THEM AS THEY ARE. IF ITS SOFT THEN IT IS NOT A "QUARESIMALE"

name: Mango-Pineapple Upside-Down Cake
review: This is a wonderful twist to my   all time favorite cake . My sons and their picky

name: Mango-Pineapple Upside-Down Cake
review: I didn't have any issues thinking that this cake wasn't sweet enough, because of the yummy sauce that made it sweet. I really liked it. Delicious!

name: Mango-Pineapple Upside-Down Cake
review: I was suprised that it was not overly sweet, but I liked it that way.  The texture was very good, and it was especially good with fresh Hawaiian pineapples and macagamian nuts.  Some people didn't care for it because of the lack of sweetness, but I personally liked it.  The recipe was fairly easy to follow but very labor intensive for those of us that are not very good bakers.

name: Green Beans with New Potatoes
review: These were fantastic! I used whole canned green beans (drained and canned, sliced potatoes and adjusted the cook time. So tasty that you'll think Grandma made them. My 90 year old mother in law and husband loved them.

name: Green Beans with New Potatoes
review: Everyone loves these and I've been asked to make them again and again.

name: Green Beans with New Potatoes
review: I didn't follow this recipe to the letter, substituting only bacon for the salt pork. But it really is very good. I cooked for family dinner, and everyone loved.

name: Pistachio Ice Cream
review: Great! Halved the recipe, since my KitchenAid ice cream maker is for about 1 quart. Definitely let the mixture "marinate" (cool for 2 hours because that infuses the mixture with pistachio flavor.

name: Pistachio Ice Cream
review: A very good pistachio ice cream. I substituted 1 Tbsp of rose water for the almond extract and added shaved marzipan. Yes, shaved marzipan.

name: Pistachio Ice Cream
review: This ice cream is one of the best things I've eaten recently. Really delicious. The texture of mine is closer to gelato really, but it's fantastic. I halved the recipe and switched the milk/cream ratio, so 1.5 cups of milk, 1 cup of cream. Perfect. I also added maybe two tablespoons of pistachio butter before churning, just for a more intense taste. Really fantastic.

name: Sloppy Veg-Head Joe
review: Very very nice. I didn't have some of the stuff so I messed with it a little bit (instead of diced canned tomatoes I cut up my own tomatoes and used some canned tomato sauce, I used Tobasco sauce instead of the vinegar, and I used half of the black beans called for and added some TVP. The consistency is fantastic; it's just like any meaty sloppy joes. Reminds me of when I was a meat-loving little kid. This might just end up a weekly dish for me.

name: Sloppy Veg-Head Joe
review: Oh my gosh! These are the yummiest veggie Sloppy Joes I've ever tasted. I agree that it reminds me a little of chili but the brown sugar and a splash of ketchup (my addition really really takes it to another level. Made it for dinner and my bread is baking in the oven but the gravy is already half over because my husband and I have been in and out of the kitchen with tablespoons full of it, "just tasting".

name: Sloppy Veg-Head Joe
review: The recipe needs a bit of adustment in my opinion, I found the end result to lack depth.  I added a bay leaf for body and a lb of ground turkey for soul and to please my meat and potatoes man.  I will use the recipe again however I will omit the brown sugar and use the recipe as a base to healthier Sloppy Joes with ground ground turkey.

name: Fried Apples
review: Excellent.  Used sucanat instead of brown sugar, an extra tablespoon of butter and some cinnamon and nutmeg.

name: Fried Apples
review: Pretty tasty, with a couple of tweaks.  I didn't add the water, but I threw in 1/2 teaspoon of cinnamon and 1/2 teaspoon of nutmeg.  They were very good with ham tonight, and I think the leftovers will be equally tasty with waffles tomorrow morning.

name: Fried Apples
review: These were very good and easy. I used whatever apples we had and like others added some cin and fresh nutmeg. Thanks, A&A; Deppen

name: Tuscan Roasted Chicken and Vegetables
review: Very easy & tasty.  I used thighs instead of the chicken breasts & it was delicious.

name: Tuscan Roasted Chicken and Vegetables
review: A Sunday night staple in our home. This is a terrific recipe, both easy and flavorful.

name: Tuscan Roasted Chicken and Vegetables
review: This is an excellent recipe. The only change I made was to add some red pepper flakes to the vegetables.

name: Nuevo Chipotle Beef in Butternut Squash Boats (Nuevo Latino Beef Dishes)
review: I prepared this recipe exactly as the directions state and it's wonderful. If the kids are eating it I cut the chipotle chile pepper and the cumin in half otherwise it's too spicy for them. Make sure you don't skip any of the ingredient because the squash, tomatoes, and avacado cool off the spicy beef creating the perfect balance.

name: Nuevo Chipotle Beef in Butternut Squash Boats (Nuevo Latino Beef Dishes)
review: I have now made this about eight times, and each time we love it. My grandparents are requesting it for the third time in three visits.

name: Nuevo Chipotle Beef in Butternut Squash Boats (Nuevo Latino Beef Dishes)
review: The flavors of this dish are incredible!  The tomato/meat mixture really compliment the squash, and the cilantro, fresh tomatoes, and avocado add brightnes and dimension.  I have made it multiple times and always love it! My one tip is to roast the squash without water - I think it tends to get waterlogged, and makes the squash watery.

name: Marinated Tomatoes
review: These are so delicious and didn't last long at our home over Memorial Day Weekend. Will definately keep this recipe close at hand for all the summer cookouts and things. I put a few of the leftover smaller bits into some pasta and chopped some chicken, added a few olives and had an instant pasta salad with the marinade and the smaller bits of tomato, excellent ! ! ! Good recipe for any time of year. A keeper recipe and one I'll share with everyone. Delish

name: Marinated Tomatoes
review: I didn't have red wine vinegar (I hate when your pantry is empty of things you thought you had so I substituted 1/4 cup balsamic vinegar and 1/4 seasoned rice wine vinegar.  I also added some cucumber (because it was in my fridge and some fresh cubed mozzarella.  Turned out fabulous!

name: Marinated Tomatoes
review: Makes winter store tomatoes taste good. Added avocados & red onion.

name: Kicked Up Mac and Cheese
review: "FILED UNDER PASTA..."  HMM.... Perhaps you should rethink the name of this recipe, Emeril.... WHERE THE HECK IS THE "MAC"?  I've heard of Tater Tot Mac and Cheese... but it would help to have macaroni in it...

name: Kicked Up Mac and Cheese
review: I served this at my sister's bridal shower and it was a total hit.  Easy to make and very yummy.

name: Kicked Up Mac and Cheese
review: I printed out this recipe with the intention to make a mac and cheese dish.  I neglected to notice that there was no mac!  Regardless, I made it and it came out delicious!  I refer to it as more of a brunch or breakfast casserole.  enjoy!

name: Raspberry Sauce
review: I've made this numerous times and always have to give the recipe to my guests! Delicious! PS Make the recipe as written!

name: Raspberry Sauce
review: Fast, simple, easy and tasty!  I loved it.  Only problem I had was the whole batch wouldn't fit in my mini-food processor at one time, but this is a problem I frequently encounter.  Served it over vanilla ice cream and brownies.  I will definitely make it again.

name: Raspberry Sauce
review: Delicious and easy! I use it for a topping on my greek yogurt every morning -so yummy. I previously made Giada's blackberry jam with basil - but I have to say I like this one a lot more.Great job Ina!

name: Scott's Salmonberry Pie
review: I live in Kodiak, AK where I have fresh salmonberries available in the summer. We love this recipe.

name: Green Chile Macaroni
review: Did not like this recipes at all. Too much garlic (and we like garlic and overall the flavors were off and it wasn't at all creamy.

name: Green Chile Macaroni
review: This green chile macaroni dish is absolutely addicting and absolutely perfect. I cannot believe how much I could eat of this without getting sick of it and everyone else felt the same. I first had it at the restaurant, Renegade in Scottsdale and immediately went on a search of the recipe. I'm so glad I found it as I couldn't wait to make it!

name: Green Chile Macaroni
review: This stuff is addicting. Goes great with ribs and an ice cold beer. this is a perfect recipe just the way it is.....dont change a thing.

name: Spanakopita (Spinach Triangles or Pie)
review: Very good; made this dish for supper last night combined with a recipe in a cookbook I purchased in Greece but with all measurements in kilos or teacups.  In that cookbook, recipe called for 2 kilos spinach which I think is around 2 lbs. and 1 teacup finely chopped dill.  So the only change I made here was to add  1/2 cup of the dill.  Went great w/olive oil, garlic, lemon juice marinated grilled chicken.

name: Spanakopita (Spinach Triangles or Pie)
review: Some helpful hints: keep the melted butter on top of hot water to keep it melted, frozen spinach works just as well as fresh and is much easier to work with, extra seasoning (salt and pepper needed to your taste, and fresh dill added really makes spanakopita pop. Also, I think the better spanokopita's I have had in my life have had much more lemon and cheese. Good starting point though, minor tweaks make this sooo much better, I wrote about it on my blog posted on my profile name.

name: Spanakopita (Spinach Triangles or Pie)
review: Fantastic! I hadn't worked with filo dough before, but followed instructions in recipe and on box closely, and had very few broken filo strips. I used a rounded teaspoon of filling for each triangle and ended up with some extra filo (I think I only used 2/3 of a pound. Don't skimp on the salt/pepper - I added more in the later batches.

name: Shrimp Etoufee
review: OMG, love this recipe. I made this last weekend great flavor and will save this recipe to make again.

name: Shrimp Etoufee
review: Being a NY'er, I have no idea what Shrimp etoufee is supposed to taste like, but when I saw Pat & Gina make this, it seemed so easy and today was Fat Tuesday, so today was Etoufee day. Very good!  I saw other etoufee recipes online and some were almost identical. I liked this one b/c it used chicken broth along with the clam broth. The others didn't. I like to adjust the thickness of my sauce and the broth allows that. I borrowed two ideas from P. Deen's etoufee recipe: cajun seasoning I just happened to have, and canned Rotel tomatoes. Added more kick. This is a good make-ahead meal, have everything ready and just spend 5 mins. at the end cooking the shrimp.

name: Shrimp Etoufee
review: Made this last night. It was awsome and so easy to make! Will make again with crawfish and maybe sausage nextr time.

name: Vegetarian Risotto
review: EXCELLENT! My first time making risotto and this went with out a hitch. I cooked some sliced green squash in a bit of hot butter till brown and caramelized , the added some butter beans. Salt, pepper, red pepper flakes, and some sage. Then right at the end, folded that into the risotto. YUMMY!

name: Vegetarian Risotto
review: Excellent taste and easy to follow

name: Vegetarian Risotto
review: It was a bit too simple. I added steamed vegetables to give it more substance.

name: Filet Mignon with Red Wine Sauce
review: Excellent recipe!  Our company loved it.  Intense flavors.  Very easy to make.  I didn't add the last 4 tablespoons of butter to the recipe, and it was still great.  I used Columbia Crest (Founders Estate Cabernet.  My favorite wine!

name: Filet Mignon with Red Wine Sauce
review: Awesome, and the sauce is great (just the right consistency.  Made this for Mother's Day, and everyone was happy.  Easy to make, and a real crowd pleaser.

name: Filet Mignon with Red Wine Sauce
review: Very yummy Wasnt as thick as i would have liked!! It was a home run  with my boyfriend!! Thanks Giada!!!

name: Apple Brown Betty with Ice Cream
review: This was very good, and I didn't find it dry at all. I did let the apples and sugar, etc. sit for a while before combining with the bread. This let more of the juices flow out of the apples. I used cinnamon raisin bread and cut down slightly on the added cinnamon. Covered with foil for the first half hour then uncovered for another 30 minutes. Came out with some nice crusty pieces on the bottom.

name: Apple Brown Betty with Ice Cream
review: Holy cow!  This liquid sauce that comes out this is AMAZING!  I used Challah bread, and Apple Jack instead of Calvados.  Sweet, savory, and fantastic.  I cooked it covered with aluminum foil @ 350 degrees for 40 minutes, then another 40 minutes uncovered.  I also added 1 tablespoon of tapioca flour to the apples to make it more gooey.  Aside from the time it takes to peel and cut the apples, this was very quick and easy, and will definitely be made again.

name: Apple Brown Betty with Ice Cream
review: I substituted this and I substituted that...and the recipe was a complete failure! Get a life folks, if you mod it, don't review the original. Plain and simple.

name: Pita Bread
review: Works well with other syrups,  WHAT IS AGAVE SYRUP??????

name: Pita Bread
review: I liked the dough. I used 1/3 whole wheat flour and 2/3 AP, but mixed it by hand and added the oil with the other ingredients. I also discovered that by letting the dough rise longer you get a better "pita pocket".

name: Pita Bread
review: didnt have agave nectar or grape seed oil so i used honey and olive oil they came out nice and puffy, i actually made them a dessert with marshmallow fluff and nutella yum

name: Veal Parmigiana
review: I made veal parmigiana for the first time last night for my husband and I and we absolutely LOVED it. My husband kept telling me how good it tasted; he LOVED the breading. I used shredded mozzarella instead of sliced and it was fantastic! Veal parmigiana will be a regular dish on our dinner table. Thanks so much!!

name: Veal Parmigiana
review: This was delicious and a pleasure to prepare. Thanks for making this dad look good :

name: Veal Parmigiana
review: Very easy to make recipe. I added more Parmigiano-Reggiano cheese that was indicated in the recipe, and it turned out of be really good.

name: Braised Escarole with Garlic and Lemon
review: Good but a little bitter, prob should use a little less lemon, or some wine.  It was soupy, but I like my escarole that way.  If you don't add less water.

name: Braised Escarole with Garlic and Lemon
review: It was great.I bought it purely by accident..Instead of pepper flakes I used Olek Sambal hot Chili paste..it added something extra..a lovely aroma as it cooked and  then a gentle burn...great...I will buy it again...Joy

name: Braised Escarole with Garlic and Lemon
review: I gave this recipe 5 stars because the end result was incredibly yummy, despite the weirdnesses of the recipe.

name: Double Dipped Fried Chicken
review: Love the double dip,but I brine my chicken instead of soaking it in buttermilk. The brining (sp only takes an hour and a half so it is quicker as well.The meat comes out very moist the chicken breasts are awesome!

name: Double Dipped Fried Chicken
review: Okay, I really liked this fried chicken recipe, but I do have a few caveats worth mentioning. First, I found the breading to be bland; it needed more salt. Also, I thought the marinating process needed salt. It made the chicken ever so tender, but I will add a little salt next time to the buttermilk. With that said, I thought this recipe was quite good. The actual texture of breading was fantastic. It was crunchy, and it held on to the chicken perfectly. I, too, have suffered through bouts of lost breading, and that's not any fun. No more thanks to Tyler.

name: Double Dipped Fried Chicken
review: Yum!

name: Meatless Meatloaf with Mushroom Gravy
review: Love this recipe! I've made it twice and even meat lovers enjoy it and asked for more.

name: Meatless Meatloaf with Mushroom Gravy
review: Meatless anything is not my thing so I will not comment on that but the Mushroom gravy was fabulous. The thyme & Marsala just brought it all together. Would be great on chicken.  I used it on a Meatloaf that was not tomato based so it was perfect.

name: Meatless Meatloaf with Mushroom Gravy
review: My suggestions: (1 try using a basic tomato sauce instead of mushroom gravy, (2 try using grilled eggplant instead of baked, (3 double the amount of salt, (4 try using a spice blend (I used a Moroccan mix, and (5 use instant oatmeal as opposed to the traditional type. This is a genuinely good recipe!!! The texture is remarkably close to real meatloaf, it cuts well, and holds its loaf shape. Thanks foodnetwork!!!

name: Dirty Rice Stuffed Collards
review: I great way to get my kids to eat their vegetables... They loved it, I used ground Italian sausage and Pastorelli mariana sauce......

name: Dirty Rice Stuffed Collards
review: This was a terrific recipe, which I made them for a ladies dinner party. I substituted brown rice and made it vegetarian by using a meat substitute instead of pork. I was afraid the collard leaves would not be tender enough because of their thick stems, but baking the dish covered did the trick. I'll definitely try this recipe again, but will allow enough time for all the steps.

name: Dirty Rice Stuffed Collards
review: FABULOUS!!  I made it last night, and substituted Chicken Andouille sausage for the pork sausage, and used brown rice.  My husband and I both loved it so much that I'm making it again tonight to serve to company tomorrow!  I think I'll try it made with spiced up ground chicken breast this go around because my guest is a personal trainer and requested "something healthy".

name: Pumpkin Roll Cake
review: This is a huge hit with the church crowd on our Potluck days. I used a cream cheese filling instead and it disappears everytime. :D Too rich for me,  but with the crowd I go to church with, it's perfect. Thanks Paula!

name: Pumpkin Roll Cake
review: I made the cake part of the recipe just as it was listed. It was very easy to make and roll. I loved the smell of it baking too. I made a cream cheese filling instead of the one listed and served the roll with warm caramel sauce. It was the hit of the party.

name: Pumpkin Roll Cake
review: It was fantastic.  This is going to be a part of our Thanksgiving tradition for the dinner table.  Thanks Paula!

name: French Onion Soup
review: well worth the time and work. It is the best french onion soup I have had in a long time, if ever.

name: French Onion Soup
review: This is a wonderful recipe.  It does require quite a bit of time, but worth it!  Once the onions start to brown, you have stir frequently to prevent burning or sticking to the bottom of the pan.  I have always made French onion soup with beef stock and cognac and vermouth which makes it somewhat richer.  But this was light and full flavored.  Also, I did not have fresh thyme this time of year and used dried.  It worked well.  Thanks, Anne, for another restaurant chef winner!

name: French Onion Soup
review: Delicious!

name: Otto's Beer Cheese Soup
review: We loved this soup.  Had read the reviews before making it and meant to add less flour, but forgot to adjust. So I added a little more beer and chicken stock. I also used 3 oz of swiss and 11 oz of extra sharp cheddar cheese.  We served it in sourdough bread bowls and it was amazing!

name: Otto's Beer Cheese Soup
review: Soup was extremely thick more like fondue. Also very bitter due to to much swiss cheese.  Definetly has potential.  Next time i will add more liquid and less swiss cheese.

name: Otto's Beer Cheese Soup
review: I am a huge cheese lover so I found this dish to be great! I was a bit uncertain about trying this soup since I am not typically a huge beer fan BUT I am so glad I did.  Like others that have reviewed this recipe, I only used Â½ cup of flour. The texture turned out amazing. I used the Sierra Nevada beer and shredded carrots.

name: Baba Ghannouj
review: Best taste ever, and very easy to make I make almost every week I'm vegetarian, love with salads. Thanks

name: Baba Ghannouj
review: The recipe on the show is perfect.  I have made it with both Italian eggplant and Asian eggplant and I find the Asian eggplant to be far better.  5 stars with Asian eggplant, 3 stars with Italian eggplant.  The cooks who gave it one star should try again with Asian and see what they think...

name: Baba Ghannouj
review: First let me say I didn't make this exact recipe, so my rating doesn't carry any weight.  Next, here's the actual recipe from the show:

name: Sea Scallops
review: Simple and delicious! Lets you taste the sweetness of the scallops!

name: Sea Scallops
review: This was the 1st time I made scallops and was nervous about over or under cooking them.  They turned out perfect!  Thank you for a simple basic recipe that I will use again & again!!

name: Sea Scallops
review: Excellent. I drizzled a little of the marinade over the scallops as they were cooking and then mixed a little in with the greens. Very satisfying.

name: Neely's Homemade Hash Browns
review: It was wonderful. Thank you so much  andrea

name: Neely's Homemade Hash Browns
review: Great recipe but I admit that I cheated a bit, lol. I bought the frozen hash brown potatoes that you see in the frozen food section and thawed them out. Instead of canadian bacon I used ham and added some cheese on top for the last minute or so until it was melted over the hash brown. Just as tasty and delicious.

name: Neely's Homemade Hash Browns
review: Loveeee it!!

name: Cherry Pudding
review: my family loves this i alwyas have to make a double batch

name: Hoppin' John
review: Delicious. In the interest of time, I soaked the peas in warm water for about 2 hours instead overnight. I used smoked ham shanks, because that's what they had at the grocery store, and used about 4 of them. Only addition was some diced tomatoes. Otherwise followed the recipe exactly. At the end, I chopped up the ham into little pieces, threw away the bones, and returned the ham to the pot. So good and so easy.

name: Hoppin' John
review: This recipe is my fool-proof "go-to" for Hoppin' John.  My family has Creole roots and I've tried several other family and southern cooking-school recipes for this.  None of them are anywhere near as tasty.  I've used smoked ham hock, diced ham and/or bacon (whatever I have on hand. The very best part of this dish is it's consistency.  Time after time after time it turns out perfectly - you really cannot goof it up.  The very best black-eyed pea recipe I've tasted.

name: Hoppin' John
review: I assumed the ham hock was supposed to be fresh and not smoked but I am not one hundred percent certain of that, given some of the references to bacon in some of the other comments.  The finished product was good, but I wonder if I arrived at the intended result.

name: Fried Crab Wontons
review: These wontons are a lot of work, but well worth the effort.  While they're wonderful fried, we also love them in soup.  They freeze beautifully and are great to have around for those unexpected guests.  BTW...my kids love to help with these!  Thanks Tyler!

name: Fried Crab Wontons
review: i'm 11, but still a great cook! I made these for an appetizer at my family's Sunday lunch and they were amazing. I was still working on my dad's father's day gift in my room so i sent the wontons with him and i walked to my grandmother's house. I got there about five mins. after that and there were 3 left! Three?! Yes three out of about thirty and a total of about 11 ppl were there! I would totally reccomend this recipe to anyone!

name: Fried Crab Wontons
review: I made these last night for my boyfriend and he could not stop eating. We both thought they were great. However the sauce for dipping the wontons in was not good. It was heavy and lacked flavor. We used sweet and sour sauce for dipping and it was great

name: Microwave squash
review: Worked like a charm!  Each half only took 5 minutes and was cooked to perfection!  Thanks for this easy recipe.  I filled each half with diced fresh pears, honey, pecans, dried cranberries, and a touch of light margarine.

name: Microwave squash
review: This method cuts the time it takes to cook acorn squash down by 75%, and it tastes great!  All I add is a drizzle of honey.

name: Microwave squash
review: This is the way I've always microwaved acorn squash--except I cover with wax paper not plastic wrap.  Excellent!

name: Lebanese Stuffed Grape Leaves
review: If you think this is a waste of lamb chops than you shouldn't cook any Lebanese food. The only thing I changed was , I mixed ground lamb with the ground beef.

name: Lebanese Stuffed Grape Leaves
review: I am lebanese and this is how we make it, minus 25-30 cloves of garlic.Yum

name: Lebanese Stuffed Grape Leaves
review: Why should I waste good lamb chops for flavoring when ground beef is used to stuff the grape leaves?!?

name: Nutty Basmati Rice with Almonds
review: I used brown basmati rice.  It took a little longer (about 30 mins but it tasted great and is healthier.

name: Nutty Basmati Rice with Almonds
review: her use regular cooking rice instead of instant, why instant rice?  she isn't under a silly time constraint like rachael ray.  she doesn't even use minute rice.  i thought robin is a nutritionist, minute rice is highly processed, therefore, loosing important healthy qualatees.

name: Nutty Basmati Rice with Almonds
review: I loved this rice.  It was such a perfect combo with Robin's Stir-fry with Chicken and Vegetables.  Basmati rice already has a nutty flavor, so giving it the actual nutty crunch of toasted almonds was perfect.  I will definitely make this again for the stir-fry, or just as a side dish in general. So Good!

name: Coffee Rubbed Rib-Eye
review: My husband I both disliked this alot! It was too much going on and tasted awful. We ended up going out for supper :(

name: Coffee Rubbed Rib-Eye
review: I agree, too many spices. I stuck with just the Paprika, coffee, brown sugar, S&P.; Sometimes less is more!

name: Coffee Rubbed Rib-Eye
review: Easy to make, delicious results.

name: Braised Spare Ribs
review: Easy and good ... I used a little wine in the sauce reduced by half and serve it with a little garlic mashed taters with some red wine that I used in the sauce. Winner Winner short rib dinner

name: Braised Spare Ribs
review: I've made this a few times for dinner parties, and this has always been a hit.  It's got a ton of flavor, with a little kick from the cayenne.  I always receive compliments on the dish.

name: Braised Spare Ribs
review: Easy to prepare with rich depth of flavor! Served it with gorgonzola polenta with wilted spinach and baby bella mushrooms! Pinot Noir paired well! Great make again meal with a wow factor!

name: Golden Gingerbread with Dried Blueberries
review: The quick cake mix makes way too much.  There are no other suggestions how to use the leftovers.  I used the leftovers in place of a cake mix and it didn't come out all that well.  Also, the three spice recipe makes too much and you only need a teaspoon in this recipe.  This recipe is okay, but to cakey for me.  I thought it would be more like gingerbread, it was cake and not a very good one at that.  It was okay.  Good luck!

name: Basic Tamale Dough with Sweet Roasted Corn
review: Fun to make, festive, but I needed to put salsa on it because it didn't really have much flavor.  I'm use to bold flavors.

name: Basic Tamale Dough with Sweet Roasted Corn
review: easy and versatile.

name: Basic Tamale Dough with Sweet Roasted Corn
review: Excellent recipe!

name: Iron Skillet Brownies
review: I am a baker I have baked all my life. I have never had a problem with any of Paula's recipes exceepet for these brownies. She said on the TV to use 20 1oz chocolate squares so that is what I used I do not think that it is the chocolate that is the problem I think it is the butter. When I was baking it the butter seperated tried adding flour that did not even help. will not be making these brownies again!

name: Iron Skillet Brownies
review: should be 20  1oz squares

name: Iron Skillet Brownies
review: I only used the 1 ounce of chocolate called for in the recipe.  It turned out delicious, and has a great texture.  The bonus is that when they're baking, they smell amazing!  Very good results, and super easy.  I've enjoyed all of Paula's recipes that I've tried so far.

name: Grilled Asparagus and Quinoa Salad with Goat Cheese and Black Olive Vinaigrette
review: Terrible! I agree with Angrybird. A lot of effort and time wasted.

name: Grilled Asparagus and Quinoa Salad with Goat Cheese and Black Olive Vinaigrette
review: Unfortunately, my family did not enjoy this dish.  A lot of work for a disappointing result.

name: Grilled Asparagus and Quinoa Salad with Goat Cheese and Black Olive Vinaigrette
review: Delicious and filling.

name: Pumpkin Chocolate Chip Cookies
review: Awesome cookies, I used salted butter and cut down on the salt in the recipe.  I used semi sweet chocolate chips and went heavy on the spices, and they were  perfect!  Makes about 5 dozen cookies

name: Pumpkin Chocolate Chip Cookies
review: The best cookies chocolate chip cookies with a twist.

name: Pumpkin Chocolate Chip Cookies
review: I add extra pumpkin and go a little heavy on the spices, they always turn out fluffy and amazing.  People rave about them.

name: Copper Pennies
review: i saved 26 recipes and can only view 6 . there is no scroll bar how do i view the rest of my recipes in my recipe box. anyone know

name: Copper Pennies
review: Classic Southern dish.  First ran across it in a New Orleans cookbook.  This is an excellent version.  Long storage in the fridge is a great feature--  gets better with each passing day.

name: Copper Pennies
review: 1 cup of oil is too much.  I have a recipe I've used for years and it calls for 1/2 cup.  Even on her show it looked like Paula used less than 1 cup, just didn't look like a cup when she poured it into the sauce pan.  My recipe also calls for 3/4 cup vinegar, not 1 cup.  Pecan sauce on Fried Chicken?  May have to try that one!

name: Green Peas with Cheese and Herbs
review: Great and easy summer salad!  I saw the peas at the farmers market and they looked so good I bought them without thinking what I would use them for.  But this was great!  I didn't have fresh mint or parsley so I used some dried mint and bit of mint sauce.  I also put in some cilantro and used shaved parmesan cheese.  Fresh, light, and tasty!

name: Green Peas with Cheese and Herbs
review: What a great, fresh tasting salad!  I didn't have any mint, so I omitted that and I didn't miss it a bit.  I used homemade ricotta cheese for the cheese, and it was tasty!  This is a great salad for a hot, summer day!  I will definitely make it again.

name: Green Peas with Cheese and Herbs
review: I gave this an 'excellent' because I really don't like peas, but this is fantastic!  The flavors are delicious together.  We couldn't find any of the cheeses so we used fresh mozzarella, which tasted fine.  Even my 1 year old likes it, and that's saying something!

name: Swedish Meatballs with Lingonberry Sauce
review: made these with pork & beef I ground myself and the meatballs came out great, moist and really tasty. The sauce was okay-I thought a little bland, but tasty. It is a time consuming recipe to make, but worth it.

name: Swedish Meatballs with Lingonberry Sauce
review: TASTY. The meatballs are soft and moist! Everyone loved them! I will try them again and again. They may not be the original swedish meatballs, but they are my favorite meatball recipe thus far!

name: Swedish Meatballs with Lingonberry Sauce
review: Wonderful! I baked my meatballs instead of frying them and made the gravy while the meatballs were roasting to save some time and fat.

name: Chicken Croquettes
review: These sound exactly what I have been hunting even to the cone shape.I use to buy these frozen at an Amish Co-op near Harrisburg a long time ago.!!!! thank you so much.

name: Chicken Croquettes
review: Stopped by The Dining Car and gave these a try.  I am not big on other Chicken Croquette recipes that I have tried but these were really good.

name: Chicken Croquettes
review: Update: We have added the following steps for clarification regarding the process.

name: Sweet Plantains
review: Incredible taste.  Wanna try something really crazy with these?  I was trying out a Ropa Viejas recipe and remembered a dish I had in Manhattan a few years back.  It was put together as a stacked dish, like layering/packing in a tin can and then pulling the can up/off.  Based on my memory, here goes - seasoned black beans (try jalapeno/onion/garlic/smoked salt/bayleaf/tomato, rice, Ropa shredded beef, Ropa sauce and topped with these plantains (minus the cinnamon.  It sounds like a crazy combination, but honestly the combination makes an incredible dish.

name: Sweet Plantains
review: Excellent recipe! I believe sweet plantains should be sweet, thus the name and this recipe was a perfect representation. My family thoroughly enjoyed these!

name: Sweet Plantains
review: Sweet plantains are delicious! But they do not need sugar, cinnamon , butter or vanilla extract, just fry them with nothing else added and sprinkle with salt and garlic powder while they are still hot.

name: Vegetable and Fruit Kugel Cupcakes
review: Horrible recipe.  I followed the recipe precisely and the cupcakes came out mushy and bad tasting.  My kids thought they smelled good, but when they tasted them they said "yuck" and asked if they could throw out the rest.  The preparation was labor intensive and time consuming because of all the peeling and grating (I had to grate by hand which made the unsuccessful dish particularly disappointing.

name: Vegetable and Fruit Kugel Cupcakes
review: I followed the recipe exactly and they were terrible!  They were flat and mushy.  I even tried cooking them longer, cooling them and lastly, I put them in the refrigerator overnight, but nothing helped.  Don't bother making these.

name: Vegetable and Fruit Kugel Cupcakes
review: There is definitely something wrong with this recipe, something is missing. Didn't read the reviews, would have not made this so don't waste your time until it is revised.

name: Basic Pizza Dough - Processor Method
review: Thick or thin, this recipe never dissappoints me.  It's all about making the dough right.  Letting the yeast sit in warm water for the 5 minutes and then letting the dough rise for an hour in a warm place.  I usually put mine in a pre-heated oven that the temp went to 350 degrees F (shut the oven off before making the dough.

name: Basic Pizza Dough - Processor Method
review: I've used this recipe about 4 or 5 times and I think it is the best pizza dough recipe I have found.  It is simple and easy and it raises to perfection.  I have used my Noni's recipe and it is a headache.  Today I have doubled this recipe and turned it into a wonderful loaf of Italian bread with a crunchy crust and a tender middle. I recommend this recipe for your food processor.  Make sure your water is warm enough for the yeast.

name: Basic Pizza Dough - Processor Method
review: Stephanie - You do NOT need sugar in pizza dough to make it rise. The yeast feeds on the flour and that causes it to rise. Sugar may slightly speed up the process, but it's unnecessary. Just wait a bit longer for it to rise if it's not doing it fast enough for you. I have never used sugar in any of my bread or pizza doughs, and if you look at pizza dough recipes across the internet, you will find many--especially Italian doughs--do not contain sugar.

name: Mexican Chicken Soup
review: We love this soup!  I've made this several times since finding it when doing a search for recipes using whole hominy (posole - I love hominy, too!. It's dreary, chilly and rainy today, and my husband has a terrible spring cold.  When I asked him what he wanted for dinner he said chicken soup.  I asked whether he wanted chicken noodle, or Mexican Chicken soup, and Mexican Chicken Soup was his answer.  I use a can of petite diced tomatoes, or sometimes fire roasted diced tomatoes, juice and all, rather than the tomatoes called for.  I also top it with tortilla strips, and sometimes shredded cheddar cheese. I like to serve it with Tex-Mex Cornbread with Cheese and Green Chiles from another site. It makes a wonderful, very satisfying meal.

name: Mexican Chicken Soup
review: This soup was fantastic.  I used 2 cartons of broth (8 cups which turned out just fine. As suggested by a reviewer I used a whole can of diced chilis but I pureed 1/2 the can with a can of diced tomatoes.  I also used 2 15oz. cans of hominy and I bought a roasted chicken and used almost all of it.  The cilantro and lime juice are a must, brings out the flavors.  I topped it with tortilla strips and shredded cheese.  Next time I want to use a dollop of sour cream.  This made a nice dinner served with corn bread muffins.

name: Mexican Chicken Soup
review: The soup was okay.  I will probably make it again; however will need to improvise and add some more ingredients.  I found it to be a little flat.  We put shredded cheese and a dollop of sour cream on it, and it was oh so much better, as well as more fattening!

name: Crisp Chocolate Wafers
review: I had a recipe that called for chocolate wafers. These really weren't anything special, but they get the job done. Taste was decent, but like I said nothing special.

name: Oven-Fried Potato Wedges
review: I'm not a big potato wedge fan, but my family loves them.  Looking for a recipe I found this.  Unfortunately I didn't have all the ingredients so I substituted Worcestershire & some crushed red pepper for the hot sauce.  I didn't have cornbread mix, so I used Shake & Bake Italian for Chicken and the family loved it.  I even ate a couple of pieces ..,.. and for not liking potato wedges I thought they were good - anyways thanx for a great recipe!

name: Oven-Fried Potato Wedges
review: I had the biggest potato craving for an entire week then I saw this recipe on Paula's show, I had to make it! I actually made it for a large dinner party so it took a little time coating all the potatoes, but OMG was it worth it! These are sooooo delicious, I'm making them again this weekend for my husband and I because I've been craving them like crazy ever since I tried them. They're even good at room temp so would make a nice side dish to bring to a party. Love these!

name: Oven-Fried Potato Wedges
review: A new favorite to my recipe collection. I didn't have any cornbread dressing so I finely crushed potato chips and used them instead. Will stick with the crushed potato chips, soooo good.

name: Mom's Lasagna
review: I did this recipe in a two day process - made the sauce one day - then assembled the next day.  I used the Barilla No-boil flat lasagna noodles & they worked well.  For the sauce I used browned pork ribs & also used hamburger and italian sausage - no veal. For the cheese used a fresh whole milk ricotta for one pound & the other pound was store bought Frigo brand.  Used dry oregano - it worked well. Used regular pre-shredded mozzarella in a 2 pound bag. Reheated the sauce and assembled the lasagna in a stoneware 13x9 pan. After the first hour removed the foil, after 30 minutes more baking the crusty cheesy bubbly-ness were - jaw dropping beautiful~  I did put the pan on a small foil-lined sheet tray to catch a few drips which was a good idea. All kudos I passed to Michael for sharing his mom's recipe!

name: Mom's Lasagna
review: I made this recipe for new years dinner and was very delicious, my family loves a lot. I even used the meat of the pork bones i shedred and i added to the sauce. Thank you Chef Michael Symon you are one of my favorits chefs.

name: Mom's Lasagna
review: Outstanding flavor!  I have always loved neckbones and they were great the next day with some sauteed greens!  Lasagna was a little oily so I would reduce the olive oil next time as the meats will release enough fats without so much oil. Mike Symon is the Nuts!

name: Mixed Salad with Herb Vinaigrette
review: I used spinach instead of the Bibb lettuce b/c I had it on hand already, and I left out the Tarragon b/c I just don't really care for it, but other than that this salad was amazing. I loved the dressing. We will DEFINITELY be making this one again in my house!!

name: Mixed Salad with Herb Vinaigrette
review: I made this salad the same day I watched the show and it was an excellent side dish for my grilled chicken.  The avocado gives this salad the flavor and the dressing are so good together.

name: Mixed Salad with Herb Vinaigrette
review: This is an outstanding and simple to make dressing, and it is healthy too(no sugar-it doesn't need it!  I use only olive oil when I make it and love to put it over sliced fresh tomatoes with a little salt and pepper. Fresh herbs are best but I have used dried ones and it is still delicious!

name: Round 2 Recipe: Cajun Dirty Rice
review: Dirty rice is usually with pork. But nonetheless, she called it that probably because it was paired with a meat. Look up the def. of the term 'dirty rice'. I tried it and the the whole loved it. A+...

name: Round 2 Recipe: Cajun Dirty Rice
review: while this is actually a tasty recipe, to call it cajun dirty rice is ridicules

name: Blueberry Syrup
review: I was craving blueberry syrup but had none on hand and with our new fresh snowfall, the store is not where I wanted to be on a Sunday morning. I found this very easy simple syrup to be great. I've tried making others that include orange juice and/or corn syrup before but they were never want I wanted them to be. Will this test like bottled syrup? No. But it's sweet and a good consistency and the lemon does not overpower. It's more of a silent partner. It was easy and I thought it good.

name: Blueberry Syrup
review: We used this with the blueberry buttermilk pancakes by Cookworks and they were wonderful together.  I used fresh blueberries instead of frozen.  I don't think it made as much as the recipe said, but you can always make more.  It was really quick!

name: Blueberry Syrup
review: This is the easiest recipe and works for syrup, jam, ice cream topper, and cheesecake topper!!  One of my favorites!!

name: Spinach and Mushroom Enchiladas
review: This is such a quick and healthy recipe. We really enjoy this. Not sure about the earlier comments with regards to the flavors not melding together. This recipe has great flavor!! A great guilt-free recipe!!

name: Spinach and Mushroom Enchiladas
review: My fiance liked it, but I wouldn't make this dish again. The flavors of the filling just didn't work for me: somehow it was too sweet and too sour at the same time. I think it had something to do with the the cornstarch-milk slurry and the mushrooms? I'm still not sure what went wrong when I made this...

name: Spinach and Mushroom Enchiladas
review: My family loved it! They didn't even know they were eating "diet" food.

name: Miso Soup
review: Very flavorful. I live in Korea so I used deonjang instead of miso which I guess is a tad stronger. It was very good!

name: Miso Soup
review: Wonderful bright taste and soothing soup. I loved this recipe and felt good serving it to my family and friends.  This is better than any similar soup made in either of our three Asian establishments.

name: Miso Soup
review: Had to make this after watching the Good Eats "Pantry Raid" episode. True to his word, it was easy to do and tastes better than anything I've had from a restaurant!

name: Chocolate White Chocolate Chunk Cookies
review: Delicious! I don't like white chocolate that much but this tastes great! I prefer to eat them right after coming out if the oven. It's a little bit too sweet though. I will cut down the sugar next time.

name: Chocolate White Chocolate Chunk Cookies
review: Excellent!Made these cookies for a church bake sale and they were a great hit!

name: Chocolate White Chocolate Chunk Cookies
review: I JUST made these cookies a few minutes ago, and they turned out great!! I only wanted half a batch, so I followed csdiva2g's advice (THANK YOU!!! The only difference I made was that I used an 11 oz. bag of white chocolate chips. I followed everything else, and baked for 12 minutes exactly. I left the cookies on the tray for about five minutes before transferring to a wire rack. Perfect! I will definitely make these again! :

name: Pasta with Sardines: Pasta con le Sarde
review: I've never had sardines, but was hoping to have a great experience especially after reading the rave reviews for his dish. I discovered I don't like sardines so it's hard to separate my dislike for this dish without punishing the recipe. The flavors of the sauce before the sardine introduction was actually delicious too bad I didn't save half the batch ;-| If you like sardines then you might enjoy this recipe.

name: Pasta with Sardines: Pasta con le Sarde
review: I made a small batch using about 1 pound of sardines.  It was amazing, and my husband was delighted when I told him he did not have to share. He said that it was absolutely amazing!  He said it was 5 stars plus.

name: Pasta with Sardines: Pasta con le Sarde
review: "Pasta con le sarde" isn't too easy to prepare, and this recipe is really well done, and well explained.
review_date: asta con le sarde" isn't too easy to prepare, and this recipe is really well done, and well explained.

name: Peppercorn Rubbed and Grilled Flat Iron Steak
review: This was really REALLY good.

name: Peppercorn Rubbed and Grilled Flat Iron Steak
review: I tried this recipe on the grill and it turned out great!  It has a wonderful flavor and was very tender.

name: Sweet Potato Casserole
review: I found this dish to be dry and lifeless.

name: Sweet Potato Casserole
review: Huge hit at Thanksgiving!

name: Sweet Potato Casserole
review: I personally didn't try this but made it for my boyfriends family and they all LOVED it.  I did do a couple things different.  I used 5 large sweet potatoes and instead of topping with pecans topped with mini marshmallows & toasted them under the broiler.  Kept all the same ingredients and still turned out great.  My boyfriend could have devoured the entire pan.  He said it was probably the best sweet potato casserole he's ever had.  Will use this recipe next time he has a craving for it.

name: Cayenne-Candied Bacon
review: I tasted a version of this at a holiday party where I work and just had to find a recipe to make it.  I tried Emeril's recipe at my home holiday party and it was a crowd pleaser.  Different yet tasty!

name: Cayenne-Candied Bacon
review: Simply fabulous!  I made 10 lbs. of this bacon for my son's cross country team and not one piece left.  This is the top requested dish 3 years in a row.

name: Cayenne-Candied Bacon
review: Everyone in the family loves it. A hit with guests!

name: Seafood Paella
review: Excellent Recipe.

name: Seafood Paella
review: This was a really tasty dish and my guests kept raving about it. They said this was one of the best tasting paella they have ever eaten. Great recipe. This one is a keeper. Thank you so much!!!

name: Seafood Paella
review: Love it! Thanks for sharing this recipe!

name: Spinach Pasta Dough
review: Yum, quick, easy and delicious!

name: Spinach Pasta Dough
review: Easy to make, great color and tastes great!

name: Spinach Pasta Dough
review: Great idea to do with the kids. About to start my second batch on this snowy day. Got a bag or organic spinach from my CSA and away we go!

name: Spicy Oyster Crackers
review: It would be better if there were more salt in it.  It only calls for 1/4 t. and that's the only salt in all the ingredients.  I'm not by any means a bit salt eater but it doesn't have the taste that I'm looking for without it.

name: Spicy Oyster Crackers
review: I used Emeril's essence (oops sorry Guy I made my own lobster bisque and needed to quickly make these crackers. My gosh to Die for folks. Just want to say that any spice you like works.

name: Spicy Oyster Crackers
review: My husband saw your show over a month ago and has been requesting them ever since... After EVERYTHING we've seen you make, this is what he craves!

name: Spinach and Three Cheese Calzone
review: It turned good/okay. I was disappointed that the flour to water ratio was off so I added flour until it didn't take anymore. I was generous with the salt, filling up the tsp to just over the brim. I only used the dough recipe and filled with classic ingredients... I was looking forward to a softer dough but I was alittle tougher after it baked.. Maybe a lower temp? I didn't use egg wash and it browned fine and stuck to itself fine when filling it. I also used bread flour and since I was going for the 'gluteny' pizza parlor style dough. I wasn't makin no cake here.. Lol

name: Spinach and Three Cheese Calzone
review: It was good maybe if some people use here use their imagination or common sense it would come out outsanding.

name: Spinach and Three Cheese Calzone
review: I agree with Andrea, that the consistency wasn't that of a regular calzone, it was a bit too thick.  I didn't make the dough, so I'm only reviewing the filling, but I wasn't very impressed.  It tasted fine, but not something I would crave and make again.  I even added sausage for a bit of flavor and it was still pretty bland.

name: Gnocchi
review: I have loved absolutely loved gnocchi since I was a kid.   I have two of Lidia's books and have made this recipe as written several times all with excellent results. I am trying to incorporate more wheat flour versus white flour in my cooking so recently I used 1 cup wheat flour and 1/2 cup white flour too see what would happen and they came out fantastic. Light and pillowy and oh so yummy.  Next time I will try all wheat flour.  If you like wheat pasta like I do then try wheat gnocchi too.  My husband gave them rave reviews as well and he is not as big a fan of gnocchi as I am.  Lidia rocks!

name: Gnocchi
review: Easy, easy, easy!  These turned out perfectly.  The texture was light and fluffy--so much better than store-bought.

name: Gnocchi
review: Got adventurous this morning and used 25 potatoes to make a huge batch of gnocchi. (it was my first time making them! Even though it took me all day it was worth it!! I had not eaten gnocchi unitl a year ago in Italy and this recipe brougth me right back there!!!  Light and delicious. The only thing I left out was rolling the dough on the fork. I was making soooo many I left the little pillows of dough as they were after cutting the ropes of dough, w/o making the ball. It didn't change anything about the results.  Cooked some and froze many. Topped with Lidia's homemade basil pesto!!  Added fresh spinach and parsley to her recipe. She is an amazing cook! Thanks Lidia! My family enjoyed every bite!

name: Sauteed Vegetable Medley
review: I didn't even blanch the veggies separately (forgot to read the blanching instructions and blanches them how I usually blanch veggies, but they came out great! I made a double recipe, added a couple cloves of garlic and a couple squirts of lemon juice, and salt and pepper to taste. Great easy veggies!

name: Sauteed Vegetable Medley
review: The medley looked so beautiful, very bright and colorful, I sauteed bets on a different pan and added at the end to the serving plate to get some more color to the dish, they were very good!!!!

name: Sauteed Vegetable Medley
review: Follow the directions and enjoy.

name: Ice Cream and Cake Pops
review: tasty!

name: Ice Cream and Cake Pops
review: This was so much fun to serve to my friends!  First, I am not sure if this was supposed to be the small lolli-pop type molds, or the larger "Popsicle" molds.  I used the Wilton cake popsicle cake mold from amazon.

name: Ice Cream and Cake Pops
review: Thanks Jill for the tip, I was searching online for the pan your tip lead me to amazon, I'm going to purchase the pan and try the recipe.

name: Italian Tomato Gravy
review: Can't say enough about this flavorful recipe!  I used an extra garlic clove, a little more wine (1/2 cup, 28 oz. whole tomatoes and 28 oz. crushed tomatoes.  I also used dried herbs 1 tsp for each that called for 1 Tablespoon of fresh.  This is a great way to get some veggies into your (or your children's diet....I had some grated zucchini left over from a bread I'd made and added about a cup of that when I added the tomatoes.  Served with homemade meatballs and spaghetti.  I'll use this over and over again.

name: Italian Tomato Gravy
review: I made TF's "Italian Tomato Gravy" for the first time and loved it!  It worked well with chicken, beef, and veal.  I can't wait to try it with seafood.  I plan to make large batches of it so that I may always have some on hand.

name: Italian Tomato Gravy
review: I'm Italian and appreciate a good ragu.  This is backwards, but gives the sauce a whole new taste, which I prefer.  Very good.

name: Asparagus Frittata
review: This took a lot longer to cook than I thought (wound up leaving it in the over for about 10 minutes, but it was fantastic!!

name: Cabbage and Potato Bake
review: This recipe is so very very good that I will never make Corned beef and Cabbage again.   My family loves it, my neighbors love it and we love it.

name: Cabbage and Potato Bake
review: I was looking for a recipe for cabbage because we needed to start eating vegetables with Vitamin E in them and came across yours Emeril.  The bacon and potatoes appealed to my 13 year old son, but he has NEVER had cabbage before.  I let him be the first to taste it and he finished the whole thing!  Needless to say we've found a good recipe for cabbage. (I used the low sodium broth as I have high blood pressure and it was still great.  Being a single parent it was very economical too.  Thank you very much : D

name: Cabbage and Potato Bake
review: Just loved it.  Kicked it up a notch and used pancetta instead of bacon, just had to add that Italian flavor.  What a great way to use cabbage and potato's not only healthy but economical at the same time.

name: King Ranch Chicken
review: Loved it- everyone asked me to make this again!  I did make more sauce then called for.

name: King Ranch Chicken
review: This came out great! Everyone loved it!

name: King Ranch Chicken
review: A more sophisticated KRC.  The recipe does not list salt but be sure to use it in the sauce and in the filling....or season the chicken well.   I put a wet paper towel over the tortillas and put them in the microwave for a minute....heather than frying.

name: Stuffed Shells with Chicken and Arugula and Creamy Alfredo Sauce
review: Amazing! I used store bought shells but I used the sauce recipe and baked it and it was soooo good. All my boyfriend kept saying was "this is so good". He even said "I think you might have outdone yourself this time." I will definitely make this again!

name: Stuffed Shells with Chicken and Arugula and Creamy Alfredo Sauce
review: Great recipe, my family and i love it

name: Stuffed Shells with Chicken and Arugula and Creamy Alfredo Sauce
review: I'm certainly in the minority, but I am not a huge fan of this.  I love all the ingredients, but somehow the combination fell short and was a little bland.  If I'm going to indulge in such a rich dish, I need it to have a little more spunk.

name: Warm Scallop BLT Salad
review: I added chopped walnuts and mango slices.

name: Warm Scallop BLT Salad
review: Not a very tasty recipe.  Was disappointed bec it looked and sounded wonderful

name: Warm Scallop BLT Salad
review: We truly enjoyed this recipe.  It was easy to make and was flavorful.  Make sure that you are in a well ventilated area what you sear the scallops.

name: Strawberry Rhubarb Sauce
review: This was delicious! I added a small chunk of peeled ginger to the sugar and water and let it simmer along with everything else.  I added some salt and 5 black peppercorns to the rhubarb/strawberry mixture, and after it had simmered for an hour or so I used a potato masher to get out some of the pieces, but still left it slightly chunky. Delicious!  It was awesome - texture like a thick applesauce and flavor that was sweet and tart at the same time.

name: Strawberry Rhubarb Sauce
review: I used frozen rhubarb and frozen strawberries and it turned out just fine.

name: Strawberry Rhubarb Sauce
review: Excellent!  And I didn't even puree it--I just smashed the strawberries with a fork when the sauce was cooked so it would stay a little chunky.  Will make again.

name: Thanksgiving Turkey Brine
review: This is the most amazing brine ever!!!  Our family will never make a nonbrined turkey ever again!  It makes the turkey super moist and flavorful.

name: Thanksgiving Turkey Brine
review: This brine was excellent. For Thanksgiving I used this brine for 2 turkeys one was fried the other   roasted. My mother had this look as if I was in over my head because 2 turkeys were going to be ruined. LOL I was amazed at the outcome for both, my family was very pleased. I made some adjustments to the recipe for a turkey breast last week and again it was very good. Thanks Alex for an easy way to prepare a turkey.

name: Thanksgiving Turkey Brine
review: Made the brine for thanksgiving but we cooked the bird in a charbroil big easy and I can say it was the juiciest and most flavorful turkey I have ever had!

name: Oyster Pie
review: Just wonderfull. I had never had oyster pie before and I was blown away. I made it because I live here in southern NE and had heard about it but surprisingly had never seen it anywhere. Its not fishy, just yummy. It reminds me of traditional English pies. Thanks

name: Soft Scrambled Eggs With Avocado
review: I typically cook my eggs this way, but adding the avocado was a terrific idea! I didn't expect it to add so much and it's very tasty. A bit rich, so it's better to have occasionally. Highly recommended.

name: Soft Scrambled Eggs With Avocado
review: These eggs were AWESOME! I used half & half instead of cream.  I used the extra chives (for garnish and whipped up some chive cream cheese to top my english muffin on the side. You can see pictures of my eggs at my blog on the world wide web

name: Soft Scrambled Eggs With Avocado
review: I had some ripe avocados to use up and found this recipe while searching 'avocado'. These eggs were spectacular! I agree with the reviewer who said 'I will never make eggs any other way than this again!'. Amazing!

name: Barley Bread
review: I have been looking for barley bread in super market but there are all kinds of breads (whole wheat, rye, multigrain, etc., etc.. but I have not been able to find barley bread. Thanks to Alton I used his recipe but with feedback by others (who gave useful reviews and baked an amazing barley bread. Instead of baking soda powder I used active dried yeast as one reviewer had suggested. Instead of eggs I used egg subsititute (milled flex seeds disolved in water and instead of full fat milk I used home made almond milk as another reviewer had suggested. The end result was amazing! I knew barley bread is dry and flat so that did not surprize me. I also smeared canalo oil on the pan and sprinkled barley flour on pan as another reviewer had suggested and the break popped out easily. I also used traditional oven instead of dutch oven at 350 degree F for 30 minutes. I just love barley bread and everyone at home enjoyed my new creation. I don't think I will buy bread ever again.

name: Barley Bread
review: Just made it. This bread was quite good except for the fact that it calls for too much baking powder and it makes the bread taste salty. I will definitely make it again since there is great taste potential and is very easy to make. Almost like baking a cake. No need to let the dough rise like you do with regular loaves. I milled my barley and used homemade vanilla almond milk, egg substitute, raw honey and sea salt, no oil. It doesn't rise much. I sprinkled and spread a small amount of barley flour at bottom of the glass pan that I baked it in and it was easy to separate. Again, it tasted great, except for the salty (baking powder aftertaste. TRY IT! I'm just trying barley and other types of flours for breads and SO glad Alton Brown had already thought of it. Mine took an additional 10 min. in the oven. It's a fairly flat bread that resembles cornbread in texture. Can't wait to try it again tomorrow! My husband loved it.

name: Barley Bread
review: OK I cheated. Based on the reviews, I did what my grandmother adviced to refine any recipe: substitute a small part of flour for corn starch. So, in a half-recipe, I used 4oz barley flour and 1oz corn starch. Also, I did not have honey so I used 2 tbsp of Splenda sweetener but added 1 tbsp of milk to compensate for moisture. Also used olive oil instead of canola and light soy milk instead of whole milk. Baked at 360F for 25 min, although the bread was probably ready at 20 min.

name: Date Nut Bread
review: Delicious!  I changed the recipe a little, after reading reviews (and checking my pantry- I used unbleached all purpose flour (no whole wheat and 4 Tblsp of butter instead of the 3 Tblsp of vegetable shortening.  I used 1/2 brown sugar and 1/2 white, and added about a Tblsp of molasses.  Extremely moist, came out of the pan easily after cooling for about 15 minutes and tastes delicious!

name: Date Nut Bread
review: Excellent recipe! For those of you who are trying to eat healthier, I modified it a bit. I used coconut oil instead of shortening, 1/2 cup honey instead of 3/4 c sugar, and milled my own flour using hard wheat for the whole wheat and soft wheat for the all-purpose.  Schmear it with low fat cream cheese for a treat. So much better than store bought!!

name: Date Nut Bread
review: A NOTE ON DATES: There is no such thing as a generic date. For this recipe, I used KHADRAWY dates that I bought at Whole Foods. They were not pitted - so I pitted them, of course, and removed the stem end and mashed them into a pulp. Medjool Dates have a stronger structure and they keep their shape better than other dates but I DID NOT WANT THAT - I wanted a date pulp with no discernible date pieces in the bread. Consequently, my battter was very loose and wet and I had to keep adding ten minute intervals to the cooking time so that the top would set properly. When it was all said and done, I added 35 minutes to the cooking time at 10/10/10/5 minute intervals - checking the bread each time the timer went off. The recipe makes a GREAT Date Nut Bread - you really should give it a go! I also added 1 tblsp. HONEY and 1 tblsp. MOLASSES - without changing the original sugar ratio - it simply added depth without making anything too sweet.

name: Provencal Vegetable Gratin
review: Great recipe.  Added sliced fresh mushrooms to the layering process because we add mushrooms to everything.  Also, happened to have a small eggplant on hand.  It worked very well with the other veggies.  I think the biggest hit was the addition of reduced balsamic butter sauce I served to drizzle on top.  Even the non-veggie eater loved it.  Will definitely make again.

name: Provencal Vegetable Gratin
review: What a fantastic recipe! It was easy and yum! Between us, my husband and I ate the whole thing.

name: Provencal Vegetable Gratin
review: Delicious, Easy, Beautiful! My family ate every bite of it for dinner last nite so I dont know if its better the next day or not.  But I intend to find out!!

name: Mike's Clam Chowder
review: yes it's a very good recipe...........i doubled it......now i have A LOT of clam chowder..........but that's not a bad thing.  It was fairly easy to make....I will definitely make this again :

name: Mike's Clam Chowder
review: I thought this recipe was great, but it did need a little extra seasoning to it.  I added more thyme, a little old bay seasoning, and a couple shakes of Tobasco and it was wonderful.  It was easy to make and a big crowd pleaser.

name: Mike's Clam Chowder
review: Three major course corrections are needed to make this chowder taste as it should.

name: Green Bean Stir-Fry
review: Spicy and sweet!  I cut the amount of red pepper flake by half and it was still pretty spicy (which I liked.  I think 1 teaspoon would have been too much heat for me.  I served these alongside Guy's "Dirty P's Garlic-Ginger Chicken Thighs" - good pairing.

name: Green Bean Stir-Fry
review: This is my familys favorite green bean recipe,spicy & seet & sour

name: Green Bean Stir-Fry
review: These green beans are very flavorful with just the right amount of 'kick'.  I made these as a side dish with sweet sour chicken.  My husband typically does not go for green beans - he went for seconds!  I would also serve this as a vegetarian dish when we entertain.  Yummy!

name: Pasta Salad with Arugula Pesto, Grilled Chicken Breasts, and Feta
