I wouldn't even salt the pasta water. Just under cook the pasta and let them finish cooking in the onions, anchovies and cream. They will absorb all the salty flavor they need then. Again, spot on recipe!

name: Oyster Stew
review: My family has made Oyster Stew for decades, added cayenne, white pepper and green onion . . . OmG so gooood.

name: Oyster Stew
review: Something about eating a bowl of half-n-half and butter seasoned with oysters seems unnecessary.  So I changed the around to my liking.  Started with about 1/2 the butter to saute the onions and 2 stalks celery.  Like others I added potatoes, but not precooked; I added to the onions and celery then added the oyster liquor and enough water to cover the potatoes and simmer until the potatoes were still firm but edible (by this time 1/2 the water evaporated, this also serves to draw more flavor out of the onions and celery.  I then added 1/2 cup heavy whipping cream and then about 1 quart of 2% milk and brought to a simmer.  (You'll need to salt appropriately for the amount of potatoes added.  Add the oysters and simmer till the edges just begin to curl and then get it off the heat.  For best flavor you MUST let the soup sit 10-15 minutes to allow to oysters to take in the broth.

name: Oyster Stew
review: This is the most delicious recipe for oyster stew I have found.  My 92-year old father, who remembers this dsh from his childhood, absolutely loved it.  I read the posted reviews and decided to use ALL of the suggested additions :  The stew was delicious.  I, too, used heavy whipping cream instead of half-and-half.  I also added more oysters than called for in the recipe.  Then, I added:

name: Kicked up Stuffed Garlic Bread
review: Grew up in evansvile always tried to duplicate stromboli. This is very good recipe I do tweak it a little but is still great

name: Kicked up Stuffed Garlic Bread
review: I made this the other night, and my family LOVED it!  There is so much flavor, WOW, thank you Emeril.  You are gifted.  Love, love, watching your shows.  I'm learning so much from you.  Thank you!

name: Kicked up Stuffed Garlic Bread
review: this dish is amazingly delicious and very different.

name: Pecan Praline Lace Cookies, Cups, and Coronets
review: These cookies tasted wonderful. I made a Lace Cookie Sandwich with Pumpkin Mousse. Simply, its pumkin mousse sandwiched between two lace cookies. It reminds me of creme brulee...the crunchy from the cookie and the creaminess from the mousse. DIVINE! It's great as a plated dessert. You can see photos on my blog, Baking is my Zen, posted on 10/21/11.

name: Lamb Burger Sliders
review: whats missing in this recipe is the house seasoning... correct me if I am wrong, but I don't see it in the recipe.

name: Lamb Burger Sliders
review: OMG, about a year ago I had some ground lamb to use up, and being a food network junkie, found this recipe.  It was so good, that I have made it several times, the last time being last week.  When I saw it on DDD, I said, "Hey, that's my lamb slider recipe!".  Sooo cool to see something that I have cooked in action on TV, even though I know they did it first, and I just missed it!

name: Lamb Burger Sliders
review: My husband and I tried these Saturday, after seeing this episode of Diners, Drive-ins and Dives.  They were amazing.  I haven't tried to make them myself... yet!  Way to go Chef Olive and thanks Guy for finding amazing food, right in our "backyard"!!

name: English Pea Salad
review: Super easy, Super yummy!!!!  I left out the eggs aswell just because i dont like them.

name: English Pea Salad
review: I did not like the egg. I added green onion and mimi pasta shells, seasoned with Mrs. dash table blend. It was good.

name: English Pea Salad
review: I thought this recipe was fun, very easy and delicious.  Its been a favorite of mine but I never took the time to make it myself until now so it will be added to a barbecue menu for flavor and color.  Thanks Deen Brothers.

name: Old-fashioned Bread Pudding
review: This was simple and easy.  my family loved it.

name: Old-fashioned Bread Pudding
review: Was a good recipe, the sauce was a little bit difficult, but will try again!

name: Old-fashioned Bread Pudding
review: I have never in my life attempted bread pudding however its my boyfriends absolute fave dessert so for Valentines Day I thought Id surprise him. He loved it and has stated its my duty now to make this every now and then. Thank you soooooo much for this recipe

name: Iced Pumpkin Cookies
review: Me and my wife made these and loved them even without the icing.  We decided to use Cool Whip instead of the icing to give it just the right amount of sweetness!

name: Iced Pumpkin Cookies
review: I made these for thanksgiving, and they were a huge hit! They are more cake like than a cookie, but they were great none the less. They were extremely soft and the perfect texture. The frosting makes the cookie 10 times better, so i would suggest making it. Without the frosting the cookie is too bland for me.

name: Iced Pumpkin Cookies
review: Delicious and soft. Easy to make.

name: Cheese Stuffed Bacon Meatballs
review: I made the meatballs last night, there were no leftovers. I have more cheese, I'm make more tonight.

name: Cheese Stuffed Bacon Meatballs
review: Yep, I agree with what everyone else is saying.  These are awesome.

name: Cheese Stuffed Bacon Meatballs
review: @AK8301, those aren't JUST bread crumbs, you have got to try PANKO ITALIAN SEASONING BREAD CRUMBS!!! :-. You are missing out, try it again and I assure you, you will not be disappointed, smiles....

name: Brussels Sprouts Lardons
review: These were very delicious-the only caveat with this and all of the Contessa's recipes is to be mindful of the salt-Things can get too salty too quickly-adjust before it's too late. In this case the pancetta that I used was quite salty, the chicken stock was a lower salt level, but, I might not have needed to use the 3/4 teaspoon that she recommends.  It's a great recipe-delicious flavor-obviously the quality of your stock will make a big difference in the overall flavor.

name: Brussels Sprouts Lardons
review: I've always loved brussels sprouts, but this is the best recipe for them that I've ever come across.  In fact, a long-lost bistro chef friend of mine recently contacted me and asked for this recipe!

name: Brussels Sprouts Lardons
review: Awesome. Will become. A tradition in my house.

name: Sweet Potato Pancakes
review: Very good. Made it for breakfast! It was easy!

name: Sweet Potato Pancakes
review: Made the sweet potato pancakes and applesauce this evening for dinner to go with pork chops. Will def make it again. Super Easy and fall flavors to boot! Hubby didnt luv applesauce but he ate it. Pancakes were an A

name: Basic Long-Grain Brown Rice Pilaf
review: this is a great way to transition a family with picky eaters to brown rice noone even noticed, I used chicken broth, a sauteed onion and lemon zest, doubled the recipe using 4 cups of broth, it turned out great, i also cooked it in a saute pan vs. the sauce pan, and it was fine

name: Basic Long-Grain Brown Rice Pilaf
review: My husband ate it and loved it.  I was concerned that he would think it was too bland, but no complaints.  Next time, I think I'll add herbs and pine nuts.

name: Basic Long-Grain Brown Rice Pilaf
review: This is some Very Good Rice.  I doubled the recipe, but, i did not add 5 cups of liquid, i only added 4 cups of Chicken Stock ( 2 1/2 or even 5 cups is way too much liquid.  I  toasted the brown rice with some Shallots, and during the cooking process, i added 1/3 cup of Golden Raisins.  And just before i fluff the rice, i added 1/4 of Toasted Pine Nuts, and chopped up some Jalapeno slices to give the rice a little "Kick".  This is a keeper.

name: Grilled Hearts of Palm and Crab Salad with Mango
review: I made notes for myself to use ,

name: Grilled Hearts of Palm and Crab Salad with Mango
review: very easy to do and yummi

name: Grilled Hearts of Palm and Crab Salad with Mango
review: I thought the flavors were excellent but would cut back to one T. hot sauce I would not pour all of the dressing over the hearts of palm and crab.  The combination of flavors is really fantastic though and easy to prepare.  I used Fresh Alaska King Crab rather than canned crab.

name: Sugar Cookies
review: very tasty going to make them for christmas

name: Sugar Cookies
review: Amazing recipe; I've used it twice in the past week. Makes about sixteen cookies, very tasty. Cook maybe thirteen minutes or so, and you don't have to refrigerate for the entire two hours: I put them in the fridge maybe half an hour the second time I made them, and they turned out better than the previous two-hour frost, thought that may not necessarily be BECAUSE of the lesser time. But I'm rambling. Bottom line? Yummy recipe. Cook maybe a minute or two less than the prescribed time. Bake often! (:

name: Sugar Cookies
review: Unremarkable and very sticky dough.  Not really worth it.

name: Triple Chocolate Cookies
review: these are GREAT. Easy to make and gone before I'm done baking.  Bobby hits another grand slam home run.

name: Triple Chocolate Cookies
review: I thought these were very good, but a bit dry. I used 1 stick of butter and 1 cup of sugar. Turned out great! They also freeze nicely before baking. I just drop them on a cookie sheet, then freeeze and put in plastic container and take out when I need to bake them.

name: Triple Chocolate Cookies
review: "1/4 plus cup plus 2 tablespoons all purpose flour "

name: Yorkshire Pudding
review: Yummy!!! I make this every time I make a roast. I use a cast iron skillet, mine always turns out great!

name: Yorkshire Pudding
review: The recipe was easy to follow, but the baking time was off. We have a Jenn-air stove purchased in 11/11. The temperature should have been close enough to settle the mixture. My husband and I needed to add about 7 minutes for the top to appear less liquidy. Otherwise, the final outcome was appealing and quite delicious.

name: Yorkshire Pudding
review: I used a muffin tin to make these and they were beautiful. I didn't have enough drippings so I used rendered duck fat which gave it a great flavor.  I also ended up letting these sit for a while due actually to other stuff goin on.  Turned out great.  These puffed up like yummy crispy savory popovers.  I added a bit of thyme before pouring into the tin and served with prime rib.  The next morning we filled the leftovers with scrambled eggs and chopped bacon!  Yum!

name: Italian Potatoes
review: Excellent salad!

name: Italian Potatoes
review: Delicious recipe, which I have made quite a few times without making anyone ill.  If you clean the produce very well, use clean utensils and keep your hands clean, this recipe should not pose a problem.  I view it as sort of similar to making pickles at room temperature--the vinegar and salt help keep "growies" at bay.  Do observe scrupulous cleanliness and cover the bowl between stirrings.

name: Italian Potatoes
review: Hey Paula,

name: Upside-Down Caramelized Apple Cake
review: The first time I made this in 2003 I didn't care for the cornmeal in the batter.  I made it again today and only used 2 Tblsp of cornmeal and added another Tblsp of flour.  I liked the texture of the cake much more.  I used granny smith apples sliced thinly.  Only baked it for 35 minutes.  I think next time I'll double the syrup and put more apples in it.

name: Upside-Down Caramelized Apple Cake
review: First time I make it and came out great!!, great texture, the topping is delicious and is sooo easy!

name: Upside-Down Caramelized Apple Cake
review: Doubled the topping, followed the rest as written. Turned out great. Loved the topping.

name: French Cut Steak
review: Fabulous!  I didn't find skirt steak but found flank steak (which I think is very similar--2 lbs. for 6.50/lb. and I cooked it all, which made for lots of delicious leftovers.  The only other change I made was using smoked paprika, which is what I had on hand.  Would definitely make this for company.  This is a keeper.

name: French Cut Steak
review: I don't usually review recipies, but this was awesome.  Super easy and delicious.  For those complaining about the price/lb of the skirt steak: Melissa advises in the episode that you gotta get it on sale!  I paid over $10/lb (I live by the beach and it's summer right now. The onions take a long time to carmelize, but you could make them ahead of time and keep them in the fridge until you are ready to make the meal. It was so good though - the carmelized onions in that sauce is what made it really exceptional!  I am going to stock up on skirt steak when it goes on sale - this will be in my regular menu rotation!

name: French Cut Steak
review: Very easy to make and so many layers of flavor.  I will add mushrooms the next time I make it.

name: Pralines
review: Wonderful recipe! I have made several batches over the past couple of weeks and they are delicious. I love the rich, buttery flavor! As good as any I have ever had in Louisiana (and I ate them by the dozens whenever I was down South. I let the candy boil after it reaches soft ball for about 4 minutes before shutting off the burner. The ten minute rest is a must, and I stir mine for about 3 minutes instead of 2 (and don't try to cheat with a hand mixer - it doesn't work!. You have to spoon fast and furious because they begin to dry very quickly. I live in the desert, and found that when I tried to make a batch when it had been humid and rainy for a few days, I had to re-boil them for a few minutes because they were not solidifying.

name: Pralines
review: The flavor is good but mine set too quickly so I ended with a big mass of goo in the pan.  I turned off the burner at the right temp. according to the termomether, I left them rest for 10 mins. and was only able to beat them by hand for 1 1/2 because they started solidifying very quickly.  I don't know what I did wrong.

name: Pralines
review: yum!!!! just finished making these with my 9 year old daughter. creamy consistency and lovely caramel color.  didn't find the recipe to be difficult. it does take a little patience to wait for the candy to reach the right temp.  used the water trick and worked perfectly.  i think the key is to give it the full 10 minutes to cool prior to spooning on to paper. love all paula's recipes and i for one am glad it's full of sugar and butter! you go girl!

name: Chocolate Peanut Butter Cheesecake
review: This is the first time I have ever written a review.  I decided to because this cheesecake is amazing!  I am a very good cook and an ok baker and have never made a cheesecake. This recipie is easy and very very delicious. Just make sure you have everything at room temperature. I followed the recipie exactly and it turned out perfectly. My advice, make it the day before you need it. As it sat in the fridge over night it set up even more and was perfect the next day.

name: Chocolate Peanut Butter Cheesecake
review: This recipe has the texture of a perfect cheesecake, but was pretty flavourless except for peanuts. The three layers don't blend together at all, the topping doesn't contribute anything except to smooth over the appearance, and I don't get the slightest taste of chocolate, despite using very high quality stuff. Won't be making this again.

name: Chocolate Peanut Butter Cheesecake
review: The best ever!!!! i made it for xmas :D and it was a success!!!!

name: Fillet O'Fu
review: I think I'd give it 3.5 stars if half stars were allowed.  It's a good method for prepping the tofu and getting it ready to fry.  I think I'll try some of the suggestions for the marinate next time. I noticed in the Good Eats book that he suggests 2 hours of de-watering and putting sirachi chili sauce on top.

name: Fillet O'Fu
review: For those who love tofu, are vegetarians, or want to change this up, try this:

name: Fillet O'Fu
review: I usually enjoy Alton's recipes, but this has to be the worst yet.  It kind of defeats the purpose of why I eat tofu, because it is healthy.  But breadiing and frying this negates that fact.  Flavor was bland, and not pleasing.  Deleting from my recipe box.  Sorry Alton, but I still love you!  :

name: Basic Sticky Rice
review: My god mother from thai land would always make this, same way. I need a new basket

name: Basic Sticky Rice
review: Nice job.

name: Garlic-Studded Pot Roast
review: BEST POT ROAST! Made many times and always get great reviews! I double the sauce recipe because everyone loves to dip their bread in it or put over the meat (not that the meat needs it.

name: Garlic-Studded Pot Roast
review: Excellent recipe, however I find a discrepancy and would like clarification.  Ingredients call for 1T + 1 1/2 tsp Essence.  The directions call for using only 1T Essence.  Which is correct?  For those using a smaller portion of roast, suggest adjusting cooking time accordingly.

name: Garlic-Studded Pot Roast
review: awsome so good .served it with rice and crusty bread. the longer you cook it the more tender it gets. the flavor is so good. didn't see where to put the potatoes exactly so i added them to the last hour of cooking. there were 7 people eating and most went back for seconds or thirds .there is still enough for my husband and i to take some for lunch on bread with mayo tomorrow. yumm!

name: Stuffed Lobster
review: This was a great way to use up all the lobster leg meat! I always feel bad throwing it out. This technique of using a rolling pin is terrific. It takes some time, but who knew their was so much meat in the lobster legs???

name: Stuffed Lobster
review: Thank you for offering us "scaredy cats" a more humane way to prepare this dish in our kitchens. It's a bit more work than boiled lobsters. But it's such a treat!  'Loved that butter is kept to a minimum and EVOO used to serve. Even though we baked our 1 1/2 lb lobsters the full 14 minutes, the claws needed a bit more time. Next time, we'll bake them a minute longer, But we couldn't get over how much more tender lobster meat was - especially the tail meat using this method. Thanks, Alton!

name: Stuffed Lobster
review: LOVED this recipe! I followed the directions to the 'T' and it came out perfect! I cannot wait to do it again. My lobsters were a gift from lobster gram and I found a place nearby that sells live lobbies for a fraction of what you would pay for in a restaurant. I think my girlfriend will want me to do this on a regular basis but I would have no problem doing it. Served with a nice filet mignon with cracked pepper and sauteed shrooms and a shrimp cocktail to kick it off!

name: Salisbury Steak with Brown Gravy
review: Going to bump up this yummy  sounding recipe with fresh roasted garlic, a dash of cayenne and some diced green bell.pepper to the patties since we adore spicy foods at our house, which includes Italian, Spanish and Mexican  euheritage, lol!

name: Salisbury Steak with Brown Gravy
review: Very good. I left out the mushrooms since I don't like them and followed the recipe otherwise. The gravy was perfect and served with mashed potatoes and salad, this is a great dinner. I was very light with the salt and pepper and still it was very flavorful. It was a hit with the boyfriend and I!

name: Salisbury Steak with Brown Gravy
review: This was delicious and a hefty amount of food. Loving the gravy and the mushrooms! Tasted soooo good!  Definitely a recipe keeper!

name: Stuffed Baked Potatoes
review: Very easy to make, takes a bit of time but worth it.  I forgot the milk and it was just fine.  My 12 year old and friend loved them.  No left overs. Would make again.

name: Stuffed Baked Potatoes
review: simple but sooo yummy

name: Stuffed Baked Potatoes
review: creamy, delicious.   Leaves you wanting another

name: Kansas City Barbecue
review: The rub was just ok. Very sugary and not much flavor.  I added more paprika, chili powder and garlic powder and it was still fairly bland.

name: Kansas City Barbecue
review: The rub was awesome

name: Kansas City Barbecue
review: WOW!  These were great.  I used my own rub, but followed the cooking instructions.  The meat was done perfectly, falling off the bone, but not dry.  I can't wait to make them again.  Thank you!

name: Pear Honey
review: I just made this pear honey.  I used 8 cups of chopped pears and 4 cups of sugar.  It took a little over an hour to cook.  I'm not sure if I got the right consistency though.  I used a potato masher to mash up the pears.  It came out very thick consistency.  More like a jelly.  Is it suppose to be so thick?   The taste is amazing!  Like candy!  But its not smooth and creamy like honey.  Should I have cooked it more?  I wouldnt want to add more sure because it is very sweet already.

name: Pear Honey
review: I have made this recipe twice and the only comment I have is that it takes much longer than 30 minutes, probably like an hour or more.  I use my dutch oven, uncovered, since it distrubutes the heat evenly.  It is extremely runny at first but you have to cook until all the liquid has evaporated and only the sugar is left.  You can tell when this has taken place on how it bubbles up and it should be a golden honey color when it is ready.  But when that water completely evaporates, you have to be right on it or it will begin to burn.  Love this recipe!!!  Tastes just like my friend Jackie's pear honey.

name: Pear Honey
review: very pretty and tasty. Took much longer than 30 minutes to cook. Did not know what to expect. Would have liked directions on how the pear honey should look when ready. Thanks,We Love Paula

name: Taco al Carbon
review: Well I used store bought tortillas first off, and eliminated the liquid smoke. The chicken turned out fabulous. ( cooked in skillet instead of on the grill... it's been a little chilly I tried to roast the tomatillos and serranos in the oven (gas broiler. This is my first time ever using tomatillos for anything.  They did not turn out quite right... anyone have some tips on this? Can you use them raw in this recipe or do they have to be roasted/skin peeled off?

name: Taco al Carbon
review: I made this chicken for a large crowd and everyone absolutely loved it!!! I used large, boneless, skilnless chicken breasts and did not overcook them on the BBQ. The flavor and moisture were perfect. The tomatillo sauce was equally great. I used store bought tortillas, and made the tomatilla sauce in my blender instead of in a mortar. This made for an easy dinner which we will make again.

name: Taco al Carbon
review: this dish was pretty good. it was spicy and yummy, but it was dry. Maybe because i did not cook it right, but i would make it again.

name: Roasted Barley Salad with Bacon and Vegetables
review: I loved this salad.  Though, I do wish I had read the reviews before taking it on.  Maybe then I would not have had Mount St. Helens on my stove top...... I doubled the recipe for a large party we had planned.  I toasted the barley and had the water/broth boiling.  I poured about 1/2 of the barley in the water pot and all heck broke loose!  Wow!  I had a MAJOR eruption!  A salad that should have only taken an hour to make, took about 3 hours.  I had to wait for the stove to cool down so I could sop up the mess from under all 4 burners.  Other than the explosion, I thought it was wonderful.  I did replace the zucchini with celery instead. I also added chopped sweet onion and one bunch of green onions.  The salad was a hit, there were very few leftovers.

name: Roasted Barley Salad with Bacon and Vegetables
review: Is the first time i tried barley like a salad and it turned out excellent, the flavor is perfect, the mix and the colors and the smell absolutely delicious and healthy. My family loved it.

name: Roasted Barley Salad with Bacon and Vegetables
review: This was my first time to make a barley salad...only used barley in soup before.  I also almost had an explosion when adding it to the water/broth. My husband and both liked it.  He preferred it warm.  We used anaheim peppers instead of zucchini.  I would use it for a picnic or covered dish for folks who can eat something a little unusual.

name: Doughnut Glaze
review: It has way to much sugar in the recipe now it tastes like I just put sugar all over it instead of glaze! But I did make a change to the recipe, I cut the vanilla in half because it would've been super strong.

name: Doughnut Glaze
review: Very good glaze, sets up nice and fast. I made a couple changes, I made half a recipe and used whipping cream and only 1/8 teaspoon of vanilla. I would make this glaze again :

name: Doughnut Glaze
review: This is not what I think of as donut glaze, sorry. First off, cut the vanilla in half, or it will be way too strong. Secondly, I was looking for more of a hard, thick Krispy Kreme sort of glaze, but this mixture is way too thin. Now I just have soggy donuts, great.

name: Whole Roasted Fish with Herbs
review: Unfortunately, my snapper had no flavor.  Yes, this recipe was super easy, the snapper was very moist, the end result looked beautiful but the fish had no flavor.  Let me note, I am also not a big white fish lover.

name: Whole Roasted Fish with Herbs
review: The recipe is definitely great! My husband doesn't like fish very much and he loved this one. I plan on doing it again but I'll use less lemon underneath the fish (inside the fish it's ok, because the sauce was too lemony (1 or 2 slices  are enough.. at least if if you're using a dry white wine.

name: Whole Roasted Fish with Herbs
review: Have your fishmonger butterfly the fish - remove the bones from the insides. I don't feel the flavor suffers from the lack of them, especially because you leave the head and tail on. The presentation is the same and the serving is so much easier, faster and, therefor, hotter. Check the cooking time earlier.

name: Bellini Bar
review: This was very easy and wonderful.  We don't drink so I used Non-alcoholic Brut and it was fantastic.  Not to sweet, just perfect.

name: Bellini Bar
review: Awesome idea!  Instead of pureeing the fruit, I cook it down with sugar until syrupy.  Strain; cool; serve.  We prefer champagne for the bubbles.  Uses less fruit flavoring. May have to experiment with ratios based on preferences.

name: Bellini Bar
review: I love how Giada just knows how to make some things simple!  I made these for a Bridal Shower I hosted and they were a hit!  Peach was the favorite of the group but I also did blackberry and strawberry.  I recommend using a larger glass than a champaign flute because it seems like when you are putting the fruit puree into the glass it may not be enough but then the champaign fizzes up and you have to keep refilling the glass until you get the right mix.  Overall - LOVED IT!

name: Limoncello Cheesecake Squares
review: The BEST cheesecake!

name: Limoncello Cheesecake Squares
review: Made it a while ago and it was a hit every time. My new favorite!!!

name: Limoncello Cheesecake Squares
review: Loved everything about it but would probably consider using a spring form pan for a standard cheesecake format.

name: Penne ala Vodka
review: This is a real real good pasta. It is excellent and tasty. I would recomend this to everybody! I think you should add to the directions that you should only add the sauce to the pasta right before serving so the  texture remains good.

name: Penne ala Vodka
review: This Penne alla Vodka is outstanding.  I used homemade tomato sauce, and the 13 cloves of garlic required.  I have made this many times and it never disappoints.  Tonight I added shrimp to the sauce. I don't understand the people who are giving it 2 stars perhaps they are using minced jarred garlic instead of fresh or a less superior tomato sauce.  It is very important to light the vodka on fire once added and to reduce the cream (I used half heavy cream and half half and half because I did not have enough heavy cream. This is not bland at all and better then restaurants.

name: Penne ala Vodka
review: This is the BEST recipe I've made in a long time...My family begs me to make this and it's SO easy.  Definitely recommend anyone to try it.  Better than what I've eaten in restaurants too!!

name: Ultimate Shrimp and Grits
review: This is without a doubt the best grits recipe ever.  I call them dinner grits because they are so rich and decadent.  I substituted crawfish (shelled for the shrimp and hot Italian sausage because no andoullie was available. It was DELICIOUS.  Also, because I only had 5 minut white grits I used 4 cups of milk and cream instead of the 6 cups called for and the grits were perfect.  As a southerner, I know how to cook grits.  This will become one of my signature dishes for company. YUMMY GOOD.  Also went together quickly.

name: Ultimate Shrimp and Grits
review: Quick, easy & delicious! Thanks Tyler! I too replaced the white corn meal with Quaker Grits and they were perfect!

name: Ultimate Shrimp and Grits
review: Very nice!  A quick and easy meal to make. I used Quaker brand grits because they are made from hominy which in my opinion are true grits, cornmeal is polenta.  I used only 4 cups of water to a cup of grits.

name: Creamy Chicken Noodle Soup
review: Very good and easy!

name: Creamy Chicken Noodle Soup
review: SO GOOD!!!!!! I ended up putting the noodles in all together in crock pot by accident but i DO NOT REGRET IT. It came out so much better. If you like your noodles Super soft then do this. It was so good! and also I cooked on high for 4-5 hours to get more flavor out of it. Added more veggies too! Thanks for the recipe sandra lee!!

name: Creamy Chicken Noodle Soup
review: Love this recipe.

name: Sauteed Summer Squash and Tomatoes
review: this was a simple and delicious recipe - loved it!

name: Sauteed Summer Squash and Tomatoes
review: I followed the recipe as is--and love it! Easy, quick, and best of all, absolutely delicious. The mint does more for the dish than I could have imagined, and the tomatoes are perfect in it. I can't think of a better summer side dish.

name: Sauteed Summer Squash and Tomatoes
review: Great recipe cept i used garlic powder, onions, oregano and hot sauce with the squash!!!

name: Braised Red Cabbage
review: Really good, but I would use less cinnamon next time. Also butter instead of peanut oil is probably a good bet.

name: Braised Red Cabbage
review: Cause this dish was awful.  I read the other comments before I made the braised red cabbage and thought it would be great.  Their isn't too much I don't like when it comes to food.  I am not sure it was the cinnomon, it had a sweet taste to it, or if the whole dish would be better if it were made cold like a slaw.  I don't know.  This was bad.....really bad.

name: Braised Red Cabbage
review: VERY TASTY AND EASY RECIPE.  I WOULD GREAT THE APPLE NEXT TIME.

name: Spaghetti with Crab Sauce: Spaghettini al Sugo Gronchio
review: Sometimes Simple and fresh are all you need for a good meal.  This recipe will be as good as your ingredients are fresh.  (If dealing with frozen/fresh crab... look for it to be a little saltier.  When you marry your garden with the sea you get this dish and it should be a crowd pleaser.

name: Spaghetti with Crab Sauce: Spaghettini al Sugo Gronchio
review: Great recipe.

name: Spaghetti with Crab Sauce: Spaghettini al Sugo Gronchio
review: I made this dish as part of a Christmas eve seafood dinner, the simplicity of the dish; sweet dungeness crab, tomato, and not much else works together wonderfully.  It was so fast and easy as well that as long as you can get the crab its well worth making.

name: Braised Romaine Lettuce with Mustard and Bacon
review: This recipe was delish.  I only cooked the lettuce about 12 minutes and we enjoyed the wilted texture with some texture left to the ribs.  I think I might add some shallot to the bacon and a squirt of lemon to finish next time.  Served with pork chops and mashed potatoes, great combo.

name: Braised Romaine Lettuce with Mustard and Bacon
review: A good way to use up loads of lettuce from the garden on your CSA bin!  I really liked the sauce.  Great compliment to pork.  I really decreased the cooking time for the lettuce and I'm so glad I did.  If it simmered for thirty minutes I can't imagine how it would be anything other than a squishy mess.

name: Braised Romaine Lettuce with Mustard and Bacon
review: We tried this recipe last evening & were pleasantly surprised.  My husband had purchased too much romaine lettuce from Costco & only so much salad can be eaten by two people.  This dish was both unusual & delicious.  We both had second helpings.  I will definitely fix this recipe many more times.

name: Pumpkin Risotto
review: I cooked this recipe for a book club dinner and everyone loved it.  I used a good chardonnay, and you could taste it.  The recipe was easy, but allow enough time. It sat in the pot for awhile and was still fine.  People couldn't believe I started from "scratch"!

name: Pumpkin Risotto
review: I made no changes to this and it was fantastic!  I've made risotto before but WOW I'm a happy girl.  Perfect for the fall.

name: Pumpkin Risotto
review: I have made this recipe so many times and it never ceases to disappoint.  It is one of my favorite comfort foods by far.  Thanks again for making me seem like a MUCH better cook than I really am!

name: Squash Blossom Quesadillas
review: easy recipe and helped me make my first recipe with squash blossoms from my garden!

name: Squash Blossom Quesadillas
review: These quesadillas are great, I made some with four tortillas and some with corn.  My family perferred the corn....I lovee them both!!!!

name: Marinated Lamb Kebabs
review: Delicious and easy!   Yes, agree it was a bit messy on skewers, but the meat was grilled perfectly and very tender.  I did add a clove of garlic to the marinade, and it really made the lemon flavor pop.  Cooked the meat and onions on separate skewers since we like to really char the onions.

name: Marinated Lamb Kebabs
review: The lemon totally over powered the lamb in this recipe!  I would not have known I was eating lamb!  It's the first time I have been disappointed in one of Ina's recipes.......this one went directly into the trash..........along with the lamb that my guests did not eat!

name: Marinated Lamb Kebabs
review: OMG! These were sooo delicious. Sure they're a little messy but the end result is so worth it.  Very easy to prepare.  Made them for a family bbq and everyone commented.  Might add some garlic next time too, just to give it a little extra kick.  Definitely will make these again.

name: Peking Duck with Pancakes
review: The recipe for the pancakes is completely wrong, it took a few oz of water to make a workable dough, then they were nasty. Better off using soft taco shells from the grocery store than these. I lived in beijing for 6 months, so i have a clue on what they should be like...

name: Peking Duck with Pancakes
review: Needs much more than 1 cup of flour to make the dough using 16 oz of water.

name: Peking Duck with Pancakes
review: Made this for Valentine's Day. Told my girlfriend, "You better love it for the trouble I went through, then again I hope you hate it as I will not cook it again".

name: Vinegar Pie
review: I am making this pie for my book club. Each year we take a field trip associated with a book we read. This year we read Thin Blue Smoke by Doug Wargul and are traveling to Kansas City for BBQ (a major theme in the book. Smoke Meat, the fictitious BBQ joint in the book, serves vinegar pie, I had never heard of it. I tasted the filling as I was making it and was surprised at how good it is! I can't wait for my book group to taste it with their KC BBQ tomorrow night!!

name: Vinegar Pie
review: Very tasty filling, but I never could get it to set up in the fridge, even overnight. Wonder what I did wrong?

name: Vinegar Pie
review: I didn't add any lemon to my pie filling because I used unfiltered apple cider vinegar from Trader Joes.  This filling has a wonderful, zippy flavor with a nice sweetness to it.  I think that people will wonder what the special ingredient is and never guess that it could be vinegar.

name: Rack of Lamb Persillade
review: I saw this show a while back and was afraid to try lamb because I remember my mom made a leg of lamb when I was young (like 8 and I guess we all hated it. A coworker told me she thought it tasted like pork so I decided to give it a whirl. I deliberately searched for Ina's recipe and it was incredible. My husband loved it too. What I changed up was I used less lemon rind. I don't care too much for overpowering lemon taste in my food. I also used italian panko bread crumbs. Next time I am not going to oil the rack with the olive oil. I think that's what caused the coating to slide. And I did pack it on with my hands! I had this two days ago and I'm ready to have it again, it was that good!

name: Rack of Lamb Persillade
review: In a word... WOW, a whole lotta WOW! Love this, it's easy to make and my family and friends have this on their request list!!

name: Rack of Lamb Persillade
review: I love Ina.  She is my favorite Chef Celeb.   I tried this recipe for the first time today and it turned out wonderful.  Someone mentioned that the parsley breading slid off, but I didn't have any issues with it and I used a lot of olive oil.   I think they should probably have just scooped it out with their hands and packed it on.  Anyway, I am a spice girl so I added a bit of red pepper along with roasting it with black pepper and kosher salt.  WE LOVED IT.   IT TURNED OUT PERFECT AND IT WAS SO EASY.  THANKS INA.  Love Ya!!!

name: Christmas Cutout Sugar Cookies
review: They taste eh, ok. I followed the directions completely, scared to death because I'm not a great baker...I usually burn them. I mixed up the dough and it was all crumbly like cornmeal. I ended up adding water to get the consistency right to make 'dough'. I refrigerated it to for about a 45 minutes. It was impossible to roll unless I cake it with flour. Luckily my daughter is only 2 and a half and she enjoyed being hands on & doesn't know the real process. We had to make a ball and mash each one by hand just to put the cookie cutter in so they are thicker than they should be. They taste OK. I think I should've used lemon instead of vanilla flavoring. They're kinda bland. But, at least I didn't burn them like usual.

name: Christmas Cutout Sugar Cookies
review: This recipe was terrible!  It was a waste of money and time!  Dough was too stiff and dry! Had to throw dough away!

name: Christmas Cutout Sugar Cookies
review: loved this recipe!! this cookie plumps up and stays white and gorgeous when baked. just like a sugar cookie should. add a few drops of milk at a time, if batter is too stiff. This is my GO TO cookie recipe!!!

name: Mini Chocolate-Meringue Cupcakes
review: This things were great; whenever I make them, I only get a few, everybody else eats them so fast! However, I'm giving this a four because the merigue made them flaky on top, and they fell apart when I tried to take them out of the muffin paper. I would recommend letting the merigue deflat a bit, or not to beat it a much as said, so they aren't so flaky. Otherwise they are pretty good, a party favorite, and are even better with the top dipped in chocolate, instead of drizzled.

name: Mini Chocolate-Meringue Cupcakes
review: Super delicious! These have a nice crispy, light top because of the meringue...but then they are soft and chocolatey on the inside. Just the right amount of sugar, not too sweet. Perfect Giada! Love them!

name: Mini Chocolate-Meringue Cupcakes
review: These little light fudgey gems of delight are so addictive!  I followed the recipe exactly, and they turned out perfectly. You have to fill the cups to the top as she said. They puff up, then when they cool, they flatten out and get a nice light and airy, slightly crispy crust...like an angel food cake, since you're using meringue.  My husband went crazy over these. He said, "You eat one, and it's like a little chocolate puff, but then it doesn't feel like you ate one, so you eat another and another!"  Ha! Good description!  My mom cannot have dairy, so this recipe is perfect for her.  I just have to sub dark chocolate for the semi-sweet.  I'll probably add a bit of espresso powder, too, to ramp up more on the decadence.  Yum!  Can't wait!  P.S.  I used the exact amount of cinnamon and we did not taste it. I think it just helps to enrich the chocolate flavor, in this case.

name: Grilled Peaches with Mascarpone and Honey
review: This was super quick and easy, but it looked and tasted supreme.

name: Grilled Peaches with Mascarpone and Honey
review: we didn't like this.  the flavor wasn't bad but the texture was.

name: Grilled Peaches with Mascarpone and Honey
review: you are not going to believe how wonderful this is. yummy.  also excellent with plums.  i could eat this every day

name: Grilled Portobello Mushrooms Stacked with Fresh Spinach and Shaved Manchego Cheese
review: I had vegetarian relatives coming to visit and decided to make this for them while the meat-eaters had cedar-plank salmon (which, also thanks to Bobby, was delicious.  I figured they probably cooked portobellos a lot and would simply appreciate my effort to accommodate them, but they raved about it.  Everyone tried some and they loved it too.  Do yourself a favor - go to the trouble to find and buy the sherry vinegar and taste this the way it was meant to be.  You won't be disappointed.  As others have pointed out the leftover dressing is great on a salad, too.  I added the cheese while the mushrooms were finishing on the grill, which really seemed to kick up the integration of the flavors.  Will definitely be making this again.

name: Grilled Portobello Mushrooms Stacked with Fresh Spinach and Shaved Manchego Cheese
review: Like many others, I used balsamic in lieu of sherry.  Using baby portobellos to make this an appetizer is always a hit at our house.  We are always on the lookout for tasty vegetarian recipes to fill up our carnivorous friends, and this one certainly does the trick!!

name: Grilled Portobello Mushrooms Stacked with Fresh Spinach and Shaved Manchego Cheese
review: Delicious.  Everyone that tried this, gave the thumbs up.  I served the portobellos individually, not stacked.  Only one request from my daughter, "More spinach please".  So next time, I plan to have small bowls of spinach tossed with the vinaigrette (I used balsamic vinegar, to serve the portobellos on.

name: Roast Bacon
review: Great idea...BUT if you use heavy-duty foil that has been crinkled (carefully crush and gently unfold to avoid tearing in the bottom of the pan and up the sides, the grease pools in the crevices making the bacon crispier and less fatty.

name: Roast Bacon
review: I made this for my 9yr old daughter & I and it was by far the best way I've made bacon. She is a true bacon lover & after eating this she said "Mom will you make the bacon like that all the time now."  :-

name: Roast Bacon
review: Put the bacon on foil for easy clean up. Best way to cook for bacon ever.

name: Strawberry Pretzel Salad
review: I have been making this recipe for years, especially at family (holiday BBQ's. The best and funniest compliment that I received about this dessert is "Are there any drugs in this dessert"?. It really is that addictive. Paula doesn't specify, but I use salted pretzels in the recipe. It gives a nice sweet/salty flavor that I enjoy. This is a MUST TRY recipe.

name: Strawberry Pretzel Salad
review: My son's classroom is a nut free zone due to food allergies.  This dessert was perfect for their year end celebration and the kids and adults loved it!

name: Strawberry Pretzel Salad
review: This is an easy recipe to convert to low sugar.  We have several diabetics or people on low carb diets in our extended family so I have been making this with less sugar for years and no one can tell the difference.  I use sugar free jello and splenda sweetened frozen strawberries (Kroger makes them in my area, I get sugar free cool whip for the middle and use less sugar than the recipe calls for in the crust and the filling.  I have tried half sugar with a little splenda, stevia and equal spoonful blend and it worked but would not add just splenda (odd taste - but equal spoonful worked best if just adding one type of sugar substitute.  We never add the pineapple.  Taste exactly the same, just a little healthier.

name: Crack Proof Cheesecake
review: Overall the cheesecake was pretty good.  The look was beautiful with no cracks.  I would prefer the texture to be a little more dense.  It came out more like the Jello instant cheesecake.  Also, one whole lemon zest was a bit too much.  My daughter asked me if it was lemon cheesecake.  I really liked the crust look and taste.  The cook time was off.  I cooked an extra 20 min.

name: Crack Proof Cheesecake
review: My sister is going through some hard times during this economic downturn, so she is a little stressed let's say.  So I've decided to make her some comfort food.  This weekend I searched online for an easy cheesecake recipe & found this one.  Since my sis only likes simple, plain cheesecakes without the toppings and with a graham cracker crust, this one was an excellent choice.  I made this one without making the topping and it was FABULOUS.  Everyone that tried it, LOVED it!  I forwarded the recipe so they can make it.  A tip that may help if this is your first cheesecake...  the cheesecake should rise to the top of the spring form pan and the outside edge should just start to turn brown for it to be completely done cooking.  It will fall when you take it out of the oven so it is very important to take a thin knife to divide the edge of the cheesecake from the pan, which has been sprayed with the non-stick butter flavored spray with no flour.  The cheesecake did not crack at all and presented beautifully with no topping. In my oven, the cooking time was 1 hour 30  minutes at 325 with the temperature increased to 350 for the last 10-15  minutes.  The key is for the cheesecake to just start browning at the edge.  For the graham cracker crust, I used the cinnamon & sugar graham crackers and I did not add the cinnamon.  Yum!  PERFECTLY DELICIOUS & SMOOTH CHEESECAKE!

name: Crack Proof Cheesecake
review: Making this recipe for at least the 100th time.  Fabulous!  Make sure the cream cheese is completely soft, the sour cream and eggs are at room temperature, it prevents clumps. I mix the filling in a food processor to avoid bubbles. I use fresh raspberries, take some and puree in food processor, add sugar and the lemon juice from your zested lemon. Mix with whole berries.   Delightful.  I've varied it with cocoa powder, (needs extra sugar and either made a complete chocolate version, or did a plain/chocolate swirl.  All three are beautiful with the raspberry topping.

name: Parmesan Chicken Sticks
review: These came out great! A super hit with this family:o

name: Parmesan Chicken Sticks
review: I'm not one for pan frying, but tried these due to the positive reviews.  All I tasted was grease...the flavor was not good.  Sorry, this one didn't work for me.

name: Parmesan Chicken Sticks
review: These were so good!! We used Italian breadcrumbs and the flavor was really good!

name: Potato Pea Curry
review: This recipe tasted fabulous using only half of each quantity of spice.  I think any more would have been overkill.  As a template, I would rate it 5 stars, with the caveat that one must start with half of each spice amount and adjust upwards as wished.  My guests said it was delicious.

name: Potato Pea Curry
review: Tasted great!  I modified the recipe slightly to fit what I had on hand, but it turned out delicious, anyway!

name: Potato Pea Curry
review: this was really good, even if it was a little cumin heavy for my taste.

name: Jicama Matchstick Fries
review: looked like fries, very appealing visually but didn't like the flavor or texture. tried them plain and dredged in parmesan. yuk and yuk.

name: Jicama Matchstick Fries
review: Cut Jicama into 1/4" square fries. deep fry @ 350 until very brown and crisp. Time in the fryer means nothing. Lots of seasoning. A tbsp. of Hunt's Low carb ketchup. . . wow!!

name: Jicama Matchstick Fries
review: You definitely can't cut these like regular sized fries.  The insides are still hard and the outsides burn.  As matchsticks they're really tasty though!

name: Pan-fried Salmon
review: So simple and delicious! Salmon was cooked perfectly! Thanks for the great recipe:

name: Pan-fried Salmon
review: Always add 4 capfuls extra dry vermouth per lb fish before heating to eliminate fishy smell.

name: Pan-fried Salmon
review: So simple so good. Seasoned the buttered pan with Old Bay, garlic powder and pepper the way MsDiscious did and it was absolutely fabulous! Followed suggestions for sides and made horseradish mashed potatoes with caramelized onions and a little spring mix. Most definitely a keeper!

name: Chicken Pozole
review: Made this last night for my family and some friends. I was pretty nervous because we all know what abuelita's Pozole tastes like so I had to live up to some expectations. Everyone loved it.  Used canned Pozole, I added a little extra since I knew the kids would eat more of it. For the chile paste I ended up adding some of the brothe to my blender and blended it until it was smoothe. I didn't have a sieve to use.

name: Chicken Pozole
review: This recipe is excellent!!!  I did make it my own a little, like using canned hominy.  You have to make everything your own and what your family will like.  I as well am hispanic and grew up eating Mexican dishes and this recipe is a great base for making some authentic and tasty pazole.  Highly recommend this recipe and all the ingredients.

name: Chicken Pozole
review: This pazole is fabulous! I was impressed by this recipe. I am hispanic and it was good. It does need cilantro and limes. Canned hominy is fine. For a little more depth, I used a variety of dried chillies and a can of tomatoes. Good job Bobby Flay.

name: Roasted Cauliflower and Broccoli
review: So yummy!  Loved all the veggies.  I also put in some fresh Brussels

name: Roasted Cauliflower and Broccoli
review: I thought I was the only one! Once again the recipe is incomplete! I too "guessed" at what had to done with garlic, the cooking time is way off, if you cook the veggies as long as stated, they become mushy. I like my veggies with more crunch, so I do suggest you cut back on the time as put the veggies on a cookie sheet, uncovered for 30 minutes.

name: Roasted Cauliflower and Broccoli
review: Okay, so what do you do with the garlic? And yes, I am complaining.

name: Sweet and Sour Chicken: Pollo in Agrodolce
review: I love this dish and make it frequently.  It's easy, very tasty and isn't run of the mill.  I cook the chicken with the lid on for a while before letting the sauce evaporate.  It seems to mellow out the vinegar.  A hearty recommendation.

name: Sweet and Sour Chicken: Pollo in Agrodolce
review: This was delicious and easy recipe.  It is my new favorite recipe for chicken.  I have made for 3 dinner parties over last few months, and I am one that likes to try new things - so this has to be tasty.  I made a few minor changes, none that impacts flavor.  I used all skin-on chicken thighs, as they stay moister and I prefer them.  Instead of doing the last 20-25 min on the stove, I braised uncovered for 35-45 minutes at 350 in the oven.  This works well for a dinner party (put it in and rejoin your guests.  Finally, i skipped the fennel fronds after first time making it - really added nothing to the dish, so unless you have on hand, don't bother.  Make this dish, I can't see how anyone would not love it.

name: Sweet and Sour Chicken: Pollo in Agrodolce
review: I didn't use currants or the peperoncinis, but it was delicious none the less!

name: Cabbage Rolls
review: I know it is summer time but I just had to have something substantial to eat.  I haven't made cabbage rolls in decades.  I liked this recipe because it is pretty easy and the results were excellent.  My husband rarely comments on any of the recipes I try but last night he actually said he liked it.  That says it all.  I followed the recipe as written but I did make sure to season my rice which is a big component of this recipe.  I thought the sauce was absolutely wonderful.  Although my sauce did not thicken up.  Personally I did not care for the chopped tomatoes.  Next time I would puree them or possibly use tomato sauce.  I have left overs and I will freeze.  I am sure they will be even better the second time around.

name: Cabbage Rolls
review: These were great!! Thanks Emeril!!

name: Cabbage Rolls
review: I didn't have ground pork but I did have bacon!... So, I chopped up the uncooked bacon and mixed this with the meat and rice instead. It was DELISH!!! I had to taste it before my husband got home and almost couldn't stop... I have a feeling he is gonna be a happy man tonight.

name: Rustic Apple Tart
review: Delicious and so easy!

name: Rustic Apple Tart
review: It was delicious, although I changed it a little.  I added raisens and some walnuts and it was great.  Ate warm out of the oven with my homeade ice cream.  Thank you

name: Rustic Apple Tart
review: This is the BEST EVER apple tart!  I added blackberries and it was delicious!  So easy to make (especially with a store bought crust and you could add any kind of fruit you want. Next time I'm trying apples with pears or peaches or maybe blueberries.  The  possibilities are endless!  Thanks, Gina and Pat...I LOVE your show and your recipes!

name: Peking Duck
review: not even close to peking duck!Chinese people don't give up secrets easily!I highly doubt that this is emerils recipe,i beleive the FN just put his name to it.

name: Peking Duck
review: This is roast duck with bad crepe instructions.

name: Peking Duck
review: SOOOooooo...good!

name: Spinach and Ricotta-Stuffed Chicken Breasts with Lemony White Wine Sauce
review: Amazing! Delicious! Fun! Easy!

name: Spinach and Ricotta-Stuffed Chicken Breasts with Lemony White Wine Sauce
review: Choose this recipe because I had almost everything on hand.  I didn't want to do the bacon, so I substituted about 2-3 TBS of sun dried tomatoes.  First off, I have no idea how you could pan fry the chicken.  They were to big, so I ended up baking them at 375 for 40 minutes.  They were done fine.  (My oven runs a bit hot though.  Second, the sauce is just odd!  It has no connection to the other flavors in the chicken.  (I had made some Brussel sprouts and the sauce was better on them.  I could never get it to the "sauce" stage and it was way to lemony.  Not something I would make again.  FYI: with all the cheese in the stuffing, it makes it very rich.

name: Spinach and Ricotta-Stuffed Chicken Breasts with Lemony White Wine Sauce
review: Why does the recipe specify Kosher salt? It has bacon in it.

name: Biscotti Regina (Sesame Seed Cookies)
review: I make these every Christmas for my dad who is Italian, he loves them. This is the best recipe I have found.

name: Biscotti Regina (Sesame Seed Cookies)
review: These are fabulous.  A real taste of my childhood.  I would definitely recommend these!

name: Biscotti Regina (Sesame Seed Cookies)
review: Absolutely the best.  I had lost my mother's recipe and I am 86.  It brought back so many memories of my childhood when my uncle owned a bakery on 9th avenue in New York.    I did not coat with the heavy cream, I just coated the biscotti with sesame seed and they were perfect.  Many thanks for the perfect recipe.    Anna Torpy

name: Johnnycakes
review: needed more sugar  This is best servrd with maple syrup

name: Johnnycakes
review: Simple and Sweet!

name: Johnnycakes
review: I made this quickly and easily. I think that it tastes a little like corn bread. I though it was a little bland, next time I am going to try adding some more salt and sugar. This will make a good healthy snack, add some butter and honey.

name: The Ultimate Stuffed Potato
review: This was really great, but I dont know what he was thinking when he put down 1/2 cup of milk. It needs about 1 and 1/4 cup to be evenly distributed. Other than that, its delicious!

name: The Ultimate Stuffed Potato
review: Made this last night as a side dish for grilled london broil (used the sweet and spicy rub from this site.  There is a bit of work involved, but it all fits in the time it takes to bake a potato anyway!  The sauce though either needs more milk, about double what the recipe calls for (which I did - have a TON of leftover sauce or perhaps less flour, it was too thick with the recipe as written.  I also added some chopped scallions to the butter when making the roux.  With the changes above, everyone loved the potatoes with the mornay, a nice change from plain sour cream if you have the time.  Very filling and could be served alone as a simple supper.

name: The Ultimate Stuffed Potato
review: I prepared the whole meal, potato and the steak. It was out of this world, I had so many compliments on the meal. Best EVER!

name: Sukiyaki
review: This was about twice as sweet as it needed to be, and I didn't even use all the sugar that the recipe called for. Next time, I'm going to omit the sugar while cooking the meat. The sweetness of the sauce before cooking seemed just right. But the rest of the flavors were great.

name: Sukiyaki
review: Very easy to make, and tasted like the real thing. GREAT!

name: Sukiyaki
review: This was an excellent, elegant and easy recipe.  I couldn't find yam noodles so I substituted bean threads.  Instead of celery and Napa cabbage (which I couldn't find I used baby Bok Choy.  My husband loved this, but next time I will double the sauce since the bean threads absorbed so much of the liquid. Definitely a keeper!

name: The Ultimate Breakfast
review: For those who say "this recipe can't be correct because it yields so much gravy" Come on people, use common sense. DUH. Don't use all the gravy! Save the rest of it for something else! It's so delicious that you want to make more sandwiches! ; This recipe was great. I think anyone would understand not to use a gallon of gravy on two sandwiches.

name: The Ultimate Breakfast
review: AWESOME

name: The Ultimate Breakfast
review: this recipe can't be correct --- I tried!  5 cups of water and 7 cups of milk... that is a lot of liquid.... i would suggest trying tablespoons...

name: Pulled Pork Sandwiches with Homemade BBQ Sauce
review: Delicious, My teens especially loved the BBQ Sauce. They had the left over sauce all week with every dish.  I had to cook a little longer than indicated, but never the less very good dish.

name: Pulled Pork Sandwiches with Homemade BBQ Sauce
review: Haven't made the pulled pork part of this recipe, but this is the only bbq sauce recipe I use for my pork ribs, which I cook in the slow cooker.  I find that before I put the sauce in the slow cooker it is on the vinegary side, but after it's been in there for a few hours with the ribs it is pure perfection.  It's not like store-bought bbq sauce which is super thick and overly sweet, and that's what I love about it!  It really enhances the flavor of the pork rather than overtaking it.  I recommend this sauce to everyone!

name: Pulled Pork Sandwiches with Homemade BBQ Sauce
review: I just had to comment. Made this recipe yesterday for a Superbowl gathering (along with Tyler Forence's cole slaw and Paula Deen's blue cheese potato salad and all I can say is WOW! Fairly easy to make. I wasn't sure about the sauce while making it because the smell (and taste of vinegar seemed strong but mixed with the pork-it was crazy good and had a nice kick. Along with a ice cold beer it was perfection.

name: Free-Form Fruit Tart
review: Very easy to follow directions and very tasty dessert.  Maybe if people would fully read the directions before making rude comments, they would enjoy this as well. I've also tried it with strawberries, kiwi and raspberries. Yummy!!

name: Free-Form Fruit Tart
review: Do you edit these receipes? You include the ingredient list but no directions, for the pastry cream?

name: Arugula, Toasted Walnut and Roasted Pear Salad with Red Wine/Shallot Vinaigrette
review: I didn't even roast the pears (because my pears were already very ripe but the salad was delicious. I added some goat cheese on top. The dressing seems very very simple but is surprisingly delicious and unique. I'll be using this dressing recipe on all sorts of salads.

name: Arugula, Toasted Walnut and Roasted Pear Salad with Red Wine/Shallot Vinaigrette
review: Tasty & simple to make

name: Arugula, Toasted Walnut and Roasted Pear Salad with Red Wine/Shallot Vinaigrette
review: you can get by with much less oil for this recipe - my arugula ended up almost soggily soaked, and that was with cutting the oil down some already. Flavor wise - things were great! I would agree that dried cranberries would be a nice addition.

name: Garlicky Broccolini
review: This was really easy and really good.  Nothing more to say.

name: Garlicky Broccolini
review: I got broccolini in my veggie box this week and had no idea what to do with it.  Fortunately my box also had garlic bulbs.  So I made this recipe, it was very quick to make and it tasted so much better than regular broccoli or plain kale.  Thanks for having this recipe available!

name: Garlicky Broccolini
review: I made it with regular broccoli, because I already had some in my refrigerator, but it was really easy to make.  Altho, I added a little butter and lots of salt, and I thought it tasted a lot better than just regular steamed broccoli with butter and salt.

name: Corned Beef and Cabbage
review: 300 proved to be way too high, totally high boil of meat shriveled it down to a cannonball.

name: Corned Beef and Cabbage
review: My family was skeptical.  Why change a good thing?  Well...they loved it.  The best ever!  They wished I had used a larger brisket so there were more leftovers.  I did use carrots and an onion.  And, the horseradish sauce was awesome.  Thank you for my new method to make this dish.

name: Corned Beef and Cabbage
review: I made this for an early St. Patrick's Day celebration.  It was the best Corned Beef and cabbage dinner that I have ever made.  Usually the corned beef is stringy  and the veggies are mushy, but not this time.  Everybody raved about it !  I ran right out and bought 2 more packages of corned beef to have at a later time because it was so good.

name: Vegetable Stew (Giambotta)
review: When my garden begins producing in the summer, I always make this dish.  We (hubby and I love it.  I increase the broth a bit and serve it over brown rice.  So yummy!

name: Vegetable Stew (Giambotta)
review: Very satisfying, healthy, and delicious!  I substituted butternut squash for the potato (threw it in around the same time as the eggplant, and I also added some dried thyme, oregano, and crushed red pepper as the vegetables were cooking.  I served it along side some seared boneless, skinless chicken breasts.

name: Vegetable Stew (Giambotta)
review: I've been making this for the past four years and it's delicious! It also freezes very well. I add turkey kielbasa occasionally to satisfy the meat eaters

name: Mahi Mahi Tacos
review: This recipe is tremendous, with a couple changes.  Instead of paprika, I used pure ground chile and smoked paprika, and a little cayenne, no chile flakes.  The ground chile powder provided enough heat.  Also, I served this with Green Olive/Cilantro Salsa from "The Well-filled Tortilla" cookbook, lettuce and sour cream.  In a word -- Killer.  And the soy sauce is very important to create a full flavor profile, but you brush it on, not bathe the fillets in it.

name: Mahi Mahi Tacos
review: I just got done tasting the fish tacos and  they are very very salty and spicy. It's funny, cause the recipe didnt call for much salt, it was probably cause I soaked the fish in the soy sauce with the spice rub on it before refridgorating it for an hour before grilling, : but all in all the tacos turned out well, I browned a 12 " tortilla, put some thinly sliced romaine lettuce, then the seasoned fish then the pico de gallo and topped it with some thinly grated cheddar cheese and sour cream. Lol , it was so salty I had to add lots of sour cream. I  assumed the recipe  and all of its ingredients and amounts were right...... which was deadly wrong, I will taste as I go next time around.

name: Mahi Mahi Tacos
review: I also used smoked paprika as a rub. However the smoked paprika is hard to keep lit.

name: Carrot Cake
review: This recipe was amazing. Super moist and fluffy...it was gone in one night. LOVE THIS CARROT CAKE!!! Will be making this for Easter dinner.

name: Carrot Cake
review: First time I tried it today. Whole Family Love It! Excellent & Moist!!! Will make this recipe again this weekend!

name: Apple Cider Donut
review: i am going to chang it next time. I will use more cider and apple

name: Apple Cider Donut
review: We used all white flour.  Flavor was okay but Canola Oil?  Whole wheat flour?  We eat lots of healthy stuff and don't need "healthy" to spill over into donuts.  A very disappointing recipe!  And this is the only one the Food Network could provide?  tsk!

name: Apple Cider Donut
review: As the previously noted comment indicated,we too were hoping for the donuts we remembered from the orchard where we used to live in New York. This recipe does not have the apple taste we are looking for.In fact,little apple taste at all.Would not make them again

name: Gingerbread Cake
review: This cake was horrible. It was too dry, crumbly, and tasted bad.

name: Gingerbread Cake
review: The recipe is okay. I wouldn't make it again.

name: Gingerbread Cake
review: made this twice over the holidays...best tasting gingerbread ever, BUT both times it fell in the middle...very odd. been baking for eons and never had a cake fall before...any thoughts?

name: Vegetarian Chili with Black Beans and Peppers Sweet and Hot
review: I made this last night when I was short of time and it was delicious! I added a couple of small chili peppers to spice it up. Easy and nutritious all in one go

name: Vegetarian Chili with Black Beans and Peppers Sweet and Hot
review: It was too chunky with the peppers and not spicy enough.

name: Vegetarian Chili with Black Beans and Peppers Sweet and Hot
review: The chili is great and it lasts for days.

name: Marinated Mushroom and Arugula Salad
review: This is a great salad!  For presentation sake, add the mushroom mixture right before serving and toss tableside otherwise, the mushrooms sink to the bottom.  Do splurge on the Manchego cheese - it's well worth it!

name: Marinated Mushroom and Arugula Salad
review: This is amazing !!!! great side with pasta

name: Marinated Mushroom and Arugula Salad
review: Overall the recipe was good but has too much salt! My fault, I doubled the recipe and added 3tsp. without tasting.

name: Vegetable Stir-Fry
review: I used no tofu and no egg plant. I used coconut oil instead sesame oil. It was great!

name: Vegetable Stir-Fry
review: I modified the ingredient list to use the vegetables I had on hand, so no squash, eggplant, sprouts, tofu, or broccoli. I did add carrots. I also just kind of used the ingredients and cooking time as a guide, so I didn't really measure. The flavor of this stirfry is fantastic. Next time I'll add meat. Thanks for a great recipe!

name: Vegetable Stir-Fry
review: Very good! Add some peanuts for extra crunch, and use peanut oil instead of the canola...it's better for you.

name: Brown Rice Crispy Bar
review: These are a great change from the boring rice krispy treat of childhood. I was advised by the health food store to not use flax seed oil because it tends to go rancid too fast.  So I substitued with grapeseed oil that I had on hand.  I also was unable to find puffed brown rice so I used Kashi Honey Puffs which provided even more fiber and more levels of taste. Wonderful bars!

name: Brown Rice Crispy Bar
review: This rating is from my 11 yo daughter who gives it a 4.5 star. It probably would have been a 5 had we any flax seed oil. We didn't and we couldn't get the marshmallows to melt all the way. No problem; it still bound the puffs together with clumps of marshmallow. She is not a big fan of dried fruit but we found cranberries infused with Pomegranate juice (her favorite fruit and it gave it a nice burst of flavor.

name: Brown Rice Crispy Bar
review: Good Thing! Hope not the last one!

name: Saga Wagyu Sukiyaki
review: Absolutely loved this. Tastes just as good as what i've had at Japanese restaurants (and better than some. It really is easy to make too. I like to have a sauce made with a raw egg mixed with sukiyaki sauce to dip everything in. I also add sliced onions and arabiki sausage inside!

name: Saga Wagyu Sukiyaki
review: I loved it but then I love all his recipes he's awsome ..

name: Saga Wagyu Sukiyaki
review: Loved this sukiyaki recipe! I didn't have wagyu beef but substituted it for tenderloin. I also doubled up on the sauce adding 1/4 C more on the sake (to give it a boost because my family loves the extra sauce for the rice! Thanks for the great recipe.

name: Fried Catfish Po Boy
review: Wonderful and so easy! Make sure to add the salt after frying - it makes all the difference!!

name: Fried Catfish Po Boy
review: This is a great recipe with lots of flavor!  Instead of frying the catfish, I rubbed them with cajun seasoning and pan fried (to lessen the calories, but followed every other step to the T.  Many compliments from my husband - the slaw and the garlicky bread and the catfish go so well together.  Make it, you will not be disappointed.

name: Fried Catfish Po Boy
review: This is a good variation on traditional fried catfish. A nice summer meal. My husband makes the coleslaw while I concentrate on frying the fish.  The pickles add a nice crunchy texture.  We have made this several times now and alternate between French and Italian bread - both are good.

name: Sauteed Chicken Breast with Artichokes and Peppers
review: Just had my first bite! Delish!!! Easy to make and great flavor!

name: Sauteed Chicken Breast with Artichokes and Peppers
review: This was a great recipe!  I didn't have Vermouth, so I used Marsala cooking wine, which was really good.  The sauce was delicious and we ate it over rice, which made it!  The only thing I would change, is I would cook the chicken differently.  Sauteing it on each side and then putting it in the oven to finish it off, made it very dry.  I think I would cook it slowly in the sauce.  I will definitely make this again!

name: Sauteed Chicken Breast with Artichokes and Peppers
review: Wow. This was so good. My husband said he had to keep swallowing - he was salivating so much :-. I used chardonnay instead of vermouth, but yes, delicious :- Served with a romaine salad and pasta.

name: Turkey and Stuffing Egg Rolls
review: These were a HUGE hit in our house. I have raved about this recipe to friends and family since I first made them.

name: Turkey and Stuffing Egg Rolls
review: I have told everyone I know about this recipe. It has become a tradition in our home since I saw the show two years ago. I am a fan of jellied cranberry sauce so I put in the egg rolls. Assembly consists of just pulling out leftover bowls and placing turkey,stuffing and cranberry sauce in wrapper.  Heat up left over gravy and dip away! We are actually more excited for egg rolls than the actual dinner. Way to go Aaron!

name: Turkey and Stuffing Egg Rolls
review: wonderful, wonderful oh how wonderful.

name: Italian Mini Meat Loaves with Mac and Three Cheeses
review: i loved everything i made it this week for my parents and boyfriend my parents liked it alot i loved the meatloaf and my boyfriend said it was the best mac and cheese he ever had.

name: Italian Mini Meat Loaves with Mac and Three Cheeses
review: I made the meatloaf twice, once using it with ground sirloin and then again with just ground chuck.  I liked the chuck better than the sirloin, and I really liked the meatloaf recipe.  It was very tasty.

name: Italian Mini Meat Loaves with Mac and Three Cheeses
review: Very good and very tasty, followed everything as is and they came out amazing. This is a keeper. Thanks Rachel

name: Roast Pork Loin with Apples
review: I don't want to lose this recipe, its great

name: Roast Pork Loin with Apples
review: Fantastic!  I used 4 pork loins and forgot the mustard.., but it was delicious.

name: Roast Pork Loin with Apples
review: As my late father would say, "Bryan, this meat is superb." I cooked this to 160 internal temperature and the meat was still moist and juicy... and the flavors, man, oh man, was this ever good. It goes into my favorite recipes book.

name: Lamb Curry
review: I was initially looking for an Indian recipe for Beef so I came upon this one though it calls for lamb.  I made it with beef stew meat and it turned out great.

name: Bananas Foster
review: Recipe easy to follow.  I didnt add any liquor and first times making creeps, final results easy and delicious, I will make again

name: Slimmed Down - Bison Patty Melt
review: Read reviews about patty being dry. Added 1 1/2 tablespoons of Barbecue sauce to meat before cooking.  Turned out great moist and added another flavor not over powering just a hint of the Barbecue sauce.

name: Slimmed Down - Bison Patty Melt
review: I actually started putting Worcester sauce and/or steak sauce in my caramelized onions on my own before seeing this recipe so I knew that part would be good.  I followed the directions almost to the T and it was a little dry.  Not the meat because I cooked it medium/medium-well but the whole sandwich was just a little dry.  It needed some sort of condiment or maybe just more sauce in the onions.  It could also be to the fact that I used the thick Worcester sauce instead of the regular one too.  I ate it as is though because I am watching my calorie intake.  I used sugar free Nature's Own whole grain bread and Sargento reduced fat Swiss and all the flavors worked really well together.  Overall I would definitely make this again.  Maybe next time just use the regular sauce and not the thick one.

name: Slimmed Down - Bison Patty Melt
review: Okay, I added homemade russian dressing with a bit of horseradish so they weren't so slimmed down. Very good and so easy in the winter on the stovetop. Serve with a warm cabbage slaw with bacon.

name: Mini Lasagnas with Sweet Corn and Mascarpone
review: Unfortunately, this was a disaster for me. I made it in an 8" pan as done in the Weeknights cookbook. The cream compoents bubbled up and oozed over the top of the lasagna noodles and it never did brown. It never got firm either and was way too soupy. I didn't deviate from any of the ingredients, so not sure what happened. It did taste very good, however, I later felt that the richness of all of the cream ingredients was too much.

name: Mini Lasagnas with Sweet Corn and Mascarpone
review: I made this lasagna after watching the special on the reception for Kate and William.  This was very tasty and I will be making it again.   It had an elegant feel, a smoothness and sweetness that was delicious  Everyone who tried it, loved it.  I did use fat-free half and half instead of cream and it made no difference, still delicious.   I will try some of the other suggestions for lowering the calories and fat that some of the reviewers mentioned.

name: Mini Lasagnas with Sweet Corn and Mascarpone
review: i make this lasagna frequently. its a wonderful vegetarian dish, very unique. i make it as a "normal" lasagna, its just easier for me that way. the only way i deviate from the recipe is to sometimes use whole grain pasta, and i also put a little jarred alfredo sauce on the bottom of the lasagna pan to keep the dish from sticking. definately a fave!

name: Indian Ice Cream with Pistachios: Pista Kulfi
review: Awesome recipe, please bring more Indian desserts like Jalebi, Kaju Barfi, Badam (Almond Halwa, Kheer, etc. Thanks!

name: Indian Ice Cream with Pistachios: Pista Kulfi
review: I can't find the recipe on here, but Sandra Lee has a much better one. If I remember correctly (and even if I don't, I know this is great you do the following: take a half gallon of good vanilla ice cream and let it soften at room temp or make fresh homemade vanilla ice cream and add these ingredients: 1 tsp ginger, 1 tsp ground cardamon, 1 tsp cinnamon, 1/4 tsp powdered clove, 1/4 tsp freah ground black pepper (trust me, you must add it or it isn't as good. Then add 1/2 cup shelled and smashed pistachio nuts. Mix it up good and refreeze or if you made home made ice cream add all this at the end (last 5 min. You and your friends will love it. I call it "exotic ice cream," so I can serve it with any dish. They always say I gave them too much, but then they eat it all! Yummy.

name: Indian Ice Cream with Pistachios: Pista Kulfi
review: this receipe is very simple and no fancy ingredients required. as an indian i always love kulfi and this receipe is great.

name: Pad Thai with Chicken and Shrimp
review: TrIple de sauce, add 2 eggs and will make it awesome

name: Pad Thai with Chicken and Shrimp
review: Flavors were good.  NOT ENOUGH SAUCE!!! Double or triple it.

name: Pad Thai with Chicken and Shrimp
review: I've had a lot of pad thai's and I have to say this is one of my favorites. I, like other reviews said, doubled the sauce, depending on much you're making you may even have to triple it. I loved the sauce and I cooked the noodles and added a bunch of ingredients that I had around the house baby corn, water chestnuts, and bamboo shoots to the wok. In my opinion the garlic, ginger, and brown sugar could be left out if you don't have on hand. Everyone I made it for loved it and will definitely be making it again!

name: Chocolate Cocoa-Buttermilk Cake
review: Delicious cake but the topping never thickened up for me -- it just reduced. The sugary pecans were good but I was looking for a sauce. Served it whipped cream and it was good, but the topping was a disappointment.

name: Chocolate Cocoa-Buttermilk Cake
review: I only had 1 1/4 cups brown sugar.  I went ahead with the cake, but I was unable to make the topping.  Instead, I topped it with homemade whipped cream and fresh strawberries, and it was wonderful!!!  Also, I used an 8x8 pan, and my cake was perfectly cooked in 50 minutes.  I will definitely make this again, and I can't wait to try the recommended topping.  It seems like it would be equally good with a raspberry or orange glaze-type sauce or even a liquidy, warm chocolate sauce

name: Chocolate Cocoa-Buttermilk Cake
review: I googled chocolate, buttermilk, and molasses because those were the ingredients I had on hand.  and wow! this cake recipe appeared.  I've made it twice, the first time "as directed", but it's dull, it just needed something extra.  So this time I added coarsely chopped walnuts and sugar as a topping while it baked.  I also baked it as a cake, not a loaf in a 14 x 9 pan.  it came out great in the time allowed. It's like a dense, dark chocolate cake.  I recommend it, it 's much better than a cake mix!

name: Pear and Almond Crostata
review: I want to make this. I know it'll come out rather well. And just watching Brain make it, is so simple. I just need to know is there a substitute for the almond paste? I and a few members of my family are allergic to this nut.

name: Pear and Almond Crostata
