review: Made the whole meal plan and it all came out great!! Couldn't believe it was so simple after watching Brian do it.  I hadn't ever used almond paste. What a great secret way to whip up a quick tart that tastes like it was hard to make.  Loved all of it!!

name: Pear and Almond Crostata
review: I printed out the recipe the day I saw the show, but never had reason to make it until now.  I made it for a very small dinner party last night and it was FABULOUS!  The top browned before the bottom cooked fully, so next time I might cover the edges with foil so that the bottom can finish cooking without burning the top.  I made a half-recipe as there were only 4 of us, and the almond paste was $10/tube (the original recipe called for 2 tubes.  I think that even making 4 of them out of one tube they were too big.  We ended up cutting them in half and serving half to each guest (which was fine, because now I have leftovers.  I'd say maybe 6 would be the perfect amount for 1 tube, though you could go as small as 8 of them if you just want a sweet nibble.  I did eat part of the leftovers for breakfast today (don't judge - it is fruit and almonds and cream cheese - probably better than any donut ; and I must say that it was not nearly as good the 2nd day (taste was great, but it was soggy.  They are fabulous right out of the over though.  I pre-rolled out the paste and whipped up the filling before the guests arrived and left it all in the frige...then once we had cleared the dinner dishes I assembled them and had them in the over in less than 5 minutes.

name: Caldo de Res: Spanish Beef Soup
review: This is a fantastic soup and this recipe deserves top marks for being clear, easy and so amenable. Made mine with yuca/cassava instead of potatoes. Most beef cuts with the bone in work just fine, I've had it with shank in the past, but used beef plate short ribs/soup cuts and it was delicious.

name: Caldo de Res: Spanish Beef Soup
review: this is all perfect ingredients...only thing I modified, are the times...I am Mexican and have eaten this many times so I know how soft this should be....simmering the meat...about 2.5 hrs....40 minutes after you add the vegetables...then about 20 minutes more after adding the cabbage.....this is how I make it, it is one of many ways....it is a perfect "puchero" or "caldo de res" or "beef soup"...different names, same thing!....times all depend in how fast you get the meat and vegetables really soft but not mushy...

name: Caldo de Res: Spanish Beef Soup
review: Tasty? VERY GOOD! but some modifications i made...i used small red potatoes, added garbanzo beans, and served with a side of mexican rice. (my grandma is from mexico and she served it this way but this recipe is GREAT!

name: Creme Anglaise Ice Cream
review: This recipe is fabulous, easy to make. Prepare it during the  morning, set it aside to cool for an hour and enjoyed  a delicious dessert at lunch.

name: Creme Anglaise Ice Cream
review: This recipe is fantastic, so easy. I make the custard the day before I am ready to make the ice cream. Set it aside to cool, then refrigerate over night. This is the only homemade ice cream my husband has liked. Also it has no cream in it, I used whole milk. I also put an orange liquer in it. Today I am going to put baileys in. Wish me luck!!!!

name: Creme Anglaise Ice Cream
review: This ice cream is so good.  Creamy, rich and very vanilla.  I also steeped the vanilla bean husk in the milk before adding it to the egg yolks ande then added it to my sugar canister.   I also used whole milk.  I will definitely make this again.

name: French Omelet
review: For the first time I know how to make an omelet :

name: French Omelet
review: Do you know were to get eggs and chease omelt for breakfest.

name: French Omelet
review: OMG i luv the recipie i am goin to make it for christmas morning

name: Crispy Crunchy Fish and Chips
review: My whole family LOVED this recipe!!! and they're picky eaters

name: Crispy Crunchy Fish and Chips
review: I've been dying to find a recipe for a crispy batter and this one is AMAZING! I seasoned my fish w/ a little old bay and it was perfect. LOVE

name: Crispy Crunchy Fish and Chips
review: Love frying fish with this batter.  The batter also works well when making onion rings!!

name: Cioppino
review: Amazing flavor! I added a lobster, scallops and linguica and it was better than at most upscale restaurants.  Kudos to Giada!

name: Cioppino
review: I'm giving this a well-deserved five stars.  It was excellent.  I used shrimp, scallops and tilapia while doubling up on the fennel and shallots.  Fantastic.

name: Cioppino
review: This is the best Cioppino I have ever had.  It is very easy to make.

name: Skordalia (Greek Potato and Garlic Dip)
review: food says

name: Skordalia (Greek Potato and Garlic Dip)
review: The person who said too much salt and anyone reading this recipe... it it only a generous pinch of salt going into the recipe (controlled by the pincher.  The T and t of salt goes into the water for boiling.  This looks good, I will try it out.

name: Skordalia (Greek Potato and Garlic Dip)
review: When I lived in Washington there was a place called Zorba's Cafe that was a Greek dine-in/carry out place. They had the best skordalia in the world and I'd never been able to duplicate it.... until now. I used 4 red potatoes (all I had and an entire head of garlic (about 16 cloves in all that I pureed in the food processor with some course salt and olive oil to make a paste. I whipped my potatoes (after boiling them threw in the garlic paste, 1/2 cup of olive oil, and 1/3 cup of RICE WINE vinegar. This stuff packs an amazing punch! Alot of other recipes also use the almonds but I prefer it without them. Maybe as a garnish on top if you're using the skordalia on a crudites platter. Garlic lovers will really like it and it will give your a taste of what Zorba's offered and were famous for.

name: Braised Napa Cabbage with Bacon, Red Wine Vinegar, and Mint
review: So delicious - I substituted apple cider vinegar and left out the mint. I removed the cover and cooked for an extra 20-25 mins to concentrate the broth. Killer with pork tenderloin & potatoes of your choice.

name: Braised Napa Cabbage with Bacon, Red Wine Vinegar, and Mint
review: I would give this dish 5 stars on taste.  I'm giving it 4 stars because I prefer to make a faster version in a pan (without giving up the flavor.  I heated the ingredients in a pan, brought to a quick boil, covered and steamed for 10-15 minutes.  I stirred in the crispy bacon pieces during service.  I left out the mint because I didn't have it on-hand.

name: Braised Napa Cabbage with Bacon, Red Wine Vinegar, and Mint
review: Just made this and the vinegar about knocked me out!!!  Way too much.  I don't think I'll make this again.

name: Porcupine Balls
review: instant favorite!

name: Porcupine Balls
review: Love these!!! Sister-in-Law fixed them for us one night and the whole family fell in love!

name: Porcupine Balls
review: This was great - Hubby liked it so much he wants it again tomorrow - SHOCKING - He is a picky eater so that was great to hear.

name: Shrimp on the Barbie
review: This was easy and awesome?Everyone loved it. I want to try adding a little black and red peppers... not so much for heat but for lip-smacking goodness.  DO IT!

name: Shrimp on the Barbie
review: Wow, this is one of THE BEST shrimp recipes I ever made.  Everyone loves it!

name: Shrimp on the Barbie
review: This is an awesome marinade. I used it on some vegetables I grilled at the same time and they were tasty as well. Be sure to overcook the shrimp.

name: Keftedes: Greek Meatballs
review: I agree with Sharpio. Bland. Terribly bland. Tasted like balls of oniony meat. I added what I thought was plenty of salt and pepper along with the added seasoning (I even added a bit more than recommended, but next time, I'll take this recipe well in hand and triple the amount of mint and oregano. Tough thing about meatballs is just that you don't realize what else the receipe needed until you're all done and then it's too late. Maybe even go a little further East with it and add some Garam Masala. Made these for a party and they were very ho hum. Nothing inspiring or delicious.

name: Keftedes: Greek Meatballs
review: I used ground turkey instead of beef.  After the meatballs were cooked through, I removed them from the pan and deglazed with white wine.  I added butter, a smashed clove of garlic, and a lot of lemon.  I returned the meatballs to the pan and finished in the sauce.  I served with pita, tzatziki and an Armenian-style cabbage salad.  My eaters raved!  The meatballs were incredibly moist and tender (do not overmix the meat when you are adding ingredients.  This is a fantastic recipe and something I personally could eat at least once a week.  My 10 year old brought it to school for lunch (I packed the bread, meatballs, tzatziki, and salad separately so she could assemble it herself and it wouldn't be soggy.

name: Keftedes: Greek Meatballs
review: very disappointed!  This recipe fails on many levels.....first off it makes about 20 - 25 meatballs.   It's wasteful and time consuming to roll, flour and cook all that unless it's for a party or a family of ten.   The recipe also has too much milk (or not enough bread which makes the balls too soggy and mealy.  This recipe should also tell you how much salt should go in, if you get it wrong the meatballs taste incredibly bland.  also, this recipe needs 3 times as much oregano and mint. With 2 lbs of beef, the herbs don't stand out.     Definitely don't make this recipe, it's time consuming and tasteless.

name: Baked Ham with Brown Sugar Mustard Glaze
review: Terrific glaze. Kept spooning it up over the ham as it cooked, mixed with the drippings. I had steamed carrots, and it was delicious on the carrots as well. Will make it for carrot even when I don't cook ham. Thanks

name: Baked Ham with Brown Sugar Mustard Glaze
review: Excellent....family devoured the ham! A definite KEEPER!

name: Baked Ham with Brown Sugar Mustard Glaze
review: Cant keep everyone off of this ham, yummy!

name: Sopapillas
review: Outstanding!  Absolutely outstanding!

name: Sopapillas
review: My friends and I had a mexican night, one our friends made this dessert. It was the best mexican dessert I have had by far. It's addicting very good with a good cup of coffee.

name: Sopapillas
review: Excellent!! Super esay!!

name: Bouillabaisse
review: Absolutely sensational!  Omitted the lobster.  Also, small whole fresh Mediterranean fish were not available to me!  Used sea bass and halibut instead with excellent results.

name: Bouillabaisse
review: Comfort food without the heaviness. Easy and great to serve in a beautiful pot on the table!  Added extra saffron (expensive stuff but worth it!  Served twice to guests and twice there was nothing left in the pot - not one bit!

name: Bouillabaisse
review: this was absolutely wonderful, it was alot like ciopino.  fantastic!!!

name: Beef Tenderloin with 2 Sauces: Horseradish Sauce and Creole Mustard Dressing
review: I didn't make the beef this time, just the horseradish sauce, but it was perfect.  Not overpowering and just the right heat.  I also added about 2 teaspoons of the beef juices with it.  I would highly recommend this recipe.

name: Beef Tenderloin with 2 Sauces: Horseradish Sauce and Creole Mustard Dressing
review: THIS MUSTARD SAUCE MADE A BEER COOKED CORNED BEEF MEAL THAT MUCH MORE TASTIER. I SEARCHED FOR A MUSTARD SAUCE TO EAT WITH OUR TRADITIONAL ST. PATS DINNER AND THIS ONE WAS THE BEST. SMOOTH NOT TOO STRONG TASTE BUT EASY TO MAKE AND DELICATE FLAVORS ON THE TASTE BUDS. THANKS TO THE GENIUS BEHIND THE DESIGN! ITS BASICALLY A HOMEMADE MAYO MUSTARD DRESSING BUT BETTER THAN YOU WOULD EXPECT.

name: Beef Tenderloin with 2 Sauces: Horseradish Sauce and Creole Mustard Dressing
review: I made this, using a larger tenderloin roast, about four pounds, and it was simple and the perfect dish for a casual party. Alton Brown had a similar recipe, and I used his suggestions for technique, and the seasonings from this recipe.  I only made the horseradish sauce.  Thin slices of meat on a platter, with the salad greens, some small tomatoes sliced, and others whole, for garnish, and some shavings of the cheese made a beautiful presentation.

name: Silence of the Leg O' Lamb
review: Excellent.  We had it tonight for the first time. We Had a 9lb Leg of Lamb and although the cooking time was longer, the flavor was amazing.  Try this recipe.

name: Silence of the Leg O' Lamb
review: We have used Alton's recipe numerous times for dinner parties.  This is ALWAYS a hit!

name: Silence of the Leg O' Lamb
review: Amazing and easy.  Followed the marinade, but put in a ziplock overnight.  Did not tie it up and baked till 150 degrees.  Holy smokes!

name: Curried Cashews
review: Better make two batches of these....they went in no time.....and they hold well in an airtight container........Enjoy!!

name: Edamame (Cooked Fresh Soybeans)
review: Delicious and easy - tastes exactly like the edamame in sushi restaurants.  Not sure WHY you have to salt and rub and let sit for 15 minutes, but I did that and was well rewarded with a steaming, tasty bowl of fresh edamame.

name: Edamame (Cooked Fresh Soybeans)
review: These truly are a wonderful snack.  You still have to watch portions, but as was mentioned - having to peel each bean does slow down the mindless munching.

name: Edamame (Cooked Fresh Soybeans)
review: Personal opinion ... it is a joy to have established chefs present a "how to" cook something...not a recipe but a single ingredient.  Julia Child, Jacque Pepin and Ina (Barefoot Contessa in the Hamptons, NY have always included such teaching.  Specifically, this suggested method for edamame...fine for beans in the pods.Also tried it for the frozen edamame beans from grocery store.  Same success.

name: Tennessee Banana-Black Walnut Cake with Caramel Frosting
review: Before the show was even over my husband was checking to see if we had all the ingredients we (I would need to make this cake--soo0 yummy and the frosting is out of this world! It turned out just a bit dry but we had some ice cream with it so it didn't matter. I think I used a bit too much flour. We'll be sharing with family and neighbors since it's just the 2 of us now. Jane C., Iowa

name: Tennessee Banana-Black Walnut Cake with Caramel Frosting
review: I didn't make the cake either, just the frosting.  The frosting was soooo delicious!  I topped it on chocolate cupcakes and no one could get enough of it!  Easy to make and delish!

name: Tennessee Banana-Black Walnut Cake with Caramel Frosting
review: I made this cake using regular walnuts.  We all loved it.  It is a little crumbly.  We heat it a few seconds in the microwave and it's delicious

name: Emeril's Cold Noodle Salad
review: After reading the reviews and those for Guy Fieri's Dang Cold Asian Noodle Salad I decided to combine the two recipes in one for the dressing. So I basically doubled the overall dressing and added 2 gloves of raw minced garlic and 1 teaspoon Dijon mustard so that when I immersion blended it the dressing would emulsify. Much better with both dressings combined - Emeril's lacked vinegar and was a bit too sweet. Guy's lacked sweetness and was a bit too vinegary. Best of both worlds when combined.

name: Emeril's Cold Noodle Salad
review: Delicious.  Easy.  Added some fresh basil as well.

name: Emeril's Cold Noodle Salad
review: I made this several times.  Easy recipe.  I used regular dry pasta.  Thin long pasta seems to be the best.  Used light soy sauce, honey, sesame oil & cilantro only.  Omitted other ingredients.

name: Grilled Hearts of Romaine
review: Loved it!  My husband was feeling adventurous so he made this.  We had some ceasar dressing on the side, but it wasn't necessary.  We will def make this many times.

name: Grilled Hearts of Romaine
review: This is such a great and easy side dish!  I sprinkled parmesan cheese on top when it was done to add a hint of the ceasar salad flavor that we all associate with romaine lettuce!  Was delicious and will definitely cook it again!

name: Grilled Hearts of Romaine
review: This was not great, in fact the lettuce came out wilted and bland. Kind of gross.

name: Menudo
review: TRADITIONAL MENUDO DOES NOT TAKE POSOLE IN IT. TRY IT WITH MENUDO ONLY AND A FEW BEEF FEET. NO CHILI POWDER  IT BITTERS THE FLAVOR . USE FRESH CHILI PASTE ,LOTS OF GARLIC AND ONIONS IN THE POT . SERVE AND TOP WITH DICED ONIONS , JALAPENO AND PINCH OF GROUND OREGANO . AND SOME TORTILLAS DE NIXTAMAL.    OH SO GOOD !!!

name: Menudo
review: Very Easy! It was very Very VERY! Good... my husband loved it, and the kids couldn't get enough! Thank You Food Network...

name: Menudo
review: @Dorado90...tripe is the lining of the stomach...Perhaps you're getting tripe confused with tripas?

name: Lemon Blueberry Cheesecake Bars
review: Made it gluten-free with crushed corn chex instead of graham crackers. It was a hit with my gluten sensitive relatives. I used frozen blueberries and tossed them with 1 Tbl. tapioca flour put on crust before adding cheese filling. Great, not too sweet.

name: Lemon Blueberry Cheesecake Bars
review: Made this for Memorial Day and have made it several times since, because everyone LOVES it!  I've made it with just the blueberries, a combination of blueberries and raspberries, and even with strawberries (reduced the lemon juice and added vanilla.  If I'm short on time, I just pour the batter into a packaged graham cracker crust and bake it like a cheesecake.  Delicious EVERY time!

name: Lemon Blueberry Cheesecake Bars
review: Love this recipe. I make it in a springform pan and turns out just as good. Always a summer favorite and definitie crowd pleaser.

name: Sauteed Broccoli
review: Loved this broccoli! So flavorful and so easy to do! I will definitely be making this again and again!

name: Sauteed Broccoli
review: This dish was and flavorful. i liked it. i wonder if i could use this for asparagus. I love Love Love asparagus Yum!

name: Sauteed Broccoli
review: This is by far my favorite way to eat Broccoli. Easy to make with minimal ingredients.

name: Sweet Potato (Yam) Pie
review: Found this to be a little bland.

name: Sweet Potato (Yam) Pie
review: I am not a sweet potato/yam fan so I was skeptical of how it might taste but once I tasted it I thought this was so close to pumpkin pie (which is my favorite that it blew me away. Easy pie to put together. I did have to cook it a little longer than 45 minutes, but the instructions mentioned extra time may be needed.

name: Sweet Potato (Yam) Pie
review: That pie ios wonderful! I served it for Christmas and my family went wild for it

name: Smoked Pork Loin with Rasberry Chipotle Glaze
review: Perfect balance between the sweetness of the Raspberry Jam and the smokey bite of the Chipotle Tabasco sauce.  Used seedless Black Raspberry Jam to provide a distinct color contract between the black glaze and the white pork tenderloin.  Also, used our grill instead of a smoker, total prep. time was less than an hour.

name: Smoked Pork Loin with Rasberry Chipotle Glaze
review: I served this at Easter dinner and it was a smash hit!  If you like the sweetness and flavor of raspberry, and the mild-to-moderate spicyness of the rub, you'll love this recipe (younger and older kids thought it NOT too spicy.  I used mesquite wood chips in my basic smoker - the mesquite paired nicely with the recipe, but I think I'll try wood chunks next time instead of chips.

name: Pan Seared Chilean Sea Bass, Roasted Baby Corn, and Colorful Pepper Infused Broth
review: Go hug a tree moron.

name: Pan Seared Chilean Sea Bass, Roasted Baby Corn, and Colorful Pepper Infused Broth
review: I'd give this zero stars if I could. Chilean sea bass, really? Way to promote rampantly unsustainable fishing, Food Network. Also, enjoy your mercury and PCBs.

name: Pan Seared Chilean Sea Bass, Roasted Baby Corn, and Colorful Pepper Infused Broth
review: I love this recipe.  It's easy and the flavor is simply amazing.  I'll be making this in future for sure.

name: Shrimp Puffs
review: Simple dish, easy to make.  I've made these puffs so many times since last summer that I've got it down to a science. I don't care for mayo so I only use about a quarter cup, substituting sour cream for the rest.  I experimented with different canned biscuits but found them all too doughy and too difficult to work with, used frozen puff pastry sheets instead, perfect!. Used pepper jack cheese for a little heat and whatever shrimp I have on hand (I never have baby shrimp in the house, baked them in a mini muffin pan that makes 24 at a time.  I think my family inhales them they disappear so fast.

name: Shrimp Puffs
review: Mistake the people that find this recipe boring is not using Pepperjack cheese!  I know the recipe just says Monteray Jack, but Pepperjack (Monteray Jack with jalapeno peppers gives it that zing that you need!  Tons of compliments!

name: Shrimp Puffs
review: Had them at a friend's house and they were delish. Would be easy to alter with cooked chicken and thyme, ham and swiss, etc instead of shrimp and dill.

name: Mozzarella, Cherry Tomato and Basil Skewers
review: I made these as an appetizer for a garden party last week.  They were gone in a flash!  many compliments on presentation and taste.  I left the mozzarella in the marinade for about 4 hours.  I made extra  marinade and drizzled it over the skewers after plating.  I folded the basil and used it as a separator between the mozzarella and cherry tomatoes which i repeated twice on each skewer.

name: Mozzarella, Cherry Tomato and Basil Skewers
review: I made these for some firends and everyone enjoyed them more than I did.  The skewers were refreshing but lacking in flavor.  I would have liked some balsamic to give it more of a kick.  I was worried the basil would be overwheliming just wrapped around the mozzarella, but it wasn't.

name: Mozzarella, Cherry Tomato and Basil Skewers
review: this was a really easy and great entertaining idea.

name: Curried Chicken Wraps
review: Great recipe, but I made a few changes. I substituted 1 cup of mayo with plain greek yogurt (saves about 2000 calories, and used craisins instead of raisins. I also topped the chicken/dressing mixture with the cashews as I wrapped them, which prevented them from getting soft and lost in the mixture. Ate the leftovers the next day, on a slice of toasted wheat bread. An excellent meal that I'll be making again soon.

name: Curried Chicken Wraps
review: This recipe is always a hit in my house.  Wonderful flavors.  I never change a thing; I never need to.

name: Curried Chicken Wraps
review: I did this today and truth be told that it was absolutely delicious.  But I substituted a couple of things...instead of a cup and a half of mayo, I put one cup and added cilantro and instead of the chutney I used a Haas Avocado and the richness that the avocado added was devine.  I have to say that this is the first time that I make a recipe that I saw on t.v.  Thank You Ina...

name: Spaghetti with Eggplant, Butternut Squash and Shrimp
review: Our CSA box contained butternut squash and eggplant this week so I found this recipe so I could use both in one meal. Most of Giada's recipes are fantastic, but for us, this one was a dud.  The ingredients just did not work together, it was bland, and the textures were unappealing.  The leftovers were practically inedible.  I fished out the shrimp so that at least they weren't wasted.

name: Spaghetti with Eggplant, Butternut Squash and Shrimp
review: On a scale of 1-10 we vote 0. nuf said.

name: Spaghetti with Eggplant, Butternut Squash and Shrimp
review: This was so tasty!  We halved the shrimp and doubled the garlic.  We also cooked the squash about 5 minutes longer than the eggplant.  Since we made it for Halloween, we used black pasta instead to get the black/orange contrast. Finally, we topped it off with red pepper flakes and Parmesan. Delicious!

name: Peach Sorbet
review: Turned out really tasty. I had a lot of trouble peeling the peaches using this method, and ended up just peeling them with a knife. I also added a splash of bourbon, because I think a little alcohol in sorbet helps with the consistency, and also peaches and bourbon are delicious together. It was a little on the sweet side for me, so I'll just add a little less simply syrup next time.

name: Peach Sorbet
review: Fabulous! So simple and so easy and so delicious. I will always keep a pint of this in my freezer.

name: Peach Sorbet
review: Very good. Instead of fiddling around with an ice cream maker, I just poured the mixture into popsicle molds. They came out great! You can easily half the simple syrup recipe and still have enough for the recipe and some leftover. Not sure why the quantity is so large if you only need a cup and a half for the recipe.

name: Better Than Grannie's Creamed Corn
review: This is the best creamed corn ever! It's summer so the fresh corn is awesome anyway but adding the fresh rosemary and turmeric puts this over the top!

name: Better Than Grannie's Creamed Corn
review: Best creamed corn EVER! Used farm fresh corn...it was fabulous. We make it every year at Thanksgiving with frozen corn from the farm. Thanks Alton!

name: Better Than Grannie's Creamed Corn
review: By far the best creamed corn I ever had. It's an esay recipe for anyone to do. Give it a few minutes to hang out before you jump into it. Give it time to cool off. All the flavors will come together.   It is so good you may feel like bathing in it.

name: Brussel Sprout Salad
review: Not the bitter brussel sprouts you have had before.  Very savory and NOT bitter!!!

name: Brussel Sprout Salad
review: Cutting a medium egg, or even an extra large egg into 16 segments, now that's a challenge!

name: Brussel Sprout Salad
review: I actually had this same salad at another restaurant then found this recipe and made it.  It's a great dish.  The first time I made it, the ratio of onion to brussels sprouts was too much so I adjusted that.

name: Vidalia Onion Pie
review: For what this comment may be worth to a reader...

name: Vidalia Onion Pie
review: I made this when I first saw it years ago after the airing of the pie contest.  Just made it again for the first time in a while, and hey wow!..just delicious.  I bake it without a crust to make it a little lighter calorie.  Just oil or spray a pie dish and pour the filling in.  Proceed with the filling and bake times as written, just skip the crust.  Makes a great side dish..or chop up some ham or smoked sausage to add in and make a meal.  Add your favorite spices or mix-ins to make it your own.

name: Vidalia Onion Pie
review: I made this pie about three years ago and my whole family loved it. I misplaced the recipe and have since run across it in my recipe fiiles and I thought that I would make it again. It was as good as I remembered and just as easy as I remembered. I would though recommend making the pie crust yourself only because I am not a fan of the refrigerated kind. The crust is really easy when prepared in a food processor.

name: Mini Beef Wellingtons
review: I made this last night and it was delicious! The beef tenderloin was very pricey though.

name: Mini Beef Wellingtons
review: Delicious, easy, and fun to make.  I agree with others, just don't overcook the meat and you will be fine.  Ours was tender, not overcooked.  I cooked my cubed beef for only a minute on each side.  Also, keep an eye on the pastry in the oven; ours cooked in less than 20 minutes.  I used Filet Mignon instead of beef tenderloin, which is cheaper and still tender.  I also added bacon, which I think dramatically enhanced the flavor.  I put the bacon in, then mushrooms, then shallots in that order.  With the leftover meat sauce, I created a sauce that was delicious!  This also goes really well with mustard.  I served mine with a side of broccoli and cold sliced tomatoes.  I might recreate this dish with chicken and peppers.  Its really easy.  I also got rave reviews.  I had my sister-in-law package up the pastry dough while my fiance` prepared the broccoli, I sliced tomatoes, and cleaned up dishes.  Group effort!

name: Mini Beef Wellingtons
review: Brilliant!!  I want to make these anytime just, well, because!!! I've made the traditional and it is so time consuming and a bit difficult to predict the internal temperature of a whole tenderloin - this way is sooo much better!

name: Homemade Bagels
review: Just made the first batch, but used bread flour instead of AP. Thanks for an easy recipe.

name: Homemade Bagels
review: Ever since I moved thousands of miles away from New York, I have been looking for real, dense, chewy bagels, but where I live now people seem to prefer their bagels soft and light.  I finally decided to try making some at home, and now I can't believe I didn't try it sooner!  I didn't follow the recipe quite exactly, which makes me hesitate to review it, but my changes were so minor I can't take any credit for the awesome result--it's all Emeril!  I used part bread flour and part brown sugar, I rested the dough 20 minutes before kneading, and I kneaded a lot longer than 5 minutes; I wanted that dense, chewy texture.  I didn't use the cornmeal or flip the bagels during cooking, and 20-25 minutes was the longest any of these stayed in the oven.  Next time I'd add just a little more salt, but these are already GREAT bagels--just what I've been searching and searching for!  Amazing!

name: Homemade Bagels
review: bagels are chewy excellent and easier than i thought - thank you Emeril!! will make these many times in the future!!

name: Frozen Pineapple Cream Pie
review: Not supposed to fold in the egg whites.  Save those for another day.  You are supposed to fold in the whipped cream.

name: Frozen Pineapple Cream Pie
review: This is another nice, easy Paula recipe.  A great cold dessert for the summer.  I've made it several times, and I prefer more pineapple than just one can.  I use 1-1/2 cans of pineapple chunks canned in juice, rather than syrup.  Paula's desserts tend to be a little sweet for me, so I don't add any sugar to the pineapple--only to the whipped cream.  Don't forget that this pie needs to spend a good bit of time in the freezer before you serve it.  It will then have the consistency of an ice cream pie.

name: Frozen Pineapple Cream Pie
review: We saw this recipe a few weeks ago, and I finally made it last night. It was wonderful! Unlike some other reviewers, I had no problem with it being runny. The pineapple mixture isn't supposed to thicken up a lot on it's own. I froze it for only 2 hours because we couldn't wait any longer, and it was just right. Firm, and a little softer in the middle, like ice cream that's mellowed a bit. We had the leftovers tonight, and it was fully frozen. Very good, but I think I liked it better a little softer. It seemed to bring out the flavor a little more.

name: Double Fudge Cake with Chocolate Buttercream Frosting
review: The cake was delicious.  Texture was like a box cake but with wonderful flavor.  I did use 1 !/2 Cups of Buttermilk.  Also used my favorite chocolate cream cheese frosting.  This will be my go-to cake !  I may try it as a layer cake also.

name: Double Fudge Cake with Chocolate Buttercream Frosting
review: Cake was dry, but flavor fabulous. The frosting was great, but needed to cool completely to thicken. Guitard chocolate chips made the flavor rich and creamy.

name: Double Fudge Cake with Chocolate Buttercream Frosting
review: This frosting was absolutely terrible.  It never got thick enough to use.  I decided to use powdered sugar to thicken it, but I needed to use so much of it the frosting became too sweet.  It was horrible and I will never use it again.  Ina really needs to edit this.

name: Biscuits with Milk Gravy
review: I made this recipe exactly as it is listed and they turned out beautiful.  I prefer a lighter biscuit, so I may increase the baking powder a bit next time.  I cooked them on a heavy sheet pan and they turned out nice. I may try the iron skillet next time, but I didn't want the bottom to burn the first time. Gravy was so wonderful and easy.  I did have to incease the buttermilk to about 1 1/3 cups in order to get the mix to be wet enough to roll out.

name: Biscuits with Milk Gravy
review: Very tasty!  A heavy, good southern style buttermilk biscuit.  I made as recipe directed but had only salted butter and used it with no problem.  I accidentally rolled out too thin so I doubled up my cut biscuits and they turned out great!  15 minutes is perfect cook time.  Thank you Paula for another yummy recipe.  Try em ya'll...very easy to make.  Husband stated "very good, honey!"

name: Biscuits with Milk Gravy
review: I made the biscuits with out buttermilk, but with fat free milk a bit of cream and lemon juice.  I topped them with honey-butter.  That we're tender, but a little dry.

name: Rich Chocolate Cake With a New York Attitude
review: I have not made this cake I plan to but not yet I am going to give it a 5 star rating because I dont want to ruin its rep but those of you who are complaining about the time it took to bake the cake you have to remember that each oven is different. Michelle could have been using a brand new oven where as others could be using the oven thats been in there home for 15 years so the times will vary its a fact of life

name: Rich Chocolate Cake With a New York Attitude
review: This cake was delicious!  I made it for a surprise birthday party and everyone loved it!  This is a large recipe, so if you're not making it for a large group I would suggest cutting the portions in half.  I did make the full batch because I had about 18 people to serve and I still had left overs.

name: Rich Chocolate Cake With a New York Attitude
review: I found this cake to be very good and was received well by my family but here are a few words of wisdom:

name: Bubba's Shrimp Gumbo
review: great gumbo..!!  my friends loved it too..thanks

name: Bubba's Shrimp Gumbo
review: This recipe is wonderful! Best Gumbo Ive ever had hands down!!! Everyone loved it and keeps asking me to make it again. So far Ive made it twice and got the same results both times:

name: Bubba's Shrimp Gumbo
review: I followed this recipe to a tee and wasn't happy with the results.  It was a VERY soupy gumbo.  No one wanted seconds.

name: Apple-Nut Muffins with Streusel Topping
review: These were delicious! I made them for a meeting and they were wonderful! I used the sour cream and you couldn't even tell the difference. The only thing is that we are a nut allergy family so yeah I know why make the walnut apple muffins? Cause they are SO easy and yummy! We just replaced the walnuts with more apples in the muffins and had to add more flour to the streusel. Other than that it was great!

name: Apple-Nut Muffins with Streusel Topping
review: Wow! Very easy to make and soooooo good!!

name: Apple-Nut Muffins with Streusel Topping
review: Easy to make, taste great. I made them with sour cream. I will be making these again.

name: English-Style Fish and Chips
review: It was pretty good.  I didn't have any rice floor, so I just used the flour I had.

name: English-Style Fish and Chips
review: Our friends sent us a box of Halibut from Alaska and I remembered watching Tyler make this recipe. His instructions were perfect; each person had a PLATE FULL of fish and chips and every man at the game night said it was the best Fish-n-chips they had ever had. We LOVE the batter.....easy to work with!! Thanks

name: English-Style Fish and Chips
review: We made this recipe and even my picky eating daughter found something to love. She couldn't get enough of the crust! Every bit as good as beer battered fish and chips from the restaurant in my opinion. They were even good the second day reheated, although the crust obviously wasn't crispy, but it was still tasty!! This recipe and the crispy fish tacos from Tyler are my two favorite fish recipes ever! Thanks!!!

name: Tomato Bisque
review: Made this a number of times, it is our staple for holiday meals and always requested! I do not do the last straining called for in the recipe as I do the final blend in a VitaMix which doesn't leave anything to strain. I do like my soup with a little texture anyway. This is an excellent, can't go wrong, recipe. You will like it!

name: Tomato Bisque
review: Absolutely amazing taste. I followed the recipe "as is" except I did not strain the soup after blending AND I added half of a 4 oz can of tomatoe paste.  It tastes exactly like, if not better than, the tomatoe bisque at the hot bar at whole foods! My husband LOVED it and he's a "meat and potatoes" kind of guy.I cook great tasting food all of the time but this recipe made me feel like i'd outdone myself. (not to toot my own horn but... Thanks Food Network!!

name: Tomato Bisque
review: I used this as base for a delicious soup.  I used an entire package of bacon.  Then I boiled three chicken breasts with a carrot, onion, thyme, celery, peppercorns, sea salt and garlic until cooked.  I then shredded the chicken and added it to the soup with some fresh spinach, and frozen veggie tortellini and cooked until the pasta was done.  It worked out very well.

name: Baccala Salad
review: Just like Momma used to make.  The flavors are great and it brings back the feeling way back when we all were at home and my mother would be the only cook and this would be my favorite appetizer.  Easy to make and wonderful taste.  Only issue is it is very hard to find vinegar peppers now so I have to make them myself.

name: Baccala Salad
review: My family would always make baccala every christmas eve.  They would flour and fry it which was great.  This recipe puts bacala In a new light for me, I love the colors and the briney flavor. This will definatley be a new years day favorite for years to come. .

name: Baccala Salad
review: Being italian, this recipe is a staple in our christmas eve "Feast of the seven fish" tradition. This recipe is almost exactly like ours, except we bake the baccala for this salad-the flavor and texture are a bit better (I find boiling the baccala makes it a bit mushy. But you all should try this as a flavor treat-much different than your regular "tuna salad."

name: Chef Rick's Classic French Bread
review: Very easy recipe to make the only ajustments I had to make was to use only 1 teaspoon of salt, and 1/4 cup more of flour. 350 degree oven for about 22 min's very tastey hot and buttered top.

name: Chef Rick's Classic French Bread
review: Tried it for the first time yestrday and it was great and easy to make

name: Chef Rick's Classic French Bread
review: I have made thing recipe twice and will be making it alot!  I cut the pieces into 12 piece. This is the perfect size to make small sandwiches and/or just to put in a nice dish to serve along with a meal. THANKS!!!

name: Emeril's Fried Seafood Platter
review: These were good but taste did get kind of old if eating alot of shrimp.  I guess best for appetizer. I used Tabasco and Texas Pete Hot Sauces.  I found the Tabasco to be more well rounded but both were good.

name: Emeril's Fried Seafood Platter
review: These were good but taste did get kind of old if eating alot of shrimp.  I guess best for appetizer. I used Tabasco and Texas Pete Hot Sauces.  I found the Tabasco to be more well rounded but both were good.

name: Brisket Tacos
review: So flavorful and so simple! I've also prepared this recipe successfully in a Crockpot.

name: Brisket Tacos
review: I love brisket when it is tender and not chewy, as it can sometimes be. I followed the directions, but heeded the advice to keep checking and adding more liquid. I used a 5 lb brisket and ended up using an entire bottle of wine, 1/2 a can of beef broth and probably about 3 cups of water by the time it was finished cooking. It took about 7.5 hours to cook. The brisket was mouth wateringly tender and just pulled apart, as it should be.

name: Brisket Tacos
review: These were amazing!!! They were tender and juicy. However I did use flour tortillas since my family really doesnt care to much for corn ones

name: Jalapeno Corn Muffins
review: it's easy to make and taste sooooo good.

name: Jalapeno Corn Muffins
review: This corn muffins where so boring> texture was ok but they had no taste at all.

name: Jalapeno Corn Muffins
review: Everybody loved the muffins. I was scared to try it at first. But following the recipe made it so easy. The corn and jalepenos go togther so well. Mt ten year old niece loved them and couldn't get enough.

name: Callaloo
review: This might be a fair recipe, but it is not the correct way.  The dasheen leaves and the stems are used.  The dasheen, pumpkin, okras, crab, pig tails, salt, bandanya (cilantro, celery, chives and black pepper are placed in a pot and boiled in the coconut milk a habanero pepper is placed whole into this pot.  It is swizzled when cooked or placed in a food processor.  It can be said that callaloo is our national dish, which is also one of the most popular sunday lunch, along with stemed rice, baked chicken, and macaroni pie all Trini style of course.

name: Callaloo
review: After all ingredients have been simmered and softened, after the heat is turned off, all ingredients are swizzled together. I suppose you can blend it, but it really doesn't look the same. I don't know if this is the 'big secret' but you absolutely must include a green habanero pepper. It sits in the pot, boiling with the other ingredients, and is removed before the swizzling. Also, it should be noted that salted pig tails are used.

name: Callaloo
review: What was your point when you stated secret ingredients? Dont you think other people would want to make their dish just as good as yours?

name: Three Cheese Stuffed Eggplant
review: Sounds like it has potential but where is the rest of the recipe?

name: Three Cheese Stuffed Eggplant
review: Where are the directions for this recipe????  Only the ingredients are listed.  I wanted to make this tonight, but I guess not :(  I see it's not my computer or the page; others have posted the same comments, so, when will you post the rest of the recipe?????

name: Three Cheese Stuffed Eggplant
review: all ingredents are there but what do you do with them?

name: Butternut Squash and Pear Soup
review: Made this yesterday for the first time.  Roasted the butternut squash with olive oil salt & pepper, and added grated fresh ginger.  It was SO completely yummy, and made a huge batch. I never would have thought the combination of ingredients would be as good as they were, and I was pleasantly suprised!  Already emailed the recipe to my mom & sister.  You won't be disappointed!

name: Butternut Squash and Pear Soup
review: The flavor of this soup is excellent, plus it is quick and easy to make.  I used precut squash from the produce section to save some time and omitted the cream to save some calories.  We did not miss the cream at all, the soup is good enough on it's own.  One thing I would change next time is to use less broth as the soup was a little thin (maybe the cream would have helped that, but I really doubt it would have been enough.

name: Butternut Squash and Pear Soup
review: Butternut squash is supposed to be savory... That was however offset by the sweetness of the pears (I used Bartlett pears and the rosemary did nothing to help the flavor. I have a potful of soup I'm debating on serving or throwing away....

name: Rabbit Stew
review: Yep!!! This one worked! The whole family loved it … and the neighbors even wandered over because they could smell it. I do have a confession, though. I didn't have enough red wine, but I had a bottle of reisling opened. It was fantastic!!! I will be doing this one again and again! Thanks Robert!

name: Rabbit Stew
review: As a young girl my job was to help with the harvest of our rabbits we raised year round in Illinois,and I can't say I liked rabbit meat at all.My family prepared it pretty tastelessly and in similar ways so I thought this recipe was going to be another disappointment.Well Was I Wrong.This is delicious and luscious with a velvety texture,the aroma filled my house with Love.Thanks Chef Irvine you renewed my faith in rabbit forever.!!

name: Rabbit Stew
review: Made it last night!  It was unique, rich and flavorful!  Great recipe!!!!

name: Steamed Vegetables with Ginger Miso Dressing
review: I can't think of many veggie recipes where I go back for seconds, but definitely did with this one!  My husband doesn't like cauliflower or asparagus so I omitted those and just used broccoli, carrots, fennel, and yellow squash as the main veggies.  I was a little afraid to use 8 cloves of garlic, so I only used 4, and used 1/2 a bunch of scallions.  I always use a ginger grater so it comes out really fine. Will definitely be making this dish again and again!

name: Steamed Vegetables with Ginger Miso Dressing
review: Hubby and I liked this very much, nice and tangy.  Recommend using a small grate for the ginger, mine was too big and left long ginger strips (depends on your preference, really.  Could use this sauce on other dishes - a keeper.

name: Steamed Vegetables with Ginger Miso Dressing
review: My partner wasn't thrilled about an all-vegetable dish but tasting it changed his mind.  We love the sauce, which would be fabulous on any stir fry or steamed veggie combo.

name: Chicken Pot Pie
review: Quick,Easy and Very Good!

name: Chicken Pot Pie
review: It was good. I actually made mini pot pies using ramekins and they came out really cute and much more fun than regular big pot pie.

name: Chicken Pot Pie
review: I LOVE this recipe. However, I omited the tomatos and the corn, but added more vegetables and seasonigs. The prep and cook time were longer than suggested. BOY, its worth the wait. This chicken pot pie is GREAT.  My family and friends love it.  Its a great way to make sure the kids and everyone else is eating vegetables.  Thanks Robin I love this show.

name: Pigeon Pea Rice (Arroz de Gandules)
review: We loved this, although I did add a couple of different spices, smoked paprika and ground allspice. Other changes, used red bell pepper instead of green. This was the first time I had tried cooking the dried pigeon peas and they turned out great. The best thing was the wonderful warm, spicy aroma coming from the kitchen. I will definitely make this again.

name: Pigeon Pea Rice (Arroz de Gandules)
review: I had to tweak the recipe a bit because I had every ingredient on hand except the pigeon peas.  I did it all on the stove top without the peas and at the end tossed in frozen baby Lima beans from the freezer and it was a fine substitute.  I'm fast becoming a fan of Tyler Florence and his food.

name: Pigeon Pea Rice (Arroz de Gandules)
review: I thought this rice was WONDERFUL.  The second time I made it, I made one half of the oil.  I put in in the microwave (pyrex measuring cup for one minute with the seeds in it and it heated it plenty to extract the seed flavor.  Saved a little time. The whole meal was really good.

name: Baked Ziti
review: Simple but satisfying. A crowd pleaser.

name: Baked Ziti
review: Ziti was a Christmas Eve tradition when I was growing up and I wanted to carry it on to my family.  I made this recipe for the first time today (Christmas Eve and it was so good and so easy!  I actually bought marinara from a local Italian market (it was their homemade sauce and it was delicious.  I made it in the AM and baked it tonight.  Served with fresh bread and a salad - perfect!  I will definitely be making it again!  It was a big hit with everyone!

name: Baked Ziti
review: I've made this recipe many many times. And making it again tonight! It's my go to for when I want to please a crowd. I love it, friends love it and its easy to do.. and it's even easier if you substitiute the sauce of two jars of store bought sauce. One thing that I like to add to spice it up is a pound of hot italian sausage, for my family the sausage completes it!

name: Sweet Potato Pie
review: This recipe was very easy to follow, easy to do and very yummy!!! I served it at Thanksgiving dinner amoung other things and EVERYONE LOVED IT!!! Thank You Emeril!!!

name: Sweet Potato Pie
review: xgfh

name: Sweet Potato Pie
review: Well this is a recipe that scared me because of the crust I was leary. But I should have known that Emeril would not stear me the wrong way. I would have to say that the pecans in the crust is the missing flavor of most Sweet Potato Pies I have had in recent years. It adds a woodsy downhome flavor...It was a really nice touch to a old favorite. Thanks a Million Emeril.

name: Shrimp and Grits
review: This is a good recipe; we made it exactly how the directions said (except bacon instead of sausage. We made it a second time just as good with a lot less hassle. Instant grits with 2% milk, add 1c of cheddar, 1 jalapeno, sautée the shrimp in garlic/white wine/butter, and crumpled the bacon on top. You should try it; just as good but a lot less mess.

name: Shrimp and Grits
review: if it is, it is so delicious!!  i will make this for my family in grand isle LA.  it will be a big hit!  at a local restaurant in thibodaux la (flannagin's i ate the soup of the day.  pumpkin & shrimp.  it was excellent.  it was creamy & delicious.  i would love to have a recipe with emril's take on it!?!?!?!

name: Shrimp and Grits
review: I tried this recipe.  The grits were very good.  The shrimp stock adds lots of flavor; however, I have a couple of ?'s.

name: Turnip Gratin
review: Absolutely, hands down, the most amazing recipe. The flavor that comes from the fresh thyme cooked in the cream is insanely good. The flavor is just phenomenal.

name: Turnip Gratin
review: A friend brought this dish using your recipe to our family Christmas gathering.  it was outstanding.  I picked turnips from our garden today and I'm preparing it for family tonight.  Thanks for a terrific recipe for turnips.  Even the people who "hate' turnips loved it.

name: Turnip Gratin
review: I made this dish for our Christmas dinner. I made two batches, one with turnips and one with potatoes. Both were a five star hit! My elderly aunt actually scraped the sides of the turnip dish! My husband's comment was that watching the food channel is "paying off!"

name: Matzoh Ball Soup
review: To gailmcgraw

name: Matzoh Ball Soup
review: This is the same recipe my mom, grandma, and great-grandma have made for the past 70 years.  It is delicious and true Jewish Chicken Soup.  A staple in my house.

name: Matzoh Ball Soup
review: In the TV show, you put 1/4 cup of chopped parsley in the matzoh balls.

name: Roll and Cut Cookies
review: This recipe makes cookies that are good, but not great. I personally do not care for the flavor that the almond extract imparts. Next time I will use all vanilla and see how they come out.

name: Roll and Cut Cookies
review: These cookies were easy to make and everyone wanted the recipe. They tasted great, were easy to roll out and kept their shape during baking. You won't need another recipe.

name: Roll and Cut Cookies
review: I use coconut oil in place of butter in my baking, and I also substituted a cup of whole wheat flour for one of the six all-purpose ones.  Woof, these cookies are fabulous!!  I used Alton's recipe for royal icing; these are...so very yummy, both plain and iced.

name: Chicken and Peaches
review: Outstanding recipe - the seasonings are perfect, love the slightly sweet and spicy flavors together.  A very special dish - great for tradional chicken suppers on Sunday - family friendly and guest worthy - try it out, you'll love it

name: Plain Brown Popper
review: I used cheap pop corn, light butter (2 tsp, salt and omitted the staple.  The brown lunch bag stayed folded just fine.  Nice fluffy pop corn just like my air popper makes! Probably would use a bit more butter next time.  I am now a big fan of this method! My kids loved it.

name: Plain Brown Popper
review: Love the convenience and of course the price, but......burns too quickly In a little more than a minute and so many unpopped corn.

name: Plain Brown Popper
review: I mixed popcorn, oil and salt in a small bowl, placed in a paperbag folded for 3 minutes. Came out fine except there were still alot of kernals left not popped. Otherwise, it was great!

name: Garlic and Herb Roasted Potatoes
review: My husband and I loved this dish. It is simple to make and it's really delicious. I've made this several times, and our favorite is a mix of russet or yukon gold potatoes, sweet potatoes and butternut squash. We didn't need any of the leftover oil once it was roasted. Also, I'm tempted to try it with garlic powder instead of fresh garlic because a lot of the garlic burns while roasting.

name: Garlic and Herb Roasted Potatoes
review: I love this recipe.  My whole family loves this recipe.  My extended family loves this recipe.  If it didn't make so much, there would not be leftovers.  The potatoes and squash turn out perfectly caramelized and delicious.

name: Garlic and Herb Roasted Potatoes
review: These potatoes were very simple to make and hardly any time at all. I used dried rosemary and the flavor was still great, but I will try using fresh next time! Even my 4 yr old loved these!

name: Mama Lachute's Blackberry Dumplings
review: It is just soooo good, there are no words to describe.

name: Mama Lachute's Blackberry Dumplings
review: This recipe makes a lot of dumplings, so maybe half it if you aren't feeding a crowd.  I tried it with blueberries, and it was only ok.  You really need to use a berry with a strong flavor or it will come out sweet but not flavorful.  I'm doing it with blackberries or raspberries this time around.

name: Mama Lachute's Blackberry Dumplings
review: My friend and I went picking blackberries down the street, and needed to cook them in a sweet treat! This recepie is wonderful, and I have a lot of berries and sauce left over, so I'll use that for a pie!

name: Pineapple Fritters
review: ONLY one forth cup flour...this don't sound right...but I'm going to do it your way...hope I don't make a mess.How do you make a well in one forth cup of flour to add eggs?....rating ?  not sure yet

name: Baked Stuffed Onions
review: If you have a special evening planned, these stuffed onions are so yummy!  They are even better the next day.  Made this recipe with steak, garlic mashed potatoes...so good.  Try it...you will not be sorry!

name: Heirloom Tomato Panzanella
review: I make this recipe all the time and I love it.  I skip the red onion but I put all the rest in. I also don't peel the tomatoes, just take the seeds out so it isn't watery.

name: Heirloom Tomato Panzanella
review: The crutons are the thing that transforms this from being "just another panzanella" salad to a really great panzanella salad!  Delicious twist in this recipe by treatment of the bread turned into crutons.  And the crutons are great made all by themselves to serve as "nibbles" along with wine.  (In which case you'll want to cut the crutons just a bit larger.  I've found we prefer the crutons made with something like baguette with the crust left on. (With apologies to the remarkable Chef Chiarello for our modification. Also, like another reviewer, as long as you toss and serve this salad and don't let it sit for a long time, we didn't find any detriment to leaving skin on and seeds in the tomatoes either.  'Tis the season right now for an abundance of heirloom tomatoes.  Give this recipe a try with some...it is a yummy salad indeed.  And any season is a god time for the crutons!

name: Heirloom Tomato Panzanella
review: Made this dish 3 times already and it is delicious. The mini heirloom tomatoes from Trader Joes is the best. The seasoning for the crouton are so tasty. However the crouton that get more butter on them may take a few extra minutes to bake!

name: Brownie Cake
review: When you first get this out of oven, it seems undercooked. Perfect after a few hours or the next day! I will never make box brownines again.

name: Brownie Cake
review: delicious!!!!!!

name: Brownie Cake
review: it is wounderful so yummmmmmmy

name: Green Peas with Mint
review: I love peas & wanted to give this a try. It didn't appeal to me & I like mint so I thought it would be great. I did add the juice of half a lemon after trying it w/o and that was better. I think additional black pepper would improve it. It was worth the try though. :

name: Green Peas with Mint
review: I'm not a pea-lover and these were good. The mint adds alot to the finished product. My 18-month-old couldn't get enough. Next time I might squeeze half a lemon in w/ the mint. An easy, quick, hassle-free side dish.

name: Green Peas with Mint
review: We thought the peas tasted a little strange. I am not a mint person so maybe that was part of the issue

name: Toasty Coconut Macaroons
review: Beautiful! I made these and they looked just like the photo in the recipe.  I added cream of tartar just to make sure and I am so proud to give these to my husband. Oh and not only did they look good they were delicious. I dipped the bottoms in dark chocolate and oh so yummy!

name: Toasty Coconut Macaroons
review: Light macaroon more like meringue.  Very easy to make.   I will stick to a more traditional coconut macaroon.

name: Toasty Coconut Macaroons
review: OMG...these are magnificent. Perfect: easy, simple and tasty.  Thanks!

name: Kicked-Up Creole Cassoulet
review: I have made this several times over the years. It is labor  intensive but well worth the results.

name: Kicked-Up Creole Cassoulet
review: something different good for winter time

name: Roasted Vegetable Soup
review: OK, the roasted vegetables were really good as roasted vegetables, but once pureed in to a soup... GROSS!  I was surprised because I enjoyed the vegetables before I pureed them but after... :o( I tasted one spoonful and it promptly all went down the drain,sorry Ina this one is a serious miss.

name: Roasted Vegetable Soup
review: This was so good!  I roasted a large sweet onion with the veggies and used my food processor to blend.  It wasn't a smooth soup; but had lots of texture!  Love it!  Thanks, Ina!

name: Roasted Vegetable Soup
review: The cooking time for roasting the veggies is way off, it took me over an hour to cook them and they were not too big of chunks to begin with. I added Vegetable broth because the chicken broth was just too bland and I needed to add another 2 Cups of broth because it was so thick.. I also added a tsp.of Truffle oil and roasted garlic, it gave this soup a great boost of flavor.

name: Potato Chip Cookies
review: I have made this cookie for gifts the last four years. I like that it is more a traditional shortbread than the recipes with egg.  I've also used toasted pecans or pistachios. You can also dip them in powdered sugar when they're still hot. An alternative to the chocolate sauce is to melt dark chocolate (I prefer the 60% cacao over hot water. While the cookies are on the racks, put two forks "back to back". Dip the tines in the chocolate, then drizzle it across the cookies. It makes a great presentation, with or without the powdered sugar. These can also be rolled into a log and refrigerated. Slice and bake. The texture is a little different when they're refrigerated. I think it's because the chips absorb the moisture the longer they are unbaked.

name: Potato Chip Cookies
review: These yummy little cookies, with their sandy texture and nutty taste, are extremely simple to make.  I wish I'd found this recipe years ago - it beats my former mother-in-law's recipe hands down!

name: Potato Chip Cookies
review: Half an hour from start to finish! So fast and tasty.

name: French Onion Soup
review: The soup came out GREAT. It tastes really good and it's super easy to make too. I used 2.5 lb sweet yellow onions and I cut the rest of the ingredients in half. So basically, I used only 1 quart of chicken broth ,1/4 cups of the alcoholic beverages, and so on... Will make it again!

name: French Onion Soup
review: This soup turned out so much better then I ever could have hoped for.  I also like some other reviewers could not find veal stock, so I used 1 organic beef stock and 1 organic (low sodium vegetable stock.  I also decided not to use sherry and put in a little extra wine and brandy, and followed all other directions exactly.  On top, I put a nice baguette and some Gruyere cheese- the classic for french onion soup, and it was the best I have ever made.  This recipe is easy, and makes so much soup- so invite lots of friends!  I love Ina, and as expected, another recipe of hers has turned out wonderfully!

name: French Onion Soup
review: This is wonderful soup, very balanced in flavors. I too, could not find veal stock. I used an organic beef stock. I made my own bread and used a swiss cheese. Please, don't skimp on the alcohol, use the best flavor. It's true alcohol will burn out with cooking and heat, it then leaves you with either good or bad flavor. Like most soups, it's best the second day. I grate fresh parmesan over the cheese.

name: Sauteed Broccoli Rabe
review: Eh, not terrible, but certainly not very interesting.  There are better things to with Broccoli Rapé.

name: Sauteed Broccoli Rabe
review: I loved it, but my entire family hated it.  It was just too bitter for them, but I couldn't stop eating it!

name: Sauteed Broccoli Rabe
review: First time that I cooked broccoli rabe.  It was really tough (perhaps it was old.

name: Grilled Bartlett Pears A La Mode
review: This recipe is an absolute favorite of mine. The recipe instructions and ingredients are friendly to the novice cook. The result of the recipe was scrumptious: full of flavor! My party particularly enjoyed how the brown sugar caramelized itself on top of the vanilla bean ice cream! I will use this recipe in the future to impress my friends... as a "last minute, spontaneous" dessert hehe.

name: Grilled Bartlett Pears A La Mode
review: I bought bosc pears and thought they might night hold up...but the did! Wonderful dish. Going into the recipe box.

name: Grilled Bartlett Pears A La Mode
review: Quick, Easy and elegant enough to serve for guests.  The flavor is fantastic!

name: Blackened Home-Fried Potatoes from Hell
review: Made this tonight for the first time, I consider myself a moderately experienced cook.  It came out great!  My whole family loved it and asked if I can make this again.  We ate this with a rotisserie'd pork loin roast, the whole meal was delicious.  I highly recommend this recipe as a compliment to just about any meat dish.

name: Blackened Home-Fried Potatoes from Hell
review: These are the best fried potatoes I ever made.  It takes a long time to make, but worth the wait.

name: Blackened Home-Fried Potatoes from Hell
review: I make potatoes mixed with alot of spices quite often. It is very good

name: Chocolate Meringues
review: These were such a delight!  So easy to make too!

name: Chocolate Meringues
review: I have a 7 year old grand daughter who has food sensitivities and is limited to the kinds of sweets she can eat. This recipe was not only easy for me to make and turned out GREAT but it was also her special sweet treat that she is enjoying. Thank you soooo much for this recipe. Grammy Carol

name: Chocolate Meringues
review: These were delicious and super easy to make.  I do not like my meringues too sweet so I am going to try these with a little less sugar next time maybe half a cup.  Overall, my husband ate every last one of these cookies in one sitting!!!

name: Nutella and Banana Sandwiches
review: I <3 this recipe.  Thanks for sharing!

name: Nutella and Banana Sandwiches
review: This is amazing! I think i have made this for breakfast pretty much every day this week! Bobby, you're amazing!

name: Nutella and Banana Sandwiches
review: Deeeeelicious, my daughter and could eat them every night.. Thanks Bobby !

name: Cheeseburger Meatloaf and Sauce
review: I made this recipe last night. I had 3.25 lbs of ground beef. I tripled all of the ingredients. My husband and sons loved it. They all said they will never want regular meatloaf again. Follow the recipe and it will come out perfectly.

name: Cheeseburger Meatloaf and Sauce
review: I love this recipe, I have never made the sauce but the meatloaf is delicious, serve it to company and get great reviews

name: Cheeseburger Meatloaf and Sauce
review: My husband raved!Paula Deen you are a gift to my hungry fam!!We love everything you do just the way you do it.So creative and down home delicous.

name: Chocolate-Covered Cherry Cake
review: Great tasting!!  Easy to make.  I took it to a dinner and it was a big hit they thought I cooked all day!!  Loved it!!

name: Chocolate-Covered Cherry Cake
review: This cake is amazingly delicious and so easy to make ~

name: Chocolate-Covered Cherry Cake
review: Yum!! So easy and delicious!  I made this as a 2-layer cake for Easter frosted with an easy ganache instead of the frosting it called for, with a ring of stemless maraschino cherries around the top.  To make the ganache I just heated a cup of evaporated milk to boiling, poured it over 12 oz semi sweet chocolate chips in a bowl, whisked until smooth, then added 1 t. almond extract.

name: Proper Polenta
review: Can also use cornmeal or coursely ground cornmeal (non-instant polenta, which takes about 45 minutes instead.

name: Proper Polenta
review: My family and I loved this.  We have never tried polenta before this recipe.  Since then we have made it a part of our menu.

name: Proper Polenta
review: A good simple recipe that goes well with all sorts of things. Great with Jamie's Chicken in Milk.

name: The Best Bowl of Oatmeal Ever
review: I never liked oatmeal as a kid but while trying to lose weight I need to try new dishes that are healthy. Well, I got some steel cut oats from Whole Foods, chopped walnuts, heavy whipping cream and golden raisis and boy was this DELICIOUS! I don't like soupy oatmeal but if you add the apple juice I'm sure it makes it even tastier but apple juice has a lot of sugar and isn't necessary to make the recipe delicious. Considering that you ad brown sugar you don't need more sugar by adding apple juice. Add fat free organic milk and it is a little less rich and smoother. But I like my oatmeal firm. Definitely add some chopped walnuts! HOW CAN SOMETHING THIS HEALTHY TASTE THIS GOOD?

name: The Best Bowl of Oatmeal Ever
review: This is delicious!

name: The Best Bowl of Oatmeal Ever
review: I enjoy creating new things,  and this sounds great.  I need to find steel-cut oatmeal first,  but will look around.

name: Lemon Marshmallows
review: This is an excellent recipe..I have a lemon tree in my yard,and,the fresh lemon juice made all the difference. I followed the directions...had no issues whatsoever. Just tangy,sweet,pillowy clouds of deliciousness..A keeper :-.Thanks Emeril!

name: Lemon Marshmallows
review: An easy marshmallow recipe.  I whipped mine for 10-12 minutes and the consistency was excellent.  I used bottled lemon juice and the flavor wasn't quite what I had anticipated.  Fresh juice would have probably made the difference.  These are good with a little white chocolate drizzled over the tops.

name: Lemon Marshmallows
review: I've made marshmallows many, many times and found this to be the biggest mess!!! I followed the recipe to a tee and it stuck to everything except my golden retriever!!! All I needed was Ethel (I Love Lucy to be with me. I couldn't get ANY of it in the prepared pan. It's to bad because it tasted good. I usually will try something twice in case I goofed up the first time but I will never attempt this one again!!!!

name: Apple Cider-Braised Pork Chop Sammy with Apple Slaw
review: Really liked this recipe!  The pork came out tender and moist, and with a good flavor.  I loved the apple slaw as well.  The celery seeds really add something to the slaw, so don't skip them.  I tried to grate my apple using a food processor with a shredding attachment, and that did not work well (it shredded them much too finely, and they turned brown quickly as a result.  I recommend hand shredding them, or possible julienning them, as larger pieces have more crunch and add a nice texture to the sandwich.  Also, I like my pork to be really saucy, and I thought it was nice to also slather a little barbecue sauce on top of the pork.

name: Apple Cider-Braised Pork Chop Sammy with Apple Slaw
review: I have tried three of Jeff's recipes so far and cannot wait to try the rest!!! So far everything has been GREAT! The only problem I have had is my family says I didn't make enough. Next time I will be doubling any recipe he has. Thanks Jeff!!! Me and my family LOVE YOU and your show! Keep the recipes coming, can't wait for the next one.

name: Apple Cider-Braised Pork Chop Sammy with Apple Slaw
review: FIRST, I LOVE THIS MAN.  HE HAS QUITE A PERSONALITY AND HAS A GREAT TWIST ON WORDS. I WANT TO LAUGH ALL THE TIME. THIS RECIPE IS A KILLER AND SO DELICIOUS.  I MUST SAY VERY CREATIVE BESIDES.  I FOLLOWED THE RECIPE AND DID NOT NEED TO ALTER ANYTHING.  THAT A-GO!!!

name: Roast Chicken with Gravy
review: I have been making this chicken recipe for years now and my family still asks for it all the time. I stick to the recipe except for doubling the grave. Yum

name: Roast Chicken with Gravy
review: A big hit in our house.  I cooked a 7lb roasting chicken on my oven's convection roast setting.  It was done in just a few minutes over 2 hours.   Very juicy and flavorful.  I will be making this again soon.

name: Roast Chicken with Gravy
review: I really enjoyed this recipe.  However, I would like to try other recipes as I think this could be a little better.  The chicken came out very moist but, a little bland.

name: Chinese Braised Short Ribs
review: I used a chuck roast instead of short ribs and cooked it covered in the oven for 3 hours.  The liquids cooked down to a rich sauce.  It smelled incredible while cooking! I served it over egg noodles. Delicious!!! Can't wait to cook it again.

name: Chinese Braised Short Ribs
review: I have made this recipe several times.  Everyone who has had them at my table loves them and always asks for the recipe.  I love being able to use my slow cooker to prepare them.  A great Sunday brunch or busy day recipe!

name: Chinese Braised Short Ribs
review: This is one of my go-to slow cooker meals, it is always delicious. I have never put the five-spice powder in so it doesn't taste very asian but it is a very flavorful tomato/onion broth. I sometimes add a little cornstarch at the end to thicken it and serve over mashed potatoes or gnocchi.

name: French Meringue
review: This is very simple and quick resulting in a terrific looking cake!  Most meringue cookies take time to dry in the oven but this approach was much faster.  I made the cake for my father's 80th birthday and everyone commented how they liked the texture of the cookies with the cake.

name: Bunuelos: Fritters
review: I'm Cuban and my grandmother used to make these for me and my brother growing up but only during the holiday season. I made them for the first time and they came out Great! her spirit must have been watching me from heaven.

name: Bunuelos: Fritters
review: I made these buneulos for a fiesta in my daughter's 4th grade Spanish class.  They were not too hard, and they are very tasty.  Instead of making the balls, I rolled the dough out and used a pizza cutter to cut out small squares and rectangles.  Then I put the cinnamon-sugar topping in a brown paper bag and  shook the fried buneulos in the bag (about 2-3 at a time for about 10 seconds.  I will definitely make these again.  I always seem to do well with Emeril's recipes.  Thanks!

name: Bunuelos: Fritters
review: I've learned that Puertorrican food is a mix of different cultures. My grandma used to make me these when I was a kid. I'll definitely do this at home to bring me back to my childhood (I'm feeling kinda old now.  Thanks!

name: Potato Roesti
review: This recipe is great.  First couple of times I made it, I did it in a 10" skillet.  But, I found that my Cuisinart Griddler works even better.  No flipping.  Just put butter on the bottom and spray the top with PAM.  It browns well and cooks in 7 minutes. You can make 2 at a time as well.

name: Potato Roesti
review: I made the roesti recipe, and it was  very good. The only problem was trying to flip them over...I got oily potatoes all over the burners and burned my fingers to boot. I tried with a plate; with a generic lid; with a spatula- it was a mess, but tasty. Maybe next time...did anyone else have  trouble?

name: Potato Roesti
review: It is a good start if you are trying to learn how to make real rosti.

name: Souffle a la Fraise (Strawberry Souffle)
review: I followed this recipe to the tee and the souffle never rose or even cooked.  It came out of the oven looking exactly the way it did when I put it in and I even left it for more than double the time the recipe said.  It was a liquid mess.

name: Grandma Blair's Pecan Caramel Rolls
review: These were very good! I did make a few changes though. I used 1 cup scalded whole milk instead of water. After the milk was scalded I added cold butter and let cool to 110-degrees. I also added 1 teaspoon vanilla to the dough. Based upon another review I doubled the caramel sauce and also doubled the pecans, chopped. For the filling I spread the dough with melted butter and then topped with 1 cup brown sugar mixed with 1 tablespoon cinnamon, leaving 1-inch along the short end bare. I rolled it up from the other short end to make 8 big rolls.

name: Grandma Blair's Pecan Caramel Rolls
review: I'm a pretty good cook, but I'm not great at baking. Dough especially eludes me. But I did this and these rolls turned out fabulous! It was even fun to make the dough, not annoying as I usually find dough to be.

name: Grandma Blair's Pecan Caramel Rolls
review: We love this recipe baked these yummy treats many, many times.  We are cooking some right now for Thanksgiving Day.  It is becoming a tradition.

name: Shrimp and Artichoke Dip
review: i think it was delisious i dont have any complains about this dish was verry good :

name: Shrimp and Artichoke Dip
review: I ever so slightly modified this recipe, and it is fabulous. I adjusted the flour and cream ratio, but the sauce HAS to be fully-cooked or it will taste 'raw' and become watery. An experienced cook knows this about a white sauce. Also, drying the shrimp and veggies really cuts down on any excess moisture. Try it again.......... It's great.

name: Shrimp and Artichoke Dip
review: this recipe is awful and gave me and my family diarrhea.

name: Bangers and Mash
review: This was awesome! Will have to make again!

name: Bangers and Mash
review: Super easy and very tasty!!!!  I also let the sauce reduce into a more gravy-like consistancy.

name: Bangers and Mash
review: My kids liked it. That means it's a keeper

name: Sauteed Asparagus
review: Very easy & tasty!

name: Sauteed Asparagus
review: Best Asparagus Ever! Sage makes it!

name: Pickled Vegetables
review: So quick, simple and flexible. My family loves it w/o the cauliflower, but that's just personal preference. These get devoured in no time. Reminds us of the taco shops in San Diego...mmmmmm! One of our homesick fixes!

name: Pozole Verde
review: Well, for one thing one does not use hominy from a can. Pasole is produced differently and takes about 3 hours to cook by itself.

name: Pozole Verde
review: Yum,yum, yum, in my Tum tum tum LOL  Loved it !!

name: Pozole Verde
review: I gave this recipe a 4 star rating because I had to make adjustments, but it is delicious.  First of all, traditional pozole is made with pork, not chicken.  It is also a lot of work to make such a small batch.  Here are my recommendations:

name: Quick Broiled Flank Steak with Quick Roasted Veggies
review: Great

name: Quick Broiled Flank Steak with Quick Roasted Veggies
review: So Yummy and Easy! I used broccoli, mushrooms and onions because I didn't have the other items. I turned the broiler on them for the last few minutes to get them a little toasty. It turned out great!

name: Quick Broiled Flank Steak with Quick Roasted Veggies
review: Quick, easy and great flavors.

name: Turkey Pot Pie
review: I had 3 cups of turkey and 1 of chicken & wanted to use them up.  I made the recipe, but increased the carrots & celery by 1/2 c each & I added a can of Cream of Chicken low fat soup.  I used puff pastry, as that was what I had, and forgot the peas, unfortunately.  Some green would have been pretty.  But it was very good!  Even my picky granddaughter ate it up.  The underside of the puff pastry stays a bit damp, but the top gets crisp.  I had to cook it nearly an hour to get the crust nicely done.  It was really good!

name: Turkey Pot Pie
review: 5 Star with additions! I added 1 head of broccoli,  the whole can of peas, 1 sweet potato or yam ( the orange one  instead of ordinary potato, and 1 tbsp of poultry seasoning.  I placed it in a 9 x 12 casserole dish, and covered it with the 2 pie crust box mix.  One crust would have been too short. the crust was a big thicker, but in my opinion, just right! Thank you.

name: Turkey Pot Pie
review: A leftover's dream dish!  I had cooked a turkey breast & had a ton left over.  It was perfect for making this dish.  Great Flavor, easy & filling.  Need to add a extra crust because it shrunk during cooking.

name: Flatbread Pizzetta
review: This was a super easy awesome recipe.  I also had to use almost a cup of water.  I did not use rosemary, as I am not a big fan.  I also did not use tomato sauce.  I topped them with olive oil, fresh grated parm cheese, tomatoes, fresh basil and mozzarella. Delicious!

name: Flatbread Pizzetta
review: I love this recipe, I just made it last night with the only exception being I used 1 tablespoon of oregano and 2 tablespoons of dried chopped onions and 2 tablespoons of olive oil as well as the other ingredients. It is so easy, I didn't refridgerate it for 30 minutes either just made it rolled it out and baked it. My picky 6 year old twins loved it. I love it! Thank you Robert! I love this show!

name: Flatbread Pizzetta
review: Used almost a cup of water. Easy to do and we like to use all kinds of toppings.

name: Easy Chicken Pot Pie
review: I'm going to try this recipe this weekend, craving some comfort food and a homemade chicken pot pie sounds delicious! :

name: Easy Chicken Pot Pie
review: This was a hit for my family.  I enjoyed it too but wasn't crazy about the tomatoes, probably because I'm so used to eating chicken pot pies from Banquet that don't contain tomatoes.   I also added an extra pie crust for the bottom and placed it in the casserole dish before I added everything else.  My hubby LOOOOVED it and that's all that matters.  Thanks Robin!!

name: Easy Chicken Pot Pie
review: Like Susan from Pembroke said, I wish I'd read the comments also about pre-cooking the veggies. And I wished I'd read over the directions slowly instead of quickly.

name: Bucatini All'Amatriciana
review: This recipe is fantastic!  We found the guanciale at Whole Foods in Los Angeles, on sale for $15.99 a pound.  Amazing flavor!!

name: Bucatini All'Amatriciana
review: i replaced the guanciale with a thick cut bacon , super easy and delicious !!

name: Bucatini All'Amatriciana
