review: I have fixed this chicken broth several times since downloading in December 2009.  I freeze it and use it with other recipes.  Made a beef and vegetable soup with this broth. My significiant other has falling in love with me all over again.

name: Homemade Chicken Broth
review: Thanks for the great recipe. I will admit though, very labor intensive. The finished product is well worth the effort. It made 18 cups. I will have a-lot of broth to use for later.

name: Gigi's Carrot Cake
review: This Carrot Cake Recipe came out great and very moist! The only addition I made to it was that I added 1 cup of raisins.

name: Gigi's Carrot Cake
review: was the best carrot cake ever tasted made it and brought ot to work many of them are men they wanted the recipe to make it WOW

name: Gigi's Carrot Cake
review: This is the most requested cake I make for special occasions.  Yes, it's *loaded* with butter and calories and is a bit time consuming to make.  However, I've never had any trouble with this cake turning out anything but fabulous.  I do line the cake pan (as I do with all cakes...why take a chance your creation will be ruined leaving the pan? and I only frost between the layers and top.  It's easier and looks lovely!

name: Verdura Mista
review: grilling, even indoors, is the most fabulous way to cook. i served this along with crab cakes that came from my grocers freezer. what a cool meal for a hot day. thanks again jamie.

name: Cherry, Almond and Cinnamon Granola
review: Thank You. I have been looking for a granola like this for a long time.  It's wonderful and even my husband likes it.  It's the best I think, I've ever had.

name: Cherry, Almond and Cinnamon Granola
review: This is my first review!!!! OMG!! This recipe is awesome. Bumped into this by accident and thank you so much. The reviews below are spot on. Do not cook over 325 and make sure you toss and turn the granola every 5-10mins. Put the fruit and the coconut at the last 5 mins. I put too much honey and would recommend keeping it a 1/3 unless you have a real sweet tooth. It really came out great and if it was not for the reviews below I would have burnt my first batch.

name: Cherry, Almond and Cinnamon Granola
review: Easy, the whole family loved it, easy to make gluten free!

name: Homemade Baked Beans
review: AWESOME111

name: Homemade Baked Beans
review: OK recipe.  Not great.  Way too much liquid in the end product.  IMHO, the best baked beans recipe I've ever tried is on this website.  It's called French Canadian Baked Beans and uses maple syrup instead of molasses as the sweetener.  DELISH!!!

name: Homemade Baked Beans
review: these were very easy to make and have a wonderful flavor,  however I thought that there was at least twice the amount of liquid there should be.  I will add another bag of beans to the recipe or halve the amount of chicken stock next time i make these. Overall a winner!

name: Honey-Butter Baked Chicken with Mashed Sweet Potatoes
review: This was a very easy and tasty recipe. I made this before soccer practice and came back and all there was to do was heat it up. The ingredients are simple but combined taste wonderful. I left off a star because although my family loved the sweet potatoes, i thought they were a bit too sweet. But overall, great recipe and i would recommend it!

name: Honey-Butter Baked Chicken with Mashed Sweet Potatoes
review: Looking for a new way to bake chicken, this turned out to be perfect. The combined flavors from the chicken, sweet potatoes, and leftover chicken juice drizzled on top was simply delicious. Although my kids are not fans of sweet potatoes, my husband and I enjoyed. Thanks Emeril!!

name: Honey-Butter Baked Chicken with Mashed Sweet Potatoes
review: This was my first ever roast chicken and I'm so pleased with the results.  I brined my chicken overnight and I think that helped to make it even juicier.  The glaze was delicious and I wouldn't change a thing. For the sweet potatoes I ended up just mixing in the pan drippings (no butter, cream, or syrup and it was quite tasty.

name: Shoo-Fly Pie
review: I made this today and it is another winner by Alton.  The only thing I can figure from the negative reviews is that they did not measure by weight the flour, brown sugar, and molasses.  To pfinney the 2nd pie pan could be used in the blind baking of the crust if you don't have anything to weigh it down with you can set the 2nd pie pan inside the first to keep it from puffing up.

name: Shoo-Fly Pie
review: I want to meke this pie but am confused as to where the 2nd pie pan fits it?

name: Shoo-Fly Pie
review: The flavor was ok, but the texture was not good at all.  This is my first ever shoo-fly pie, so it may not be the recipe.  It could be that I dont like this pie.

name: Louisiana Crab Cakes with Corn Relish
review: This is a fantastic recipe, I have made this multiple times for the other people at my fire station and for my family, and each time I hear how much they enjoy these cakes.  I have been told by people that eat crab cakes often that these are better than those they find in many seafood eateries.  I figure that if they guys at the station like them, they must be good!

name: Louisiana Crab Cakes with Corn Relish
review: This dish was absolutely fantastic and well worth the time.  Recipe says prep time is 25 minutes - not likely when making the essence, creole mayo and special corn relish  AND cracking a pound of fresh West Coast dungeness crab.  It was a ton of work but sooooo worth it.  I paired it with a simple Caesar salad (homemade dressing and loved the combo.  I made the cakes slightly bigger than recommended (I got 15 from the recipe and served 3/person as a meal portion.  I only used 2/3 of the mayo too, so I'm looking forward to adding it to a sandwich to give it a little kick.  Delicious!

name: Louisiana Crab Cakes with Corn Relish
review: I recently had this dish as an appetizer at Emeril's resturant NOLA in the French Quarter.

name: My-oh-Mahi! That's a Good Fish Taco
review: We are si addicted to this recipe in our house. It also works great with tuna.

name: My-oh-Mahi! That's a Good Fish Taco
review: I only made the mahi mahi portion of the recipe, but it was AMAZING. It is one of the best fish tacos I have ever made.  Even my 2 year old liked the way the fish tasted.  Definitely will be adding it to my repertoire.

name: My-oh-Mahi! That's a Good Fish Taco
review: I usually like Rachel's recipes, but this one was way too sweet. The heat balance was nice, but for me, fish taco's should be savory-spicy. not sweet-spicy. Her margarita fish taco is much better.

name: Danish Dough
review: This is an excellent and relatively easy dough to make. I used cream cheese filling topped with huckleberries. Delish!

name: Danish Dough
review: This is by far the best homemade pastry I have ever had or tasted!  It was alot of work but sooooo worth it.  I truly felt like I was in heaven when I took my first bite.  I divided the dough in half and made 2 small rectangles on a cookie sheet.  Rolled it out, leaving a crust like pizza and spreading cream cheese and jelly in the middle.  So incredibly yummy!

name: Danish Dough
review: Just did this dough it's PERFECT.

name: Chicken Kiev
review: I followed the directions to the T but for some reason I feel that my oil was way to hot on the intial batch.  I used a thermometer, let the oil get to 375 degrees F.  The oil was smoking but dropped the Chicken in anyway.  The Panko BC immediately went from light to dark within seconds.  Not sure why this happened.  Maybe the thermometer was not working properly.  Anyone have any ideas?  All in all all 4 pieces were great anyways.  Thanks AB

name: Chicken Kiev
review: Gave this only 4* because of the tarragon, which I really don't care for; I used savory instead and added some fresh garlic.  Very good!!  Note to the person who said it needed ham & swiss:  There's a huge difference between Chicken KIEV and Chicken CORDON BLEU; hope you don't make Cordon Bleu with the Kiev butter mass!! LOL

name: Chicken Kiev
review: Amazing. My kitchen is a wreck from preparing this dish but it was well worth it. My family scarfed it down and wished for more!

name: Homemade Dinner Rolls
review: I have made lots of homemade breads, but this one tops the charts! I chopped fresh rosemary and sprinkled it all over the top after I buttered them, and my wife and kids (me too destroyed these! After punching the dough down I rolled them into golf ball sized balls, put a little space between them and I let them rise and bake in my large cast iron skillet, and they turned out better than perfect! LOL! I am going to use this recipe for homemade hamburger buns next time! This is a must try, even for rookie bread makers!!!

name: Homemade Dinner Rolls
review: I thought these rolls were great even if the recipe got the timing wrong.  1 hour not 1 minute and total time about 2 hours.  The rolls were soft and excellent.  I cooked them in my convection oven at 350.  We dipped them in prime rib soup but my 6 year old ate them plain and said they were good.

name: Homemade Dinner Rolls
review: These rolls are simply terrific. They are sweet, but not overly sweet. The perfect dinner roll recipe. I made these and let the dough rise, baked half the dough and froze the rest. They were great both ways.

name: Wild Rice Salad
review: OMG this is over the top delicious and I will make it again. We ate it with smoked salmon that my husband made on the charcoal grill. 1 1/2 cups of oil is way too much unless you cook 2 cups of rice. I used 1 can of 6oz artichokes non marinated, more grape tomatoes cut in 4ths, orange pepper instead of green, and thawed frozen peas instead of canned. It had so much flavor and tasted so fresh.

name: Wild Rice Salad
review: I LOVE this recipe!  I did only make half of the dressing and there was still lots of it left over.  It is the best tasting dressing.  I used Uncle Ben's Original Wild Rice and boiled it in half water and half chicken broth, which gave it a nice flavor.  Used red pepper instead of green because it gives it some pretty color, and we do love the red more.  I probably only used a half cup of the cherry tomatoes because that is all I had on hand, and it seemed enough; sliced each into smaller pieces.  I bet that dried cranberries would be a yummy substitute.  We loved the artichokes in it.  Will definitely make this again.

name: Wild Rice Salad
review: Awesome dish! I have made this numerous times, and it will be served this Sunday for Easter.

name: The Absolute Best Fried Vidalia Onion Rings
review: Very good and easy batter recipe, I did add a splash of hot souce and refrigerate onions for about an hour before battering. Er'body liked 'em!

name: The Absolute Best Fried Vidalia Onion Rings
review: These were good. The texture was perfect, but I would season them much more heavily last time, as they were fairly flavorless. Absolutely perfect for fish, and fried dill pickles though. No problem with keeping the batter on the food...Overall, I will use this again, I will just add more seasonings next time.

name: The Absolute Best Fried Vidalia Onion Rings
review: VERY GOOD , WORKS FOR RINGS FISH OR VEGGIES , I LIKE TO BATTER , FLOUR , THEN FRY FOR A BETTER CRUNCH !!!!!!!!!

name: Asparagus Soup with Herbed Goat Cheese
review: Excellent Recipe..I have made this numerous times and have served it Hot and Cold..The only thing I add are more leeks than it calls for. I usually add what is in the bunch which is usually 3. Love it! Thanks Giada!

name: Asparagus Soup with Herbed Goat Cheese
review: This soup is amazing and easy to make!  I have used a little less butter than suggested and it still came out fine.  I have also used cream cheese instead of goat cheese, because that's what I had on hand.  I have also used this recipe as a base for almost every soup I make now.  I've made it with asparagus of course, broccoli, cauliflower and carrot soups.  Thanks Giada for another great recipe :

name: Asparagus Soup with Herbed Goat Cheese
review: This soup is so good that my husband ate the whole pot in one sitting.  He could not stop eating.  It is easy to prepare and does not take much prep time.  A wonderful addition to my soup collection. I would give it 10 stars if I could.

name: Mixed Berry Soup with Gelato
review: This was wonderful!!  Each of my guest loved it and the ladies asked for the recipe.  I've made it several times now - we really like it with vanilla ice cream with peaches - Oh So Good!

name: Mixed Berry Soup with Gelato
review: I usually prefer chocolate desserts but thought I would try this and it was AMAZING!  Didn't use the star anise because I didn't have any and it was still so good.  And easy!  Perfect summery dessert.

name: Mixed Berry Soup with Gelato
review: Made this for dessert for a dinner party.  Everyone's tastebuds exploded with happiness.  Couldn't get a hold of fresh Raspberries, but I used frozen instead.  It was magnificent.

name: Dover Sole a la Meuniere
review: I use filets. After browning, I let them briefly heat in the oven while making the sauce.  Oil needs to be hot. Quick and easy

name: Dover Sole a la Meuniere
review: Poor recipe...

name: Dover Sole a la Meuniere
review: Exelent and very easy to make also you can add your own flavor! Thank you!!

name: Old Fashioned Sweet Green Tomato Pie with Sweet Pie Crust
review: The crust was very good. Pie tasted a little like apple pie, but with an unusual flavor.

name: Slimmed Down - Chicken Pot Pie
review: Super easy and fairly quick to make!!  I added sweet onions and more carrots and tasted wonderfully.  I also added twice the flour and 1/2 more water to make it thicker.  Perfect for next day leftovers @ room temparature, too!!  Enjoy~

name: Slimmed Down - Chicken Pot Pie
review: Maybe I am crazy, Matthew, but it seems to me that the recipe tells you the size and number of ramekins in the first line.

name: Slimmed Down - Chicken Pot Pie
review: Ok, so, I read this recipe several times.....have I just missed it?

name: Okra Fritters
review: Tried these after seeing Paula prepare them on her show. The family thought I had slaved in the kitchen all day.  Our oldest daugter wants them for her birthday dinner.

name: Okra Fritters
review: I pass a little vegetable stand on my way to visit my sister-in-law and nephew.  So I picked up some fresh okra and green tomatoes.  I fixed these along with salmon patties and fried green tomatoes.  Yes we love our fried food here in the south.  Of the three dishes, my nephew loved this one the best.  For me, it was the easiest to fixe.  Now he wants me to fixed them every I go to visit.

name: Okra Fritters
review: this recipe did not turn out like Paula's, it was like a a fried  biscuit with okra. i added cornmeal and thinned it all out and now its better but they are not lacy and crispy like the show recipe. when Paula cooked them I wanted to go through the tv to eat them...

name: Dried Cherry Scones
review: these scones are amazing. i did not have almond extract (left it out and not enough heavy cream so added whole milk tasted amazing! this is a keeper

name: Dried Cherry Scones
review: After reading some reviews I decided to stray a bit from the recipe. Here is what I came up with and they came out AMAZING! I added a half cup of sugar instead of 1/3 and used the advice from others about the temperature which was 375 instead of 325. Bake for about 18 minutes. I also used turbinado sugar on top with the almonds. Lastly, I cooled them for 15 minutes and lightly glazed them with a vanilla bean glaze. As a side note, I believe in using the best ingredients available and without a doubt will always use Chukar cherries. I used a mix bag of dried Bing, Montmorency, and Rainier cherries. I buy them online and they do not disappoint. I will definitely make these again!

name: Dried Cherry Scones
review: Love this recipe.  I made the scones in a food processor also.  Baked them at 375 degrees for about 18 minutes.  I am going to use this as the base to make other scones.

name: Baklava
review: I have made this recipe twice now, although I only do half of the quantity.  Lord knows I don't need more than a 9x9 pan of that stuff laying around!  Anyway, I layer 12 sheets on the bottom, 8 for the middle, and 12 for the top.  Very stable and gives a more lucious presentation.  I do up the cinnamon to 2 tsp.  I love the large amount of nuts.  Don't skimp on the pistachios.  I did have to increase the syrup some to get it to cover enough. The first time my syrup was too runny.  The second time I used a candy thermometer to 230F/Syrup.  Perfect.  For those that think it is too much syrup, try that.  I did the syrup a day ahead, and the nut mixture a day ahead too.  (I didn't worry about blanching the almonds.  This recipe is wonderful (and I eat a lot of Baklava, as I go to a lot of bellydance functions. ;

name: Baklava
review: This was the best baklava I've ever made, and I've made several over the years.  It makes a LOT, so we shared with neighbors who raved about it also. Thanks Tyler.

name: Baklava
review: great easy to make baklava

name: Pistachio Crusted Salmon
review: So delicious and easy! Made this when we had friends over for dinner and it was a hit! Definitely making again.

name: Pistachio Crusted Salmon
review: Unbelievable, tasty... I used lime juice instead of lemon, and added some honey to the mustard paste... I could easily make this weekly. Simple, straightforward, sumptuous!

name: Pistachio Crusted Salmon
review: I thought this recipe was very good, except that next time I will add less bread crumbs.     I really liked the very tiny hint of mustard with lemon.

name: Seafood Antipasto alla Venezia
review: This recipe was easy and looked fabulous when put together.  I used this for a Christmas party and it was a definate hit.  Will make again for New Year's Eve party:

name: Scrambled Eggs with Chorizo Sausage
review: I decided to try this out and it worked great.  I added in a bit of green bell peppers and green onions to the eggs as they were cooking.  Great recipe.

name: Scrambled Eggs with Chorizo Sausage
review: This is exactly how my family has been making chorizo con huevos for yeeeears. The only thing I see wrong with this recipe is the whole "slicing" part - chorizo is a very soft sausage, and doesn't exactly slice well. It's also a very greasy sausage, so taking it out of the pan with a slotted spoon & wiping it out before cooking the eggs are great tips.

name: Scrambled Eggs with Chorizo Sausage
review: This is what I always order when dining at Mexican restaurants and this recipe is a good version. I like the approach of cooking the sausage partially and then adding it later to the eggs while cooking.  I drained the chorizo on papertowels while cooking the eggs to remove some fat.

name: Chocolate Peppermint Cookies
review: Delicious! Almost like a brownie so great for those of us who like soft cookies. For the glaze, even a single drop will give you a good peppermint taste so add more than the suggested two drops at your own caution.

name: Chocolate Peppermint Cookies
review: Chocolate and mint is a favorite combo for me and these were fantabulous! Moist, deep chocolate cookie with a delicious mint glaze. I made the mint glaze with pure peppermint extract and added a little extra, too. These were perfect for my Holiday cookie gift box.  Since I cannot eat eggs I use "Ener- G" Egg Replacer (found in natural food stores as directed. I have used it for 20+ years. It works great! No one ever notices the cookies I bake are made without eggs. These remind me of moist thin mints, so yummy!!

name: Chocolate Peppermint Cookies
review: These were absolutely delicious!!  I messed up the glaze though (that's what happens when you bake too late into the evening - I used 3.5 tablespoons of water instead of 3.5 teaspoons, so the glaze didn't set right. I will try again! The cookies themselves were amazing! ::

name: Tewa Tacos (AKA- Indian Tacos)
review: If you check around on this site, there are a couple more fry bread recipes that I've seen.  I have to agree, don't over-complicate this.  Flour, baking powder, salt, water, that is all that is necessary for fry bread.  Can deep-fry in lard or oil, but many prefer the lard.  Some people add a little sugar, or use a can of evaporated milk, or even powdered milk... different versions can all be very good.  Don't overwork the dough, or it will be tough!  And be sure your oil is hot!  One thing about the Indian taco recipe that seems to be missing, is using refried beans directly on the frybread, then adding the browned hamburger, and then lettuce, tomatoes, onions, grated cheese, salsa, or any combination of your choice.  This is regular fare at any Native American event, at least here on the West Coast.  Probably not so good for you, what with the deep-frying and all, but OH-SO-GOOD!

name: Tewa Tacos (AKA- Indian Tacos)
review: flour,baking powder,salt,water..  no measuring.. mix to doughy consistensy.. finger knead into a round disk till a hole forms in center and fry!! some people might add a little sugar.. but thats it.. I am from sw Oklahoma and Indian tacos are at all festivals, fairs, sporting events etc..  this recipe doesnt even season the meat.. chili powder in the meat is a must!! I like to salt/pepper and add CHILI powder to my meat.. then I also add ranch style beans to it after draining.. top with onion, lettuce, tomatoes(or salsa and sour cream.. this is Kiowa/Comanche style Indian Tacos.. (I do sometimes slather guacamole on the fry bread base  but the fry bread doesnt need lard!!

name: Tewa Tacos (AKA- Indian Tacos)
review: The frybread we use as meskwaki's is made from salt baking powder and warm water. we don't use yeast or sugar or dry milk powder. We Fry it in Lard but we also make slits in the raw dough prior to fryingso it will cook evenly on the inside as the outside. We also use cast iron skillet over an open fire with iron grill, There are precise measurements for our frybread

name: Chicken in Red Wine with Onions, Mushrooms and Bacon: Coq Au Vin
review: quick ?: Do the onions need to be both braised and baked before being added to the chicken, should 1 method or the other be used, or just the sauté prior to adding them to the chicken?  Its not particularly clear in this regard - just that the braised and baked onions can be served as is, but I can't tell at which point the onions are ready to be added to the chicken.  I'd really appreciate any answers from people who've made this successfully!

name: Chicken in Red Wine with Onions, Mushrooms and Bacon: Coq Au Vin
review: excellent dish - if you follow the directions as noted, you and your guests will be very pleased with the outcome!

name: Chicken in Red Wine with Onions, Mushrooms and Bacon: Coq Au Vin
review: It was a good deal of work, but, it certainly paid off.  The onions and mushrooms were perfectly soft, and the chicken was fall off the bone.  The sauce was completely perfect, with deep, rich flavors (most likely from the wine, as we used a Burgundy instead of one of the fruitier recommendations, but it still was as great as one could possibly hope.  I would recommend this to anybody who's willing to put in the work to achieve something truly delicious.

name: Grilled Salmon Hash
review: This was the perfect way to use the extra grilled salmon I had leftover.  The citrus zest really made it, and I used Smoked Spanish Paprika which was a nice compliment.  I'll definitely be making this again.  What a delicious combination of flavors, perfect for Summer!

name: Grilled Salmon Hash
review: We eat a lot of Salmon here in the Northwest. LOVE this recipe. Reggie's recipes are delicious! I would watch a cooking show with Reggie! I think that the  Food Network should create a show with both Guy & Reggie!They should call it, Sassy Southwest Cooking. Both of these chefs are just too good!

name: Sicilian Style Spaghetti and Eggplant
review: Light and delicious!

name: Sicilian Style Spaghetti and Eggplant
review: Tks. for the recepe, delicious my family is very please.   Gracias!,,,

name: Sicilian Style Spaghetti and Eggplant
review: This was really good--a little on the oily side, but I'm not exactly watching my weight so I really didn't mind.  What was important was that my husband and daughter both liked, which is a hard feat to accomplish.

name: Nut Roll and Poppy Seed Roll
review: This is the best recipe I have ever tasted.  Very flaky crust, nut filling is perfect for this roll.  I have been making many different recipes over the past 40 years and this is the best.  The only trouble I have is with keeping the rolls from breaking open, any suggestions?

name: Nut Roll and Poppy Seed Roll
review: This recipe was better than I could have imagined. I had never made nut roll but had it my entire life. I could not find a treasured family recipe and feel that all of my family would have treasured this recipe even more!

name: Saag Paneer
review: This is not a good recipe. It is NOT at all creamy. Keep looking for a better recipe. I wish I had read the other reviews about putting it in a blender!!

name: Saag Paneer
review: After reading the recipe and the reviews, I made this recipe with only a few minor variations. I more than tripled the spices other than chilis and I left the heat on as I added the spinach and for a few minutes after to evaporate a bit of the moisture. Before adding the paneer, I buzzed my emulsion blender a few times in the pot. I served the leftovers to one of my coworkers who is from India and has only been in NY since Aug 1st. He said that it was very similar to the Palak Paneer his mother makes and he asked me how I made it. After telling him the recipe, he said the key is to make sure you sautee the onions and spices until they are well browned and "dry" before adding the spinach which brings out the flavors, makes the color richer and helps thicken the sauce. Otherwise, this is exactly how Palak Paneer is made and Saag Paneer is the same recipe, just using mustard greens instead of spinach. It was good enough that he ate all of the leftovers.

name: Saag Paneer
review: Like several other people have said, this recipe does not make saag paneer.  The result doesn't look or taste anything like traditional saag paneer.  What came out wasn't exactly horrid, but it was not what I was expecting.  If you want reall saag paneer get a different recipe.

name: Homemade Tortillas
review: I have tryed your recipe put when i roll it out to put it in the tortilla pan the dough shink it will not stay to the shape that i rolled out

name: Homemade Tortillas
review: I thought the tortillas were a little on the oily side-it could have been my mistake in measuring. I will give them one more try.

name: Homemade Tortillas
review: I followed this recipe exactly and everything came out perfect!!  Now i am useing this recipe instead of buying tortillas already made because they taste better than store bought and I can control how many I need.

name: Espresso Chocolate Chip Angel Food Cake
review: Debby, I think I know precisely why your cake flopped, because mine turned out the same way the first time I made it.  My guess is your eggs weren't quite stiff when you added the flour, and the one and only secret for angel food cake is incorporating enough air into the batter during preparation.  Sugar also disables the natural tendency of eggs to fluff while being whipped, and if over-mixed after that point will begin to lose volume.

name: Espresso Chocolate Chip Angel Food Cake
review: I thought this cake was fantastic. I also used minni-choc-chips. It turned out great. I have to say....I can't stand it when people give bad ratings to a recipe when the alter the ingredient amounts before making it! If you ommit the espresso and lower the amount of suger you aren't following the recipe at all. If the cake turned out dense it is because you did it wrong! If you want to alter the recipe fine, but them you can't give it a bad review beacuse your changes didn't work.

name: Espresso Chocolate Chip Angel Food Cake
review: I have tried dozens of Food Network recipes and this was by far the worst.  I followed the recipe (I omitted the espresso and reduced the amount of sugarexcept for the two omissions but this came out dense and heavy, rather than light.I think I'll stick with Ina's recipes - hers are always GREAT!

name: Homemade Potato Chips
review: I will never buy regular potato chips again. Not only where these perfect, the were easy to make. Important things to do that the recipe does not mention. After slicing your potatoes (use a mandolin to get them paper thin, let them soak in a bowl of water to remove the starch. Next make sure to pat the chip dry after you remove them from the water if not they will be soggy. Finally when the oil hits 350 degrees, put them chips in there, lightly stir them around for about 2 to 3 minutes. As soon as they start to turn brown, begin pulling them out.  I spread them out on a baking sheet lined with paper towels. I then seasoned them with sea salt. These where the best and easiest potato chips I've ever had. Great way to get rid of old potatoes that are about to go bad. Ill be making this again and again and again.

name: Homemade Potato Chips
review: These came out amazing, I had to swat my husband out of the kitchen otherwise we wouldn't have had any for dinner.  I followed the recommendation to rinse then dry the potatoes which was a great tip.  It did take twice as long for me to fry them, but I'm pretty sure it was because I tried to fry too many at one time so that's on me.  Even with just a bit of salt these were very flavorful.  I highly recommend using a mandolin to slice the potatoes though so that they'll be thin enough to fry and it saves you a bunch of time.

name: Homemade Potato Chips
review: Thanks for the explanation, Dave.  This was my first chip recipe to try and they came out great. (I always forget to dry my vegetables before frying and it really does make a huge difference.  I think I will stop buying chips all together.

name: Mustard-Green Onion Potato Salad
review: This is delicious--I can't stop eating it!

name: Mustard-Green Onion Potato Salad
review: Highly recommend this recipe.  I grilled some awesome burgers and this potato salad topped it off.  Add just a little more mustard that what is requires.  I also added 6 green onions rather than 4.

name: Mustard-Green Onion Potato Salad
review: Love this recipe!  It has the perfect balance of vinegar and mustard.

name: Luscious Lemon Layer Pie
review: I made this pie two days in a row it was so delicious!  My father-in-law came over to celebrate fathers day on Saturday though I didn't realize it his favorite pie is lemon and I had made this pie for our cook-out.  He loved it, we loved it and so the following day we were at my husbands grandparents house and I made it again but used whipped cream topping instead of the top layer.  Once again it was delicious.  The lemon curd filling is wonderful and is a recipe I will use again and again!  The filling does make enough for two pies, so like the other reviewer said, double your crust recipe to make two pies.

name: Luscious Lemon Layer Pie
review: This pie was absolutely wonderful. Something I would definitely buy from a restaurant or bakery. I doubled the crust because the other layers made double. It is time consuming but since it made two pies it was well worth it. Wonderfully delicious. It does say 2 boxes of instant lemon pudding. Each box comes with a different size at different stores so I was unsure on what to do. My store had a 1 oz box and 3.5 oz box. I bought two 3.5 oz boxes. After adding one I thought it best to add the second, so I did. It worked out very well.

name: Luscious Lemon Layer Pie
review: This is so good!!!  Everyone loved it and ask for more!!   Thanks

name: Veal Milanese
review: It works great with pork chops, too.  I use the loin chops with bone, french the bones and pound them, and it looks like veal chops and tastes as good, at about 1/3 the price.  Also panko instead of regular bread crumbs makes it a little lighter.

name: Veal Milanese
review: Big hit with my family and will be a repeat.  Followed recipe as it was and wouldn't change anything.  Easy too!

name: Veal Milanese
review: and it was good. I hate veal! I would use red onion instead of yellow and I added lemon to the sauce.

name: Pecan Squares
review: I thought 6 minutes was too long to cook the filling....it had a slightly burned flavor and was much chewier than I expected it to be.  The crust is amazing, though.  I would definitely use the crust recipe, but I don't think the filling is worth the expense.  Sorry!

name: Pecan Squares
review: gift from Peg Harvey.......sounds difficult but it was wonderful

name: Pecan Squares
review: You must try these! They are a family favorite! DELISH!!!

name: Swiss Chard Empanadas
review: We used refrigerated pie crust and saved a ton of time.

name: Roasted Fennel with Parmesan
review: Easy and delicious.  Be generous with the parmesan cheese.  Fennel and parmesan make a great flavor combination.

name: Roasted Fennel with Parmesan
review: So simple and flavorful, love it!

name: Roasted Fennel with Parmesan
review: What a nice change for a green veggie!  Very tasty.  Normally, we do not care for fennel but this was delish...nutty flavor and parmesan adds great touch!

name: Yellow Cupcakes
review: Light and delicious taste.  I made these for a family event and they received rave reviews.  I topped them with vanilla frosting.

name: Yellow Cupcakes
review: These were very dry. They weren't worth the amount of work you have to put into them. It took me about an hour just to mix all the ingredients and follow all instructions. I paired them with a simple butter cream. Overall just very dry i wouldn't recommend the recipe.

name: Yellow Cupcakes
review: I made a batch of these vanilla cupcakes and topped them with chocolate ganache and I can tell you every one in the house thought they were real good. The cream cheese frosting recommended with them did not seem too appealing, that's why I opted for the ganache and I can tell you it gives excellent contrast to the taste buds. Oh, and they looked beautiful and decadent as if they were bought from a bakery. I will keep this sweet recipe.

name: "Debris" Po'boys
review: This takes sandwiches up a notch or two, add cajun seasoning and pepper hot cheese to bump it up even more.

name: "Debris" Po'boys
review: My 10yr old sons favorite!!

name: "Debris" Po'boys
review: fantastic food,throw a few drops of zatarins liquid crab boil in it and you have another thing that will blow your taste buds up !!!

name: Sole Veronique
review: excellent.... no fennel added small red grapes & 2 peaches cubed  sauce excellent as well

name: Sole Veronique
review: This dish did not excite us.  The fennel was good, and I would make it again.  The grapes broiled with the fish was a nice flavor too.  The sauce for the fish was just a bit boring for the amount of work it took.  I would not make it again.

name: Sole Veronique
review: I loved this dish.  I made it with cod, which wasn't ideal (it would be much better with sole, but the sauce was delicious.  I thought it was very easy to make, too.  I didn't try the fennel but I love fennel so I absolutely will next time.  I think the flavor of the fennel will play off of the richness of the sauce well.

name: Clarified Butter
review: The yield is incorrect. 2 sticks (1/2 pound of butter is 1 cup of butter. Once you clarify it you should yield approximately 3/4 cup.

name: Clarified Butter
review: Tried it the other day. Simply wonderful. I recently ran out of Plugra Clarified Butter and couldn't find it anywhere. Now all I have to do is buy unsalted butter from Costco and there I am! Emeril, thanks!!

name: Clarified Butter
review: Haven't tried it yet, but for ease for someone who doesn't cook much, looks fantastic!

name: Chile con Queso
review: Followed recipe, but cheese and milk in double boiler and once it melted it was lumpy.  Not sure if milk curdled or if it was cheese.  Just regular Kraft American Singles.  Not sure what went wrong.  I'm at high altitude, maybe that was the cause.  Wish I could have got it to come out smooth.  :(

name: Chile con Queso
review: I like that it didn't get that cheese-skin that quesos often have, but there was something missing that I just couldn't put my finger on.   I made the recipe as directed.  Maybe next time I'll double the veggies &  saute them before I add them to the cheese.

name: Chile con Queso
review: Mmmm! Delicious. Definitely will be making this again!! i used white cheddar instead of american so next time im going to use heavy cream instead of the milk to make it creamier. Also, like others said, i am going to cook the veggies before hand.

name: Hot Dog Noodle Casserole
review: This is a very tasty dish and unless you think that eating hot dogs is redneck, totally not. I made this last night and my husband loved it. I did make a few changes. I used smoked sausage as that is what I had on hand. Saute'd them in the bacon grease then added it to the soup mix. I also used cream of celery and Jack cheese. I will make it again and will add green chili's to it when I do, for that little extra punch. We like things spicy. Give it try!

name: Hot Dog Noodle Casserole
review: The combination of ingredients sounded strange, so I wasn't too surprised that it tasted strange. I'll eat it because it's there now, but no plans on making this again.

name: Hot Dog Noodle Casserole
review: I gave this excellent because it was awesome tasty and you would never expect it out of the seemingly "cheap" ingredients.  Has more flavor than you would ever expect from the recipe.  Easy, tasty, and makes really good leftovers.  I will make this again for sure!

name: Pasta with Tuna, Tomatoes, Garlic, Capers, and Olives
review: Pretty good and definitely easy. I used chopped spinach instead of basil because that's what I had at the time. I think a finely grated strong cheese such as Pecorino really adds to this dish, which is somewhat bland with just salt, pepper and garlic seasoning the dish.

name: Pasta with Tuna, Tomatoes, Garlic, Capers, and Olives
review: This was okay but there way WAY too much pasta for the amount of sauce. If I ever made it again I would change the proportions dramatically.

name: Pasta with Tuna, Tomatoes, Garlic, Capers, and Olives
review: I love this recipe. I use double the tuna and use tuna in olive oil. I never have cherry tomatoes so I dice a whole tomato. I use fresh basil but have used dry basil and it was good. I have brought this for lunch and it even reheats in the microwave. Oh and I add parmesan to it at the end. Delicious.

name: Roasted Butternut Squash Soup and Curry Condiments
review: This is one of my favorite fall/winter dishes.  I have made it several times and it is still requested on a regular basis.  I agree about peeling the items before cooking.  I have found that just using a chef's knive and cutting the skin as opposed to peeling with a peeler is MUCH easier.

name: Roasted Butternut Squash Soup and Curry Condiments
review: Unbelieveable soup!  But do yourself a favor and by the pre-skinned and chopped squash.  Haha, that's the only drawback to this recipe.  You could get carpal tunnel syndrome just trying to peel one of those babies.  Other tan that, this is a fabulous soup.

name: Roasted Butternut Squash Soup and Curry Condiments
review: I like the soup until I put curry in. I love curry, it just doesn't work with butternut squash to me. I think apple cider works better with butternut squash to me.

name: Breast of Veal Stuffed with Lemon, Pancetta, and Rosemary
review: Great recipe for a cooking show. My family loved it.  I made this recipe for Christmas 2007. It took too much time and it was actually very difficult. Never, again.

name: Breast of Veal Stuffed with Lemon, Pancetta, and Rosemary
review: I was unable to stuff the veal adequatedly, but, the stuffing was fantastic. I made it into stuffing balls and have served them with pork chops and chicken. They are spicey but, with these meats, they are terrific. I don't think I will attempt this recipe again since the veal was too much fat.I found a keeper with the stuffing though.

name: Breast of Veal Stuffed with Lemon, Pancetta, and Rosemary
review: this recipe is so yummy, my husband loved this recipe as well as my children. Thanks Emirel. you alaways make five stars recipes.

name: Southern Tea Cakes
review: I remember helping my Grandmother make tea-cakes when I was real young.What was wrote down in her recipe book,which she never wrote out the full details to any of her recipes. The ingredients are

name: Southern Tea Cakes
review: Very Good! Extremely close to the ones I use to eat as a little girl. Good job Paula. My hubby suggested i use a touch of nutmeg though.

name: Southern Tea Cakes
review: This recipe was good but to add a special "Arkansas Southern" flavor try adding a pinch of nutmeg'' A trick from my Great-Great Grandmother.

name: Spaghetti Bolognese
review: I changed a few things to make it more my taste because I didn't like how it was turning out but it was an overall good start.  I added herbs and spices, added mushrooms for more flavour and depth, as well as more tomatoe to get more of a tomatoey flavour and of course some sugar to balance the acidity of the extra tomatoes.  Then it was just the way I wanted it after adding the milk.  But it will be even better next time.

name: Spaghetti Bolognese
review: Great Great recipe.  Some basic ingredients come together with exceptional flavor.  You don't have to go searching the store for 'eye of newt' to make this.  You don't even have to spend $1.99 on one little bunch fresh herbs to get great flavors.  You do need to remove some of the fat and water after browning the meats.  And you do need to let it simmer for quite awhile before everything tenderizes perfectly.  But it's SO creamy over the pasta.

name: Spaghetti Bolognese
review: This recipe took so long and never thickened.  Even after adding a thickener and taking out a lot of the liquid, it didn't have the flavor I thought it would.  Very disappointed.  Would not make again.

name: Chili-Beans
review: This recipe is great, thanks for sharing it Emeril.

name: Chili-Beans
review: Made this for the first time today.  Everyone has enjoyed it and are happy that it has spice to it.   My husband can eat really hot things, so it is difficult to find something he considers spicy that the rest of us can still eat.  :p  Thanks Emeril

name: Chili-Beans
review: Made this dish it was very good.It had great flavor. My husband even wanted seconds. Will make again. I bet it would be good over rice may try that next time.

name: Jen's Sweet Potato Bisque
review: Followed the recipe as written. Divided in half and made one with the added cream and one without. The cream cut the spice but both are delicious. Will definitely make again.

name: Jen's Sweet Potato Bisque
review: I made minor substitutions - margarine for the butter, vegetable broth for the chicken stock and soy milk for the cream - to fit my vegan diet. This was SO flavorful. I liked the balance of sweetness from the sweet potatoes and apple juice with the savory of the herbs. The texture was just perfect, not too thick, not too thin. The croutons on top were a fantastic finish. I will definitely make this again.

name: Jen's Sweet Potato Bisque
review: I do not understand how a viewer (hopkinton 79 can rate a recipe with 5 stars if he/she virtually changes all the ingredients in the recipe.  A totally different taste is created with different ingredients.  Aside from being very quick and easy to prepare, I thought the recipe was pretty good exactly as presented.

name: Sweet Irish Soda Bread
review: Made this Irish Bread and tasted Great.We had to increase the Butter due to an Allergy to Shortening.Did not change the consistency or End Results. We thoroughly enjoyed and consider a Staple.Not only an Honorary Irish Lass Once a Year! When cooler or have a bread machine to bake this lucious loaf,do not wait. We added Currants.If too hard, soften in a 1~2 ounce amount of liquid of choice. e.g.Orange juice,sherry,warm water,dark lager,stout...

name: Sweet Irish Soda Bread
review: Fabulous warm with Irish butter on it. I sprinkle raw sugar over it prior to baking.I omitted the currants and caraway seeds.

name: Sweet Irish Soda Bread
review: I have been making this bread for years and everyone loves it.  I did make a few adjustments- skip the caraway seeds and add raisins instead of currants.  It has so much more flavor that regular soda bread!!

name: Profiteroles
review: Although my puffs were a bit overdone (20 minutes in my oven was too long, this dessert was surprisingly easy to make and amazingly delicious. I agree that the chocolate sauce is one of the best I've ever made or tasted. Big hit with my family and friends! Will definitely make again.

name: Profiteroles
review: This is one of the #1 sweet treats I always whip up in a jiffy and it is perfect everytime. The one thing I do different is mix it in my Cuisinart.

name: Profiteroles
review: These aren't nearly as hard to make as I had anticipated.  They are delicious!

name: Grilled Lobster Tails with Herb Butter
review: Very good

name: Grilled Lobster Tails with Herb Butter
review: Very yummy and super easy to make. No fail recipe.

name: Grilled Lobster Tails with Herb Butter
review: Great flavor and meat was tender. Cooked true to time stated in recipe

name: Apricot and Walnut Phyllo Cups
review: Delightful presentation AND delicious!  AND simple to make, too!

name: Apricot and Walnut Phyllo Cups
review: Overall this is a good dried fruit recipe.  I hate apricots but had 8oz package of dried apples hanging around.  I threw in a handful of golden raisins and used cinnamon and nutmeg instead.  I didn't measure, just a few shakes around the workbowl and a few scrapes of a nutmeg on a rasp.  I did measure and toast the walnuts, OJ and honey. After a few pulses I tasted, and the apples were too tart, so I threw in a packet of splenda. I used puff pastry shells and baked them off.  I then filled the bottoms and tops as well. The filling presses together nicely.  Topped with powdered sugar and then some big pieces of walnuts.  You don't have to bake the filling at all.  They were great at room temp.  I have dreams of more dried fruits; dates and figs and pistachios, cherries and almonds, pinapple and papaya and macadamia nuts with some candied ginger too...  I can't wait!  I think I will measure the cinnamon next time tho, it needs a bit more than a few shakes.

name: Apricot and Walnut Phyllo Cups
review: These were so easy and yummy!  I love almonds and apricots together so I used almonds instead - maybe next time I'll try the walnuts as I'll definitely be making these again.

name: Rustic Pesto Pizza
review: The pizza had good flavor but turned out a little soggy. It might have been because I didn't use the corn meal and flour. But all in all I would make it again.

name: Vegetable Rice
review: I just love this rice!I use Jasmine rice for mine but other than that I follow  it to a T.

name: Vegetable Rice
review: Made this for my boyfriend who loooooooves rice.  I usually just make the plain stuff, but was watching this episode while I was cooking dinner.  I decided to "spice" it up.  He loves it! It is now his new favorite! Thank you!

name: Vegetable Rice
review: this rice was sooo good

name: Vegetarian Pot Stickers
review: Delicious and easy to make substitutions if you don't have exactly what the recipe calls for. Yum!!

name: Vegetarian Pot Stickers
review: Too much Ginger. I will have to try it a few times to get it right. Other wise they turned out pretty good.

name: Vegetarian Pot Stickers
review: I picked this recipe out of many and I will say I LOVED it! Made it last night for my dinner. Trader Joe's has some good ones that I like buy but I'm too far from there. The only thing that I changed  was that I had to use won-ton skins because the store didn't have gyoza skins, so mines were a bit small and I left out the mushrooms. Thanks for this recipe!!!!!!

name: Cornbread
review: I can't even recall how many times I've made these corn muffins because they are so good!!!! My boyfriend claims this is the best thing that I bake, and ironically it is the simplest! I would recommend using Krusteaz because I've tried another brand before and it just didn't turn out as good.

name: Cornbread
review: Best cornmeal I ever used in my nearly 40 yrs of cooking is White Lilly, a good corn bread is all in the meal, with a good meal all you need is egg and milk and a cast iron skillet for the best cornbread you ever ate.

name: Cornbread
review: Well made this for friends; just a change from our real Southern Cornbread. It was a complete failure. Sorry but this recipe sucks.

name: Roasted Beet Salad
review: An excellent recipe...a definite "do-over".  I love its simplicity.  I used goat cheese and roasted red beets as well as yellow.  I sprinkled a little bit of diced red onion onto it, used walnuts on mine but my husband doesn't like walnuts so I added toasted pine nuts to his.  This is definitely a recipe that can be suited to your preferences or mood.  I think substituting a little blue cheese might be good too.  I served it on a bed of lettuce leaves which really perked up the beautiful colours.

name: Roasted Beet Salad
review: Excellent, wonderfully tasty a bit of work also a bit messy but well worth it thank you Claire love your show keep up the good work your fan forever Gabriela

name: Roasted Beet Salad
review: This was so tasty. It was a little work preparing the beets (wear gloves like she tells you and oranges but well worth it. It's also a good template to switch out ingredients, ie. use golden beets and blood oranges, walnuts instead of hazelnuts or even asiago instead of romano.

name: White Sausage Gravy
review: It was a big hit for breakfast this morning. Simple and easy.  I had to add about a 1/2 of tablespoon more of flour to get it to the right consistency.  It was delicious!

name: White Sausage Gravy
review: Very good.  A little too much sausage to milk ratio.  In the future, I'll probably add 30-50% more milk.  As the recipe is written, it could use an additional tablespoon of flour to thicken it up, or maybe I need to simmer it for another 5 minutes or so.

name: White Sausage Gravy
review: Easy to make and so delicious! Will make this again!

name: Yellow Split Pea Soup
review: Agreed, great simple recipe. Another Canadian here.

name: Yellow Split Pea Soup
review: The only thing I can think of against this dish is the color, I found the yellow slightly off-putting.  I guess green split pea soup isn't the best color, either.  It was amazingly easy to make with relatively few ingredients, has a nice rich and hearty texture yet is surprisingly light and was inexpensive to make.  I used a smoked ham hock and added about 8 oz finely diced ham steak (after puree for texture.  I was able to make the dish for around $15, including the bread and ham steak.

name: Yellow Split Pea Soup
review: What an excellent recipe, as always with Milliken & Feniger! I followed the recipe exactly except for adding 2 garlic cloves and one teaspoon of curry powder. This recipe was so easy to make, especially since I have an immersion blender and didn't have to go the blender or food processor route in small batches. I served it with the croutons and brown mustard. Gave a pint to my mother and to my sister, and they agreed that it was excellent. Thanks so much for this recipe! We are so lucky to have the Food Network and all the recipes from superb professional chefs. We're really getting spoiled, aren't we?

name: Veggie Burger
review: This recipe is very good.  I made the following changes.  In place of the spinach, kale was used.  I used egg beaters in place of the egg white, and used seasoned salt instead of plain salt.  In addition to the fresh bread crumbs, I used oatmeal to make it more binding.  Since neither of us care for mint, cilantro was used in its place.  Also added 1/2 a slice of cheese and topped it with lettuce and tomato.

name: Veggie Burger
review: Very good. I pulsed the corn, pepper, mushrooms and scallions in the food processor as suggested before cooking. I also used about 1 cup of panko. I cooked about 7-9 minutes per side on med-high and topped with cheese for last two minutes. Served on whole wheat buns with fresh spinach, balsamic roasted red onions and reduced-fat monterrey jack. I will definitely make again. p.s. I would like to add peppadews in place of red pepper next time.

name: Veggie Burger
review: OMG! So good, I couldn't believe it.  Have a taco taste.  Based on some of the reviews, I used sweet potato, put them in the food processor and extra bread crumbs to firm up.  I, also, coated a cookie sheet with olive oil and put them in the oven.  I will make again.  Better than the Lentil and Barley ones, but they were good, too.

name: Thousand-Layer Spice Cake: Spekkoek Lapis Legit
review: I made this recipe and it was really good and well received. The spice mixture is quite harmonious, though mine was a bit nutmeg predominant because I made the mistake of packing it down. I had to tweak the recipe a bit. Instead of 1 cup of sugar I used 2 cups. It just didn't sound right especially with the 3 sticks of butter and 12 eggs. It ended up being just right in terms of sweetness and wasn't too sweet. Also I don't have a stand mixer so I had to whisk the egg whites by hand. Even after incorporating the meringue with the butter, egg yolks, flour etc there was still enough lift for a light moist cake that wasn't dense at all (despite the lack of a leavening agent. Also as you build the layers, you have to be aware that the higher you go the closer your cake is to the broiler flame so lowering the rack towards the end makes sense. Overall a great recipe, a little time consuming, but well worth the effort and your guest will be impressed!

name: Thousand-Layer Spice Cake: Spekkoek Lapis Legit
review: My husband comes from a Dutch-Indonesian background and this is his favorite dessert, so naturally I had to learn how to make it.  I have not used this recipe but one similar to it that my father-in-law uses.  What I love about this cake, in addition to its beauty if one takes the time to make it properly, is the bold flavor of the spices, but not overpowering.  If you're like me and love your food to be full of flavor, this is definitely a cake you'll love.  I don't find it hard to make at all, just a little time-consuming but it's well worth the wait! Since it is so rich, it's best to serve it in small slices. It goes well with coffee or hot cocoa and you could drizzle some chocolate syrup on it if you wanted, but why change something that's already fantastic?  Happy Cooking!

name: Emeril's Country File Gumbo
review: This was my first attempt at Gumbo, and what better to try then an Emeril recipe.  Please note the yield on the Roux recipe.  If you want to reduce the time needed for your Roux, only make a half batch. Be careful with the heat if you are using an electric stovetop, and don't stop stirring!!!  I'm not sure if it was something I did, but after the 50 minutes of cooking the gumbo was just a bit too thick.  I added 1 more cup of chicken broth and it came to the perfect consistency.  I substituted oysters for the crab meat.  I also let my guests add the File to their liking at the table.  It came out FANTASTIC.  Emeril did an amazing job with this recipe and the seasonings.  The spice level was perfect.  Browning the sausage rounds really brought that grilled flavor to them, and the fresh basil and thyme at the end really brought great fresh herb flavor to the dish.   Adding the seafood at the end allowed the shrimp to maintain a good firm texture.  Overall this recipe is AWESOME!

name: Emeril's Country File Gumbo
review: I don't follow a particular recipe.  I review them and concoct my own with what I have on hand at home. Made gumbo today and let it cook for a few hours. Used a medium dark roux, sausage, ground turkey, okra, celery, onions, garlic, thyme, salt, pepper, chicken stock, can of tomatoes,even threw in some corn I had and brown basmati rice. I don't eat white rice. Came out pretty good. I was out of File and was not going to the store for it. Came out good anyway.

name: Emeril's Country File Gumbo
review: Ah-mazing.  Getting the Roux to the right color is key.  It takes time, but it is worth it.  I ladled some broth into a small cup; then stirred in 1 tsp of file powder, then returned this to the pot and stirred to combine.  DO NOT USE THE AMOUNT OF FILE INDICATED IN THE RECIPE.  IT WILL RUIN THE DISH.

name: Buttered Egg Noodles with Parsley
review: Loved it & very easy.  The lemon zest adds so much.

name: Buttered Egg Noodles with Parsley
review: Very easy recipe with a surprisingly refined taste.  The parsley is mellowed after cooking in the butter, and lends the entire dish a lovely, fresh green color.  The lemon zest makes the entire dish bright and lively, and cuts through the heaviness of the butter.  A great complement to egg noodles, which require a sauce with more punch than the typical tomato to bring out its rich flavors.

name: Buttered Egg Noodles with Parsley
review: This was fool-proof! I added parmesan cheese to taste. Next time I will add grilled chicken.

name: Pan Seared Chicken Breast
review: Great recipe!  Quick, simple and delicious.  I did make a few adjustments.  I cut down on the garlic (4 cloves.  I also reduced the oven temperature to 350 degrees, added 1/2 cup white wine just before putting it in the oven and cooked it for about 15 minutes.  Chicken was very moist and flavorful.

name: Pan Seared Chicken Breast
review: We loved this recipe! Unfortunately, we didn't have any Rosemary, but used Basil and Parsley instead. Next time we will try it with the Rosemary for sure. :

name: Pan Seared Chicken Breast
review: Delicous and simple.  I will definitely do this again.

name: Bacon-Wrapped Buffalo Shrimp Cocktail
review: While I thought this was an unlikely and unusual combination, I made these for my Superbowl party mainly because I count carbs and wanted to be sure that I had something to eat, too. The shrimp was absolutely delicious! So flavorful and made a beautiful presentation. Everyone gobbled this up even though they weren't watching carbs. You'd never know this was low carb. I will for sure make this again.

name: Bacon-Wrapped Buffalo Shrimp Cocktail
review: These are an excellent appetizer.  The look great and taste even better.

name: Bacon-Wrapped Buffalo Shrimp Cocktail
review: Great!

name: Deluxe, Divine Chicken Divan
review: I found this recipe as I was searching for a use for some leftover rotisserie chicken. This is a dish you could entertain with (unlike the cream of chicken soup and egg noodles type chicken divan I had growing up. It's delicious; the flavors of all of the ingredients come together VERY nicely! Using rotisserie chicken made the prep faster. I just added the chicken to the sauce at the very end. I dont like mushrooms and used chopped onions for the sauce instead. This worked perfectly. I used steamed broccoli instead of asparagus because that was the vegetable in the dish I had growing up. It was delicious with broccoli; next time I will try asparagus, Don't know if I'd make the rice as a stand alone side but it tastes outstanding with the sauce and chicken. Easy recipe. Excellent results! Oh- and if you're not sure about the tarragon just go light on it (1 Tbsp will not overpower the sauce.

name: Deluxe, Divine Chicken Divan
review: I thought this came out great! I did use orzo instead of white rice, but very tasty! and I loved the scallions with the orzo.

name: Deluxe, Divine Chicken Divan
review: The dish was good once I got it made, the recipe its self was a little harf to follow.

name: California Wrap Sandwich
review: Just want to let everyone know that this has been the biggest hit among all the parties I have thrown and all the church functions we have had.  The only thing that I did different was I omitted the arugula.  I also just used Romaine Lettuce and plain old bacon.  I have been asked over and over to make this at every event that comes my way.  Way to go Food Network Kitchens :

name: California Wrap Sandwich
review: I have made these for years.  I love them, but Im a Cali girl.  I use sprouts not lettuce. yummy

name: California Wrap Sandwich
review: i loved every thing except the avacado

name: Stuffed Peppers
review: Delicious and easy! I used hot italian sausage instead of breakfast sausage because that was all I had on hand. Also, my grocery's poblano peppers were a bit picked over so I chopped a jalapeno for the mixture and put the mixture into red bell peppers. Really great, easy dish!

name: Stuffed Peppers
review: My boyfriend and his frat brothers (we're in college... LOVED this. There were no left overs! I'm going to try a healthier variation using turkey sausage and low fat cream cheese.... the Hungarian peppers really made this dish!

name: Stuffed Peppers
review: Delicious!  I used the food processor for my medium onion, small bell pepper and 2 stalks of celery. It went pretty quickly after that.  I only used about 6 oz of regular cream cheese.  I would say it will serve 2-4 people.  My husband and I each ate one pepper for a light dinner.  My 2 year old tasted a piece of the filling with the regular Owens breakfast sausage and appeared to like it.

name: 10,000 Island Dressing with Layered Salad
review: This is near exact to a recipe we prepare when vegetables and greens are in season. We add boiled chicken cut up as a layer near the top. We have left out the cooked egg yolks and left the whites cooked. The Beets are a new spin and will try.Thanks, Guy!In our local newspaper was/is a recipe as well as a local book by the Women's Club.

name: 10,000 Island Dressing with Layered Salad
review: Very good!  So glad I made it because I did have second thoughts with all the ingredients. The homemade dressing is worth making to use on any tossed salad.  I served this salad with bbq shrimp, the salad is almost a meal itself.  I did use homemade pickled beets to save a step. I will be taking this to a future cookout or potluck dinner - it serves a lot!

name: 10,000 Island Dressing with Layered Salad
review: Great!!! I too changed up and used homemade pickled beets.

name: Cake Petit Fours
review: I wish I had put in the work and made the cake and icing myself.  I didn't like the chemical taste and the texture of the pound cake which was spongy.  The only things I really liked about this dessert were the jam and the strawberries.

name: Cake Petit Fours
review: This was all looks and no taste I feel as though a lot of sandra lee recipes are just for looks, the pound cake and the ice cream did not taste good together however when i've done pound cake and strawberry shortcake just in a sloppy bowl they were great...all in all too much work for too little taste

name: Cake Petit Fours
review: the petit fours I buy from a catalouge, and much cheaper too!

name: Snickerdoodles
review: So easy to make and tasty.  The only suggestion is to add more cinnamon.  But otherwise wouldn't change a thing!

name: Snickerdoodles
review: Wonderful flavor and moist! Wish they were a little fluffier.....

name: Snickerdoodles
review: These were the best cookies ever. I really enjoyed making them for my family. My kids really loved these. try these cookies for your self.

name: Pressure Cooker Pork and Beans
review: This was delicious! I made this as my first in my new pressure cooker, so I followed the recipe to a "T." I hope that my next attempts are this good!

name: Pressure Cooker Pork and Beans
review: Great flavor, but with the delicious pork shoulder, this is elevated to more of a main course.  Eaten that way, there is far too much brown sugar in these.  Next time, I'll add two tablespoons of brown sugar instead.  I can always add more later.

name: Rib-Eye Steak Rub
review: I was really disappointed to find two ingredients listed as non-named rubs. I wonder how some hear gave it a 5.

name: Rib-Eye Steak Rub
review: I find it odd that for a steak rub recipe the first listed ingredient is "steak rub", and later in the recipe, "rib rub".  If your intent is to make your own steak rub, why would you want to include two store bought rubs?

name: Rib-Eye Steak Rub
review: I am not a fan of Steak but my fiance is! I found this recipe and made it and used on a 16oz steak. I marinated it over night and cooked the next day *medium* it came out gorgeous! I tried some and enjoyed it so much that I wanted my own piece of steak! Will be using this recipe EVERY-TIME!

name: Florentines
review: love them even plain

name: Florentines
review: Fantastic tasting!! After reading all the reviews I was somewhat apprehensive...but decided to try it anyway.  I increased the orange zest and listened to the  other reviewers and decreased the size to a teaspoon...still a bit big and not perfect.  I didn't want to add the chocolate in between because I felt they were so rich as it was..by themselves..maybe next year... but delicious ...crunchy and lovely..not sure how they will maintain  their lovely crispness..next time I'm going for the silicone muffin pans

name: Florentines
review: I think I figured out the problem.  These are the most delectable (and popular cookies I've ever made so I knew there was a problem when I saw that they were only receiving a four star rating.  In the recipe it says to add 2 tsp. of batter to make 8 cookies on a sheet.  On the show she only uses ONE tsp. of batter per cookie.  That's why some of you have ended up with "almond brittle".  Though I'm sure it was yummy.  Use very little batter and space them out more than you think you need to and you'll be fine.  Take the time to do these right and you WON'T be disappointed.  Good luck!

name: Roasted Fresh Ham with Cider Glaze
review: I was nervous about attempting to work with a fresh ham, but this recipe makes it easy. I brined it for the time suggested, and after roasting, it was very moist and tasted wonderful. I was surprised at how moist it was. I would do this again, and it's cheaper than buying an already prepared ham.

name: Roasted Fresh Ham with Cider Glaze
review: Roasted Fresh Ham is a great idea for great recipes but better if it is a great fresh ham! ; I prefer Cinta Senese one, if you do not know this beatiful Italian ham have a look on

name: Roasted Fresh Ham with Cider Glaze
review: I use the recipe every year for Christmas and It turns out great! My whole Family LOVES it.

name: Chocolate Layer Cake
review: tasty batter, the recipe did not specify that it is THREE layers, and I over-filled the pans and it overflowed all through my oven. they should say that you need THREE pans up front and not way down in the bottom of the icing directions!

name: Chocolate Layer Cake
review: I have tried this cake for my brothers 9th birthday because he loves chocolate and coffee !!! So far it is in the process of baking but the batter is delish and the consistancy is amazing! the batter seems to have turned out perfectly. Responding to other reviewers who asked if it was too much coffee, it wasnt. just enough to taste it and to enhance the chocolate flavor!!! Loved It

name: Chocolate Layer Cake
review: I made this cake yesterday for a Kwanzaa celebration and everyone loved it!!   The cake was super moist and sliced well. I substituted a buttercream frosting. I will be making this cake again.

name: Sweet Biscotti
review: This has been my favorite recipe for biscotti for 10 years now, and no matter how many different types I make, this is the one everyone wants most, I have to make at least 3 batches, just so everyone is happy.  Yes, it is a wet dough and not the easiest to work with but well worth the effort...

name: Sweet Biscotti
review: I decided I want to be one of those wives who always has cookies around when people come over randomly- so I figured biscotti is a good cookie to have in the freezer because it is already hard so I can't see how freezing it would mess it up. Maybe my eggs were too small because they are organic, but my dough was way too dry- like powdery, so I added barely a tablespoon of water and that was plenty of extra moisture. Don't be lazy and try to make this fit onto one pan, they spread a lot so my cookies are really long. And my only advise is to slightly wet your hands- like when you make matzo balls- and then the dough doesn't stick to you. I missed the part where you are supposed to turn this out onto a board- I just shaped them on the parchment itself. yummy. emerils great! plus no butter so i can eat them after meat! YEY!

name: Sweet Biscotti
review: You must follow the recipe verbatim, including cook time.  Biscotti are not soft cookies fyi.  They are supposed to be a dunker therefore harder than most.  But if you want to add a different kind of nut or chip, by all means go ahead.  The dough WILL BE SOFT to handle, this is why you must throw it out on the cutting board or counter with additional flower to help it keep it's log shape.  Once the original batter is mixed, it's up to your discretion to throw a little or a lot extra around it to mold it's log form.  You can also dip them in any kind of chocolate [white, dark, semi-sweet, milk] when they're done.  They freeze beautifully as well in any airtight container.  These are perfect every time.

name: Emeril's Chili
review: Very tasty chili recipe! I experienced no problems with it being too soupy, as some others have posted. I used ground chuck in place of the cut meat because I had ground chuck on hand. I used 2 Tablespoons pulverized doritoes instead of the masa, because I could not find the ingredient at my local grocery. It was ready much quicker using the ground meat also. My boyfriend LOVED this recipe! I will make this again.

name: Emeril's Chili
review: YOUR RECIPE REALLY GOOD !

name: Emeril's Chili
review: I enjoyed the chili, but it was not as flavorful as I expected.  I did not add the cheese and sour cream as I was trying to cut the calorie level and I used canned tomatoes not fresh but do not believe that would have made a big difference.

name: Bloomin' Onion
review: My first attempt ever making a blooming onion. I want to try a few other recipes to compare, but this one was good but it had way too much salt and pepper. Luckily I cut back on the pepper in advance. I should have done the same with the salt! I was drinking water all night long!  Other than that, it was good and looked presentable. I made 2 smaller onions and the amount of dry and wet were perfect.  The smaller size is a good portion for one or two people and take just 5 mins to cook.  Just cut back on the S&P;!

name: Bloomin' Onion
review: GREAT TASTE JUST SOME DIFFICULTY IN CUTTING THE ONION

name: Bloomin' Onion
review: This is so good!!!  This is a long hand me down recipe in my family for years.  We forgot who found it first.  Every one loves it!!!

name: Spicy Grilled Shrimp
review: Delicious! I have used the spice rub for other seafood dishes and WOW we love this rub! Marinade great too!

name: Spicy Grilled Shrimp
review: I made this for my wife who is not a big fan of spicy shrimp... She loved it... I made a lot of the rub... I will use it in other seafood dishes...

name: Spicy Grilled Shrimp
review: FAR too salty. Yuck! Stick with Justin Wilson's recipe

name: Rice Pilaf
review: I made this at the Firehall, it was a huge hit. I followed the recipe exactly and it worked amazingly. The best rice i've ever cooked. I didn't have the peas, but it was still delicious. The orange zest makes it.

name: Rice Pilaf
review: It didn't work. I followed the directions. I brought it to boil, used the damp cloth, and put it in the oven for 15 minutes. Then I removed it and let it sit for 20 minutes. When I opened it, the rice was very crunchy and swimming in broth. I had to cook it on the stove for another 10 minutes before it was edible (and almost burnt it to the pan, but that was my fault. Maybe it's the altitude? I'm around 5000 ft. Also, the flavor of the bell peppers didn't quite meld.

name: Rice Pilaf
review: Never a fan of those salty, nasty rice pilafs I encountered in life, I never considered making one before. This is super and beautiful.  I used homemade veggie broth instead of chicken, left out the salt and added herbs. The way the rice was cooked was great also. What a wonderful pilaf!

name: Italian Sub Stoup and Garlic Toast Floaters
review: I make this as one of my regular meals... sooooo good

name: Italian Sub Stoup and Garlic Toast Floaters
review: this is one of my family's favorite soups!  I love the left-overs the next day for lunch. :

name: Italian Sub Stoup and Garlic Toast Floaters
review: I thought this was fantastic!  Very very tasty!  It seems all of Rachel's soups are great.  The croutons were a great addition.  Substituted spinach for the arugula.  GREAT!!!

name: Pecan-Stuffed Dates
review: Getting ready to make.  To save last minute prep can I make them and freeze?  Also maybe to keep on hand for a quicker snack for drop in guests.

name: Pecan-Stuffed Dates
review: Interestingly good.

name: Pecan-Stuffed Dates
review: Even I, a really poor cook, can make these, they come out PERFECT every time....and they are great while watching a game on TV...really love this recipe!

name: S'Mores Cakes
review: this recipe is great. its really delicious and great for kids, though it is a bit messy:

name: S'Mores Cakes
review: This recipe is a very good tasting one in terms of s'mores and easier to make than campfire version.  Only thing I would change is putting the marshmallow inside rather than on top.

name: Turkey on the Grill
review: Hosting Thanksgiving at my house and wondering how I would heat all my pre-made dishes and the dishes others brought in ONE oven!!  I used my Weber BBQ and followed these instructions ver batim!  The turkey turned out great!  I used regular briquettes (although apple wood chips would have been nice, too, placed the turkey on a rack and in a roasting pan.  With a bit of butter on the breasts with spices, then covered just the back end and wings with foil.  My BBQ thermometer helped me to know the heat was high enough and the time suggested in this recipe was right on!!  Thank you for taking the guess work out of this endeavor!

name: Turkey on the Grill
review: This method was easy and produced a perfectly cooked, beautiful Thanksgiving turkey. We used Alton Brown's turkey brining recipe, then roasted it on the grill (gas grill using this method. The skin was brown and crispy, and the meat was flavorful and very, very moist. We will cook a turkey like this from now on!

name: Turkey on the Grill
review: I recently cooked a 10lb turkey on my gas grill, but I placed the whole turkey directly on the grill, not in a roasting pan.  It was easy and fantastic.

name: French String Beans
review: Very good, especially considering I don't really like string beans. The onion and pepper made them delicious. I prefer it at room temperature. Feels more like a summer salad that way.

name: French String Beans
review: Tres magnifique!  My gal & I bought a big bag of French beans 4 days ago, made this as a side each of the past 3 nights. Goes with anything or by itself. Very simple, very good. A shake of Herbes de Provence gives this dish a little...I don't know what...but the salt and pepper are just fine.  C'est parfait!

name: French String Beans
review: This recipe is so simple and so good, I add a little garlic with the green beans, is the perfect pair next to a roasted chicken.

name: Organic Whole Wheat Sandwich Bread with Oats and Pecans
review: Help?  I am new at baking loaves of bread.  Somewhere I killed the yeast - I am guessing.  The sponge starter did well.  But I only had rapid rise yeast.  Could that have been where it fell?  Or could I have killed it as it was a cold day and when I added additional water it may have been cold. I baked a brick as it never rose after putting it all together. The poor rating is probably the result of the baker.

name: Organic Whole Wheat Sandwich Bread with Oats and Pecans
review: First, I was a little confused as to where the rasins came in because they were neither listed in the ingredients or the title and there is no indication as to how many to put in.  In addition, because it is technically a "sandwhich" bread, I chose to leave them out anyhow.  I might add them next time experiment with them for a yummy bread to make frech toast with.

name: Organic Whole Wheat Sandwich Bread with Oats and Pecans
review: I've been looking for a sandwich bread that doesn't turn into a big pile of crumbs when eaten, and this turned out to be just what I was looking for! It did take a very long time to make, but there was relatively little work involved and pretty easy to make.

name: Potato Basil Frittata
review: I made this for a brunch at work.  I was a little nervous, as I don't cook very often, but it turned out great.  It was a fairly simple and beautiful dish, and a big success with my colleagues.  Thanks, Ina!

name: Potato Basil Frittata
review: was a little bland, needed jalapenos, sliced very thin.

name: Potato Basil Frittata
review: So delicious! I split the recipe in half and made individual portions for me and my boyfriend.  It was very creamy, lots of flavor from the basil.  Will definitely make again!

name: Curry Coconut Chicken Breasts
review: Very good!

name: Curry Coconut Chicken Breasts
review: The chicken was good. Considering there was seasoning in every step, I was really surprised that it didn't have more flavor. As always, I followed the recipe exactly. I will definitely try this again, because the crunchy texture was absolutely to-die-for!! I loved it! I just need to tweak the seasoning to make it a little less bland. It still gets five stars though. I can't wait to try it again!

name: Curry Coconut Chicken Breasts
review: Delicious, quick and easy.  I always struggle with trying to come up with different ways to prepare chicken.  My mom was coming in from out of the country and I wanted to welcome her with a meal that say welcome home to the United States of America where we have the best foods and ingredients available to make savory meals.  She loved it as so did my husband and I.

name: Shrimp and Salmon Cakes
review: My family loved them and thought the sauce was great.  Took a little more time then a normal crab cake but was worth it.

name: Shrimp and Salmon Cakes
review: I LIKE IT

name: Shrimp and Salmon Cakes
review: Made this tonight.... I can only think of a few words to describe this recipe. E

name: Flounder Francese with Toasted Almonds, Lemon and Capers
review: Cannot figure out why this simple, quick recipe is anything less than perfect. I am not a big fish person, but this is a go to recipe.

name: Flounder Francese with Toasted Almonds, Lemon and Capers
review: Fast, easy, and incredibly delicious! I have a very picky Italian family. If it passes their standards, it's awesome!

name: Flounder Francese with Toasted Almonds, Lemon and Capers
